story:
Indiegogo now offer 'In Demand' which means you can PLEDGE AFTER THE OFFICIAL CAMPAIGN HAS FINISHED...

So if you're just arriving and still want to pledge, feel free to pick a perk and get behind the TV Show!

#1 +£200 we can get cover art done** REACHED

#2 +£500 we can buy hard drives to store the content on and have backups so we don't lose it!** REACHED

#3 +£1000 will give us a small buffer for any unexpected costs** REACHED

#4 +£2000 we can invest more in the editing process** REACHED

#5 +£4000 we can invest more in the team** REACHED

#6 +£4900 we can fully fund a claymation music video done for 'It's All About Grace'! (check out our previous one here: https://youtu.be/T9-Dx0JkMaI)

#7 +£5500 We can properly pay crew! (currently people are working for less because they want to see the project happen)

The Pitch

We are so excited about this project!! If you are new to my work, go check out our website, youtube, or the daily livestreams on facebook. For the past 7 years we've been making albums, touring shows, creating little videos all helping families discover Jesus.

It's been a long dream to be able to film professionally. Thanks to an initial seed-funding grant, plus other producers coming on board, we're now in a position to launch this crowdfunding bid to cap off the budget we need to get this series made.

We're passionate about families getting to know Jesus and our desire is that this series will even give some children their first taste of the gospel. 

 

The Plan

We're writing 6 live-action episodes, set on board the JBI Starship Juniper. Imagine Red Dwarf for kids...with biblical themes! 

For instance, the current plan is that in one episode Septima is trying to prove her worth to the crew and thinks that's the only way they will love her. She's going to have an encounter with grace and discover that God's love is a free gift she cannot (and doesn't need to) earn.

Mr Grumpy thinks he's going to have the perfect day... because everything's going to go his way. Of course it doesn't, but he does learn a valuable lesson - he is not the boss - God is, and that's a GOOD thing!!

Archibald thinks he's being left out of a party and so does everything he can to get in. He's going to find out that all we need to do to go to God's party is say 'yes' to his invitation.

Other themes include God's relentless love, his incredible rescue plan that involved him coming to earth and the fact that none of us are 'normal' but God loves us and is transforming us to be like his Son.

We'll be filming at Clownfish Studios in Chessington, UK. As well as the main dramas we want to hire the studio for an extra day to film some 'BIG Bible Questions' that children have sent, plus have Archibald 'interview' some Bible characters, helping children with little or no knowledge of the Bible meet key people and see how they fit into the big story.

 

The Team

We've got a great team behind the project. The core of the team are:

James Cary (Comedy writer - Milton Jones, Miranda, Hut 33, Think the Unthinkable, Cbeebies etc) who wrote 'Mission to Dendros', is back co-writing the show.

Anna Nicholson, voice of Septima, Roberta the ship's onboard computer and many other characters, returns in person!

Dave Walker who puppeteered 'Inspector Smart' with Michael for many years, comes in to help Mr Grumpy and Igor.

Toby Watts from Far North Film comes in to direct. 

Kathryn ‘Madge’ Healey our Production and Set Designer aka Official Realiser of the infamous (more-than-famous) JBI Starship Juniper! Plus Arch 26 Studios in Peckham will be hosting the set build and dress rehearsals.

And there's me - Michael J Tinker. Singer, actor, wannabe cricketer and author of 'The Case of the Empty Tomb'.

 

Where You Come In

We've got 2/3 of the funding needed to bring this to life. But making TV is an expensive business, so we need this final push in order to pay the camera crew, have funds for editing the series, creating music and sound fx and building the sets.

story:
Short Summary

Aloha!

I'm a Vancouver based professional actor and writer, and the producer/director of "Evil Fucking Pricks", a short film about two despicable social deviants that attempt to summon a demon for their own selfish gain and quickly discover why that's often a very bad idea. While this is the 3rd short film I've completed, it is the 1st I've felt confident enough with to submit to the worldwide festival circuit.

The purpose of this campaign is to raise funds for festival related expenses we had not originally budgeted for. Our team is very pleased with the results of our ultra low-budget effort and the reception it has had thus far has been unexpected. Having already been selected as a finalist in the first festival we entered we are now of the opinion that a more robust festival strategy may help our film (and the fine work of our cast and crew) gain the attention they deserve.  With your help of course.

What We Need & What You Get

This is what we need, and what we can offer:

  • The cost of attaining the rights to the music we've chosen for the film will be approximately $1600 CAD. Getting this track cleared is probably our biggest concern, as it is a requirement of almost every festival that we do so.  
  • Closed Captioning is another requirement (especially of many of the higher profile festivals) and another means of reaching a wider audience so this is another expense we'd like to afford. Est. $50 CAD.
  • The largest expense will be festival entry fees. Our feeling is that a minimum of $5000 is required in order to not only cover basic entry fees but the extra fees required to have our cast and crew considered for the awards and prizes for which they are eligible. 
  • The perks that we can offer range from a simple social media shout-out for a minimum donation, to an associate producer credit for the top tier.

The Impact

Your contributions (small or large) will go a long way towards pushing our film over the top in terms of exposure. I'm actually incredibly proud of everyone's contribution to this film, many of whom volunteered their time and services to make it happen. It would be immensely satisfying to be able to put their work before as wide an audience as possible and have them submitted for as many awards and prizes as they are eligible for because gosh darn it...they deserve it.

story:
Short Summary

Greetings,  Lovers of Independent Movies!

We are​    

and we are in the business of spirited, raw & triumphant filmmaking!

Our film - SAINT - A TRUE STORY - is an intimate, earthy film about the Spanish Mystic, Saint Teresa of Ávila, a barefoot rebel nun, who is pitted against the formidable one-eyed Princess of Eboli and her friends, the omnipotent Spanish Inquisition. 

SAINT is a low-budget independent film that brings together the most collaborative and innovative minds in the industry. It is a 16th century Renaissance history piece lifted out of its stifling context with a stripped, simplistic style. The film will be shot in a timeless place covered in grit and dust, in the spirit of the spaghetti western.

The soundtrack will be contemporary gypsy blended with the ethereal. Music will be composed by Lili Haydn, the Jimi Hendrix of the violin! She breaks violin strings all the time!

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise development funds - $50,000 -  to bring on board two exciting independent film producers. They have collectively produced films with Annette Bening, Judi Dench, Saoirse Ronan and Emily Watson. These ladies of quality will run with the money you give us, and produce the best team possible from their network!  Edison and I will work alongside them, we are the Creative Producers with the Vision. We are also inviting other investors and producers to join us. Reach out to us at Rosarium Films in Los Angeles. 

Know that, even though our film is an intimate film with no overproduced sets or hundreds of extras, it will be of the highest integrity and quality. 

Our friends are all rallying around us to bring their various talents to the perk table. Feast your eyes, and take a pick, or two or three.

But most importantly, it will be SAINT TERESA you will be a part of. Step into her sphere of influence. It is mighty!

The Impact

Why a film about Saint Teresa of Ávila?

As the collective voice of women is starting to rise in the world, we want to contribute to that voice. No-one better than a free-spirited barefoot nun with Godlike passion - to lead an army of nuns to empower themselves, at a time when men dominated and kept women silent. 

We need more films about women who are heroes, who are strong, who live fiercely!

Our Backstory

This film has come a long way. It started as a play, called God's Gypsy, and premiered in Los Angeles to great acclaim and controversy. People loved it or hated it! Why? Because we portrayed this saint as a woman, a human with all her faults, and in all her glory, just as she had documented so prolifically in all her books and in over 17 000 letters!

We visited Georgetown University and lectured and performed our hearts out, making men in our audiences cry with compassion, and women laugh and nod their heads in understanding.

Everyone who saw the play wanted it to become a film.

So, we started the arduous journey into the film world.

It takes a lot of people, talent, skills and money to make a good film. It is extremely difficult, but we persevered. After years of trying to find just the right screenwriter, we at Rosarium Films ended up knowing we had to write the film ourselves. No-one knew as much as we knew about our beloved Saint Teresa!

So, we took a year to write the story - through financial difficulty and with many obstacles in our way. But we persevered. Just as we were about to go into pre-production on our film, the world stopped due to the Corona virus. It gave us time to research the film industry, to polish the script and to plot our plan.

Now, the time is finally here! The film industry has started up again, we have circulated our screenplay, and the response is overwhelmingly positive! Apparently we have gold. But because we are not movie stars, we have to prove that we have an audience backing us on this film.

So, it looks like our film will be made by the people for the people. This film is a women's film, featuring two female leads, written and produced by a woman, music composed by a woman, and who knows, might also be directed by a woman. And the producers who will run with the funds and gather the rest of the team? Women!

Risks & Challenges

We are lucky to live in Los Angeles where we have befriended many wonderful people in the film industry over the years. We have an excellent creative team assembled. SPIRITED, RAW & TRIUMPHANT is our motto.

We have become experts in risk taking and in facing challenges! Know that we will not rest until SAINT is made, and it will be in 2022. However ... we cannot make this film without you!!! Please become a part of our crusade. SHARE our film with everyone you know, por favor! 

Our goal is for you to be able to watch SAINT at our Premiere, in a film theater near you, or streamed, wherever you are before the year 2022 is out!

 

***************************************************************************************

Our Team Members:

Coco Blignaut - Producer, Writer, Actress: I am an accidental producer who would rather act, write or sit under a tree, but I must have SAINT made, so I have thrown myself in - balls to the wall, is what they hear me say everyday. 

#drivenbyasaint

Edison Park - Producer, Writer, Actor:  I am ecstatic to be a part of this beautiful and dynamic team. It is either a zen garden or an awesome tempest over here at Rosarium Films, and I wouldn't have it any other way! 

Marlé Blignaut - Production Assistant:  Hi! I’m Marlé Blignaut. I’m a practical and reliable person. People can depend on me. I’m asked by this team to do all sorts of things, like ironing nun's habits, being a script reader. Imagine me lying on the ground prompting the lines to the actors. You want it done, I’m your girl! I’m also a qualified barber with a loyal clientele. 

Yvette Blignaut - In-House DJ:  Hi, I am abnormally normal but insanely obsessed with music. The 80’s decade rocks, right? I love puns, but I prefer my puns to be intended. I am a professional over thinker which causes me many wasted hours.  I am also a money-girl. Never be late, because time is money so don’t mess with mine. Pugs, heck yes!

Yohan de Silva - Graphic Designer: We are so lucky to have discovered Yohan! Very intuitive, willing, supremely talented, and a must-have at Rosarium Films.  He says, "I love to eat donuts with a hot cup of coffee. Me and my dog, Lucy, like to spend time with our friends, the squirrels and lizards, in my garden". Our kind of guy!

Jolene Thompson - Website Designer:  Lover of dogs, beer, beaches, mountains, coffee, being barefoot & not necessarily in that order! Creating truly beautiful websites that are easy to use and accessible to all. I am constantly inspired by my clients, many of whom become friends after the job is done. 

Brandon - Video Editor:  Brandon is lightning fast with his work. He amazes us. Pleasant, super flexible, willing, works hard. Like the rest of us here.

story:
"Don't Call Me Ron"

Welcome to our project! With each donation to this SUPER fun comedy film, we come closer to bringing Saff and her dreams to the screen. Here are some key points about our film:

  • Produced, Written, Directed, Acted by, Edited by 90% WOMEN!
  • Based in London, UK
  • Only possible with YOUR generous donations!
  • Serving as Rose's Final Project to graduate from the Masters in Directing from Met Film School

So what is this whole story about, anyway?

Crew:

  • DIRECTOR & PRODUCER: Rose Evelyn

  • WRITER: Deborah Loke

  • CINEMATOGRAPHER: Reiko Nagayoshi
  • SCRIPT SUPERVISOR: Julia Summers
  • 1ST ASSISTANT DIRECTOR: Alexandra Adomaitis
  • PRODUCTION COORDINATOR: Patricia Borba
  • MEDIA MANAGER: Eugénie Barety
  • LOCATIONS ASSISTANT: Tom Harrod
  • DIRECTOR'S ASSISTANT: Ella Baulcomb

Saffron's Strife for Happiness

Our film follows Saff, a strict perfectionist. After a sudden breakup, Saffron attempts to find help via her parents, sugar, and some radical outfit choices... None of which really work out how she planned:

  • Saff's parents are too preoccupied with their own home renovations & passionate love life to help heal their daughter's broken heart.
  • Saff's discarded childhood memories serve as inspiration for a better life - at what age did she stop having fun?
  • Carnivals are meant to be fun, right? Until all that sugar resurfaces unexpectedly.
  • How could anyone be sad with a 6 foot teddy bear around?
  • In the end, Saff learns that community, family, and tasty bread are key elements in the work / life balance. 

We Need YOU!

Filmmaking is not free, especially for young, innovative, talented (we hope) filmmakers at the Master's Degree level. Therefore, 

  • We have an intended budget of £2,500.
  • This amount accounts for every aspect of production that REQUIRES funding: lens rental fees, location fees, transport, paying talent, on-set catering, sound design, hair & makeup, costume, props, etc..
  • There are perks along the way! You will receive the perk associated with your contribution band within ONE MONTH of production completion. 

Risks & Challenges

As with any film, there are potential road blocks ahead. Shooting with an extremely limited budget and in a short time frame adds extra pressure. BUT -

  • We have an INCREDIBLY talented cast & crew behind us.
  • We have enough passion for this crazy art of filmmaking to push past challenges.
  • Also, we can't graduate without completing this film... so it's important!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to support financially, you CAN still help us! 

  • Please help make some noise for our campaign by sharing!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to post on social media or send directly to friends and family. 

We want to promote good belly laughs and see our project through - can you help us?.

Instagram: @DontCallMeRon.Film

If you are unable to support financially, you CAN still help us! 

Please help make some noise for our campaign by sharing!
Use the Indiegogo share tools to post on social media or send directly to friends and family. 

We want to promote good belly laughs and see our project through - can you help us?.Instagram: @DontCallMeRon.Film

story:
EVERYTHING WILL BE FINE IN THE END -

THE FEATURE FILM

We are indie filmmakers Joe Bartone - https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2416624/

and cinematographer/director, Jose Zambrano Cassella. https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0952580/

Together, we've won dozens of awards for writing, directing, producing, composing, cinematography, and a Technical Emmy (2013).  Joe is a finalist at the 2021 Bigfoot NA Screenwriting competition and took third place in horror at the 2021 Slamdance Screenwriting competition. 

Here is a link to my director's reel. 


Everything Will Be Fine In The End is like
 

Three aimless Gen Zs botch a break-in and suffer the consequences.

Struggling 20-something grifters face their bleak outlook of the future against the backdrop of a world on fire.  Rudderless, their choices erode as fast as the shoreline. After stealing a dog and a home robbery that leaves the owner dead, they are followed by her ghost who pushes them to make a life-changing decision.

Small Factory Films has video editing, audio post, and composing covered. We saved a few thousand for the production of this feature. But we still need to rent cameras, lights, locations, permits, and pay cast and crew.

THE COSTS FOR A 20 DAY SHOOT:

CAST AND CREW: $29,000

CREW:

Cinematographer, Director, 1st Assistant Camera, 1st Assistant Director, 2nd Assistant Camera, Script Supervisor, Make Up Artist, Key Grip. Swing grip and electric. Production Manager. 

Cast:

George (F) - A drifter and a grifter.

INTRODUCING ELSA KENNEDY

She's coming out from Boston to make this movie with us. Watch her self-tape audition

Elsa is also a songwriter and appeared on NPR's Tiny Desk - but here she is performing a cover...

 

Kai - A skateboarder who pals around with George bearing a secret crush for her.

 STEVEN MICHAEL MARTIN

Steven is also a top session drummer. 

Cheska - A tomboy who has long escaped responsibility and now just rolls through life.

CHESKA ZAIDE

Cheska is also a rocker!

Buzz - A delusional informant and drug dealer who sees himself as an undercover operative.

KENT HARPER

 

Mank - A man who fell through death and now sees life as an illusion.

JONATHAN MANKUTA

Julia - Struggles under crippling OCD.

HOLLY ROCKWELL

MERLIN - The urban shaman

OOPs! Loading error.

TOM - A retiree who has lost his wife and now his dog.

PATRICK BURNS

KAREN - The dog lady with the prized poodle

SUZAN SOLOMON

LEO - The dog everyone searches for.

LEO

 
MY PASSION FOR FILMMAKING AND WHAT I HAVE LEARNED

CAMERA, LIGHTS, AND SOUND RENTALS: $10,000

BOLEX CAMERAS (DIGITAL) and original lenses.

Recreations of the classic indie camera and lenses of both French and American new wave cinemas.  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_Bolex

PROPS AND LOCATIONS: $8000

Production insurance policies. A suburban home. A rundown apartment. A few bodegas. A skate park. A whole lot of plastic sheets. Fake blood. Posters. Earings. Skateboards.  

FOOD, TRANSPORT, AND COVID TESTING: $24,000

COVID tests, PPE, snacks, water, lunches. Boy, it adds up. Tables, chairs, napkins, forks, knives, spoons, coffee, bagels, cream cheese, oh my, what else have we forgotten?

CONTINGENCY: $24,000

We add a third of the budget to cover for all the things that go wrong with the shoot.

TOTAL: $98,000

THE PERKS:

EXECUTIVE PRODUCER PARTNERSHIP IN THE FILM.

Share in any revenue generated from the sale of the license of the film.  Legal expenses are not included. Formal contract based upon agreed terms. 

CO-PRODUCER

Share in any revenue generated from the sale of the license of the film.  Legal expenses are not included. Formal contract based upon agreed terms.  IMDb credit.

TOP PERK

Joe Bartone's personal, 2004 MOOG VOYAGER PERFORMER 50th Anniversary Edition 

Made under the direction of Robert Moog in North Carolina. Monophonic, Monotimbral, Oscillator3 VCOs, independent LFO, Analog Subtractive, dual lowpass or highpass/lowpass with cutoff, resonance, spacing; ADSR envelope generator, keyboard tracking, Attenuator- ADSR envelope generator, Aftertouch, Velocity expression,  896 presets, 2 modulation busses, 44-note keys with velocity

and aftertouch sensitivity. Left-hand control pitch bend and mod wheels, External control MIDI, 14 CV/Gate inputs.

TOP PERK

Joe Bartone's personal, rare Dave Smith Instruments Prophet 12 Synthesizer

The one used on Brides of Jesus soundtracks and countless film scores. This is the first new polyphonic synth I ever bought. So many songs were written on this. I will miss it, but I need to make this film. This one hurts.  This is a 12-voice DCO Analog synth from 2017, made at the Prophet factory in San Fransisco. Despite a few scratches, it is a fully functional monster synth in fantastic shape. The Dave Smith Instruments Prophet 12 is a monstrously powerful hybrid analog and digital 12-voice polyphonic synthesizer. Offering new digital waveform shapes, analog Curtis filters and distortion, a digital Character effects section, and delay and feedback effects, the Prophet 12 also features a 5-octave velocity and aftertouch-sensitive keyboard, pitch and modulation wheels, and two touch and pressure-sensitive sliders. Read all about it here: https://www.soundonsound.com/reviews/dave-smith-instruments-prophet-12

TOP PERK

Joe Bartone's personal 1991 Guild Limited Edition jumbo JF30-12 Woodgrain Blue with Factory Electronics. 

Made at the Westerly, Rhode Island factory. Guitar has some ( very minor) dings and (very light) scratches, otherwise overall it is in excellent condition. Frets are still at 100%. Includes hard case and Fishman Rare Earth pickup.

Specs: Maple body design with a Rosewood fretboard and bridge. Jumbo Body style dimensions (17" wide, 21" long, and the modern 5" depth) and comes with a solid AA spruce top with solid curly Maple sides and a laminated arched Curly Maple back. The headstock is inlaid with Guild’s Chesterfield logo; the three-piece Maple neck is outfitted with a select Rosewood fretboard and Mother-of-Pearl dot position inlay. The width at the nut is 1 11/16” and the scale length is 25 5/8”. As seen in the video Inside Me for Brides of Jesus. Here is me playing it for you!

TOP Perk 

Joe's personal 2002 Monoj Kumar and Sons Indian Sitar.  This is a delightful sitar with a few bumps and scratches. 

SPECIAL PERK 

AN ORIGINAL SONG BASED ON YOUR THEME WRITTEN, PRODUCED, AND RECORDED BY JOE BARTONE. Have a song written just for your special occasion. the perfect gift to your significant other. Maybe something like https://vimeo.com/498571578

SPECIAL PERK

An original story  written and illustrated by hand for you by Joe Bartone

SPECIAL PERK

A box of 4 Holiday cards hand made by Joe Bartone

SPECIAL PERK

A speaking role in the film for you or anyone you wish.

SPECIAL PERK

Bound and printed script signed by me and the cast. 

SPECIAL PERK

Bound and printed script of Worst Night Ever. 

Winner of some of the top screenwriting festivals in the country including Finalist in the Bigfoot Screenwriting Challenge and Slamdance Screenwriting Contest. Based on a true story. On a midnight road trip to pick up a dream car, two unlikely friends collide head-on with a monstrous curse plaguing their sleeping town

ALL FUNDS WILL BE USED IN PRODUCTION, POST-PRODUCTION, PROMOTIONS, AND EXPENDED. This can include, festival appearance expenses and sales/marketing expenses. 

The Impact - what is Everything Will Be Fine In The End

The film is an existential, dark comedy character piece with a great ghost story. All told through the eyes of a sweet labradoodle caught up in the conflicts of selfish people.

SPOILER ALERT - THE WHOLE STORY WITHOUT THE COOL CONVERSATIONS:

What is Everything Will Be Fine In The End about? George (Female 20s punk) has stolen a dog. She isn't even sure why. She likes the dog and took it. She is dating? this creepy guy is more than twice her age and one night the sex gets out of hand and he pushes her too far, so she hits him. He retaliates by stealing her dog - which of course is not hers anyway. She gets a day gig cleaning Julia's (this odd OCD lady) house. When she gets there, everything is wrapped in plastic. Once the lady leaves for yoga, she burglars the place. She corrals her friends Cheska and Kai, to steal more stuff from Julia but alas, Julia comes home and finds them in the house. They struggle and Julia is dead. Wrapped in plastic. Things seem fine for a minute, but soon Julia is popping up everywhere as some plastic-covered ghost, haunting them into an existential self-reflection. Chess decides to get her friends Mank and Buzz, George's now ex-bF, to help her go back to Julia's place and hide the body. But Mank has plans to do a standup routine on Hollywood and Vine as a transgender Luce Libre, so it's just her and Buzz, who has other motives for Cheska. Well, Tom, the real dog owner, has been looking all over town for his dog, and finally finds him with Mank. But as fate would have it, he is run over by accident when Buzz speeds up the road after leaving Cheska for dead at Julia's. Throughout all this, we are guided by Merlin, an urban shaman, who quotes the great poets to whoever is listening, and the ghost of Julia gets her revenge. The Hollywood ending has Merlin returning the dog to the widow of Tom.

Our projects won over 40 awards worldwide. Here are a few.

SLAMDANCE SCREEWWRITTING COMPETITION  - 3RD PLACE

Paris Play Film Festival - Award Winner

Rome Movie Awards - Award Winner

New York International Film Awards™ - NYIFA - Finalist

Oniros Film Awards® - New York - Finalist

Bigfoot Script Challenge - Finalist

Flickers' Rhode Island International Film Festival - Semi-Finalist

GLENDALE INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL
GLENDALE CA - July 31, 2020 - GRAND PRIZE

Los Angeles Film & Script Festival
LOS ANGELES CA - April 13, 2020 - Finalist

Flickers' Rhode Island International Film Festival
PROVIDENCE RI - July 27, 2020 - Semi-Finalist

Indie Short Fest - January 5, 2021 - Nominee

Indie Short Fest - November 29, 2020 - Nominee

BLASTOFF - May 2, 2021 - Quarter-Finalist

European Cinematography AWARDS (ECA) - March 15, 2021 - Award Winner

IndieX Film Fest - December 13, 2020 - Award Winner

Europa Film Festival - March 22, 2021 - Award Winner

Falcon International Film Festival - January 26, 2021 - Award Winner

Culver City Film Festival® - December 3, 2020 - Award Winner

Independent Shorts Awards - December 21, 2020 - Award Winner

New York Movie Awards - December 5, 2020 - Finalist

Florence Film Awards - December 5, 2020 - Finalist

Across the Globe Film Festival - December 1, 2020 - Finalist

Hollywood Gold Awards - December 5, 2020 - Finalist

Milan Gold Awards - December 5, 2020 - Finalist

Festival del Cinema di Cefalù - January 31, 2021 - Semi-Finalist

Aphrodite Film Awards - January 2, 2021 - Semi-Finalist

London International Web & Shorts Film Festival (UK) - January 5, 2021 - Semi-Finalist

Golden Nugget International Film Festival - December 20, 2020 - Semi-Finalist

Completing the film is guaranteed. We are distributed through Cinema Libre.

story:
ABOUT THE FILM

Dampened by office life during a wet Vancouver winter, a genderqueer Trinidadian woman, Marlinn, misses out on the chance to celebrate Carnival season back home. Until, one night, they discover that the power of masquerade is within them no matter where they are. 

Tabanca is a short film that explores Caribbean identity and longing amidst city life in the Pacific Northwest.

By Writer/Director: Lauren Marsden, media artist and filmmaker of Euro-Trinidadian descent. 

 

WHAT IS TABANCA?

I am inspired to make this film to explore what it feels like to be in one world while your heart is in another, something I experience all the time as a Caribbean-Canadian. And that’s basically what “Tabanca” means. It’s a Trini phrase for a deep, heavy feeling of lovesickness when you long for something or someone you can’t have. I believe it’s a feeling everyone understands in their own way, especially in these times of being kept apart from that which we love. More than anything, I am really excited to tell a story that is set in the context of modern-day Vancouver life but through a Caribbean lens. This is something that we almost NEVER SEE. And with your help, I hope to change that. 

In this story, glimpses of Carnival life seep into Marlinn’s daily life, despite being so far away. If you have ever been to Trinidad’s Carnival (aka the “Greatest Show on Earth”) then you already know what "Carnival Tabanca" feels like, but for those of you who don’t, just imagine all of these things together: Soca music, stilt-walkers (Moko Jumbies), all-night fetes, glitter, confetti, blazing sun, corn soup, feathers, masquerade, blue devils, wining…, you get the picture.

WHAT WE NEED

To make this film, we need to raise at least $12,000 CAD. This will help cover our basic production expenses:

-honoraria for cast and crew

-camera and lighting equipment rentals

-location fees

-food

-insurance

-costumes, props, hair/makeup 

In addition to the typical costs of a micro-budget film, we’re hosting an anti-oppression workshop for the whole production team before filming begins. It’s our priority to make our set an inclusive, trusting, and equitable space for everyone involved. 

WHY CONTRIBUTE?

Your contribution will make all the difference. We hope to make a film where we can express the experience of isolation and alienation while also showing the possibility of discovering joy and self-love when one least expects it. And especially from a queer Caribbean perspective, a point-of-view that is still so often overlooked and underrepresented. 

We have started establishing an amazing and experienced team, which is continuing to grow as the film gains momentum. Here’s a glimpse of who’s already on board:

 

LEAD ACTOR and CO-PRODUCER: Nneka Croal

Nneka Croal (She/They) is a queer actor, creator, and producer of Guyanese-descent based in Vancouver BC. They received their BFA from Simon Fraser University’s Theatre for the Contemporary Arts, and their MA in Arts Politics from Tisch, New York University. Nneka has been working professionally in Theatre, Film and Television for 20 years.

 

CO-PRODUCER: Nathalie Therriault

Nathalie Therriault (she/her) is an award-winning filmmaker based in Vancouver, British Columbia. Her highly acclaimed first short film, which she wrote and directed, The Tailor is currently in the festival circuit and has been shown to audiences both locally and internationally and will screen at Cannes next year. It was nominated for 5 Leo Awards, won a Spirit Award at the Chilliwack Film Festival,  Best Short Film at the LGBTQ Festival in Toronto, Best Canadian Short Film at the Oakville Festivals of Film and Arts, and most recently won Best Short Film at the San Francisco Queer Film Festival. She is currently preparing to direct her next project, Latchkey. 

 

CINEMATOGRAPHER: Israel Seoane

Israel Seoane has been working as a cinematographer for over a decade on narrative, commercial and documentary projects. He lived in Ethiopia for almost five years, where he learned to work in challenging environments, to make things look great with little resources and develop and endless patience. He´s been behind the camera in projects like the short film “Chigger Ale” (2012), the feature film “Crumbs” (2014) and the recently premiered feature “Jesus shows you the way to the highway” (2019), considered by some film critics and festival programmers as “The Matrix on acid”. 

 

PRODUCTION DESIGNER: Lillian Melo

Born and raised in the wonderful city of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, Lillian Melo moved to Vancouver to pursue her dream of working in the film industry. Carnival and samba run in her veins as well as design and art. With a degree in Architecture and vast experience in interior design, Lillian started her career in the film industry in the biggest tv channel in South America where she worked for 3 years in set design department. Currently, she works in both the art department and set dec department in Vancouver. She was recently nominated for the Indie short fest award of Best production design for the Brazilian short film Apostasy

 

COSTUME DESIGNER: Evan Clayton

Evan Clayton is the founder and visionary behind his self-titled label EVAN CLAYTON, a brand which marries art and design to create strong political, personal and imaginative statements in every piece of work. After graduating from Blanche MacDonald in 2011, Evan has since become an internationally known name in fashion with collections presented in Canada, Austria and Japan in addition to features in Vogue UK, Vogue China, Paper Magazine, Nylon and more. Harnessing an imagination that knows no limits, Evan has designed and executed 14 one-of-a- kind collections including The Fall of Joan (2013), Kin (2013), Jenova (2014), DEATHPROOF (2014), LILLITH (2015), LILLITH Download (2015), Worship (2015), MAHŌ SHŌJO (2016), The Devil in Miss Jones (2016), EC10 (2017), NAUSICAÄ (2018), EGO (2018), Like Hell (2019), and VILLAIN (2019). Inspired by drag and pop culture, Evan has an exaggerated take on how the modern day woman dresses which is demonstrated through his signature use of rhinestones, ostrich feather, molded leather, armor, and tulle. With designs embodying theatrical appeal, Evan has notably dressed the likes of Doja Cat, Jessie Reyez, Allie X, Brooke Candy, Kali Uchis, Cupcakke and drag queens from RuPaul’s Drag Race.

 

PHOTOGRAPHER: Katrin Braga

Katrin Braga was raised in the tiny remote town of Fellabær in East Iceland, where she took the kaleidoscopic culture and harsh natural beauty that surrounded her and began turning it into photographs. Though she now resides in the more typically beautiful Vancouver, BC, Canada, she continues to take photographs, focusing on individuals outside of the traditional norms of fashion and works on independent film projects that focus on unique storytelling.

 

MOVEMENT COACH: Alyssa Amarshi

Having parents from Tanzania, and of Indo-Ismaili heritage, Alyssa has always been interested in diverse types of cultural expression, especially movement and intermodal art. Her passion for performing and expressing grew while she was working with Bollywood dance companies as a preteen. In high school, her friends from the West Indies exposed her to Dancehall and STEP (a form of percussive dance), both of which she continued to explore while completing her BA in Psychology at McGill University. After moving to Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) and xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam) lands (colonially known as Vancouver), she trained with SOULdiers Dance Company and Ketch Di Vybz where she further fortified her understanding in street dance and love of Dancehall. She has graced the stage with artists such as A Tribe Called Red, Kimmortal, and Nanya Music. She has also creative directed, choreographed and performed in pieces for Vines Festival, Indian Summer Festival, and Vancouver International Children’s Festival.  Alyssa has also sat on panels for the City of Vancouver and the Reach Gallery. Her vision, through her collective “Her Tribal Roots” is to create more opportunities for artistic expression, rooted in symbiotic collaboration, compassion, and play.

 

WRITER/DIRECTOR: Lauren Marsden

Lauren Marsden is a queer Trinidadian-Canadian filmmaker and media artist based in Vancouver, BC and situated on the unceded territory of the The xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), səlil̓ilw̓ətaʔɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations. As a storyteller, she focuses on narrative and experimental works that revolve around gender, creole identity, and the human impact on the land. With 17 years of experience as an artist under her belt, her creative work has been presented by Pacific Cinematheque, the Trinidad and Tobago Film Festival, New Media Gallery, Antimatter Film Festival, Cineworks, SFMOMA and others. She holds a Master of Fine Arts from the California College of the Arts and a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of Victoria.

 

CONSULTING PRODUCER: Selwyn Jacob

Selwyn Jacob is a Canadian documentary filmmaker whose work has often explored the experiences of Black Canadians as well as other stories from Canada's multicultural communities, both as an independent director and since 1997 as a producer with the National Film Board of Canada (NFB).

Originally from Trinidad, Jacob attended a teacher's college there before traveling to Canada in 1968 to complete a Bachelor of Education at the University of Alberta in Edmonton. While in Edmonton, he was influenced and mentored by film producer, author and broadcaster Fil Fraser. After graduation, Jacob completed a master's degree in film studies at the USC School of Cinematic Arts.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Making a film on a small budget is always a challenge, but we are excited to find creative solutions to the financial stresses of filmmaking. This means working with resources we already have free or low-cost access to within our community whenever possible, such as gear, locations, and studio space. 

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Contributing dollars is not the only way you can help us realize this project. You can show your support by SPREADING THE WORD of our fundraising campaign with your own network. Tell your family, friends, colleagues, Caribbean connections, anyone who you think would love to see this story where the beauty of Carnival finds its way into everyday life in more ways than one.
story_txt: ABOUT THE FILMDampened by office life during a wet Vancouver winter, a genderqueer Trinidadian woman, Marlinn, misses out on the chance to celebrate Carnival season back home. Until, one night, they discover that the power of masquerade is within them no matter where they are. Tabanca is a short film that explores Caribbean identity and longing amidst city life in the Pacific Northwest.By Writer/Director: Lauren Marsden, media artist and filmmaker of Euro-Trinidadian descent.  WHAT IS TABANCA?I am inspired to make this film to explore what it feels like to be in one world while your heart is in another, something I experience all the time as a Caribbean-Canadian. And that’s basically what “Tabanca” means. It’s a Trini phrase for a deep, heavy feeling of lovesickness when you long for something or someone you can’t have. I believe it’s a feeling everyone understands in their own way, especially in these times of being kept apart from that which we love. More than anything, I am really excited to tell a story that is set in the context of modern-day Vancouver life but through a Caribbean lens. This is something that we almost NEVER SEE. And with your help, I hope to change that. In this story, glimpses of Carnival life seep into Marlinn’s daily life, despite being so far away. If you have ever been to Trinidad’s Carnival (aka the “Greatest Show on Earth”) then you already know what "Carnival Tabanca" feels like, but for those of you who don’t, just imagine all of these things together: Soca music, stilt-walkers (Moko Jumbies), all-night fetes, glitter, confetti, blazing sun, corn soup, feathers, masquerade, blue devils, wining…, you get the picture.WHAT WE NEEDTo make this film, we need to raise at least $12,000 CAD. This will help cover our basic production expenses: -honoraria for cast and crew-camera and lighting equipment rentals-location fees-food-insurance-costumes, props, hair/makeup In addition to the typical costs of a micro-budget film, we’re hosting an anti-oppression workshop for the whole production team before filming begins. It’s our priority to make our set an inclusive, trusting, and equitable space for everyone involved. WHY CONTRIBUTE?Your contribution will make all the difference. We hope to make a film where we can express the experience of isolation and alienation while also showing the possibility of discovering joy and self-love when one least expects it. And especially from a queer Caribbean perspective, a point-of-view that is still so often overlooked and underrepresented. We have started establishing an amazing and experienced team, which is continuing to grow as the film gains momentum. Here’s a glimpse of who’s already on board: LEAD ACTOR and CO-PRODUCER: Nneka CroalNneka Croal (She/They) is a queer actor, creator, and producer of Guyanese-descent based in Vancouver BC. They received their BFA from Simon Fraser University’s Theatre for the Contemporary Arts, and their MA in Arts Politics from Tisch, New York University. Nneka has been working professionally in Theatre, Film and Television for 20 years. CO-PRODUCER: Nathalie TherriaultNathalie Therriault (she/her) is an award-winning filmmaker based in Vancouver, British Columbia. Her highly acclaimed first short film, which she wrote and directed, The Tailor is currently in the festival circuit and has been shown to audiences both locally and internationally and will screen at Cannes next year. It was nominated for 5 Leo Awards, won a Spirit Award at the Chilliwack Film Festival,  Best Short Film at the LGBTQ Festival in Toronto, Best Canadian Short Film at the Oakville Festivals of Film and Arts, and most recently won Best Short Film at the San Francisco Queer Film Festival. She is currently preparing to direct her next project, Latchkey.  CINEMATOGRAPHER: Israel SeoaneIsrael Seoane has been working as a cinematographer for over a decade on narrative, commercial and documentary projects. He lived in Ethiopia for almost five years, where he learned to work in challenging environments, to make things look great with little resources and develop and endless patience. He´s been behind the camera in projects like the short film “Chigger Ale” (2012), the feature film “Crumbs” (2014) and the recently premiered feature “Jesus shows you the way to the highway” (2019), considered by some film critics and festival programmers as “The Matrix on acid”.  PRODUCTION DESIGNER: Lillian MeloBorn and raised in the wonderful city of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, Lillian Melo moved to Vancouver to pursue her dream of working in the film industry. Carnival and samba run in her veins as well as design and art. With a degree in Architecture and vast experience in interior design, Lillian started her career in the film industry in the biggest tv channel in South America where she worked for 3 years in set design department. Currently, she works in both the art department and set dec department in Vancouver. She was recently nominated for the Indie short fest award of Best production design for the Brazilian short film Apostasy COSTUME DESIGNER: Evan ClaytonEvan Clayton is the founder and visionary behind his self-titled label EVAN CLAYTON, a brand which marries art and design to create strong political, personal and imaginative statements in every piece of work. After graduating from Blanche MacDonald in 2011, Evan has since become an internationally known name in fashion with collections presented in Canada, Austria and Japan in addition to features in Vogue UK, Vogue China, Paper Magazine, Nylon and more. Harnessing an imagination that knows no limits, Evan has designed and executed 14 one-of-a- kind collections including The Fall of Joan (2013), Kin (2013), Jenova (2014), DEATHPROOF (2014), LILLITH (2015), LILLITH Download (2015), Worship (2015), MAHŌ SHŌJO (2016), The Devil in Miss Jones (2016), EC10 (2017), NAUSICAÄ (2018), EGO (2018), Like Hell (2019), and VILLAIN (2019). Inspired by drag and pop culture, Evan has an exaggerated take on how the modern day woman dresses which is demonstrated through his signature use of rhinestones, ostrich feather, molded leather, armor, and tulle. With designs embodying theatrical appeal, Evan has notably dressed the likes of Doja Cat, Jessie Reyez, Allie X, Brooke Candy, Kali Uchis, Cupcakke and drag queens from RuPaul’s Drag Race. PHOTOGRAPHER: Katrin BragaKatrin Braga was raised in the tiny remote town of Fellabær in East Iceland, where she took the kaleidoscopic culture and harsh natural beauty that surrounded her and began turning it into photographs. Though she now resides in the more typically beautiful Vancouver, BC, Canada, she continues to take photographs, focusing on individuals outside of the traditional norms of fashion and works on independent film projects that focus on unique storytelling. MOVEMENT COACH: Alyssa AmarshiHaving parents from Tanzania, and of Indo-Ismaili heritage, Alyssa has always been interested in diverse types of cultural expression, especially movement and intermodal art. Her passion for performing and expressing grew while she was working with Bollywood dance companies as a preteen. In high school, her friends from the West Indies exposed her to Dancehall and STEP (a form of percussive dance), both of which she continued to explore while completing her BA in Psychology at McGill University. After moving to Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) and xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam) lands (colonially known as Vancouver), she trained with SOULdiers Dance Company and Ketch Di Vybz where she further fortified her understanding in street dance and love of Dancehall. She has graced the stage with artists such as A Tribe Called Red, Kimmortal, and Nanya Music. She has also creative directed, choreographed and performed in pieces for Vines Festival, Indian Summer Festival, and Vancouver International Children’s Festival.  Alyssa has also sat on panels for the City of Vancouver and the Reach Gallery. Her vision, through her collective “Her Tribal Roots” is to create more opportunities for artistic expression, rooted in symbiotic collaboration, compassion, and play. WRITER/DIRECTOR: Lauren MarsdenLauren Marsden is a queer Trinidadian-Canadian filmmaker and media artist based in Vancouver, BC and situated on the unceded territory of the The xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), səlil̓ilw̓ətaʔɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations. As a storyteller, she focuses on narrative and experimental works that revolve around gender, creole identity, and the human impact on the land. With 17 years of experience as an artist under her belt, her creative work has been presented by Pacific Cinematheque, the Trinidad and Tobago Film Festival, New Media Gallery, Antimatter Film Festival, Cineworks, SFMOMA and others. She holds a Master of Fine Arts from the California College of the Arts and a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of Victoria. CONSULTING PRODUCER: Selwyn JacobSelwyn Jacob is a Canadian documentary filmmaker whose work has often explored the experiences of Black Canadians as well as other stories from Canada's multicultural communities, both as an independent director and since 1997 as a producer with the National Film Board of Canada (NFB).Originally from Trinidad, Jacob attended a teacher's college there before traveling to Canada in 1968 to complete a Bachelor of Education at the University of Alberta in Edmonton. While in Edmonton, he was influenced and mentored by film producer, author and broadcaster Fil Fraser. After graduation, Jacob completed a master's degree in film studies at the USC School of Cinematic Arts. RISKS & CHALLENGESMaking a film on a small budget is always a challenge, but we are excited to find creative solutions to the financial stresses of filmmaking. This means working with resources we already have free or low-cost access to within our community whenever possible, such as gear, locations, and studio space.  OTHER WAYS TO HELPContributing dollars is not the only way you can help us realize this project. You can show your support by SPREADING THE WORD of our fundraising campaign with your own network. Tell your family, friends, colleagues, Caribbean connections, anyone who you think would love to see this story where the beauty of Carnival finds its way into everyday life in more ways than one.

story:
Test Footage has begun!

 

We need You!

Voorhees Night of the Beast is Written by Jason Pitts, Directed by Jason Pitts and Jason Mansfield, Staring James Stokes and more to be announced. A Pair of Jason's Production, in conjunction with Lucid Lake Pictures and Binary Entertainment. Please share, promote, and give a few dollars to the IndieGoGo fundraiser. Lots of roles to be filled, primary and background actors so reach out to us.

We Present to you the fans of the Friday the 13th Franchise a unique film taking place between Film 8 Jason Takes Manhattan and Film 9 Jason Goes to hell to fill in some story line gaps

With added twists and turns and a Huge plot shift no one will see coming.

To accomplish this, we need you guys.  We are both accomplished film makers where I tend to be more of an editor i have worked on some very large projects,  Including programming on PBS, Amazon Prime and soon to be seen on Disney+

If you only have a $1.00 thats is fine with us.  Not setup on this platform, email me at mansfield.media@gmail.com for another way to support our efforts.

This fundraiser will compensate the actors, supply the food, pay for the locations and car rentals, and most importantly cover the cost of practical effects,  THAT'S RIGHT, no CGI.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $10,000 to pull the project off correctly.
  • Please check out the Perks on the right and choose what you can do.
  • Even if goal is not met, this film will still be done and completed

Risks & Challenges

There is always risks in life, but this film is not one of them.  

  • We own our Black Magic cameras and lenses.
  • We own our own drones.  
  • These 2 factors have helped reduce the costs of doing this film.

Other Ways You Can Help

If just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share this Crowdfund please,
  • Help us entertain you, while Hollywood is shut down.

Can't wait to show you guys this film!
 

Cast

Actor James Stokes is our Jason in this film.  With a growing list on IMDB this is a guy you need to watch for.

and Just added to the Crew Professional NXT and TNA Wrestler Madman Fulton will be coming in to play a unique and taxing role to say the least.
These are some Big boys!.... just wait to see how this film plays out!

story:
• Hi everyone, thank you for checking out the Indigogo for "Half Dead Fred".

 

  • My name is Bron Theron. I am the writer and director of this feature film. The story is a cross between China Town and The Sixth Sense. It stars  Corin Nemec as our Medium detective who travels to Flint to solve a murder case. I am working with two producers from Flint; Joe Schipani and Jessica Revoldt. They are helping this project stay true to a Flint Film. I have raised the initial funds for this movie already but wanted  to do an indigogo to get a little extra money for the main talent. I have backed  several projects myself because I want independent film to thrive. Normally I produce low budget projects, but I have been involved with large productions as well and I know how important each of these positions are in film making. Being a backer myself,  I know how important honoring the perks are. I have been on both sides of the camera and I know the most important thing in film making is positive energy, This is a truly unorthodox business and there is no "right" or "wrong" way to make a movie but there is a positive and a negative work flow and I am building my team to create a good story that stands the test of time,  and to have fun while doing it. This is my 4th feature film. Please feel free to check out my imdb for my other  projects. This film is very important to me because of the support in the community of Flint, the story that I love,  and the amount of time and money I will be investing.  Another reason why this film is so dear to my heart is I have Corin Nemec attached to it. I am a big fan and had a great time working with him on the series "The Heat Of The Beat". I also have director of photography, Zackery  Malloy from that project and the director,  Jordan C. Michael working on Half Dead Fred. 

 

  • I am excited to shoot in Flint Michigan. I have been going to Flint  since 2017 doing murals with Flint Public Art Project. I have met some great people and the community is overflowing with creativity.  After reading Haunted Flint,  I thought we should shoot a movie there. The architecture is great for this type of film and I want as many people from Flint in the movie as possible.
  • This campaign will help this film in many ways. When films are being made it is good to know there is an audience waiting to see them. We have a good story here and a good story deserves an audience. I look at this campaign as marketing. I also look at it as a way that people can get involved. We auditioned lots of locals and not everyone can star in a movie but there are options to be a part of it in other ways.

 

What we need

  • The campaign funds are for three main reasons: Main talent, transportation and to fill some acting roles that haven’t been cast. 
  • We have some amazing perks for our backers. You can be in this film as a role or a ghost! You can be drawn as a ghost in front of our famous location in Carriage Town or at the graveyard where we have an exciting scene planned out. We also have little perks that you can get like shirts and stickers! Every little bit helps,  even a few bucks can keep our campaign trending on the platform so no amount is too little.
  • I am 100 percent sure we will reach our goals and even push it to stretch goals. The films funding is already in place. The goals that will be ahead of us are marketing, film festivals, and  post production costs. It will also cost to screen in movie theaters with premieres in Flint and in Los Angeles. It is very expensive making a good movie and that is what we are doing.At this point our budget is very low to make this happen so it will help to get a positive campaign going. We are building a team, The next movie I have planned is going to probably have most of the same people. The team is the dream! 

 

If you can't contribute

I understand if you can't contribute for what ever reason. Another way you can help is just sharing this campaign on any platform you have. Most of these campaigns get traction on Facebook or Twitter. A share would mean a lot and we appreciate your time and effort! 

 

I thank you for your attention. I am brutally honest and transparent in the goals we have. This movie will be made and I hope you can be a part of it.

UPDATE ! We made our first goal so we will be hustling to make a stretch goal of 15k. We also added a great actor to the cast. Jason London will be with us on this exciting journey. Go Independent film!

The team is the dream!

story:
“Day Jobs” Pilot Summary

Day Jobs follows the story of an aspiring comedian living in Los Angeles named Stevie Tripp, who struggles to make rent to her recently ex-boyfriend turned best friend, Jason because HEY, she just came out as gay and has to figure out how to be financially independent of him while they still live together.

Which is exactly what happened to me. 

But in this half-hour tv pilot, the way Stevie makes money is by babysitting for her ex-girlfriend who she fell in love with when she was in an open relationship... Which is LOOSELY based on my experiences but mostly based on my actual nightmare. 

I mean imagine babysitting for a woman you used to be in love with who didn’t choose you? Hot. 

This script landed as a Semi-Finalist in the 2021 Walt Disney Writing for Television Program and was the top 77/2000 applicants. 

Creator’s Statement

My name’s Stevie Wain, and I’m so jazzed to be gay!

I’m a stand-up comedian living in LA who has written this TV show from the angsty pulsing spider veins that beat through my bitter heart. It’s a half-hour pilot dramedy about my journey in stand-up comedy as I’ve recently come out and continue to be best friends with my ex-boyfriend. I’ve never seen a relationship like ours on TV.

I’d love to pretend to be America’s sweetheart but I’ve fallen secretly in love with enough married women whilst babysitting for them that I might be on a list. This story is about those honest human dirty connections that put us on that list: The strive we make towards becoming our most authentic selves however painful and ugly it may be. And let me tell you, I’ve spent a lot of days feeling like a garbage human! But even vermins reproduce so, here we are. Show me yours, and I’ll show you, well… 

I just don’t know a writer I admire who hasn’t taken their shitstorm of grief and turned it into something palpable… So here I am, putting my damn self out here, offering you a chance to feel a little less alone in case you've ever stood in my shoes. Cheers! We're here, we're queer and we're attempting to do it. 

Our Needs

We’re looking to raise about $6500 to make this pilot which would cover the cost of essential things like equipment rentals, locations, food for a five-day shoot, paying actors and crew, lighting, editing, and insurance.

Meet The Cast

Co-Director and "Stevie Tripp" played by Stevie Wain

Stevie Wain is a standup comedian and screenwriter living in Los Angeles who was a Finalist for the 2021 Screencraft Screenwriting Fellowship (top 50/5000 applicants) and a Semi-Finalist for the 2021 Walt Disney Television Writing Program (top 77/2000 submissions). Her latest script New Hope garnered a score of an “8” on The Blacklist and she’s currently developing a new half-hour comedy tv show called Outcasts which is about a queer Catholic middle schooler in the 90s who learns how to be a witch in conversion therapy. She also runs her own comedy show called That’s So Gay! in Los Angeles, featuring the best up-and-coming queer comedians. Let's just say... if it's queer she'd love to be involved!

"Jason" played by Jared Kassebaum

Originally hailing from Indiana, LA actor and comedian Jared Kassebaum charms audiences nationally with his unique blend of naive storytelling, witty wordplay, and the occasional musical number. He runs a popular monthly show in Los Angeles and has performed all around the country. His stage work includes a production of Edward Albee’s The Zoo Story with Playpractice Theater Company in Los Angeles. He aspires one day to blow up on TikTok with the youths.

"Scarlett" played by Becca Buckalew 

Hailing from a small town on the central coast Becca Buckalew enjoyed the great outdoors growing up in Monterey County. After derailing her life at a young age and completely altering her trajectory, Becca switched from a law enforcement emphasis and dove headfirst into an acting career. She has not only been lying ever since but has had a hell of a time doing so. Most notably in a feature named Underdog she has more recently shot a series in Eastern Europe due to show 2022. She is passionate about her motorcycle, doing her very best, and helping people escape reality for a brief period of time. 

"Dick" played by Michael Sutherland 

Michael Sutherland trained in drama at NYU and the Stella Adler Studio where he studied with Mark Rylance. He went on to get a Master’s in classical drama at the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art (LAMDA). With an eclectic artistic career, he started in independent theater where he acted, directed, and developed original projects including a play on The Kilroy’s List of best-unproduced women’s plays and a Samuel French Finalist. As an actor, he appeared as Benedick in Much Ado directed by Tony nominee Moritz von Stuelpnagel and as Brad opposite Neil Patrick Harris in the Rocky Horror Show benefit on Broadway. As a writer, his first screenplay was an Academy Nicholl Semi-Finalist. Upcoming, he’ll be appearing in The Deliverer directed by Sebastien Bazile. 

 

Meet The Team

Co-Director, Auri Jackson

Auri Jackson is a writer-director that specializes in both unscripted and narrative content about environmental issues like climate change and plastic pollution. She also loves comedy and does stand up. Her thesis film at NYU won the only Faculty Commendation in Comedy at the 2014 First Run Film Festival. She is currently a Lead Video Producer at BuzzFeed with a focus on the environment, known for “I Tried To Make Zero Trash For 30 Days” and "I Want You To Stop Recycling." In 2020, a narrative short she directed, The Return, was accepted into the environmental category of the Bozeman International Film Festival and the San Diego Latino Film Festival.

Producer, River Branson

River is a jack of all trades producer-type who doesn’t have any straight friends. He grew up in politically conservative Orange County and was raised by a Latinos For Trump mom and a Trumpster dad. River’s conservative upbringing inspired him to create queer media for trans and queer people like him. After college, he moved to New York where he produced LGBT-focused videos for BuzzFeed News. He’s currently a freelance producer in LA, where you can find him biking the streets of Frogtown, perfecting the art of fermentation, and completely eating it in his attempts to surf.

Director of Photography, Kevin Stiller

Kevin grew up in Sugar Land, Texas spending his time breaking open electronics to see what makes them tick and making short films with my friends using a mini DV camera. These pastimes developed into full-fledged love for the art of creating bold, cinematic imagery with a foundation of technical cognizance. In his free time, Kevin enjoys loves designing & fabricating interactive creations with his 3D printer.

Editor, Heather Maggi

Heather is a television and film editor hailing from Pennsylvania. She has been working in LA for 8 years. She has had her hand in shows such as Orange is the New Black, Most Dangerous Game, and Diary of a Future President. Her most recent editorial credits include the feature A New Christmas and a web series Run Away With Me.

Production Designer, Adrian Arnold

Adrian was born and raised in San Francisco, spent her college years in New Orleans, and is now living and working in Los Angeles. Growing up with architect parents she developed an appreciation for creating spaces that can elicit feelings from a young age. When she discovered production design as a career she knew it was the perfect format for her to use her love for design to tell a story and to create feeling. She’s worked in a number of Art Department roles on commercials, features, and shorts. In her free time, you can find her in her side yard covered in a generous layer of sawdust and paint fixing up her latest curb find.

THANK YOU!

Thank you for supporting our filmmaking dreams. If you cannot donate at this time, perhaps you can share on your social media!? Every little bit helps and we cannot do this without you. So from the big bottom of our hearts, thank you for believing in us!
story_txt: “Day Jobs” Pilot SummaryDay Jobs follows the story of an aspiring comedian living in Los Angeles named Stevie Tripp, who struggles to make rent to her recently ex-boyfriend turned best friend, Jason because HEY, she just came out as gay and has to figure out how to be financially independent of him while they still live together.Which is exactly what happened to me. But in this half-hour tv pilot, the way Stevie makes money is by babysitting for her ex-girlfriend who she fell in love with when she was in an open relationship... Which is LOOSELY based on my experiences but mostly based on my actual nightmare. I mean imagine babysitting for a woman you used to be in love with who didn’t choose you? Hot. This script landed as a Semi-Finalist in the 2021 Walt Disney Writing for Television Program and was the top 77/2000 applicants. Creator’s StatementMy name’s Stevie Wain, and I’m so jazzed to be gay!I’m a stand-up comedian living in LA who has written this TV show from the angsty pulsing spider veins that beat through my bitter heart. It’s a half-hour pilot dramedy about my journey in stand-up comedy as I’ve recently come out and continue to be best friends with my ex-boyfriend. I’ve never seen a relationship like ours on TV.I’d love to pretend to be America’s sweetheart but I’ve fallen secretly in love with enough married women whilst babysitting for them that I might be on a list. This story is about those honest human dirty connections that put us on that list: The strive we make towards becoming our most authentic selves however painful and ugly it may be. And let me tell you, I’ve spent a lot of days feeling like a garbage human! But even vermins reproduce so, here we are. Show me yours, and I’ll show you, well… I just don’t know a writer I admire who hasn’t taken their shitstorm of grief and turned it into something palpable… So here I am, putting my damn self out here, offering you a chance to feel a little less alone in case you've ever stood in my shoes. Cheers! We're here, we're queer and we're attempting to do it. Our NeedsWe’re looking to raise about $6500 to make this pilot which would cover the cost of essential things like equipment rentals, locations, food for a five-day shoot, paying actors and crew, lighting, editing, and insurance.Meet The CastCo-Director and "Stevie Tripp" played by Stevie WainStevie Wain is a standup comedian and screenwriter living in Los Angeles who was a Finalist for the 2021 Screencraft Screenwriting Fellowship (top 50/5000 applicants) and a Semi-Finalist for the 2021 Walt Disney Television Writing Program (top 77/2000 submissions). Her latest script New Hope garnered a score of an “8” on The Blacklist and she’s currently developing a new half-hour comedy tv show called Outcasts which is about a queer Catholic middle schooler in the 90s who learns how to be a witch in conversion therapy. She also runs her own comedy show called That’s So Gay! in Los Angeles, featuring the best up-and-coming queer comedians. Let's just say... if it's queer she'd love to be involved!"Jason" played by Jared KassebaumOriginally hailing from Indiana, LA actor and comedian Jared Kassebaum charms audiences nationally with his unique blend of naive storytelling, witty wordplay, and the occasional musical number. He runs a popular monthly show in Los Angeles and has performed all around the country. His stage work includes a production of Edward Albee’s The Zoo Story with Playpractice Theater Company in Los Angeles. He aspires one day to blow up on TikTok with the youths."Scarlett" played by Becca Buckalew Hailing from a small town on the central coast Becca Buckalew enjoyed the great outdoors growing up in Monterey County. After derailing her life at a young age and completely altering her trajectory, Becca switched from a law enforcement emphasis and dove headfirst into an acting career. She has not only been lying ever since but has had a hell of a time doing so. Most notably in a feature named Underdog she has more recently shot a series in Eastern Europe due to show 2022. She is passionate about her motorcycle, doing her very best, and helping people escape reality for a brief period of time. "Dick" played by Michael Sutherland Michael Sutherland trained in drama at NYU and the Stella Adler Studio where he studied with Mark Rylance. He went on to get a Master’s in classical drama at the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art (LAMDA). With an eclectic artistic career, he started in independent theater where he acted, directed, and developed original projects including a play on The Kilroy’s List of best-unproduced women’s plays and a Samuel French Finalist. As an actor, he appeared as Benedick in Much Ado directed by Tony nominee Moritz von Stuelpnagel and as Brad opposite Neil Patrick Harris in the Rocky Horror Show benefit on Broadway. As a writer, his first screenplay was an Academy Nicholl Semi-Finalist. Upcoming, he’ll be appearing in The Deliverer directed by Sebastien Bazile.  Meet The TeamCo-Director, Auri JacksonAuri Jackson is a writer-director that specializes in both unscripted and narrative content about environmental issues like climate change and plastic pollution. She also loves comedy and does stand up. Her thesis film at NYU won the only Faculty Commendation in Comedy at the 2014 First Run Film Festival. He grew up in politically conservative Orange County and was raised by a Latinos For Trump mom and a Trumpster dad. River’s conservative upbringing inspired him to create queer media for trans and queer people like him. After college, he moved to New York where he produced LGBT-focused videos for BuzzFeed News. He’s currently a freelance producer in LA, where you can find him biking the streets of Frogtown, perfecting the art of fermentation, and completely eating it in his attempts to surf.Director of Photography, Kevin StillerKevin grew up in Sugar Land, Texas spending his time breaking open electronics to see what makes them tick and making short films with my friends using a mini DV camera. These pastimes developed into full-fledged love for the art of creating bold, cinematic imagery with a foundation of technical cognizance. In his free time, Kevin enjoys loves designing & fabricating interactive creations with his 3D printer.Editor, Heather MaggiHeather is a television and film editor hailing from Pennsylvania. She has been working in LA for 8 years. She has had her hand in shows such as Orange is the New Black, Most Dangerous Game, and Diary of a Future President. Her most recent editorial credits include the feature A New Christmas and a web series Run Away With Me.Production Designer, Adrian ArnoldAdrian was born and raised in San Francisco, spent her college years in New Orleans, and is now living and working in Los Angeles. Growing up with architect parents she developed an appreciation for creating spaces that can elicit feelings from a young age. story:
13 Fanboy

Friday the 13th has a passionate fan base that has been waiting for almost a decade for another installment. With the lawsuit between Victor Miller and Sean Cunningham still not resolved a new film isn't likely for several more years, but we have a solution for your much needed fix. 

Our horror thriller brings your favorite Friday the 13th actors back to the big screen in an entirely new horror series about a fan, who takes his love for the series too far and targets the real-life women from the franchise to kill them like they were killed in the Friday films or "improve" their deaths.

13 Fanboy melds the slasher-style kills that Friday is famous for and the heart-pounding  thrillers such as Hush and Cape Fear. We will be using all practical effects, NO CGI to honor the 80s slashers. 

Our ALL-STAR horror cast includes:

Horror Icon Dee Wallace, known for her brilliant performances in ET, The Howling, Cujo, Halloween (2007), Critters and many more. 

Corey Feldman, 80s icon, played in Friday the 13th, Goonies, Stand By Me, Lost Boys, Gremlins 

C.J. Graham, who played Jason, in Jason Lives

 

Judie Aronson from the Final Chapter, Weird Science, American Ninja

Tracie Savage, who played Debbie, from Friday the 13th III 

Jennifer Banko, Friday the 13th VII, Texas Chainsaw Massacre III

Deborah Voorhees,  New Beginning

Ron Sloan from A New Beginning 

Andrew Leighty from Never Hike Alone

Vincente DiSanti from Never Hike Alone 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Voorhees Films is looking to raise 50K in order to bring in the cast you love. Funds over that will help us bring in more cast members, build a topnotch crew with a cinematographer and practical special effects experts to help us create some amazing cringe-worthy kills we have planned.  
  • Perks include behind-the-scene updates from the cast and crew, your name in the credits, titles as Co-Producer, Associate Producer and Executive Producer, invitations to the film's premiere and after party, 13 Fanboy masks, created by Marcio Charllie from Horror Costume Studios; autographs, posters, T-shirts, and much more. Besides getting your name in the credits, you can have your name in the film as characters, street names, names on mailboxes and locations named after you. 
  • During the campaign, your name will go into weekly drawings for Friday the 13th collectibles such as Jason action figures, hockey masks, artist drawings, Jason pendants, as well as passes to the film's premiere and passes to the after party.
  • If we don't reach our goal this first go around, the funds will go toward locking down our actors as we raise money through investors and product placement ads. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't financially contribute, you can still help by sharing and promoting the project on social media.  

FAN ART CALL: Artists may submit original HORROR art work for the film by sharing 13 Fanboy's Indiegogo campaign in three different groups/personal pages. Then email the links to the shared posts and email no more than two pieces of original art to Casting13Fanboy@gmail.com. ALL ART must be owned in whole by the artist/s submitting the work. You must also include the size of the art and the medium that the art is in. Art must NOT be infringing on copyright material. So self-created monsters or art having to do with 13 Fanboy will only be considered. 

FAN MUSICIAN CALL: Musicians may submit music for the film by sharing 13 Fanboy's Indiegogo campaign in three different groups/personal pages. Then email the links and two songs to Casting13Fanboy@gmail.com. ALL MUSIC must be owned in whole by the artist/s submitting the work. 

 

CASTING CALL: 

13 Fanboy wants YOU involved in the making of this film. We want YOU in the film! We have several speaking roles, of ALL ages, that you might be right for. You think you can act? Great! Show us. Whip out your cell phone and do a video audition for us! You have the choice of four monologues from Friday the 13th (they are down below)! Be natural. Relax. And good luck!

Step one: Share 13 Fanboy Indiegogo Campaign to three different horror groups or two horror groups and your personal page 

Step two: Record your audition 

Step three: Upload your video audition to YouTube or Vimeo

Step four: Include the links to THREE FB posts, Instagram or Twitter in the email to us 

Step five: Include in the email a link to your audition (you can make it private. be sure to send the password if needed)

Step six: Send all FOUR LINKS to Casting13Fanboy@gmail.com 

Step seven: If you're a professional actor include your reel and bio in the email. If not no worries. Send the video audition. 

RULES: You must share the Indiegogo campaign three times. Our new DEADLINE IS MARCH 1 at MIDNIGHT. No auditions will be accepted after that date. Send ONLY ONE monologue per person. No exceptions. 

Good luck! I will see you in the movies! 

FOUR MONOLOGUES TO CHOOSE FROM:

PAUL HOLT

I don't want to scare anyone, but I'm going to give it to you straight about Jason. His body was never recovered from the lake after he drowned. And if you listen to the old timers in town, they'll tell you he's still out there...some sort of demented creature, surviving in the wilderness, full grown by now. Stalking...stealing what he needs, living off wild animals and vegetation. Some folks claim they've even seen him...right in this area. The girl who survived that night at Camp Blood, that Friday the 13th, she claimed she saw him. She disappeared two months later. Vanished. Blood was everywhere. No one knows what happened to her. Legend has it that Jason saw his mother beheaded that night...and he took his revenge. A revenge that he'll continue to seek if anyone ever enters his wilderness again. And by now, I guess you all know, we're the first to return here. Five years...five long years he's been dormant...and he's hungry. Jason's out there...watching...always on the prowl for intruders. Waiting to kill...waiting to devour. Thirsty for young blood. 

PAMELA VOORHEES

Oh god, this place! (throws hands against wall) Steve should never have opened this place again. There's been too much trouble here.  Did you know a young boy drowned the year before those two others were killed? The counselors weren't paying any attention... They were making love while that young boy drowned. His name was Jason. I was working the day that it happened. Preparing meals... here. I was the cook. Jason should've been watched. Every minute. He was... he wasn't a very good swimmer. We can go now, dear. It'll be easier for you than it was for Jason.

MARCIE CUNNINGHAM

Yeah I had this dream about five or six times when I'm in a thunderstorm. And it's raining really hard, it sounds like pebbles when it hits the ground. I can hear it! I try to block out the sound with my hands only it doesn't work, the sound keeps getting louder and louder. And then the rain turns to blood, and it washes away in little rivers, and then the sound stops.  I call it my shower dream.

MAYOR COBB

I don't care if you have to put your fucking mother behind bars! Get me the goddamn psycho who's responsible for this mess!! Holy shit, Tucker, What the hell's going on here?! I'm mean, this is a small town, man, and small towns are supposed to be safe!  Jason Voorhees? You're out of your fucking mind. You've been out in the sun too long. Jason Voorhees is dead! His body was cremated. He's nothing but a handful of ash.  Jason Voorhees?  I can't believe this! Here. This is your "Jason Voorhees" here. This!  Your ass is on the line here, Tucker. Are you getting that? You get me a goddamn live suspect!
