story:
About the Filmmaker

Hoping you are doing as best as possible during this unprecedented time and it's nice to e-meet you all! My name is Tasha Hardy and I'm a writer and a producer. Even though I'm not a fan of country music and scorching hot weather, I somehow love living in Austin, Texas.

My achievements include winning Cannes Gold & Silver Medals, producing animation for National Geographic and television pilots starring Bryan Cranston and George Takei, being an optioned writer, and winning/placing in numerous screenwriting awards. I am also a WGA Independent Writers Caucus member.

Story

CURIOSITY is an award-winning, quirky dramedy about a bored, small town mailman, Bob Cooke, who has a not-so-secret double life of spying on people and impulsively getting into their business. When he witnesses the girl of his dreams being kidnapped, it sends him into a hyper stealth mode, working alongside his younger, skeptical friend Dustin – a detective wannabe. 

A note from the filmmaker (Why am I doing this?!)

Part I:

Nobody normally wakes up one day and says "I think I'll spend 5000 hours over the next six months writing, fundraising for and making a short film." But during the pandemic, this happened to me.  Let me back up a bit. The night before I had binge watched "The Good Place" and woke up feeling hopeful, despite not leaving the house for two weeks and having had developed a crippling fear of doorknobs.

I thought about a tv pilot script I had written a couple of years back that had a similar tone and message and I thought "Curiosity would make people feel happy when they watch it." From that point on I become obsessed with pulling a short out of the pilot script to shoot. (This will also be used as a presentation piece for the television series.)

Part II:

As mentioned in the video, when I was younger I felt invisible. I was shy and had a hard time fitting in. Anxious to make friends, I started really listening to what was going on around me, which sometimes included people's private conversations/stuff I wasn't supposed to know. I became the "town gossip" and "snoop" wherever I went. I knew everything about everyone and people came to me for information. It made me feel connected and useful.

What I gleaned from this experience of myself is that I think all of us deep down inside want to make a positive difference; it just kind of comes out in weird ways sometimes. This is the theme of this film.

 - Me circa 1981 after snooping in all of the Christmas presents and taping them back together

Also this is a very diverse project, with positive commentary and undertones of racial inclusion and understanding. I feel it supports some of the social challenges currently going on in the world.

What We Need 

Making a movie is no cheap deal. In fact when I look at my budget my vision goes blurry. That's the bad news. The good news is my team and I know how to make movies and have a track record to prove it, we just need the funding and that's where you come in.

We have an initial goal of $20k as well as some stretch goals that I will explain after I share with you this beautiful pie chart I made to show you just where your money will be going. (It took me a really long time so please take it in.) 

If we make close to the goal but not the entire goal, the money will filter into the same percentages we would just need to slim the budget down in certain areas. Examples: Find a less expensive location. Tasha doesn't eat during production. (No problem.)

The funded money will pay the costs of transportation, locations, permissions, insurances, catering, equipment, set decoration, costumes, make-up, sound editing and mixing, color grading and distribution. The team of filmmakers enlisted for this project have the ability to make a small budget look like a studio film. You can help us make this happen! 

What You Get

Every contribution counts and we've come up with some very customized incentives that we think will make your heads pop up like flamingos. We'll let you peruse, but some of the perks include: a totally customized appreciation or love letter to the person of your choice, a private link to view the film as soon as it is released, or even an executive producer credit on the project!

Team

Tasha Hardy - Writer, Producer

Tasha Pearl Hardy is a writer and producer with extensive experience in film and video.

Tasha won "Best Texas Writer" at the 2019 Austin Revolution Film Festival and is a three timed optioned writer. She's won five screenwriting awards and her work made it to the finalist round in over ten other competitions.

Tasha was a producer on the Star Trek special "World Enough and Time," starring George Takei. This won a TV Guide Award and was nominated for Nebula and Hugo awards. She also produced a television pilot, "Hollywood Quad," co-starring Bryan Cranston (Breaking Bad), which was featured in Emmy Magazine.

Currently, Tasha heads up the scriptwriting vertical at Visually and was the Supervising Producer of Animation on National Geographic Channel's "The Big Picture," starring Kal Penn. "Morton Salt Girl's 100th Birthday," a commercial video she produced, won a gold & silver metal at Cannes.

James Sunshine - Director

James Sunshine is a producer, director and writer, known best for "Safer at Home: The Coronavirus Movie" starring Joseph D. Reitman, Kimberley Crossman and John Lehr. He has also directed numerous short films that have gone on to win awards in festivals, plus advertisements that have aired nationally. In addition, he's produced over half a decade's worth of major national television shows for CBS, ABC, Fox and more for shows including "Hell's Kitchen," "Project Runway," "Masterchef" and "Big Brother." He's also written more than 20 feature screenplays and pilots. Placing as a Semi-Finalist in the 2018 Academy Nicholls Fellowship.

John Lehr - Showrunner/"Mr. Avery"

John Lehr is a comedic performer, writer and producer working in television, film and theater.  He co-created Hulu’s comedy series “Quick Draw,” in which he also stared in and executive-produced. Lehr starred as Leslie Pool in “10 Items or Less,” the half-hour improvisational comedy series from Sony on TBS. Lehr also co-created and executive produced the series, which ran for three seasons.

Lehr has created multiple projects, most involving his unique improvisational-based “hybrid” style found in “10 Items” and “Memron” (a Slamdance award-winning mockumentary). With Lehr starring, he recently completed “Let It Ride,” a half-hour comedy pilot set in Las Vegas for Comedy Central; “Retreat!,” a half-hour comedy pilot set in a corporate retreat for NBC; “King of Beers,” a half-hour comedy set in a brewery for EUE/Screengem; and “JailBait,” a web series for Sony and Crackle.com.

In addition, Lehr created the pilots “Team McPhearson,” an animated series inhabiting the world of Nascar for Fox starring Jeff Foxworthy; and “John Lehr Movie Club” for TBS.

Lehr’s critically acclaimed Comedic Lectures solo performances have had sold out runs in LA and New York. He is also a respected improvisational performer having worked at the Organic Theater and Steppenwolf Theater in Chicago, The Montreal Comedy Festival, Chicago Improvisational Festival and multiple venues in Los Angeles and New York.

Bob Clendenin - "Bob Cooke"

Robert Treman "Bob" Clendenin is an American actor best known for portraying Dr. Tom Gazelian on the ABC-TV comedy “Cougar Town.” Dr. Paul Zeltzer in the comedy series “Scrubs” and Earl in “That ‘70s Show.” 

Clendenin graduated from Cornell University in 1986 and earned his Master of Fine Arts from Penn State University in 1990. He has subsequently built an acting career defined by roles as oddball side characters in TV and film.

He has had series regular or recurring roles as Carl Dawson in the TBS series ”10 Items or Less” and Slow Roger in “My Name is Earl.” He appeared as characters in numerous shows including “The Tick,” ”Popular,” ”Charmed” (3x10), “Will & Grace, “ “The New Adventures of Old Christine,” “Ugly Betty,” “That ‘70’s Show,” “Felicity,” “Weeds,” “Gilmore Girls,” “NYPD Blue,” “Desperate Housewives,” “The League,” ”Star Trek: Voyager” (as a Vidiian surgeon), “Space: Above and Beyond,” ”Roswell,” and on several episodes of “The Closer.” 

He has appeared in many of John Lehr’s shows including “Quick Draw, “10 Items or Less” and “Jailbait.” He plays drug dealer Jamie DeBell on Netflix’s “Longmire.” 

Eddie Steeples - "Dustin Baker"

Steeples became nationally known when he was cast as the "Rubberband Man" in a series of award-winning commercials for OfficeMax, featuring the 1976 song "The Rubberband Man" by The Spinners. Steeples' performance in those commercials led him to be named one of the "World's Sexiest Men" of 2004 by People magazine. He has also appeared in the feature movie "Torque," starring Ice Cube, Faison Love, and Jaime Pressly.

Steeples played the role of Darnell Turner on the NBC comedy series "My Name Is Earl," which premiered on September 20, 2005 and ran for four seasons. Steeples on the show was known as Darnell Turner (witness protection name) aka Harry Monroe (real name) a.k.a. "Crab Man".

He's appeared as a guest on "The Chris Rock Show" and besides being an actor, he is also a producer, writer, director and musician.

Callum Blue - "Peter Walker"

Callum blue is an English actor, best known for his roles on the Showtime series "Dead Like Me" and "The Tudors," as well as his roles as Zod in the American television series "Smallville," Alex in the British television series "The Secret Diary of a Call Girl" alongside Billie Piper, and Andrew Jacoby in the film "The Princess Diaries 2: Royal Engagement" alongside Anne Hathaway. He recently starred in the award winning thriller "Good Night Death."

Other Ways You Can Help

In order to reach our goal, we will need support from as many of you as possible. In addition to contributing to the campaign, sharing the link to the campaign via social media will help to spread the word. Sharing is caring!

Risks & Challenges

Planning this project in the middle of Covid 19 has been like climbing a mountain, but we're a talented group of filmmakers and ready to make it happen!

The challenges for the production are fairly simple, and they come down to the financial scope of the shoot. The resources we have to execute on this film depend on securing sufficient funding. Meeting our goal is the best scenario and a shortfall will mean working to a different financial model. (If we significantly exceed our Indieagogo goal, that's a different story, and makes things much more secure.)  There is an additional consideration with the progress of Covid 19 and the effect on future film rules and regulations. However, we are confident that we will be able to film safely, even if some restrictions are still in place. We are working to a safe production slot in February/March 2021, taking time to ensure the production is as secure as possible.
story_txt:
About the Filmmaker
Hoping you are doing as best as possible during this unprecedented time and it's nice to e-meet you all! My name is Tasha Hardy and I'm a writer and a producer. Even though I'm not a fan of country music and scorching hot weather, I somehow love living in Austin, Texas.
My achievements include winning Cannes Gold & Silver Medals, producing animation for National Geographic and television pilots starring Bryan Cranston and George Takei, being an optioned writer, and winning/placing in numerous screenwriting awards. I am also a WGA Independent Writers Caucus member.

Story
CURIOSITY is an award-winning, quirky dramedy about a bored, small town mailman, Bob Cooke, who has a not-so-secret double life of spying on people and impulsively getting into their business. When he witnesses the girl of his dreams being kidnapped, it sends him into a hyper stealth mode, working alongside his younger, skeptical friend Dustin – a detective wannabe. 
A note from the filmmaker (Why am I doing this?!)
Part I:
Nobody normally wakes up one day and says "I think I'll spend 5000 hours over the next six months writing, fundraising for and making a short film." But during the pandemic, this happened to me.  Let me back up a bit. The night before I had binge watched "The Good Place" and woke up feeling hopeful, despite not leaving the house for two weeks and having had developed a crippling fear of doorknobs.
I thought about a tv pilot script I had written a couple of years back that had a similar tone and message and I thought "Curiosity would make people feel happy when they watch it." From that point on I become obsessed with pulling a short out of the pilot script to shoot. (This will also be used as a presentation piece for the television series.)
Part II:
As mentioned in the video, when I was younger I felt invisible. I was shy and had a hard time fitting in. Anxious to make friends, I started really listening to what was going on around me, which sometimes included people's private conversations/stuff I wasn't supposed to know. I became the "town gossip" and "snoop" wherever I went. I knew everything about everyone and people came to me for information. It made me feel connected and useful.
What I gleaned from this experience of myself is that I think all of us deep down inside want to make a positive difference; it just kind of comes out in weird ways sometimes. This is the theme of this film.

 - Me circa 1981 after snooping in all of the Christmas presents and taping them back together
Also this is a very diverse project, with positive commentary and undertones of racial inclusion and understanding. I feel it supports some of the social challenges currently going on in the world.
What We Need 
Making a movie is no cheap deal. In fact when I look at my budget my vision goes blurry. That's the bad news. The good news is my team and I know how to make movies and have a track record to prove it, we just need the funding and that's where you come in.
We have an initial goal of $20k as well as some stretch goals that I will explain after I share with you this beautiful pie chart I made to show you just where your money will be going. (It took me a really long time so please take it in.) 
If we make close to the goal but not the entire goal, the money will filter into the same percentages we would just need to slim the budget down in certain areas. Examples: Find a less expensive location. Tasha doesn't eat during production. (No problem.)

The funded money will pay the costs of transportation, locations, permissions, insurances, catering, equipment, set decoration, costumes, make-up, sound editing and mixing, color grading and distribution. The team of filmmakers enlisted for this project have the ability to make a small budget look like a studio film. You can help us make this happen! 

What You Get
Every contribution counts and we've come up with some very customized incentives that we think will make your heads pop up like flamingos. We'll let you peruse, but some of the perks include: a totally customized appreciation or love letter to the person of your choice, a private link to view the film as soon as it is released, or even an executive producer credit on the project!
Team
Tasha Hardy - Writer, Producer

Tasha Pearl Hardy is a writer and producer with extensive experience in film and video.
Tasha won "Best Texas Writer" at the 2019 Austin Revolution Film Festival and is a three timed optioned writer. She's won five screenwriting awards and her work made it to the finalist round in over ten other competitions.
Tasha was a producer on the Star Trek special "World Enough and Time," starring George Takei. This won a TV Guide Award and was nominated for Nebula and Hugo awards. She also produced a television pilot, "Hollywood Quad," co-starring Bryan Cranston (Breaking Bad), which was featured in Emmy Magazine.
Currently, Tasha heads up the scriptwriting vertical at Visually and was the Supervising Producer of Animation on National Geographic Channel's "The Big Picture," starring Kal Penn. "Morton Salt Girl's 100th Birthday," a commercial video she produced, won a gold & silver metal at Cannes.
James Sunshine - Director

James Sunshine is a producer, director and writer, known best for "Safer at Home: The Coronavirus Movie" starring Joseph D. Reitman, Kimberley Crossman and John Lehr. He has also directed numerous short films that have gone on to win awards in festivals, plus advertisements that have aired nationally. In addition, he's produced over half a decade's worth of major national television shows for CBS, ABC, Fox and more for shows including "Hell's Kitchen," "Project Runway," "Masterchef" and "Big Brother." He's also written more than 20 feature screenplays and pilots. Placing as a Semi-Finalist in the 2018 Academy Nicholls Fellowship.
John Lehr - Showrunner/"Mr. Avery"

John Lehr is a comedic performer, writer and producer working in television, film and theater.  He co-created Hulu’s comedy series “Quick Draw,” in which he also stared in and executive-produced. Lehr starred as Leslie Pool in “10 Items or Less,” the half-hour improvisational comedy series from Sony on TBS. Lehr also co-created and executive produced the series, which ran for three seasons.
Lehr has created multiple projects, most involving his unique improvisational-based “hybrid” style found in “10 Items” and “Memron” (a Slamdance award-winning mockumentary). With Lehr starring, he recently completed “Let It Ride,” a half-hour comedy pilot set in Las Vegas for Comedy Central; “Retreat!,” a half-hour comedy pilot set in a corporate retreat for NBC; “King of Beers,” a half-hour comedy set in a brewery for EUE/Screengem; and “JailBait,” a web series for Sony and Crackle.com.
In addition, Lehr created the pilots “Team McPhearson,” an animated series inhabiting the world of Nascar for Fox starring Jeff Foxworthy; and “John Lehr Movie Club” for TBS.
Lehr’s critically acclaimed Comedic Lectures solo performances have had sold out runs in LA and New York. He is also a respected improvisational performer having worked at the Organic Theater and Steppenwolf Theater in Chicago, The Montreal Comedy Festival, Chicago Improvisational Festival and multiple venues in Los Angeles and New York.
Bob Clendenin - "Bob Cooke"

Robert Treman "Bob" Clendenin is an American actor best known for portraying Dr. Tom Gazelian on the ABC-TV comedy “Cougar Town.” Dr. Paul Zeltzer in the comedy series “Scrubs” and Earl in “That ‘70s Show.”

He recently starred in the award winning thriller "Good Night Death."

Risks & Challenges

Planning this project in the middle of Covid 19 has been like climbing a mountain, but we're a talented group of filmmakers and ready to make it happen!
The challenges for the production are fairly simple, and they come down to the financial scope of the shoot. The resources we have to execute on this film depend on securing sufficient funding. Meeting our goal is the best scenario and a shortfall will mean working to a different financial model. (If we significantly exceed our Indieagogo goal, that's a different story, and makes things much more secure.)  There is an additional consideration with the progress of Covid 19 and the effect on future film rules and regulations. However, we are confident that we will be able to film safely, even if some restrictions are still in place. story:
A documentary film, Pure Land, is an independent project created by a Japanese filmmaker, Nori Mizukami with his friends in New York and Bogota. Despite the global pandemic and the ongoing political unrest in Colombia, Nori’s team has not stopped developing the project. It’s time to give a final push!

 

The term “pure land” comes from the pure land/Shin branch of Japanese Buddhism. It is commonly mistaken the term “pure land” is somewhere such as Heaven that one arrives afterlife, but in Shin Buddhism and especially in this film, we define it as a place where life problems stop being an obstacle. The ultimate and only goal for many Shin Buddhists is to find a Pure Land here and now.

As an introspective journey to living and suffering, the film invites the viewers to "home" where Shin Buddhism is practiced and allows an intimate look into the heart of Pure Land through the eyes of two Japanese Buddhists, Miki and Toni. 

From the beginning, I’ve intended to make this film for an audience who knows nothing about Japanese Buddhism. The film highlights the importance of listening to ourselves as individuals and as the whole society and it gives us an opportunity to explore the state of mind where we are free from the mundane world filled with greed, ignorance, and hatred. In short, you become your own therapist by engaging in Zen moments cinematically expressed by the filmmaker.

 

While the focal point of this documentary is to observe Home Buddhism in action, the film is also a portrait of two Japanese immigrants—an ordained priest in his 50s and his student who passionately dived into finding the awakening at the age of 89.

The student, Tsune Katz, aka Toni married an American soldier, Bernie, 75 years ago. Toni migrated from the defeated country to the US without knowing that she would never meet her mother again. Using archival photography and recent interview footage, we trace Toni’s life after the war until today. With a glimmer in her eye, she reflects on the love story including the first encounter with Bernie. Throughout the film, we closely listen to Toni as she shares turning points as wife and mother.  

Miki Nakura, a former banker, is a Buddhist priest from Higashi Honganji Temple in Kyoto. He spent his 20s in a fury of resentment against his mother. Before becoming a banker, Miki was accepted to work his dream job. His mother’s suicidal threat, however, forced him to give up his dream and led him to work at a bank for nearly 20 years. When he was 43, he finally decided to become a Buddhist priest and crossed the ocean for his life mission. In the film, Miki shares his path as a Buddhist and also how he came to forgive his own mother.

 

To launch this campaign, I cannot skip talking about the pandemic. When it started, I don’t think any of us knew how long this was going to last. Looking back in March of the last year, I was underestimating the impact of this global phenomenon while we were finishing our second fundraising and started editing the film. It’s not as simple as accusing the virus of the delay of the production, but to be honest, we could have finished editing the film last year if this didn’t happen. What’s more, Pandemic was not the end of the tragedy for Colombia. The political unrest triggered by many domestic issues has put more burden to make a living.

As a leader of this project, I felt the responsibility of pushing the members to meet the deadline and deliver the film to our funders, but at some point, I had to acknowledge the necessity of taking care of the physical and mental health of everyone including myself.

For those who have been tired of waiting for the completion of the project and kept supporting us, I want to express my deepest gratitude. Emails from the funders that I have never met in person have motivated us to the finishing line. ARIGATO!

Watch the pitch video about our journey.  

 

You might have known the project or actually made a contribution before. This is our third crowdfunding campaign. The first campaign was launched before the principal shooting in 2018, and the second time before post-production advanced – before the pandemic.

There is more to be discussed distribution-wise, but we are releasing the film with subtitles in English, Spanish, and Portuguese simply to reach more audiences around the world. And, we start with film festivals. 

The finishing fund raised by this campaign goes into:

  • Staffs’ salaries until the completion
  • Animation (photo & title)
  • Multi-lingual subtitles
  • Colorization (It was paid by the filmmaker and completed in June, 2021)
  • Original film scores
  • Sound mixing
  • Distribution
  • Legal fee (e&o)

 

Our delivery will be 100 minutes with a professional look and sound of 5.1ch.

Please spread the word about the campaign and share the link. Talking directly to your friends helps a lot! And, if you have some money to share for the project, please consider your contribution!

Director // Nori Mizukami

(Our key talents in New York)

NY Producer // Ma Luyao

Location Sound // Miguel Carrascal Del Riego

Cinematographer // Scott Ruderman

Cinematographer & 1st AC // Shounan Liu (Liam)

Original Music // Masatora Goya

(Our key talents in Bogota)

Editor & Production Coordinator // Giselle Geney

Editing Supervisor // Ivan Sierra

Translator (English, Japanese, Spanish) // Gabriel Garcia

Sound Designer and Mixer // Andres Montana

story:
If you want the French or Spanish version, click on the links below: 

En français / En español

 

1. Why you need to be part of the Food Synergy Movie

Why you should care

- 58% of food produced in Canada is wasted from farm to plate
- Avoidable food waste is worth $49 billion annually in Canada
- If food waste were a country, it would be the third leading cause of climate change

Good news! Positive solutions exist!

Those solutions need to be disseminated! The Food Synergy Movie is a mixed media feature documentary, sharing 7 positive stories from Canadian changemakers. Together, we will have a positive impact, making it easy to love food, from seed to soil, with practical solutions.

 
The whole food system is interconnected and food waste affects all parts of the environment and our lives. For positive change to happen, we need synergy in our food system! 
 


 

2. The Perfect Documentary

Unlike other documentaries about food waste, we’ll go across the 7 stages of the food supply chain, focusing on positive stories, made in British Columbia. We’ll also use multimedia styles, like dance, animation, and interviews.

A Canadian story in 7 chapters

Together with our partners from British Columbia, we’ve developed a compelling story from farm to plate. The film, 100% made in BC, will be divided into 7 chapters, corresponding to the 7 stages of the food supply chain, from farm to compost. BC-based industry leaders in each of these areas will be interviewed and will share their journey, their initiatives in addressing food waste, and their solutions and challenges towards sustainable practices. Farmers will learn from retailers, consumers will learn from restaurants, manufacturers will learn from distributors. Our world is craving solutions. Our world needs hope. This is why Food Synergy is important.

We will also ensure to follow sustainable practices to produce the documentary and will share with you all the green actions we’ve taken to make this happen.

Social Impact

Food Synergy aims at having the following positive impacts:
- Save food and money for each viewer: 20 kg food saved + $90 savings per viewer
- Maximize our positive impact with 100,000 viewers by 2023
- Strengthen the local ecosystem of food businesses 

 

3. Our partners

Check out our partners. We are so happy to be working with such amazing organizations that already lead the way to a world where avoidable food waste no longer exists! 

 

4. Rewards

Choose the perk that works for you, from a personalized thank you to the following ones!

- Special Thanks credit: this is your chance to shine!

- 2 VIP tickets: attend the Premiere in Vancouver

- Your face in the film: you will be interviewed, wherever you are in the world

- Associate Producer credit: be extra special!

- Executive Producer credit + the chair of the filmmaker of your choice

- Digital access to the film + access to an online party with our local heroes

    

               

We also have some exclusive sustainable perks from our interviewed heroes: Susgrainable gift-cards, $50 gift card for SPUD, organic produce from Rootdown Farm, food waste online workshops, and many more from our partners!

       
 
 

5. Who is behind Food Synergy?

We are a group of changemakers, looking towards a world where food is not only affordable but also ethically produced. We created the Food Synergy Movie because we know that with your involvement, we can bring inspiration to the world, protect our environment and help you save money while learning foodie tips!

We are four believers in social change. Join us in this exciting venture!

- Vivian Davidson, Director and Producer: Vivian is the filmmaker and CEO at Gaia Productions Inc, and actress in 40+ films and TV productions.

- Ben Liegey, Producer: Ben is a Food Waste Expert, Co-Founder of Rethink2gether, and has an Executive MBA.

- Grace Loeppky, Cinematographer: Grace was trained at the Nova Scotia College of Art and Design, and is specialized in documentaries, music videos and commercials.

- Kevin Tovaragi, Editor: Kevin's background is in filmmaking, graphic design and communication. He has experience editing documentaries and mini-series 

 

6. Contribution breakdown

We want to ensure being transparent not just by traceability of organizations involved, but also by sharing our cost distribution in the project. We are focusing on production costs, and 5% of the fundraiser will go to local non-profits fighting food waste: Vancouver Food Runners and Second Harvest.

7. What if we exceed our goal?

If we exceed our goal, we will:

- Work with a larger team of skilled animators

- Onboard more local artists for music, dance and colour correction

- Apply to international film festivals

- Organize educational campaigns

 

8. Risks & Challenges

Trust is really important to us, and we want to share nothing but the truth with you!

Timing and delays 

In our daily lives, our team members are all very punctual. Our expectations are really high for doing things in a timely manner. Like any project, there is a risk that timelines fall apart a lot. In this case, we will have an open communication with our backers.

Team

We have a strong team extremely motivated by the project. However, we are always at risk of losing a team member along the way. This has the potential to result in delays to fulfilment. In this case, and this impacting our ability to fulfill your pledge, we will reach out to our backers with an email including anticipated timeline.  

COVID-19

The pandemic may affect the timeline of the production. However, most of our interviewees have been secured and we are confident in being able to follow safety guidelines. Our team has been working in the creative industry during those challenging times and is uniquely positioned to overcome this challenge.

We will do our best to minimize those risks and communicate with you!

The whole food system is interconnected and food waste affects all parts of the environment and our lives. For positive change to happen, we need synergy in our food system! 
 

 
2. The Perfect Documentary
Unlike other documentaries about food waste, we’ll go across the 7 stages of the food supply chain, focusing on positive stories, made in British Columbia. We’ll also use multimedia styles, like dance, animation, and interviews.
A Canadian story in 7 chapters
Together with our partners from British Columbia, we’ve developed a compelling story from farm to plate. The film, 100% made in BC, will be divided into 7 chapters, corresponding to the 7 stages of the food supply chain, from farm to compost. BC-based industry leaders in each of these areas will be interviewed and will share their journey, their initiatives in addressing food waste, and their solutions and challenges towards sustainable practices. Farmers will learn from retailers, consumers will learn from restaurants, manufacturers will learn from distributors. Our world is craving solutions. Our world needs hope. This is why Food Synergy is important.

We will also ensure to follow sustainable practices to produce the documentary and will share with you all the green actions we’ve taken to make this happen.
Social Impact
Food Synergy aims at having the following positive impacts:- Save food and money for each viewer: 20 kg food saved + $90 savings per viewer- Maximize our positive impact with 100,000 viewers by 2023- Strengthen the local ecosystem of food businesses 
 
3. Our partners
Check out our partners. We are so happy to be working with such amazing organizations that already lead the way to a world where avoidable food waste no longer exists! 
 
4. Rewards
Choose the perk that works for you, from a personalized thank you to the following ones!
- Special Thanks credit: this is your chance to shine!
- 2 VIP tickets: attend the Premiere in Vancouver
- Your face in the film: you will be interviewed, wherever you are in the world
- Associate Producer credit: be extra special!
- Executive Producer credit + the chair of the filmmaker of your choice
- Digital access to the film + access to an online party with our local heroes
    
               
We also have some exclusive sustainable perks from our interviewed heroes: Susgrainable gift-cards, $50 gift card for SPUD, organic produce from Rootdown Farm, food waste online workshops, and many more from our partners!

       

 
 
5. Who is behind Food Synergy?

We are a group of changemakers, looking towards a world where food is not only affordable but also ethically produced. We created the Food Synergy Movie because we know that with your involvement, we can bring inspiration to the world, protect our environment and help you save money while learning foodie tips!
We are four believers in social change. Join us in this exciting venture!

- Vivian Davidson, Director and Producer: Vivian is the filmmaker and CEO at Gaia Productions Inc, and actress in 40+ films and TV productions.
- Ben Liegey, Producer: Ben is a Food Waste Expert, Co-Founder of Rethink2gether, and has an Executive MBA.
- Grace Loeppky, Cinematographer: Grace was trained at the Nova Scotia College of Art and Design, and is specialized in documentaries, music videos and commercials.
- Kevin Tovaragi, Editor: Kevin's background is in filmmaking, graphic design and communication. He has experience editing documentaries and mini-series 
 
6. Contribution breakdown
We want to ensure being transparent not just by traceability of organizations involved, but also by sharing our cost distribution in the project. We are focusing on production costs, and 5% of the fundraiser will go to local non-profits fighting food waste: Vancouver Food Runners and Second Harvest.


7. What if we exceed our goal?

If we exceed our goal, we will:
- Work with a larger team of skilled animators
- Onboard more local artists for music, dance and colour correction
- Apply to international film festivals
- Organize educational campaigns
 

8. Risks & Challenges

Trust is really important to us, and we want to share nothing but the truth with you!
Timing and delays 
In our daily lives, our team members are all very punctual. Our expectations are really high for doing things in a timely manner. Like any project, there is a risk that timelines fall apart a lot. In this case, we will have an open communication with our backers.
Team
We have a strong team extremely motivated by the project. However, we are always at risk of losing a team member along the way. This has the potential to result in delays to fulfilment. In this case, and this impacting our ability to fulfill your pledge, we will reach out to our backers with an email including anticipated timeline.  
COVID-19
The pandemic may affect the timeline of the production. However, most of our interviewees have been secured and we are confident in being able to follow safety guidelines. Our team has been working in the creative industry during those challenging times and is uniquely positioned to overcome this challenge.
We will do our best to minimize those risks and communicate with you!

story:
The Film

Our film deals with themes of hope. The main character Brooklyn, a young girl, is dealing with the recent cancer diagnosis of her mother, Joan. Throughout the film, Brooklyn understands more about the severity of this diagnosis and escapes to an imaginary kingdom where she learns to hold on to hope and to be there to comfort her mother during this difficult time. 

 

The Team

Kelly McElligott - Director and Cinematographer 

Kelly is a senior at Columbia College Chicago soon to receive a BFA in Cinematography and a minor in Marketing. In addition to being the director and cinematographer for other various projects, Kelly has been on camera and lighting crews for many short films and television shows. She is extremely excited to tell this very personal and emotional story and is grateful for the opportunity to capture it on 35mm film. 

 

Domenic Campo - Producer

Domenic hails from La Grange Park, Illinois. He is a senior at Columbia College Chicago studying Filmmaking with a focus on Producing. Domenic has produced multiple films independently and at Columbia. He is lined up to produce a Practicum film at Columbia title The Good Word  later this year. He is very thrilled to be producing Kelly's project and is looking forward to collaborating with the great people of this upcoming short film. 

 

Charlie Balsar - Camera Operator 

Charlie is a senior at Columbia College Chicago studying a BFA in Cinematography. He has worked as a Director, DP, Camera Assistant, Gaffer, and more, across several short and feature-length films. He has shot both digital and film previously and is incredibly excited about operating on a Panavision 35mm camera for Kelly's film. 

 

Maximilian Vanderwerf - Assistant Camera

Maximilian will be the 1st Assistant Camera for Cure. He is a cinematography major at Columbia College Chicago. He is thankful for his time at Columbia, both learning from and supporting his peers. As the AC, he will be keeping the emotions in focus and prepping the camera for any problem big or small. 

 

Toni Nordone - Key Grip

Toni is a rising Junior at Columbia and is focusing on Lighting and Cinematography. She has been working as a Grip, PA, and AC on various professional and student sets. Toni also dabbles in social media marketing for the Midwest Film Festival and is currently a brand ambassador/ model from the brand The Same Inside. She is key grip for this project and is excited to work and be a part of the team! 

 

Why We Need Your Help

While the production will be provided film processing and equipment by Columbia College Chicago, we are asking for $1,500 to help cover the cost of other aspects of production. This includes food for the cast and crew, transportation, production design, costuming, and locations. We need your help so that this story can come to life! If you are currently unable to donate, please share this page with friends and family in order to spread the word!

story:
Jay Nagle relocated to Las Vegas from Chicago.  Chicagoans are familiar with Mr. Nagle’s elaborate Chicago Park District Summer musical productions.  As co-director/choreographer for Northside Learning Center (Special Needs High School), he helped present the ever-popular spring productions at Northeastern University.  During his tenure, he has created numerous musical shows, many featuring the touring Senior Tap Troupe “Bergerettes and Fries.”

 

As Artistic Director/Choreographer /playwright and Co - Founder for Totally New Theater, he with his late partner  Dwayne Parks penned over twenty + original new musicals, many receiving numerous awards.

Since arriving in Las Vegas Mr. Nagle works with the Smith Center for the Performing Arts in various teaching artist positions with Disney musicals in schools, Southern Nevada Wolftrap, Links to Literature . Also a Certified Storyteller through Timeslips he works with Alzheimer patients at Cleveland Clinic in Las Vegas.

 

As a performer, Mr. Nagle has had the opportunity to appear at the Lincoln Center, Off Broadway and in several National tours.

History of Slammer the Prison girl Musical 

Slammer made its debut with a staged workshop production in October of 1996 at Totally New Theatre in Evansville Indiana followed by Productions in 1997 and 1998. After TNT relocating to Indianapolis in 1999 where TNT recreated it's  theater productions at Garfield Park , once again presenting original musicals. In 2000 SLAMMER THE PRISON GIRL MUSICAL was entered in a contest through ComedySportz Indianapolis and won first place. The prize was to present SLAMMER the musical for three weekends at ComedySportz Indianapolis National theater . The show took off like gangbusters and was presented for the next ten months on Sunday and Monday evenings to sold out crowds.

Once again in 2002 TNT was on the move and the company moved to Chicago, Illinois. Within six months arriving ComedySportz Chicago contacted myself and Dwayne Parks( co-creator) and wanted to know if we would be interested in mounting SLAMMER  the musical at ComedySportz Chicago ( Formerly the Steppenwolf Theater). We agreed and put out an audition notice and a wonderful thing happened ! Several of the amazing cast members, who left audience members in stitches in the Indianapolis production, loved SLAMMER so much they traveled to Chicago  for Sunday and Monday night performances. Along with new cast members from Chicago they created performances to  sold-out crowds and the Uproarious  laughter continued .The show ran for almost a year. 

And I'm very excited to bring this hysterical musical to  the screen.

We plan to start out with a trailer introducing all the characters in a music video/documentary style of filming. Next the musical numbers from the show will be filmed as  concept music video. Then finally  Slammer The Prison Girl Movie Musical  Movie Music Videos will be entered  in LGBTQ film Festivals and contests.

Our next campaign will be to raise funds to add the screenplay to the musical videos.

story:
LET’S MAKE HERSTORY!

With your support, we will launch a landmark film. Maxxie LaWow will be the first animated film to feature a drag superhero (and #dragvillain!) with a prominent LGBTQ+ and BIPOC cast of characters.

THE FILM

The One-Liner for TV Guide

When drag queens start disappearing, a shy young barista must summon his inner super-shero to rescue them from an evil cosmetics exec bent on harvesting their magical anti-aging tears.

OMG, Tell Me More!

Shy young barista, Simon, works at the Pink Unicorn Cafe with his childhood best friend, Jae. On his 21st birthday, Simon finds a magic wig that turns him into the titular drag super-shero, Maxxie LaWow.

Meanwhile, drag villain Dyna Bolical has discovered that drag queen tears are the secret to eternal youth. She's been kidnapping queens for a test batch of her new cosmetics line. Now she's going after Maxxie and her super-powered tears to take her cosmetics company global and become filthy rich…

WE CAN ALL RELATE

Maxxie LaWow is a coming of age film with heart. As RuPaul says, "Drag reveals who you are." When that magic wig transforms Simon into Maxxie LaWow, he's confident, strong, brash -- everything he's not as Simon. Yet Maxxie is everything Simon has the potential to be.

“MAXXIEWORLD” ADVENTURE REEL

We know that seeing is believing, so we spent our own money to create this fabulous two minute adventure reel with scenes from the current film project and future potential storylines.

PRODUCTION TEAM

“Maxxie LaWow: Drag Super-shero'' features an LGBTQ+ creative team. Maxxie LaWow is an original story created, directed, and produced by Anthony Hand with a script by Michael Phillis, and animated by Chubby Beagle Productions. Creative direction by Johnny Burgess, and audio by Jordan Chin.

Creator, Director, Executive Producer: Anthony Hand is a product designer and former entrepreneur in Silicon Valley where he puts his storytelling skills to use on a daily basis. Anthony has seen every season of RuPaul’s Drag Race since Season 1, frequents local and national theater and cabaret, and is a recovering comic book geek. Anthony is also President of the Board for the Silicon Valley Gay Men’s Chorus. Seattle drag legend Dina Martina is his spirit totem.

Writer: Michael Phillis is an award-winning writer, director, actor, educator, and drag queen. His film directorial debut, MINI SUPREME, was an Opening Night Selection at Palm Springs ShortFest and an Official Selection for Frameline, Outfest, and dozens of LGBTQ film festivals worldwide. He is the co-creator and director of BALONEY, San Francisco’s popular gay all-male revue, now in its fifth year in residence at SF Oasis. His drag persona Patty From HR has been terrorizing stages, screens, and Zoom meetings since 2018. 

Animation: Chubby Beagle Productions was founded by Karen and Bill in 2018. Before forming their studio, Karen and Bill worked for ten years in animation for Bento Box, Warner Bros., USC, Google, and more. They have now turned their attention to building their studio that supports and encourages all artists to tell their own unique stories. They are developing and building a diverse and sustainable animation studio through movies, shows, music videos, Youtube content, and their original IP. Bill and Karen are both avid fans of RuPaul and are inspired by all of his productions. In their off time, you can also find Bill and Karen playing video games, planting in the garden, and playing volleyball -- badly.

Creative Direction: Johnny Burgess is an Illustrator/Animator residing in the SF Bay Area. An avid fan of drag, he has illustrated such San Francisco drag icons as D'Arcy Drollinger, Peaches Christ, and Heklina, among many others. You can see more of his work at Art of Johnny Burgess.

Sound Design & Music: Jordan Chin is a composer, sound designer, and singer/songwriter from the San Francisco Bay Area. He’s been an active part of Silicon Valley’s LGBTQ+ community, and can’t wait to bring Maxxie LaWow to life with music and sound. He brings 8 years of experience working in the film and game industries, most recently releasing Monster Train, which was awarded PC Gamer’s Best Card Game of the Year in 2020. 

Associate Producer: D’Arcy Drollinger is an actor, writer, director, choreographer and producer. His first feature film, Shit and Champagne, debuts in 2021, in which Drollinger, wrote, directed and starred. D’Arcy is the owner and Artistic Director of OASIS, San Francisco’s internationally acclaimed nightclub / cabaret. Voted Best of the Bay in multiple categories including: Best Nightclub, Best Drag Show, and Best Cabaret Venue.

Production Consultant: Joanne Butcher was a Global Marketing Consultant for YouTube, running their UK movie rental unit and collaborating with engineers and curatorial teams all round the world. She has worked extensively with 100’s of filmmakers from the US, UK, Brazil, Cuba, the Caribbean and Latin America. Joanne is now a business coach working one on one with filmmakers to raise the money they need to make their films.

YOUR SUPPORT 

Your support is critical to helping us get off the ground running. By contributing, you not only help us lay the important creative groundwork for the film, but you also demonstrate to Hollywood that a film about LGBTQ+ characters is worth producing, and that there is an audience for great LGBTQ+ content. That gets noticed. 

By raising $50,000, we will be able to kick off pre-production of this animated feature film. 

  • $5,000: For additional character design.
  • $10,000: For world building and background design.
  • $20,000: For initial storyboarding.
  • $10,000: For original music for two lip sync numbers and a lip sync duel finale.
  • $5,000: For insurance and legal services.

WHAT THE FUTURE HOLDS

When Can I See Maxxie?!?

Maxxie LaWow will be animated in the 2D style. This process takes time as most frames are manually drawn by artists and is expensive. It's also beautiful! Our current timeline will make Maxxie LaWow available for film festivals starting in January 2024, and theatrical distribution around Summer/Fall 2024. Donate to this campaign, and you’ll receive regular updates on timing, sneak previews, and more! 

What’s Next After this Movie?

We are creating a fun, fashionable, and campy world for Maxxie LaWow and her friends. Getting picked up by any streaming service or network is hard under the best of circumstances, and harder for an LGBTQ+ story. But with your help and overwhelming support from the community, we know we can bring Maxxie back for more! 

You saw the adventure reel above. You will definitely want to know what’s going on with the characters from future storylines:  that were-unicorn, the DJ Demon, and the biker faerie gang. Please donate generously and tell your friends!

THE CAST

We are currently casting the lead actors and expect to make announcements soon… The voiceover cast are expected to be fabulous up-and-coming talent from the San Francisco Bay Area, Los Angeles, New York, and beyond. With maybe a surprise or two...

Fantasy Casting Question: Who would you like to see cast in the movie? Let us know by commenting on one of the Fantasy Casting Question posts on our Instagram @MaxxieLaWow. 

How we approach casting: Maxxie LaWow celebrates characters who are LGBTQ+ and/or BIPOC (Black/Indigenous/Persons of Color), and we seek reasonably authentic representation for such characters. 

For the Latest Casting News: Donate to this campaign to receive regular announcements. We won’t leave you guessing!

“HOW CAN I HELP?”

The more people who donate, the more we can do with this movie, and the more Hollywood will take notice. So please --

  • Share this campaign all over social media
  • Write a blog post
  • Mention us in your YouTube videos, and
  • Ask your friends to also support us. 

And follow us on all the social media!

  • Instagram: @MaxxieLaWow 
  • Facebook: Maxxie LaWow Fan Page 
  • On the Web: www.maxxie.com

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

We wouldn’t be able to do this without you -- literally! So for that, we thank you in advance for your generous support. 

DONATIONS

** Donations made to this Indiegogo campaign are not tax deductible. **

To make a larger donation that may be tax deductible in the U.S., contact us to learn more: info@maxxie.com .

 

CELEBRATE DRAG

CELEBRATE QUEER VOICES

While we’re waiting for Maxxie LaWow to hit cinemas and streaming services near you, please remember to support your local drag artists. And tip generously! After more than a year of Covid, your local drag artists also need your support. 

❤️  ❤️  ❤️  ❤️  ❤️

So for that, we thank you in advance for your generous support. DONATIONS** Donations made to this Indiegogo campaign are not tax deductible. **To make a larger donation that may be tax deductible in the U.S., contact us to learn more: info@maxxie.com . CELEBRATE DRAGCELEBRATE QUEER VOICESWhile we’re waiting for Maxxie LaWow to hit cinemas and streaming services near you, please remember to support your local drag artists. And tip generously! After more than a year of Covid, your local drag artists also need your support. ❤️  ❤️  ❤️  ❤️  ❤️

story:
Short Summary

 We are currently part way through filming and we need help to finish it and to get it on the Big Screen! We a wide range of people who them the bombing has affected them in different ways!

Who is in the film?

 

Adam Lawler: Aged just 16 at the time, Adam Lawler was with his good friend Olivia Campbell Hardy at the Ariana Grande Concert. He left with life changing injuries from the bombing and awoke to realise Olivia unfortunately didn't make it. Two years on, he doesn’t let it stop him. Next year he is due to start university and aspires to be a DJ. Currently he is involved with work experience at radio station XS Manchester alongside host Clint Boon.

Figen Murray: Figen tragically lost her son, 29 year-old Martyn Hett on the night of the bombing. Ever since, she has become a peace promoter and activist, working tirelessly to fight against extremism. Most recently she has been strongly campaigning for Martyn’s Law, a piece of legislation to be introduced to make public venues have tighter security as norm across the country to prevent another incident like Manchester from occurring again.

Clint Boon: A DJ, and Radio Presenter Clint has been entertaining Manchester for over 30 years. Clint started off in the rock band, Inspiral Carpets, as a Keyboardist back in 1986. After the bands break up in the mid 1990's he then went on to create his own band called the Clint Boon Experience. He has also made cameo in films  Oasis: Mad for It! as 24 Hour Party People. Clint is currently a presenter at radio station XS Manchester.

Aaron Parmer: As a Police Officer, Aaron was a first responder at the scene of the Arena. As a specialist officer he worked with the bereaved families. After coming to the end of this role he was inspired to follow his dream job of being a firefighter. Alongside his dream job, he has a passion for running - completing 22 marathons as a  tribute to the 22 victims whose lives were taken. As a result, he has so far raised £15,000 for charity - During his final run, Aaron wore his fire suit. Recently he has set up his running club Hive 22 which continues to raise much needed funds.

Survivor's Choir:  Set up in the aftermath of the bombing the Survivor's Choir aimed to bring together people who had been affected by the incident. They were able to channel their feelings into their mutual passion - Singing. Since its inception by founder Cath Hill, it has grown into a small community supporting each other. They have performed at a wide variety of venues and in the groups membership they have helped to support over 100 survivors. Their message of peace, hope and resilience being at the core of every performance. Currently they're planning a trip to Nice, France to perform at the International Congress for Survivors of Terrorism.

 

----Many more are involved in the film, check out our Social Media pages to find out!----

 

What We Need & What You Get

Let's break it down:

  • We are looking to raise £8,500 which covers: Equipment, Crew, Festival Costs and finally our BBFC rating which need to be eligible for Cinema release!
  • We have some amazing perks up for grabs! Including copies of the film, merchandise, film credits and even more - have a look!
  • Every little helps - Please pledge as much as you can!  

 

Your Impact

Your pledges help us to tell these stories in the best way that we can. Your backing helps to:

+Finish the remainder of filming - We have 14 more shoot days we need to cover: Equipment,     Crew, Transport, Food and many other things.

+ Fund Post Production - We need to pay to get licenced archive footage, also cover: Editing, Sound Mixing and Colour grading departments to make the film look and sound the best it can be!

+ Fund a Festival run of the film - The stories we have are amazing and we want to share them all over the world. Help us fund a full run to get into film festival in order to achieve this.

+Get the film into Cinemas -  We need a BBFC rating to be eligible for UK Cinema release.

Every donation helps!!

 

Risks & Challenges

We have on been on amazing journey! Making a film of this nature of course brings a variety of considerations:

+ We want to explore the positive actions of those affected - of course covering the bombings tragedy but also to show the very often missed perspectives. Following those who in some way have been inspired to bring hope and joy into the lives of others.

+Being sensitive and ethical with our presentation. That's why prior to the release we will send everyone who has been part of the film a copy of their footage to make sure they're comfortable.

+Representation to bring these stories for the world to see - most have just made local papers, we want to everyone know who these amazing people are and what they have done.

+Distribution: We of course are aiming to be legally able to obtain the right to have Cinema release  by getting the BBFC rating. However this does not guarantee it - we will be distributing ourselves to Cinema's who like the film and want to show it.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Aside from pledging here are several things that you can do to help out listed below.

  • Share this campaign with as many friends and family members as you can. Remember, not only are you funding the film, but 34% of the profits will go back into the Manchester community to help give back to others in need.
  • Look out for us at film festivals. We will be making the rounds on the festival circuit, if you hear of us please come along.
  • We are aiming for theatrical distribution and are already in early discussions with cinema chains. Go and see the film, purchase a copy when it comes available.
  • Support us on social media, you can follow the film on Twitter and Spread Like Wildfire Films, the production company making the film on YouTube, Twitter & Instagram.

 

Thank you!

story:
ZTV SYMPATHY FOR THE DEVIL

THE SHORT FILM...

"...essentially Big Brother meets Death Race but with zombies instead of cars."

 - Jonathan Barkan, DREAD CENTRAL

 

WHAT'S THE SHORT ABOUT?

DOUGLAS SIKES, a convicted war criminal from the American Zombie War, runs a black-market trading ring from the bowels of a walled-in quarantine zone turned for-profit prison. He and the other prisoners live under the watchful eye of the ZTV broadcasting company, and at the whim of THE PREZERVE, a capital punishment reality game show that uses zombies, and horrific devices, to torture, infect, and execute prisoners and their families on prime time network television. PAUL, and his daughter, LILY, arrive at Doug’s home to find him grief-stricken and consumed with rage after his daughter Steffie’s gruesome episode has broadcast her terrible fate for all the world to see. Paul and Lily find themselves in the cross-fire as Doug readies to unleash bloody vengeance on the institution and the vengeful woman who has oppressed him.

HERE'S A CLIP FROM THE FILM!

 

 
Doug expands Paul's understanding of how things work in the QZ...

Our writer, director Jason Ragosta was just announced as one of the semifinalists in the Screencraft Film Fund screenwriting contest, with his SciFi short script HYPERBOLA.

LINK: https://screencraft.org/2019/09/03/announcing-s...

 

WE'RE UP ON IMDB!

LINK: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt10929938/?ref_=nm_...

 

THE GEEK SPEAK SHOW PODCAST!

LINK: http://thegeekspeakshow.libsyn.com/webpage/1034...

 

MAKING MOVIES IS HARD PODCAST!

LINK: http://www.makingmoviesishard.com/ep222/?fbclid...

 

CREATURE FEATURES appearance!

 

 
Watch Jason discuss the ZTV short and comic with Vincent and enjoy an exclusive 2-minute clip from ZTV SYMPATHY FOR THE DEVIL that aired nationally on television on August 31st,2019. Enjoy!
 

LJ PRESENTS PODCAST EPISODE!

 
 
LINK: https://anchor.fm/l-jeffrey-moore/episodes/Lj-P...

 

WHERE'S ALL THIS MONEY GONNA GO?

WHAT WE NEED...

 

    $25K SPENDING BREAKDOWN:

        • INDIEGOGO CUT: $1250 • 5%

        • POST PRODUCTION: $10K • 40%

            - EDITOR

            - POST COLOR

            - SOUND DESIGN & FINAL MIX

            - ORIGINAL SCORE

            - DCP ENCODING (Digital Cinema Package for Theatrical Projection - Festivals)

            - VFX

        • REWARDS & SHIPPING: $7500 • 30%

        • PAYING OFF CREDIT CARD DEBT FROM THE SHOOT:  $6250K • 25%

STRETCH GOAL MONEY:

        • FESTIVAL SUBMISSIONS & TRAVEL: TBD If stretch goals are met...

        • ADDITIONAL REWARDS: To Be Revealed If stretch goals are met...

        • SHOOT AN IN_UNIVERSE COMMERCIAL: TBD If stretch goals are met...

        • SHOOT A ZTV FEATURE FILM: TBD If stretch goals are met...

 

THE REWARDS

WHAT YOU CAN GET...

 

THE BLU RAY

WITH BONUS FEATURES...

The blu ray will have the short film as well as bonus features which will include: 

• The Full TV episode of the Steffie Sikes episode of The PreZerve 

• BTS/Making Of videos

• The Trailer

• And possibly some other goodies TBD...

 

ZTV: UNDEAD EMPIRE • COMIC BOOK

A UNIVERSE EXPANDED...

Because there is far too much story in Jason's head, he has already written volumes of material which expands the ZTV universe in several directions. We were only able to give a small taste of that world in the short film, but the comic, free from the budgetary constraints of filmmaking, will be used to explore the massive potential of the universe as well as exploring small quiet struggles of far-flung characters in their most solitary and desperate moments...

Over the course of the campaign, our writer, director JASON RAGOSTA will be posting WIP art of the thumbnailing, Layout, Inking, and Colorwork on ISSUE ZERO of the COMIC BOOK, which will tell the ORIGIN STORY of PREZERVE host, BRAD MANNINGS and the horrifying events that lead him to become the figurehead of filling ZED-FREE AMERICA'S need for Old Testament justice.

Actual page from the ZTV UNDEAD EMPIRE COMIC. Written and Illustrated by Jason Ragosta

Some of Jason's previous work on THE BALLAD OF R'LYEH:

 

THE ORIGINAL MOTION PICTURE SCORE

HAUNTING, POWERFUL, EPIC...

MUSIC BY SUSAN DIBONA & SALVATORE SANGIOVANNI

DIBONA IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2103576/?ref_=nv_sr...

SANGIOVANNI IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm6961992/?ref_=nv_sr...

WEBSITE LINK: https://www.thevillastudios.com

INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/thevillastudios/

 

CD OF THE ORIGINAL SCORE

Own a physical copy of the original score of both SYMPATHY FOR THE DEVIL and THE PREZERVE television show on COMPACT DISC! Composed by the insanely talented Susan Dibonna and Salvatore Sangiovanni and featuring the visceral sound of live recorded orchestral musicians (one of the many post-production related things we're raising the funds for...)

 

12" VINYL LP OF THE ORIGINAL SCORE

Own a physical copy of the original score of both SYMPATHY FOR THE DEVIL and THE PREZERVE television show on a 12" translucent red vinyl record! Enjoy the undisputed Cadillac of musical listening experiences!

Initially, we will only be offering six of these, so get them while you can! 

THE ORIGINAL SCORE of both THE PREZERVE and SYMPATHY FOR THE DEVIL carved into a 12" RED TRANSLUCENT VINYL RECORD with printed label and record sleeve.

 

THE ILLUSTRATED POSTER

Soon to be revealed...

The full-sized, poster illustrated by writer, director Jason Ragosta. Detail close-ups below:

THE PREZERVE METAL SIGN

A relic from another universe...

Full-scale, 100% real metal sign that is exactly the same as the sign that appears in the film. Available in GRUNGE and CLEAN versions.

 

WRITER FOR HIRE: SHORT

Are you a Director or a Producer in need of a good script? 

Have you ever wanted to make a short film but have neither the time nor the inclination to write?

Are you an actor that would like a film written specifically for you to star in? Possibly to explore a new direction in your career to show a side of your acting that falls outside the zone of what you are typically cast for?

We've got you covered! Grab this perk and Jason will write a short to your specifications. You can expect a rough draft within two weeks of approving an outline and three rounds of notes/rewrites to shape the story to best suit your creative vision. 

Includes : Story meetings, Outline, Rough Short FIlm Draft and three rounds of notes/rewrites. 

 

WRITER FOR HIRE: FEATURE

Need a script for a feature film? 

Have the rights to a book or an original story you've always wanted to tell? Want to make your very own feature film? Grab this perk and our writer, Jason Ragosta, will write an original (or adapted) screenplay to your desired specifications. Jason writes pretty fast, so you could expect a rough draft within 2 months of receiving approval on the outline. 

Includes: Story meetings, Outline, Rough Feature Film Draft and three rounds of notes/rewrites. 

 

STRETCH GOALS!_____________________________

 

STRETCH GOAL UNLOCK: $30K

THE PREZERVE VHS CASSETTE

A PHYSICAL PIECE OF MEDIA FROM AN ALTERNATE UNIVERSE...

Own a VHS copy of THE PREZERVE, EPISODE 523: THE DEVILS DAUGHTER! It features the complete episode as it originally aired in the ZTV universe, many years ago...

 

STRETCH GOAL UNLOCK: $35K

ZTV PREZERVE CREW T-SHIRT

Get you're very own ZTV The PreZerve Crew T-Shirt! These are the exact shirts we used in the filming of The PreZerve TV Show. Another artifact from another universe...

 

STRETCH GOAL: $45K

THE ORIGINAL SCORE AUDIO CASSETTE

A RELIC FROM THE PAST...

Own the ORIGINAL SCORE for THE PREZERVE and SYMPATHY FOR THE DEVIL on AUDIO CASSETTE! Featuring printed SLEEVE COVER and printed insert.

 

STRETCH GOAL UNLOCK: $55K: To Be Revealed...

 

STRETCH GOAL UNLOCK: $65K

ZTV TRADING CARDS

 

 

STRETCH GOAL UNLOCK: $80K: To Be Revealed...

 

STRETCH GOAL: $100K

IN-UNIVERSE COMMERCIAL

We will shoot an insane and gleefully sadistic commercial that would be seen on ZTV during commercial breaks in THE PREZERVE (If you're a MANDY fan, think something like the CHEESE GOBLIN commercial, but with ZOMBIES ; ) Maybe it could even be a trailer for one of ZTV's other shows called LIVING CADAVER... Sky's the limit if we reach this tier...

STRETCH GOAL UNLOCK: BE IN THE IN-UNIVERSE COMMERCIAL!

If we reach our stretch goal for the in-universe commercial, a new perk will unlock with a limited number of slots to appear in the commercial!

STRETCH GOAL UNLOCK: HAVE A SPEAKING ROLE IN THE IN-UNIVERSE COMMERCIAL! 

If we reach our stretch goal for the in-universe commercial , a new perk will unlock with a limited number of slots to have a speaking role in the commercial!

 

STRETCH GOAL UNLOCK: $150K: To Be Revealed...

 

STRETCH GOAL UNLOCK: $200K: To Be Revealed...

 

STRETCH GOAL UNLOCK: $300K: To Be Revealed...

 

STRETCH GOAL UNLOCK: $400K: To Be Revealed...

 

ULTIMATE STRETCH GOAL UNLOCK: $500K

ZTV THE FEATURE FILM 

If we hella-over-perform with our stretch goals, we will make a ZTV feature film! 

We have actually been sitting on a feature-length ZTV script for over a year, and are ready and able to dive into a full feature film to expand the ZTV Universe...

 

The Impact

Every dollar counts! And we need those dollars desperately.... But we're not doing this campaign just for the money. We're doing it to connect with people that love all the crazy horror stuff that we love. If this campaign is truly successful, it will mean that you guys will be discussing what cool new films are coming out on SHUDDER, or about to come to virtual blows over whether MANDY is a better film than HEREDITARY or who's gonna win in each category in this years FANGORIA AWARDS. (We're die-hard MANDY, change our minds!)

Please consider this campaign (and the whole ZTV Universe for that matter) as a bonfire we have lit to serve as a beacon for HORROR FANS all over the world to come together and enjoy. So please, engage us! Because we firmly believe that the love of horror is one of the purest forms of love, which is why Horror fans kind of own the internet as the most dedicated and rabid of all the fans. 

 

Risks & Challenges

We have built this project to scale to whatever amount of money we end up with. We will finish it no matter what. Only, without having enough cash, it will take a lot longer to finish and will end up with a smaller and less developed film than we know ZTV Sympathy for the Devil can be. 

With your help, we can reach our goal! 

YOU have the power to make it possible for ZTV to reach its full potential,

YOU can give us a fighting chance to stand out among the crowded field of short films that are made every year.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate cash, it's ok!  

If you dig the crazy universe that we're building, and you know other people who might dig it, PLEASE spread the word about the campaign by FOLLOWING us on FACEBOOK, INSTAGRAM, and/or TWITTER. Sharing the link to the campaign is a massive help to us and we appreciate every single SHARE, LIKE, and FOLLOW. 

We also invite you to come back and check out the campaign often, as it will evolve and have a constant stream of WIP Comic Book art, new video content, and insane new rewards as we make our way (HOPEFULLY) to our goal. 

In the end, we appreciate you actually scrolling through all of our content to read this!

THANK YOU SO MUCH for sticking with us!!

You are hella-thorough! You made it all the way to the end!

For now.

Be sure to keep the channel locked right here...

Only on ZTV.
story_txt:
ZTV SYMPATHY FOR THE DEVIL
THE SHORT FILM...
"...essentially Big Brother meets Death Race but with zombies instead of cars."
 - Jonathan Barkan, DREAD CENTRAL

 
WHAT'S THE SHORT ABOUT?
DOUGLAS SIKES, a convicted war criminal from the American Zombie War, runs a black-market trading ring from the bowels of a walled-in quarantine zone turned for-profit prison. He and the other prisoners live under the watchful eye of the ZTV broadcasting company, and at the whim of THE PREZERVE, a capital punishment reality game show that uses zombies, and horrific devices, to torture, infect, and execute prisoners and their families on prime time network television. PAUL, and his daughter, LILY, arrive at Doug’s home to find him grief-stricken and consumed with rage after his daughter Steffie’s gruesome episode has broadcast her terrible fate for all the world to see. Paul and Lily find themselves in the cross-fire as Doug readies to unleash bloody vengeance on the institution and the vengeful woman who has oppressed him.
HERE'S A CLIP FROM THE FILM!
 

 
Doug expands Paul's understanding of how things work in the QZ...

ZTV: UNDEAD EMPIRE • COMIC BOOK
A UNIVERSE EXPANDED...


Because there is far too much story in Jason's head, he has already written volumes of material which expands the ZTV universe in several directions. We were only able to give a small taste of that world in the short film, but the comic, free from the budgetary constraints of filmmaking, will be used to explore the massive potential of the universe as well as exploring small quiet struggles of far-flung characters in their most solitary and desperate moments...

Over the course of the campaign, our writer, director JASON RAGOSTA will be posting WIP art of the thumbnailing, Layout, Inking, and Colorwork on ISSUE ZERO of the COMIC BOOK, which will tell the ORIGIN STORY of PREZERVE host, BRAD MANNINGS and the horrifying events that lead him to become the figurehead of filling ZED-FREE AMERICA'S need for Old Testament justice.

Actual page from the ZTV UNDEAD EMPIRE COMIC. Written and Illustrated by Jason Ragosta

Own a physical copy of the original score of both SYMPATHY FOR THE DEVIL and THE PREZERVE television show on a 12" translucent red vinyl record! Enjoy the undisputed Cadillac of musical listening experiences!
Initially, we will only be offering six of these, so get them while you can!

WRITER FOR HIRE: SHORT
Are you a Director or a Producer in need of a good script? 
Have you ever wanted to make a short film but have neither the time nor the inclination to write?
Are you an actor that would like a film written specifically for you to star in? Possibly to explore a new direction in your career to show a side of your acting that falls outside the zone of what you are typically cast for?
We've got you covered! Grab this perk and Jason will write a short to your specifications. You can expect a rough draft within two weeks of approving an outline and three rounds of notes/rewrites to shape the story to best suit your creative vision. 
Includes : Story meetings, Outline, Rough Short FIlm Draft and three rounds of notes/rewrites. 

 
WRITER FOR HIRE: FEATURE
Need a script for a feature film? 
Have the rights to a book or an original story you've always wanted to tell? Want to make your very own feature film? Grab this perk and our writer, Jason Ragosta, will write an original (or adapted) screenplay to your desired specifications. Jason writes pretty fast, so you could expect a rough draft within 2 months of receiving approval on the outline. 
Includes: Story meetings, Outline, Rough Feature Film Draft and three rounds of notes/rewrites.

story:
Death Count is a horror film starring Michael Madsen (Kill Bill Vol 1 & 2)  Costas Mandylor (Saw Franchise, Mobsters), & Robert LaSardo (Nip/Tuck, General Hospital, CSI Miami, Gang Related, NYPD Blue)  This is a seven day campaign!  **STRETCH GOAL $40,000***

We need your help to finish this amazing horror film!  Claim a perk and join our award winning team!   Become an Associate Producer or Executive Producer and live out the dream!  Join us on the red carpet for the world-premiere event in Las Vegas. 

SYNOPSIS: Strangers awaken in individual holding cells with no memory of how they arrived soon they realize if they don't acquire enough online "likes" in a timely manner, they'll die horribly at the hands of a sinister executioner known as "WARDEN".

Be a part of a fresh and original story and help us bring this vision to the big screen!

Be a part of a fresh and original story and help us bring this vision to the big screen!

Producers Michael and Sonny Mahal, following in the success of their recent films "Bloodthirst" starring Costas Mandylor, Tara Reid and Robert LaSardo,  "Bridge of the Doomed" starring Michael Pare and Robert LaSardo, "Attack of the Unknown starring Robert LaSardo, Richard Grieco and Tara Reid" “Bus Party To Hell” starring Tara Reid and "Art of the Dead" starring Richard Grieco and Tara Reid, they are ready to conquer the world of horror and thrills again with “Death Count”. With a passion for bringing new and exciting stories to the big screen while expanding the scope of filming in the Vegas Community, Michael and Sonny will once again knock this production out of the park!

Here is a teaser for Bloodthirst.  The film is currently in post-production and will be released in Spring of 2021 by Hollywood Media Bridge (They have an output deal with Lionsgate) 

Here is a 90 second official trailer for Attack of the Unknown.   The film was released world-wide on theatres and on VOD platforms.  The DVD release is October 27th, 2020.  Below the trailer is a link to all the VOD platforms it's available on. 

 

Here is the official trailer for "Art of the Dead" horror film starring Tara Reid and Richard Grieco. This film is currently distributed world-wide and is available for purchase at Walmart nationwide (Walmart bought over 16,000 copies of the film alone) 

Here is the teaser for Bridge of the Doomed starring Michael Pare and Robert LaSardo. This film will be distributed world-wide in spring of 2021.  The film is still in post-production for another sixty days.

 

Bus Party to Hell was distributed world-wide by Gravitas Ventures. We got in 18,500 redbox locations which is every other Redbox in the United States of America. 

 

Here are some still grabs straight from our Red Cameras filming Death Count.

story:
Our Story

Hi everyone! My name is Matt and I am an independent film maker based in the North East of England. 

This campaign is for the funding for our 2nd short film "Tealight". It's a short horror film about an agoraphobic woman who dreams of travelling the world but must first overcome an evil darkness that haunts her. 

The story was devised from my own experiences with depression and anxiety and I believe it's an area most of us can relate to especially due to the pandemic. At it's core the film is about hope, overcoming fears and bringing your own light forward to protect yourself against your own darkness. 

I believe that the world and the people in it need compassion now more than ever, and if this short film can help just one person find their courage when dealing with whatever problems life throws our way or help create empathy between us, then I know the challenges to make it would all be worth it.

Film has always been a catharsis for me - a way to escape or a way to deal with grief and issues - it's power is truly remarkable. Your contributions will not only be supporting the dreams of other independent creative individuals, but they might just help someone get that little stronger in themselves and find the support they need.

What We Need & What You Get

We need £6000 to make this project a successful reality and that covers ALL production stages. Every penny raised goes directly to paying the cast and crew their wages, for locations, transportation, logistics, marketing, catering, equipment, post-production, visual and practical effects, costumes, hair and make-up, photography, music composition from the highly acclaimed and talented Marina Makarova, sound design and so much more. 

Check out our perks - you'll find a range of different items up for order and even have your names in the film credits and listed on IMDB. There are collector items available and even the chance to own a part of the film. These items are perfect for the avid collector and every purchase helps to achieve our goal!

And if you want to get involved in the production meetings and film festival events make sure to check out the producer perks!

As a bonus, every single contributor will also receive access to production diary videos from each day of principal photography - these will only be available to backers of the project and you'll get a taste of what it's like behind the scenes.

If we don't reach our target goal, any funds raised will go to the priority areas of the production. The cast and crew are all professionals working within the industry or aspiring to do so it's imperative that they are paid for their hard work.

If we exceed our target goal then we may be able to afford extra shooting days which in turn gives the cast and crew extra time to improve the end quality of the production. 

Your donations and shares will support and help independent film makers create engaging and entertaining content and you can not be thanked enough.

Location for Tealight. 

The Impact

Your contribution is not only awesome but you will be directly affecting the well-being and lives of all involved and enabling us to tell an important message. As with any film project we want it to be successful from the stand point of the audience - our goal is to entertain our audience but also to educate and promote empathy.

Our team have previously created the award winning dystopian short film AUGUST which is available online for free.

Check out https://www.directormatttaylor.com/showreel for the full film.

We want to keep creating projects that entertain, inspire and showcase the beautiful North East region in the UK. 

We also can not thank you enough if you choose to donate - independent film is a tough and competitive industry and we aim to deliver quality content to you all.

Mood board for Tealight

Other Ways You Can Help

Not all contributions to a project have to be donations. A simple share on social media platforms and a little noise about our campaign goes a long way! 

Use the Indiegogo share tools and feel free to tag us in any social media shout outs - I shall do my best to thank you each individually!

If you do donate, please share as well - the more people know about our project the better chance it has of becoming a reality

And that's all there is to it. Firstly thank you for reading our story and I am sending love and best wishes your way!

Matt
