story:
Our Film

Nico Queen -  After the night of her first performance, a closeted drag queen accidentally runs into her father while in pursuit of nicotine at a convenience store. There, she must choose whether to remain in the closet or reveal her true identity.

 

Who We Are

Hello! We are a group of student filmmakers at Montana State University in Bozeman. Media representation of queer culture is severely lacking here in Montana. Through the erasure of these identities, respect and recognition of them can be depreciated. Nico Queen was written as a celebration of the Drag scene that many do not know is thriving here in Bozeman. Nico Queen illustrates that queer communities are strong and flourishing everywhere. This film will represent the joy, love and strength found in queer communities across the country, while also addressing the complicated family dynamics that members are often confronted with. 

 

Impact 

In making this film, we want to give back to the community that we are representing. We would not have Drag as an artform, as a stronghold of the queer community or as a beautiful form of expression if it were not for trans women of color. Thus, we will be holding screenings of our films with a sliding scale entrance fee that will go entirely to Transvisible Montana. Transvisible Montana is an organisation that promotes awareness and education on issues affecting trans, non-binary, and two-spirit Montanans. Any funding that we do not use when producing our film, will also be donated to Transvisible Montana.

 

Budget

This film will take some support to make it happen. We have set a fundraising goal of $1,500 to cover the cost of our actor’s costuming and makeup, and food for our crew! If you are as excited about this film as we are, please donate to us any amount that you would like to give. Anything helps. 

Costumes & Makeup: 700

Drag is nonexistent without makeup, outfits, wigs and so much more. We want our drag queens to look and feel gorgeous. 

Food: 500

No one should work on an empty stomach, feeding our crew is an essential part to making our film and making sure no one is hangry.

Equipment Rentals: 200

Drag Queens need to look good honey! In order to display the art-form of drag to the best of our ability we want the best equipment to show off our queens.

COVID Safety Protocol: 100

Our production’s top priority is safety. To ensure that our cast and crew remain COVID-19 free we will be purchasing covid-tests, masks, disinfectant, and sanitizer. 

 

Spread the Word

Follow us on Instagram  @nicoqueen.film for updates and behind the scenes sneak peeks of our film!

story:
1 9 8 6 

A BATMAN/PUNISHER FAN-FILM

We need your help to finish our ambitious 80's set, action packed, BATMAN/PUNISHER fan-film!

Our aim is to make something a little different and bold - and with your help we can go ahead and lock in one more shoot day as well as cover post-production costs for VFX etc.  We used a great fight team that have came up with some cool AF fight scenes - but now we need to make sure we match that same quality level with the post production - and especially the VFX.  We really do want to make this the best it can be and hopefully blow people away with what we have achieved. 

Photo taken by Shane Hicks.

CAST:

 

LEE CHARLES as BATMAN 

Lee Charles is a former 6 x World Kickboxing Champion and actor known for Gangs of London (2020), Final Score (2018), Avengement (2019) and The Courier (2019)

MARK GRIFFIN as THE PUNISHER

Mark Griffin is an actor known for Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018), I Am Vengeance (2018), Strike Back (2015), The Bromley Boys (2018)

LAURENCE R. HARVEY as THE PENGUIN

Laurence is an actor known for The Human Centipede II (Full Sequence) (2011), The Human Centipede III (Final Sequence) (2015), Frankenstein Created Bikers (2016), My Bloody Banjo (2015)

CORNELIUS GEANEY JR as THE JOKER

Cornelius is an actor known for Please Don't Die (2018), Escape Room (2019) and Homeland (2020).

 

 

WRITER/DIRECTOR:

JAMES CAMPBELL is a writer/director based in the North East of England. He graduated from the Northern School of Art in June 2015. His previous work includes Ripper (2016), Please Don't Die (2018), Tiger Man (2020) and upcoming western-horror feature The Moonshine Gang of Cheyenne (2021) starring Steven Ogg, Pollyanna McIntosh and Richard Brake.

 

PRODUCER:

JACOB ANDERTON is an actor and producer who has worked with James both in front of the camera and behind for many years. They are currently developing western-horror feature film THE MOONSHINE GANG OF CHEYENNE. 

His television work includes playing 'Isaac Hedley' in ITV's 'Dark Angel' alongside 'Golden Globe' winning actress Joanne Froggatt. He also had a spell in 'Coronation Street'. In more recent times Jacob starred in '13 Graves', available on sky and amazon prime as well as appearing in Ross Boyask's feature 'I am Vengeance 2: Retaliation'. He has just wrapped on 'Give Them Wings' an emotional true story drama and 'The King of Spades', both scheduled for release this year.

WHERE THE MONEY WILL BE GOING

  • VFX artist for action sequences
  • Hiring an artist for the designing of our official poster
  • Location hire costs
  • Kit hire costs
  • Travel expenses and food for cast and crew

story:
Here Comes A New Challenger, will detail the origins of the gaming phenomena that is Street Fighter II and how it impacted the lives of kids and teenagers worldwide.  It will explore not just the tournament aspect of the series, but what made it special to players who didn’t have the opportunity to play it in the arcades but in the comfort of their own home. Bedrooms and living rooms became the arcade as children challenged their friends to become champions of the playground. 

The documentary will look at how we, the players, became better at the game through reading the players guides religiously, learning tricks from gaming magazines as we saw the series take over the world as merchandise and toys appeared across supermarket isles and the hype surrounding a live-action film starring action superstar Jean Claude Van Damme had us giddy with excitement!

The story will be a nostalgic trip back to the early 90s as we saw arcades come to the home through the new 16-bit consoles and discuss why the game has lasted all these years and why 30 years on, its legend still burns brightly.

Poster by artist Micah Brooks

Poster by artist Doug Hills

The original Street Fighter from 1987 and other fighting games during the 80s will be discussed as the groundwork establishing what Street Fighter introduced and its failure to make an impact as Capcom went back to the drawing board to think of new ideas to improve upon their new franchise with their sequel - Street Fighter II.  Will explore its success, its cultural impact, and why it changed the face of the fighting game genre, and how it rejuvenated the arcade scene. 

We will also look at the upgrades to Street Fighter 2 that kept gobbling up our pocket money and loose change with Champion Edition, Hyper Fighting, Super: The New Challengers, Super Turbo and explore why were these important to us, how did these updates improve the game and why were they implemented.  Plus will highlight the sneaky bootleg versions that popped up in local shops and arcades.

Other aspects of the franchise that we’ll explore will include:

  •  Toys & Merchandise - how did the success of Street Fighter II drive the endless amounts of merchandise, what toys and merch we loved as fans and ones that left us disappointed.  
  •  Strategy Guides – the importance of them and which ones provided the best source of information on how to become a better player. Plus will cover explore the extensive coverage by video game magazines during the 90s. 
  •  The Music - The incredible theme tunes provided to the game and the soundtracks that become part of youth. 
  •  The conversions to the home consoles with ports to the Super Nintendo, PC Engine, Gameboy, Mega Drive & 3DO, and the creaky ports to the home computers for the Spectrum, Commodore 64, AMIGA, and PC-DOS. 
  •  Street Fighter II: The Animated Movie – why it worked for the fans and its faithfulness to the video game. Will explore the differences between the various cuts and change of music for western audiences plus the strange FMV game for the PlayStation and Sega Saturn.
  •  Street Fighter: The Movie – The hype surrounding the live-action film, the cast, its success at the box office, and its failure with critics & fans and of course cover the arcade game and ports to the PlayStation and Sega Saturn!
  •  Re-releases and 30 years on - the compilations of SF2 released over the years and why the game is still played and adored by gamers today! 

 

IMAGES OF MATERIAL ALREADY SHOT

From the director of 'In Search of the Last Action Heroes', Oliver Harper has brought back his colleagues for this new production and collaborated with the talented guys at FINAL-FILM who have worked for BMG Records, 20th Century Fox and New Retro Wave to help bring a very cinematic look to the documentary. 

Oliver Harper - Director, Producer and Writer.

Christopher Stratton - Cinematography and Motion Graphics.

Timon Singh - Writer and Producer.

Christopher Stratton & Robert James - Editors.

Audi Sorlie - Producer.

Simon Begg & The Deadly Avenger - Original score.

Daniel Wallulis, Jim Kunz, Matt Marzulo, Nathan Claridge, Robert James and Vanessa Vann - Additional Cinematography.

Witt Reese - Associate Producer and Copywriting.

Peter Bruce, Micah Brooks and Doug Hills - Art Director.

Craig Mastrototaro, Damien Jackson, Napoleon Dozier, Stuart Ashen, Tanner Beard - Executive Producers.

 



Risks and Challenges

As with any documentary, there are risks and challenges that may arise over the course of the production of this film and unforeseen delays are possible due to COVID 19 and extended lockdowns. We will keep backers fully updated regarding the situation and they will know well in advance if there is likely to be a delay.

TERMS & CONDITIONS

We have accurately portrayed our project as it stands at this point in time, however, creative projects are subject to change and ours is no exception. By making a pledge you acknowledge that elements of the project, including but not limited to the artwork, cast, and content, is subject to change and that the final project may differ from what is presented while the Indiegogo campaign is active.

Craig Mastrototaro, Damien Jackson, Napoleon Dozier, Stuart Ashen, Tanner Beard - Executive Producers.

 

Risks and Challenges
As with any documentary, there are risks and challenges that may arise over the course of the production of this film and unforeseen delays are possible due to COVID 19 and extended lockdowns. We will keep backers fully updated regarding the situation and they will know well in advance if there is likely to be a delay.

TERMS & CONDITIONS
We have accurately portrayed our project as it stands at this point in time, however, creative projects are subject to change and ours is no exception. By making a pledge you acknowledge that elements of the project, including but not limited to the artwork, cast, and content, is subject to change and that the final project may differ from what is presented while the Indiegogo campaign is active.

story:
Lyle Warner's mom has passed. What's worse is, they forgot where to bury her.

Rather, the records of mom's grave plot have been washed away in an unexpected plumbing accident. It is up to Lyle to plan a funeral on his own with nowhere to bury the body. He must mitigate the chaos that is an eccentric furniture salesman with nothing but the deal on his mind, a selfish and delirious aunt who seems hellbent on making everything about her, and his father and sister, whom have transformed into turtles.

 We seem to deal with death in strange way. 

At a time when we would simply want to curl up and be left alone, we are often swarmed with attention; relatives come into town, people you haven't talked to in years reach out to you, and you're stuck planning a celebration of someone's life. Pet Turtles is a film that aims to bring the range of emotion you experience at a time of loss to the silver screen. 

Pet Turtles is a dark comedy based largely around the real-life experiences of Vern Tooley. The semi-autobiographical nature of the film allows for a window into Vern's mind, and in its own right, the minds of everyone who has experienced loss. 

Our hope is that this film can someday help someone through the same loss we have felt. We want to send the message that we can all surmount this sort of pain, no matter how great it may feel.

Hula - Narrative Short
Directed by Vern Tooley
 
The Hunt for the Acid King - Narrative Short
Director of Photography - Forest J. Wharton
Doomed to You - Web Series
Directed by Vern Tooley
Director of Photography - Forest J. Wharton
Makeup - Sarah Lovall

Various pieces by Kalie McGinnis

Makeup for narrative pieces by Sarah Lovall

story:
Overview

It's a hot summer day and Joie Jones is in desperate need of a new hairdo. To fix this, she visits her local place of worship: the beauty supply store. Here, she finds solace in knowing she will walk out with all the products she needs to look and feel better. Then her mother calls. "Stop by the store for me on your way home, please?" She asks. How will a self-conscious and overthinking Joie deal with the impending feeling of shame as she faces walking out of her safe haven and into public with a hair bonnet? Find out in the upcoming satirical drama Joie's Bonnet. A social commentary that examines the black community's relationship with acceptance and unity. 

Budget

We hope to reach our fundraising goal of $1,800 by the end of this campaign. Below is a graph displaying how funds will be dispersed during production. 

Timeline

Joie's Bonnet plans to shoot principal photography from October 15th through 17th of 2021. Post-production is scheduled to be completed by December of 2021. Afterward, we plan to begin a round of festival submissions including Black Warrior Film Festival, Reel Sisters, Atlanta Film Festival, and various others.

 

How to Help

We will take donations in any capacity we can get them. Financial support is more than appreciated, as well as sharing of our social media pages and general support. We hope you’ll join us in this process

Like us on Facebook: Joie's Bonnet Short Film

Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/bonnetshortfilm/

 

Meet the Cast and Crew

Writer/Director - Maya N. Browning

Maya Browning is a senior at the University of Alabama from Lithonia, Georgia majoring in Creative Media with a minor in Creative Writing. While attending the University, Maya has worked on 12 short film sets as a Cinematographer, Assistant Director, and Camera Assistant. Those films include award winning projects such as The Rose That Grew from Concrete (2019), House Down (2019) and Holle nominated projects Come On Home (2019), Revolve (2019), and PLUM (2019). She is also Co-Programming Director of the Black Warrior Film Festival. Joie’s Bonnet will be Maya’s directorial debut and is very excited for the journey ahead!

Producer - Lauren Brock

Alabama native, Lauren Brock, pursues her filmmaking career, studying Creative Media and 
Global Studies at the University of Alabama. She has cultivated a rich portfolio to showcase her contributions on more than 10 video productions and a university-sponsored podcast. Lauren continues to expand her skillset: producing and directing short films, capturing captivating visuals as director of photography and camera operator, and molding worlds as production designer. When she’s not on set, Lauren can be found on the boards for UA’s Black Warrior and Sidewalk Film Festival. Following her May 2022 graduation, Lauren will hit the open road with her camera and her creative insights to capture the wonders of the world. 

Director of Photography - Andrew Rutledge 

Andrew Rutledge is a senior at the University of Alabama majoring in Creative Media. He has worked on several student film sets during his time at UA in a multitude of roles including Grip, Gaffer, and Director of Photography. He is excited to DP Joie’s Bonnet as his last film before graduating to the “real world” in December.

story:
Summary

We all know what it's like to feel like we don't belong. In Spring 2021, our team launched LUNAR: The Jewish-Asian Film Project with the belief that if Asian American Jews see ourselves on camera, we can start to feel understood and find community. We gathered 23 Asian American Jews to discuss their experiences, and put the results into a video series on social media. We got real about fusion food, cultural trauma, discovering our identities, and the impacts of racism and antisemitism on our lives. These authentic and compelling videos made big waves in our communities - people watched our videos over 35,000 times; we were selected for 2 major film festivals and featured in dozens of press outlets, including MTV News. You can view our first season in the video highlight reel above.

Now we're back with a second season, because we still have so much to tell the world about who we are. In the second season, watch Asian American Jews dive deep into our experiences with media representation, religion, language, and so much more! 

What We Need & What You Get

Due to generous support from foundations, season 2 is partly funded. We just need a little more help to make the videos the best they can be! Your contribution will support:

  • Our ability to compensate our stellar team of Asian American Jewish creatives at equitable rates
  • Necessary tech equipment and software to improve the quality of our content

For your contribution, you'll receive some exciting perks, including:

  • Shout-outs on our credits and social media
  • Personalized thank-you cards from our team
  • LUNAR branded stickers
  • LUNAR branded T-Shirts
  • Meet n Greet with our all-star team
  • Private Season 2 Preview Party with our team and select cast members
  • A chance to win an original Chinese & Jewish cultural fusion art piece from our amazing Art Director, Davi Cheng

The Impact

LUNAR has resonated with people across the world. For the first time, Asian American Jews felt like we belonged. Through these videos, we felt seen as our full selves. We told our stories on our own terms. We found our way home to each other.

Belonging in such an isolated world is so important. Especially with the rise in anti-Asian hate and antisemitism this year, LUNAR videos have been a source of affirmation and empowerment for us. As folks with marginalized identities, having a place to go where our full selves are shown with pride and joy is crucial. 

We need your help to keep our videos going, so that more and more people can find themselves in our stories. More and more folks can know that they matter, they belong, and they are enough.

We want to make sure season 2 is the best it can be. Our stories are amazing and our storytellers deserve the highest quality videos to tell them. Your contribution is one step towards visibility and representation of Asian American Jews. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate right now? No problem! Show your support by sharing this campaign on social media with the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
STORY

They say that if you want to be successful, you should invest your time in something that makes you want to get up in the morning.  For directors, this is the craft of storytelling and film is our medium.  Blake was one of the first indie filmmakers in recent history to experiment with small format anamorphics.  This method of getting the larger than life, wide-screen canvas and a softness which ensures that viewing experience that can only be described as truly cinematic.  The Land was shot and edited on film, in CinemaScope.

The Injustice of Justice:  The filmmaker's connection to this theme has always been an intuitive one.  So much so that the first draft of The Land was written in only two days.  A 2020 premier is timely as the public is becoming more aware of this widespread social problem with the release of other films and TV shows that explore the issue.  In America, are we truly free?

THE TEAM

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

WHAT WE NEED

The film has been edited and now we need finishing services that amount to just under $10,000.  That covers "Necessary" Expenses.  Additional expenses are shown below that.

NECESSARY EXPENSES

OCN LAB SERVICES (Roughly 40% of the budget))

One of our major obstacles to finishing this film is that there was no way to edit Cinema Grade digital footage until 2015 (without mortgaging your house).  At that point in time, digital cinema equipment started to filter its way down to indie producers.  That's great news but our O.C.N (Original Camera Negative) is film originated.  In order to take advantage of the new technology, we still need a digital scan to convert the 16mm Cinemascope negative to a DI (Digital Intermediate.)  The DI will be in the 2k, 10 bit, DCI standard (the same standard as major motion pictures.)  This will be done at a premier film lab in Los Angeles, CA using the same equipment and workflow that Quentin Tarantino used for his latest project.  

Blog Post: What are OCN Lab Services Exactly

COLOR CORRECTION (Roughly 50% of the budget)

Film color work is extremely complex compared to traditional video color grading.  This work will be handled by the pros at Fotokem labs in Los Angeles, CA.  Our DI colorist George Koran has worked with the likes of Stephen Spielberg and David Lynch on 4k restorations of some of their prior movies that were originally shot and finished in the film medium.  He also works on new footage originated in the digital cinema 4k format and finished digitally to meet the high standards required for deilvery to major broadcast networks and streaming service providers.

LAB EXPENSES - MISCELLANEOUS  (Roughly 10% of the budget)

These expenses cover small items like hard drives needed to send files back and forth between Texas and California, freight charges, a telecine scan from The Post Group, and travel expenses for one trip to California that is needed for the final supervised color pas at Fotokem.

STRETCH GOALS 

SOUND FINISHING (Roughly 10% of the budget)

Additionally, money will go to Joe and Isaac, the sound team for sound editing, mixing and score composition and recording.  The team is all from Austin, TX, the live music capitol of the world where we have some of the best musical talent, the world over.

CAMPAIGN EXPENSES / DIGITAL DUSTBUSTING / VFX WORK / CAMPAIGN EDITING

With the introduction of low cost Ultra HD tools over the last two years, the remaining finishing work can be done in-house in Austin, TX which will save tens of thousands of dollars.  However, VFX is very time consuming and we'll need to take time of from our regular jobs to do the work.  Between the extensive time commitment needed for running the campaign and managing the post-production process, the financial sacrifice becomes a noticeable strain on myself and Cindy our marketing manager.  Some money will go towards living expenses during this intense post work period for us both.   Our head editor will also get a modest stipend.

LIVE ORCHESTRAL RECORDING ( $1,000) & HDR COLOR PASS ($TBD)  

ORGANIC music to compliment the organic film:  Isaac, our composer is also an experienced conductor and recording studio engineer.  If we can manage the funding, we'll work with him and his orchestra musicians to add a human touch to the score which up till now has all been done using synthesizers and digital sampling.  While the digital gear sounds very good, the human touch of a live musician and acoustic texture of real instruments will dovetail perfectly with the organic experience created by the film medium and anamorphic optical elements used in production.

HDR lowers our Risk:  Since our production was planned in the old Cinema tradition that puts visual art at the top of a long list of production concerns, we have the foundation to take advantage of next generation television standards that will give a more cinematic experience for those who choose to view the film at home in their living room or on a capable mobile device.  This new standard is called High Dynamic Range (HDR.)   HDR is a resolution, bit depth and color space combination that approximates the look that you would traditionally only get in the theater.  Fotokem will soon provide pricing for a color pass and mastering to the latest HDR standard.  The advantages to the viewer is obvious but also from a business perspective, this is an advantage because offering an HDR version for sale will give us a competitive advantage (most films selling on the web these days use the decades old TV specifications.)  

WHAT YOU GET

Contributors will receive perks that are unique to a film originated project like ours.  In addition to a digital download of the film, various packages will include autographed copies of production records, producers materials, actual 16mm film strips that were saved from the cutting room floor, AMA hangouts (Ask Me Anything) with the director/producer/editor, autographed festival handbills, props, your name in the credits and one lucky beverage company will win the right, as sole sponsor to have their logo inserted digitally throughout the film.

 

WHAT HAVE WE INVESTED?

  • I've spent around $25,000 of my own money to get the film shot and edited. 
  • I've invested an additional $10,000 in post-production equipment needed to handle the coordination with LA and to do the VFX work (and for VFX work...fortunately, this is setup that can be used on future films.) 
  • Four years in film school at the university of Texas, Austin
  • Over a decade studying screenwriting, literature, history, theology and philosophy. 

 

WHY IT MATTERS

This project is one of just a few programs to address the issue of corruption in the justice system as it relates to middle class society.  It also addresses the fear mongering and vilification of people without due process of law.  While this theme is nothing unique, our perspective is.  A fresh take on the problem will add to those existing voices that have made their way to the public through music, TV and film.

The Intensive Production Sequence was an exclusive program at the University of Texas at Austin.  Out of 120 applicants, I was one of 8 granted consent to enter the thesis class as a writer/director.  The Land was my submission for consent.  For myself and my film tribe, those years in film school was one of our most productive periods and we made lots of progress.  Now It's time to build on that track record.  Finishing this film is the last step towards launching a career, a journey that we started many years ago.  So much has been invested in the craft and we've come so far.  We don't plan to stop now!

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

They say that only 3 out of every 10 films are successful at the box office.  Our production crew's professionalism and enthusiasm for storytelling has already worked to overcome these risks in the production phase, which is now in the rear view mirror.  We're 90% done and charging ahead on the last mile of the marathon!  This is great news and the icing on the cake is that our theme has become more popular in the media than when we started out, with shows like "Making a Murderer" and "The Central Park Five."  This means that there is a growing market for our story.

The post-production phase presents additional challenges which have been overcome by traveling to Los Angeles to work closely with the film lab on scan tests and color correction tests.  The results have come back and some of the images have been posted to Reddit.com cinematography community with overwhelmingly positive results.

Marketing and Distribution present the final challenge.  The M&D plan is in development and will provide the road map needed to get our film into festivals where the real networking happens.  A seasoned M&D producer will be hired to advise on the most efficient/effective plan.

Promotion is as important as the production itself.  Our team is young and culture savvy.  Most of us have been in the workforce for 10 to 15 years and have experience with sales, communications messaging, advertising, and/or public relations.

 

BUT I'M BROKE!  WHAT CAN I DO?

It's a common mis-conception that crowdfunding campaigns are just about the money.  While the money is important, building awareness and relationships with an audience is more important  (There's no shame in withholding your hard earned dollars while following our progress)

If you want to simply follow us as your contribution , you can do so here: SIGNUP FORM

So, the short answer is SHARE SHARE SHARE SHARE SHARE using the tools built into Indiegogo, instagram, facebook and Twitter. 

For those who would like to do more, there are opportunities to help us further amplify our message after the Indiegogo campaign and keep the momentum going.  While this is an expanded role, but it's just as easy since the continuing awareness campaign is run through social media and all messages are created for you.  All you have to do is Share, Share, Share!  Contact Blake for more information

web: www.thelandfilms.com

IG: thelandfilms

FB: www.facebook.com/TheLandShortFilm

Tw: @thelandfilms

Thanks in advance for Sharing!

WHY IT MATTERS
This project is one of just a few programs to address the issue of corruption in the justice system as it relates to middle class society.  It also addresses the fear mongering and vilification of people without due process of law.  While this theme is nothing unique, our perspective is.  A fresh take on the problem will add to those existing voices that have made their way to the public through music, TV and film.
The Intensive Production Sequence was an exclusive program at the University of Texas at Austin.  Out of 120 applicants, I was one of 8 granted consent to enter the thesis class as a writer/director.  The Land was my submission for consent.  For myself and my film tribe, those years in film school was one of our most productive periods and we made lots of progress.  Now It's time to build on that track record.  Finishing this film is the last step towards launching a career, a journey that we started many years ago.  So much has been invested in the craft and we've come so far.  We don't plan to stop now!
 
RISKS & CHALLENGES

They say that only 3 out of every 10 films are successful at the box office.  Our production crew's professionalism and enthusiasm for storytelling has already worked to overcome these risks in the production phase, which is now in the rear view mirror.  We're 90% done and charging ahead on the last mile of the marathon!  This is great news and the icing on the cake is that our theme has become more popular in the media than when we started out, with shows like "Making a Murderer" and "The Central Park Five."  This means that there is a growing market for our story.
The post-production phase presents additional challenges which have been overcome by traveling to Los Angeles to work closely with the film lab on scan tests and color correction tests.  The results have come back and some of the images have been posted to Reddit.com cinematography community with overwhelmingly positive results.
Marketing and Distribution present the final challenge.  The M&D plan is in development and will provide the road map needed to get our film into festivals where the real networking happens.  A seasoned M&D producer will be hired to advise on the most efficient/effective plan.
Promotion is as important as the production itself.  Our team is young and culture savvy.  Most of us have been in the workforce for 10 to 15 years and have experience with sales, communications messaging, advertising, and/or public relations.
 
BUT I'M BROKE!  WHAT CAN I DO?

It's a common mis-conception that crowdfunding campaigns are just about the money.  While the money is important, building awareness and relationships with an audience is more important  (There's no shame in withholding your hard earned dollars while following our progress)
If you want to simply follow us as your contribution , you can do so here: SIGNUP FORM
So, the short answer is SHARE SHARE SHARE SHARE SHARE using the tools built into Indiegogo, instagram, facebook and Twitter. 
For those who would like to do more, there are opportunities to help us further amplify our message after the Indiegogo campaign and keep the momentum going.  While this is an expanded role, but it's just as easy since the continuing awareness campaign is run through social media and all messages are created for you.  All you have to do is Share, Share, Share!  Contact Blake for more information
web: www.thelandfilms.com
IG: thelandfilms
FB: www.facebook.com/TheLandShortFilm
Tw: @thelandfilms
Thanks in advance for Sharing!

story:
Short Summary

Be a part of Bigfoot Research History!

The Chronicles of Carlos team is ready to launch the most promising Bigfoot expedition in recent memory and this is your opportunity to be a part of this groundbreaking project.

After years of research and interviews, we have identified what we believe to be one of the most favorable locations ever identified in cryptozoology-- one that has produced consistent encounters with an unknown hominid species for well over two decades in a remote, inaccessible, and unexplored location-- one county away from where the most famous Bigfoot video, the Paterson-Gimlin film, was shot. 

We will travel with Kirk Stewart-- an eyewitness with multiple direct encounters with these creatures spanning many years-- to this Northern California location to learn more about his encounters and see firsthand where they occurred. With the benefit of his years of experience with the local creatures and the expertise of the Chronicles of Carlos team, we hope to return with unprecedented proof of the existence of Sasquatch!

ABOUT US

In the mid-1990s, I was a graduate student and Teaching Assistant at Washington State University studying under and working for Dr. Grover Krantz, who taught me the investigative methods he used and showed me the scientific proof that supported his seminal work “Big Footprints: A Scientific Inquiry into the Reality of Sasquatch.” Over a quarter-century later, I am bringing my mentor’s lifelong expertise in Bigfoot research and combining it with my own experiences and investigative techniques (involving modern technology unavailable to Dr. Krantz) to bear on this expedition, which is an unprecedented opportunity to solve the Sasquatch mystery that has eluded researchers for so long.

For the Chronicles of Carlos, I investigate, create, and share mainstream educational content, extraordinary Bigfoot encounters and other mysteries, mythologies, and legends of the unknown, and examine and discuss the scientific methods and principles corroborating our stories. My platforms are for a very large audience of those curious about Bigfoot as well as the Bigfoot knowers, believers, and skeptics. My goal is to share knowledge, stories, evidence, etc., and for my audience to share their ideas, thoughts, and encounter stories with all of us.

My hope and intent are for these platforms to bring people from all parts of the audience spectrum around the world together to grow in our knowledge and understanding of Bigfoot and other cryptic hominoids and anthropomorphic creatures. I have done (and am available for) speaking engagements, podcasts, interviews, guided excursions, investigations, and all varieties of content creation related to my areas of expertise. I never tire of teaching, sharing, and learning when it comes to Nature’s mysteries!

My educational background is in the Sciences. I earned a B.A. in Anthropology at Pomona College under Dr. James McKenna, and I finished the Masters/Ph.D. program that I started at Washington State University under Dr. Grover Krantz with an M.A. in Anthropology at the University of Wyoming under Dr. George Gill. My graduation project at Pomona-– where I also founded the Cryptozoology Club and was a member of the International Society of Cryptozoology, was on the existence of Bigfoot. At Wazzu, my unpublished thesis was about Gigantopithecines (very large, fossilized Asian apes that lived around 2.6 million years ago until very recent times) and their hypothetical, ancestral connection to Bigfoot. During my time at Wazzu, I was involved in giving Bigfoot presentations at the university and also at Sasquatch Days in Harrison Hot Springs, British Columbia, Canada.

My career background has mostly been as an entrepreneur, leader, teacher, and coach. I have worked as an Anthropology (Biological, Archeological, Cultural, and Linguistic) teaching assistant at the university level and as a middle and high school STEM/ STEAM teacher (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics). I have coached Olympic and collegiate swimmers and divers all the way down to high school and middle school athletics teams. I have loved instructing athletes of all levels-- from beginners to the elite. One notable entrepreneurial venture was a retail and social business called “Bigfoot’s Lair” where I hosted gaming leagues, a trading market, and tournaments for collectible trading card games and video games.

For this campaign, I look forward to re-introducing myself and the Chronicles of Carlos brand to the world audience and to telling the stories of Kirk Stewart whose many encounters with Sasquatch over his lifetime living off-the-grid in the Pacific Northwest are captivating as well as compelling. Several of Kirk’s encounters were written about in David Paulides’ book, “ Tribal Bigfoot.” Kirk has encountered these beings playing, found their footprints, hair, and wooden structures, heard their cries and listened to them communicate in their jibber-jabber language, smelled them, and even had one bluff charge him and two hunting companions-- it ran right over the top of him! For this campaign, Kirk has agreed to take us up to the even more remote area where something left all of his provisions but took his gun, moved it some distance away, and buried it! 

This campaign is extremely important to me as I have wanted to create a documentary to discuss the details and share the evidence of my encounters for years now. Over my lifetime I have met many people who have had similar encounters to-- and some quite different from-- my own, and I am excited to tell their stories, too. I hadn’t considered hosting a docu-series before meeting my Director, Chris Narrie, but now I am convinced that this is a much better way to not only share my own Sasquatch encounter stories but also to share the encounters of others that I have met along my lifelong journey into learning more about the Sasquatch people. Your contributions will make this dream a reality and help to give me the means to be in a position, with the help of others like myself, to create video and audio content that pushes the thoughtful conversation forward and helps to disclose one of the greatest mysteries of all time: the reality of our co-existence with the Sasquatch people of the world-- which many still do not know or even believe exist. The magnitude of this disclosure is immeasurable in terms of its impact on modern society and civilization. You can be a part of this paradigm-shifting disclosure!

What We Need 

We are hoping to collect video and audio evidence of Sasquatch.  Most of our budget is going towards equipment in order to give us the best chance of obtaining definitive proof. 

$2000 for a professional thermal camera so that we can capture evidence at night.

$250 for a parabolic microphone to capture vocalization.

$120 for a lens that will allow us to capture images from far away.

$1250 for other film equipment, tripod, lights, batteries, etc.

$1380 to cover all other costs, travel, food, basic post-production, etc.*

*Additional funds that we raise will go towards more advanced post-production, marketing, and advertising.

The Impact

The hope of this project is to create an informative documentary while gathering video, audio, and hopefully trace evidence of Sasquatch. The larger goal is to get more funding and continue making documentaries to share more anecdotes and to gather additional evidence of the elusive Sasquatch.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate please share the campaign. Subscribe to the youtube page: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYS0xKdRLA0qdS... and head to my website for more information: https://chroniclesofcarlos.com/ and to follow me on all social media platforms.

story:
You can still contribute:

We have the initial funds needed to make Mosaic the way we wanted to, but we are still funding via In Demand, which means you can redeem one of our perks and we will use your money to add even more to Mosaic.As of the start of June 2021 we are about 75% completed on the production end and we'll be shooting until October.

Teaser Trailer:

 

What is Mosaic? 

Detective Foley (Simon Bamford) has a number of seemingly unrelated cases, except for one piece of recurring evidence - a disposable camera with the same image on each. As Foley explains each case to his newly assigned colleague; Detective Wentworth, we see them play out. Mosaic is in essence a 10 part horror anthology story tied together by Foley's investigation.

Who are we?

TIS Films are Alex Churchyard and Mike Holiday who co-wrote and directed I Scream on the Beach! as well as several short films. 

Directors Michael Holiday & Alexander Churchyard on the set of I Scream on the Beach! with Troma legend Lloyd Kaufman. 

We've been successful with our previous feature film 'I Scream on the Beach!', which has gone on to be selected for various film festivals and has won multiple awards. And was picked up by Darkside Releasing in 2021. 

With ISOTB we worked with a tiny budget and equally small crew; we're used to the challenges that working under those constraints brings up. As professionally working video editors we are used to the post-production workflow and adhering to tight deadlines. We completed shooting ISOTB within 17 days in 2019 and then 2 months later had it ready for its first festival submission. 

Although we got to explore the slasher genre with ISOTB we really want to take it up a level with this one. And this is where you come in... 

What we need

We're huge fans of 80s horror and it's really important for us to have practical effects in the film. We achieved this to a degree with ISOTB but really want to go all-out with the FX in Mosaic - think buckets of gore, drills to the head, nail-gun crucifixions and even death by glow-stick! 

But we cant do this without your help, we want to make Mosaic the ultimate splatter slasher! 

Simon Bamford Leads Mosaic:

Simon who portrayed Butterball in 'Hellraiser' & 'Hellbound: Hellraiser II', Ohnaka in 'Nightbreed' and has starred in a number of the excellent 'Dark Ditties Present's' films will bring to life the lead character in Mosaic, DI Eliot Foley. 

Mosaic - each case file

Mosaic details the case files of Detective Foley and his dogged determination to catch a killer. Or is it killers..?

BONUS: Film-within-a-film - Striptease Massacre 7: Strippers in Space!

In I Scream on the Beach! we had the fake film 'The Decorator' and also the first 'Striptease Massacre'. This time our main characters will be enjoying this ridiculous throwback! Dani Thompson's Sandcastles/ISOTB character Paula Valentine is the star of it, Michael Fausti reprises his voice role from ISOTB as the space strip-clubs owner and Singh Lall will be the top patron! 

Summary

Mosaic will enter production in November 2020 and filming will continue in blocks into the first half of 2021 - this will enable us to film around any pandemic restrictions and keep everyone safe on set. 

Like we did with I Scream on the Beach! we are putting our own money in and have already invested in upgrading all of our kit (New 4K camera, lenses, lights and a gimbal) and there are a bunch of costs that we will also have to cover along the way. Your investment will go towards making Mosaic the best it can be! 

Thank you for taking the time to look over our campaign, if you can invest then you have our eternal gratitude. If not, then please consider sharing the campaign; it really helps... 

Alex & Mike

If not, then please consider sharing the campaign; it really helps... Alex & Mike

story:
When a couple of college kids decide to go on a hunting trip for their Christmas break, they get more than they bargained for when their past comes back to haunt them. An undead reindeer has set Mr. and Mrs. Claus on a murderous rampage of revenge- with the entire group as the target.

As the group struggles to stay alive and figure out what put them on Santa's Murder List, feelings run high and love triangles are revealed. However, it will take more than love and Christmas cheer to stop the killing. During a fight for survival, the question remains- what ticked off Rudolph?

 

The Christmas Slasher, which has been approved as a sag feature film project, brings a horror twist to classic characters including Santa Claus, Rudolph, A Creepy Elf, and Mrs. Claus while also adding a psychological element into the mix even the SCARY TOYS. The main character, Alita Claus, becomes not only the sole witness but also a murder suspect and the audience are left questioning exactly how much of what they see is real.

 

 

 

"The funding will cover costs for production of The Christmas slasher, a sag feature film. Lady Destiny Productions is a nascent company and quality production is critical to establishing ourselves in the industry “

The project is the brainchild of Lady Destiny Production’s founder Destiny Soria, who has long been a fan of the classical horror genre. The Christmas Slasher aims to pay homage to the great major horror tropes while also bringing something unique and thought-provoking to the audience.

he Christmas Slasher is slated to be filmed in Minnesota and Texas, featuring local up and coming talent and crew! The cast also includes well known actors Felissa Rose Lloyd Kaufman, Nicholas Brendon, Carlos Ramirez, and Shawn C. Phillips! Fantastic!

Unfortunately, lack of funding has been a major obstacle in bringing this short to the proverbial big screen. The film is currently not funded despite having sag support.

The budget is modest and includes just enough to pay cast and crew as well as to cover various production-related expenses and hope to get a horror Icon on board also.

 


We’re giving a backer a starring role beside a well-known horror icon Nicholas Brendon in the film. For those that want to join in a 80s style slasher film!! We have Felissa Rose on board to play mom in Christmas Slasher to the lead female, Destiny Soria. Amazing kills scenes by the classic characters including Santa Claus, Rudolph, Elf, Santa's Sleigh and Mrs. Claus includes SCARY TOYS! The whole movie will not disappoint with tons of bloody gore scenes. YOU CAN NOT PASS THIS UP!

 

 

The perks give you some amazing gory props from the set. Like the Rudolph-the RED NOSE REINDEER zombie monster props, Signed deck from the cast, Walk-In death kill scenes, shirts, masks, swag bags, and MORE!  

 

 

 

 

 

Destiny Soria, Owner of Lady Destiny Production

I’m a photographer, editor, and videographer -  mostly films, in any genre.

I also give back to fellow artists and models by putting together great reels for them. I taught myself how to shoot and edit videos, which I now use to help others who are trying to break into the industry. No matter what the project or what the budget, I ensure that all my customers get quality reels and headshots. I have done so much but if you ask me, I’m just getting started. In reality, acting saved me. At the age of 24, I was ready to start this new chapter in life and I decided that I was going in headfirst. Acting allowed me to share with others, to speak up, to challenge my Learning Disabilities, Autism, ADHD, and to pursue my dreams. As an actress, I was able to memorize much more information and my speech gradually became more refined. My new efforts led me to the acting school, John Robert Powers (JRP) in Bloomington, Minnesota where I received further instructions from the industry. It was these lessons that paved the way for my success in acting as I honed my expressions, improved my skills and started my ascent.

Felissa Rose Esposito At the age of 13, she landed the role of Angela in the cult film Sleepaway Camp (1983). MTV's The Party Phone Series opposite Adam Sandler. 

 

Nicholas Brendon (Buffy The Vampire Slayer, Criminal Minds)

 

Destiny Soria, Owner of Lady Destiny Production, director, and writer. ("Bro, What happened?", Witchula, Crave: Root of Evil )

 

Lloyd Kaufman (The Toxic Avenger)

Shawn C. Phillips (Ghost Shark, Slumber Party Slaughter Party 2)

 

Mathew LaSpina

 

 

Keylan Haynes is a Austin based actor. You can find him mainly doing theater work at ColdTowne and Fallout Theater.

 

Jasmine Anderson 

 

Landon Rob Munoz 

 

Kamila Talpa

IMDb: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt11193798/reference

Website: https://ladydestinyproductio.wixsite.com/christmasslasher

Like the Rudolph-the RED NOSE REINDEER zombie monster props, Signed deck from the cast, Walk-In death kill scenes, shirts, masks, swag bags, and MORE!       Destiny Soria, Owner of Lady Destiny ProductionI’m a photographer, editor, and videographer -  mostly films, in any genre.I also give back to fellow artists and models by putting together great reels for them. I taught myself how to shoot and edit videos, which I now use to help others who are trying to break into the industry. No matter what the project or what the budget, I ensure that all my customers get quality reels and headshots. I have done so much but if you ask me, I’m just getting started. In reality, acting saved me. At the age of 24, I was ready to start this new chapter in life and I decided that I was going in headfirst. Acting allowed me to share with others, to speak up, to challenge my Learning Disabilities, Autism, ADHD, and to pursue my dreams. As an actress, I was able to memorize much more information and my speech gradually became more refined. My new efforts led me to the acting school, John Robert Powers (JRP) in Bloomington, Minnesota where I received further instructions from the industry. It was these lessons that paved the way for my success in acting as I honed my expressions, improved my skills and started my ascent.Felissa Rose Esposito At the age of 13, she landed the role of Angela in the cult film Sleepaway Camp (1983). MTV's The Party Phone Series opposite Adam Sandler.  Nicholas Brendon (Buffy The Vampire Slayer, Criminal Minds) Destiny Soria, Owner of Lady Destiny Production, director, and writer. ("Bro, What happened?", Witchula, Crave: Root of Evil ) Lloyd Kaufman (The Toxic Avenger)Shawn C. Phillips (Ghost Shark, Slumber Party Slaughter Party 2) Mathew LaSpina  Keylan Haynes is a Austin based actor. You can find him mainly doing theater work at ColdTowne and Fallout Theater. Jasmine Anderson  Landon Rob Munoz  Kamila TalpaIMDb: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt11193798/referenceWebsite: https://ladydestinyproductio.wixsite.com/christmasslasher

story:
Welcome Horror Fans to the Home Video Campaign for JASON RISING: A FRIDAY THE 13TH FAN FILM.   

Our goal with this campaign is to give fans new and old one last opportunity to secure a limited edition physical copy of Jason Rising. These orders will join the hundreds of hundred of previous backers who have already secured a copy of the film. 

The funds raised with this campaign will go towards covering the finishing costs of the film, producing a behind the scenes featurette, blu ray / dvd master and production fees, and finally shipping and handling. 
 

 

This campaign focuses on the physical media side of the film. Blu-rays, DVDs, and VHS as well as digital downloads.
 

Kyle Vahan - Sheriff Pete Daltry

Anna Campbell - Deputy Eve Glover

Jerry Bell Jr - Bear

Jason Reynolds - Jed

Lisa Sorenson - Serena

Dan Kyle - Jason Voorhees

Alyxandria McCormack - Pamela Voorhees

Elizabeth Garrett - Alex

Jennie Vaughn - Bobbie

Special Guest Appearance - Adrienne King - Alice

Amy Steel - Voice of Dr. Ginny Field

Patrick Green - Deputy Cunningham

Rochelle Muzquiz - Deputy Miller

Vincente Disanti - Officer Playboy

James Sweet - Officer Richards



James Sweet - Director, Writer, Producer
James began acting in 1997, training with several methods and instructors including long-time friend Robert Blanche. James is known for his vast resume, acting in such television shows as Leverage, Grimm, Z Nation, and The Librarians. Always wanting to be a filmmaker, James wrote and produced his first short film, Blood, and Sugar, in 2017. 

Karl Whinnery - Producer, Director of Photography, Editor
Karl is a cinematographer, known for the film Blood and Sugar (2017) and for shooting and editing over 100 music videos for bands including VINTERSEA, Skinlab, and Dead Animal Assembly Plant.

Freddy Heath - Producer/ Co-Director of Photography​
Freddy has been creating in the Portland film scene for the last fifteen years as a writer, director, producer, actor, editor, and gaffer. In that time he has enjoyed working with many creative people, produced films and web series, served as the in-house music video director for a record label, shot over fifty music videos, and even built some puppets.​

Vincente DiSanti - Producer, Co-Writer
Vincente DiSanti is an award-winning filmmaker responsible for the most well-known Friday the 13th fan films to date, NEVER HIKE ALONE and NEVER HIKE IN THE SNOW.

Christina Kortum - Make-up / Special Effects
A master special FX artist with credits including Grimm, The O.A., and Cabin Fever, Christina will be overseeing all of our critical make-up for Pamela Voorhees so that we can offer some fantastic GORE-ified goodness.

story:
An unexpected dementia story that fills your heart.

Firstly, thanks for taking the time to find out about our little family story. During the lockdown in Australia in 2020, our family (like many others) experienced many new complexities living with our Oma who has Alzheimer's disease and Vascular Dementia. What unfolded in the months of lockdown was a series of playful video experiments made by our family to help Oma make sense of her home isolation. We made supermarkets, clothes boutiques and even an underwater aquarium for her to enjoy.

We were speechless when our videos went viral with over 50,000,000 views and were featured on countless news networks, blogs and shows such as A Current Affair, The Late Late Show with James Corden and Good Morning America.

We now have a unique opportunity to bring our WHOLE story to the screen for a much bigger audience through telling Oma's story in a documentary. A story that's heartwarming and real. A story that over 56,000 Facebook followers (@OmasApplesauce) have helped us bring to this stage. Now we need to take brave steps and make it a story we can share with everyone, everywhere.

Dementia affects over 50 million worldwide, with millions more involved in the daily care and responsibility of a loved one no longer able to identify with themselves or those that love them. 'Everybody's Oma' will make you laugh and cry in the same breath - and it will provide hope about a stigmatised condition that badly needs it.

Why this crowdfunding campaign? And why now?

This coming Christmas and New Year will be an important milestone in our journey as a family, and we urgently need to hire a crew to film our family during this time. For those that have connected with our little stories already, you'll know everyone in our family has been involved in making them... but now we need to focus on Oma's increasing care needs and allow another filmmaking crew to pick up the story and document us, to help complete our documentary film.

We've already been blessed to attract the expertise of Australian Producer Ros Walker (Walker Films). She's just represented her latest production at Sundance 2020, she's the real deal. Ros brings a raft of knowledge and passion to this production, and we are fortunate to have her join our team.

This is why we've created this crowdfunding page, to see what we can do together. To surround ourselves with wonderfully talented storytellers who can help us complete our story for you. And to give those that want to be more deeply involved with this film a chance to make their mark too.

 

This crowdfunding will enable us to complete our filming.

I've made a multitude of award-winning short films about humanistic stories already, so I know what it takes to connect an audience to that intangible emotive oneness. But I'm also a realist and know that the one constant I can't change is time. Time we need to find for Oma's increasing care needs. Time that won't pause her dementia while we find our own way to film the remainder of our story. Time to capture a chapter of Oma's journey that we'll never be able to get back. Just time.

Here's what we'd use our crowd-funds for:

  1. Enlist a like-minded documentary cinematographer to film our family over Christmas & January 2021
  2. Commission an experienced editor to create a 15 minute trailer to pitch to distributors
  3. Promotional resources to pitch for further industry funding to complete the film

To keep things simple, we're creating just 5 x support levels ('perks') to enable supporters to collaborate with the making of our film. Each support level is deeply valued:

  • $50 Your name in our film credits
  • $100 Dedication for a loved one lost (text sentence in credits)
  • $150 Dedication for a loved one lost (name & photo in credits)
  • $500 Film Ambassador & personalised video for you
  • $2500 Live Presentation: we'll provide a keynote or Q&A session for your organisation

 

Your support will create a big impact.

I know what our empowering stories about Oma have done already. We receive thousands of comments and messages every month, and see and hear the changes our journey has been able to inspire in YOUR lives. Imagine if we could upscale that to millions more? Imagine if you were a part of a goodwill movement that helps those living with dementia, honours those lost to dementia AND gives families everywhere knowledge about more options for care?

The more we all talk and share ideas the greater our ability. 'Everybody's Oma' will be the ice-breaker for many seeking to normalise their fears, frustrations and build capacity and ideas for new inner hopes.

 

Risks & Challenges.

I'm a realist, I've been a generous crowd-funder myself and have experienced both the pleasures and pitfalls of this democratised funding system, so I get it. Its not always easy, but take comfort in the the strengths I do bring:

  • I am an experienced, award winning short documentary filmmaker
  • We have already had over 50 million views on our Oma videos to date
  • We have an credentialed Producer (Ros Walker) confirmed to be joining our team
  • We have minimised our family business to focus on Oma and her care needs
  • We have already amassed tremendous publicity opportunities which we will reconnect with 
  • Our whole family is dedicated in seeing this film get made
  • Oma's dementia is progressing faster now - we are driven to capture as much of her story as we can, and soon

Should we not reach our total funding goal, know that we'll still do everything in our power to complete 'Everybody's Oma' - it may however be on a smaller scale. If we succeed in raising partial funds, those monies will be used for the most critical parts of our documentary's production first. Should we exceed our funding target, we will continue to invest those funds in the ongoing completion stages of the film. We'll report our progress via updates here.

 

It's not all about money though...

Funding contributions are deeply valued but it's certainly not the only way you can help us. In fact I urge you to ONLY buy a pledge if you can comfortably do so without angst, we certainly don't want to make anyone uncomfortable about stretching their funds. Should you wish to support us without a pledge, there's many ways you can have a vital role in seeing this documentary succeed through the following:

  1. Follow our @OmasApplesauce Facebook page, Instagram page and Youtube channel
  2. Create a post or share our fundraising journey with your audience - maybe you're just one connection away from someone who could help us finish our film?
  3. Use the Indiegogo share tools on this page, to help us attract audience here too

And a huge thank you for taking the time to read and consider this project. That's a generous commitment of your time right there. Thank you, from myself (Jason), Oma, Megan and the whole van Genderen family.

story:
Hi, my name is Brant Lewis, and I am a current MFA candidate for the Film and Television program at SCAD. What drove me to pursue Livin’ After Midnight was my passion for utilizing horror and comedy to tell authentic queer stories. Despite being a shy and scared kid growing up, I held a deep attraction to horror. Whether it was curiosity or learning not to be so anxious, I became enamored by it. However, I did not realize how the genre allowed me to think about the concept of queerness and how it pertained to me. Years later, the connection of horror and queerness finally clicked, which made me love it even more. As a result, it became the final nail in the coffin to focus on horror for my career. 

During my time in graduate school, most of my work has focused on queer characters where their sexuality and gender do not serve as the focal point of the story nor serves as their sole identity. Similarly, the two queer leads of the film, Robyn and Tyler, live relatively everyday lives despite being vampires. I did not want to do a movie that had queerness be centered around coming out, tragedy, or a death. I wanted to provide a snapshot of everyday queer life. Along those lines, the element of them being vampires provides a way to discuss queer identity in a more organic and deeply emotional manner. Instead of it being superficial, it is thematically richer. 

Two queer vampires must navigate the possibility of a relationship after accidentally hunting each other under the guise of a blind date.  

The story is a mix of vampire horror with slice of life romantic comedy.   It is the perfect combination of Fright Night and Weekend, two influential films on the script.  

The total cost of the film is about $7000.  The main costs of the film pertain to below-the-line production, specifically COVID safety. As the risks and challenges section will state it better, we will be practicing strict safety on set and will use the money to buy rapid tests as well as other COVID safety equipment. The funding will also help with casting quality talent for the movie.  

    

For the film, we want to cast queer performers for the two leads exclusively.  We believe that we can get quality talent who can provide authenticity to the roles by doing this.  Along those lines, Robyn, who is non-binary, will only be played by a non-binary performer.  We hope to use SAG performers, but we are also open to the best talent for each of the roles.   Also, we will be casting understudies for the parts as well. 

The film will be utilizing exclusively practical effects. Aside from the vampire transformation and fangs, the void sequences, where Robyn's inner desires are known, will be done practically. Those sequences will have a vibe similar to the void in Under the Skin, while the bright colored lights will evoke Suspiria (2018) and Possessor. 

Writer/Producer: Brant Lewis

Brant Lewis is a producer, writer, and editor from Shreveport, Louisiana.  They discovered their passion for filmmaking during their time as an undergraduate at Sewanee from 2015-2019.  They are currently working towards their MFA from SCAD.  They love working on all types of films but has a great passion for the horror genre.  In addition, they are one of the award-winning producers for the horror comedy Door to Door.  When Brant is not working, you can usually find them reading the newest issue of Fangoria or watching the latest horror film.

Director/SFX: Tom von Dohlen

Tom hails from the hills of West Virginia and ventured down south for some real learning at the University of Georgia where he earned degrees in Political Science and Theatre. He is currently an MFA candidate at SCAD studying Film and Television Production. In his work he love blending genre lines, mostly dealing with horror and comedy. His most recent film Door to Door has earned several awards in its festival tour so far. When not on set or locked away by his keyboard, Tom performs with his improv troupe Vibe Check and teaches through Sketchworks Comedy.

Director of Photography: Jonas Stewart

Jonas Stewart was born and raised in the great state of Arkansas! He is a graduate of College of the Ozarks in Branson Missouri with a Bachelor of Science in Video Production. He is currently pursuing a Masters Degree in Film & Television at the Savannah College of Art and Design in Atlanta, GA. He is inspired by many films, but some of the most impactful are 2001 a Space Odyssey, Werner Herzog’s Nosferatu, Oldboy (The Korean one), and David Lynch’s Mulholland Drive. Jonas’ philosophy on filmmaking is that it is an art form and that he will treat it as such.

story:
Help us make a positive impact through film!

The world needs positive messages during this tumultuous time, and the moral of our story is that "We're all on the same rock!” Despite our differences we are in this together!

We have a roster of talent that is passionate about telling this story. Director Michael Cawood has worked for Disney, Warner Brothers, DreamWorks, Fox, Universal, Sony, Nintendo, etc... on blockbuster films including Pete’s Dragon, Happy Feet, Dawn of the Planet of the Apes, and Fast & The Furious 7 among many others. His previous short film Devils Angels and Dating has over 11 million views online so we anticipate a viral release for The Wrong Rock. Other key team member credits include Guardians of the Galaxy, Cars, Angry Birds, Kubo and the Two Strings, and Hotel Translavania 2. Industry veterans from Disney, Dreamworks and Pixar have endorsed the film. We’re working with a team of animators from around the world, and the short is already 50% completed.  In order to make the highest caliber film and reach the widest audience, we need your support. 

 

How we would spend the funds

3D computer animation requires specialty software and equipment which can cost a lot of money.

Covers high priority costs.

Covers all "out of pocket" hard costs, and expands our reach with the festival run. 

All backer perks will be upgraded to include a short "Making of" documentary and the opening chapters of the Story eBook.

All perks will be upgraded to include a medium length "Making of" documentary, a download of the main theme as n MP3 and some sample pages from the "Making of" Art eBook.

All perks will be upgraded to include a full length "Making of" documentary and the director will make a fool of himself dancing on camera to celebrate reaching the stretch goal that will allow us to pay all our team members a fair wage for their hard work, which means the film gets made faster and at a higher quality as team members can go full time. It will reach it's widest possible audience in the most impactful version we can make. We might even try for an Oscar run!

 

What you get

We have some unique perks planned including:

  • Naming a character in the film, after yourself or as a gift to a loved one. Either way it's a perk that will last, remember: pain is temporary, but film is forever!
  • We have several initiatives lined up to share our progress in a way that helps to educate other filmmakers including a website that will fill up with behind the scenes content, a book about the making of the film and even a documentary if we reach some of our higher stretch goals.
  • We have a great book based the story of the film written by published author JP Cawood, who's previous books include 'Love from Mars' and 'Sam and the Secrets of the Universe'. It features the same beautiful artwork created for the development of the film by artists Arturo Velasco and Solomon Gamino.
  • We're offering you the opportunity to give your voice to a character in our film. Just note that they're not speaking parts... so you'd be creating the sounds of a toadstool brought to life... of course this perk includes a credit on the film.
  • For the animators out there we're offering a bundle of character rigs for use in Maya from both 'The Wrong Rock' and 'Devils Angels & Dating'.
  • We're even offering some lucky backers the opportunity to follow the progress of our edit as it develops. It's updated roughly every week for the team and you can see every update as it's posted including all the edits ever created going back to the film's inception in storyboard and script form.
  • We've also put together a nice design to remember the project by which will be available on T-Shirts, Mugs and Posters.

 

The Impact

We'd like to think we're making a film that will be seen by millions, but more than that, will be shown to millions of kids for years to come helping to build a foundation for a more equal society, giving opportunities to everyone to reach their dreams and make a difference in the world.

 

Experience

Our team leads have made numerous short indie films on top of the feature films, games, TV and commercials you'll be familiar with:

  • Devils Angels & Dating
  • The Oceanmaker
  • Napoleon: The Ticket
  • Love in the time of Advertising

 

Team Leads

We have many more talented team members currently lending their skills to the project. We've been using the online virtual studio, Artella, founded by the same team that run Animation Mentor to manage the project, and it's going extremely well. See what industry veterans have said about the project at our website, TheWrongRock.com.

 

Challenges

Making an animated film is a huge undertaking, and not one to be taken lightly. But our team leads have done it many times before so it's in safe hands. The challenge is making sure that this project has enough funding available that the team can afford to dedicate their time to the project full time without taking other work to pay the bills. Projects like this rarely have the luxury of a full time team outside of a major studio, and life often gets in the way leaving great projects on the shelf. But with your help we will try to get as close to a funded film as possible to make the most impactful version of the film we can in a reasonable time frame.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get in touch if you would like to get involved. We are interested in hearing from advocates that might be able to help us reach a wider audience or attract talent to the project. Beyond that please consider using the sharing tools on this website to help spread the word about our heart warming tale of equality, and visit our website at TheWrongRock.com.
story_txt:
Help us make a positive impact through film!

The world needs positive messages during this tumultuous time, and the moral of our story is that "We're all on the same rock!” Despite our differences we are in this together!
We have a roster of talent that is passionate about telling this story. Director Michael Cawood has worked for Disney, Warner Brothers, DreamWorks, Fox, Universal, Sony, Nintendo, etc... on blockbuster films including Pete’s Dragon, Happy Feet, Dawn of the Planet of the Apes, and Fast & The Furious 7 among many others. His previous short film Devils Angels and Dating has over 11 million views online so we anticipate a viral release for The Wrong Rock. Other key team member credits include Guardians of the Galaxy, Cars, Angry Birds, Kubo and the Two Strings, and Hotel Translavania 2. Industry veterans from Disney, Dreamworks and Pixar have endorsed the film. We’re working with a team of animators from around the world, and the short is already 50% completed.  In order to make the highest caliber film and reach the widest audience, we need your support. 

 
How we would spend the funds

3D computer animation requires specialty software and equipment which can cost a lot of money.

Covers high priority costs.

Covers all "out of pocket" hard costs, and expands our reach with the festival run. 

All backer perks will be upgraded to include a short "Making of" documentary and the opening chapters of the Story eBook.

All perks will be upgraded to include a medium length "Making of" documentary, a download of the main theme as n MP3 and some sample pages from the "Making of" Art eBook.

All perks will be upgraded to include a full length "Making of" documentary and the director will make a fool of himself dancing on camera to celebrate reaching the stretch goal that will allow us to pay all our team members a fair wage for their hard work, which means the film gets made faster and at a higher quality as team members can go full time. It will reach it's widest possible audience in the most impactful version we can make. We might even try for an Oscar run!
 
What you get

We have some unique perks planned including:

Naming a character in the film, after yourself or as a gift to a loved one. Either way it's a perk that will last, remember: pain is temporary, but film is forever!
We have several initiatives lined up to share our progress in a way that helps to educate other filmmakers including a website that will fill up with behind the scenes content, a book about the making of the film and even a documentary if we reach some of our higher stretch goals.
We have a great book based the story of the film written by published author JP Cawood, who's previous books include 'Love from Mars' and 'Sam and the Secrets of the Universe'. It features the same beautiful artwork created for the development of the film by artists Arturo Velasco and Solomon Gamino.

story:
The 7 short series:

Ugly Instagram by Testimony Ogunrin:

A young broke influencer desperate to keep up her glam lifestyle, lands herself and her sister into a messy situation 

Angie & Anu by Busayo Ige:

Best friends Angie and Anu come together to commemorate the passing of Angie’s boxing legend mother. But can Angie put her feelings aside and do what’s right by her best friend and late mother?

Coconut by Kathryn Roth:

Kianne has a strange encounter at her cousins traditional Nigerian wedding. This opens up an exploration of different cultural upbringings, family and living in Britain as a woman of mixed black heritage.

In the rhythm by Jazmine Greenaway:

Struggling with life at university, Sola finds refuge in meeting up with an old friend, only to find herself in yet another uncomfortable position. Will she break out of her shell or will she fall apart? Only time will tell.

Courage by Priscilla Krahn:

Ama finds herself at a crossroad between her hidden dreams as an artist and perceptions of security and home.

Results day by Britny Virginia:

​A young woman gets an unexpected phone call from her estranged father. 

Small Chops by Nikki Iyayi:

Two friends take a trip across London to discover the oldest red telephone box.

 

 

7BlackWomen is a collective of black & mixed women creating new work for screen

Our goal is striving to see more black women leading on screen & behind screen

 

We currently have a writers programme where 7 black & mixed writers have created 7 short pieces based on the themes: Black Joy, Sisterhood, Friendship, Adulting and Living as a Black Women in Britain’. 


We want to showcase work that best represents us as Black women and our culture in Britain.

 

We're looking to raise funds for our films to have them showcased and put forward in festivals this will allow us to share our stories and reach our goal in striving to see more Black Women on screen & behind screen, if this is a passion of yours too we'd love and appreciate your contribution to reaching our financial goal!

 

What we need and why you should contribute

Our goal for this project is we aim to get a majority ALL BLACK WOMEN/WOMEN of color cast & crew! it's possible and with your help/contribution whether big or small we'll be able to fairly pay all cast & crew members and most importantly create work of a good standard and have our stories represented on screens.

We're looking to raise £25,000 to help us towards this production. In detail with your help we will:

  • Pay our cast and crew 
  • Secure Equipment
  • Provide Catering for our cast and crew
  • Secure locations to shoot our films
  • To provide a safe on-set experience with PPE and COVID protocol 
  • Additional production costs 

 

The Impact 

7blackwomen started late last year in December, it was stemmed from an inner frustration of constantly waiting for someone to make something happen for us and (Winnie Imara) the founder of 7blackwomen thought lets be bold and create our own work with the what we have. It started off with 7 black women and then grew rapidly and we were able to connect & collaborate with almost 30 black female creatives in less than 2 months, we realised that this initiative was more than just an idea but something that was needed and we wanted to continue and create stand out work in the industry.

The sisterhood series is the biggest project we've done so far, we've only been active as a company for 9 months and have been able to connect & collaborate with various different black female creatives emerging in their careers. 

Your contribution will allow us to go even further with our goals. It will be our greatest achievement yet and finally we will be able to see more black women on screen and behind screen showcasing their talents, the success of this will allow us to continue to create more work in the future and make an impact in our industry as BLACK WOMEN

 

"7BlackWomen brings together a group of ambitious, imaginative women, and this is a great opportunity to support some exciting new storytellers. The film and TV industry stands to gain so much by amplifying the voices of Black creatives." - Jaya Campbell, Director of Development & Production, Searchlight Pictures.

 

An all BLACK FEMALE Creative Team:

Winnie Imara - Founder & Producer of '7Blackwomen' 

Kathryn Roth - Creative Producer and Writer

Maria Odufuye - Script Editor 

Stephanie Boateng - Director 

Temi Yussuf - Director

Dubheasa Lanipekun - Director 

Priscilla Krahn - Writer

Britny Virginia - Writer

Nikki Iyayi - Writer

Jazmine Greenaway - Writer

Busayo Ige - Writer

Testimony Ogunrin - Writer 

 

Our Themes
