story:
In this supernatural drama about choice and duty, Eli, a lonely and quiet young man, holds an object in his possession, giving him the ability to conjure and talk to ghosts. He attempts to fix their problems to allow them to move on to the afterlife. When caught in a lie about the help he provides, he will dispute the moral implications of his actions with a ghost.

Dead-End isn’t a horror movie, or at least not in the way you expect.

I got the idea for the story when I went home for Summer in France. My room had been left unoccupied for months, and yet, as I put my suitcases down, I saw a yellow Zippo lighter with a calavera (skull) on it on my desk.

Nobody cared to explain how it got here. But I had this weird feeling about this lighter. How did it get here? What’s its story? I felt like it had a purpose. 

That’s how I came up with Dead-End: the story of a young man using a cursed lighter that allows him to conjure the spirit of the dead for just the life of a candle and tries to help them when no one else can.

Eli was given a cursed lighter by his grandmother when she died. He’s been using it to visit the cemetery at night when everyone is gone and wakes the dead to hear them out and help them fix their problems, allowing them to move on to whatever afterlife there might be.

But one night, Eli is asked the impossible, to avenge one of the ghost's death by taking care of the descendant of the murderer. Another ghost hears that and tries to stop them from going through with it.

But something unexpected changes the stakes for all the ghosts at the cemetery, and suddenly Eli doesn’t seem like that much of a good guy anymore.

ELI

Eli is the last of three children from overprotective parents. He’s incredibly honest and genuine, but has difficulty meeting new people.

This shyness and introversion helped him develop great listening skills.

Because of this, he feels a strong duty to help anyone with their personal issues. Now that he’s moved out of the city for College.


CHARLOTTE

Charlotte grew up in Savannah around 200 years ago. She’s the eldest child of 4 and died at 21 trying to protect her sister from a man who crept into their home at night.

She’s strong willed, single minded, uncompromising, and sure of herself.

She has no sense of humor but a talent in getting people to do what she wants.

 

MEG

Meg grew up in New York and died at the age of 25. She lived in the 90s and forever will be punk.

She was and still is anti-capitalistic, anti-conformist, and a believer in “direct action.” She died, through unknown circumstances, but is determined to find out the true details of her death.

She has a very deadpan sense of humor and never hesitates to put herself in uncomfortable or humiliating situations.

 

The risks we face coming into the production range from finding and securing our desired locations to securing funds to fully realize the artistic elements of our costumes and creative departments. Some of the problems we might face is getting a cemetery to let us film on their property and costumes from the Old South period which can be quite expensive. 

One of our main challenges will be the restrictions placed on us by COVID-19. We will need to be able to comfortably work with each other while wearing masks, adhering to COVID filming as dictated by Georgia protocol and University policy. 

That being said, no challenge is too difficult to overcome with a creative sense of ingenuity and a few extra bucks! 

 

You’d be supporting a story about duty, responsibility, and personal justice. A story that offers a lighter take on the afterlife.

By donating, you’d also be helping out a crew of SCAD students who make a point of always being ambitious. You’d be encouraging students to push themselves and try things they never thought they would attempt.

Additionally, by donating you’d receive a variety of fun postcards, prints, stickers, posters, “thank you” videos or written notes, and a surprise for the most generous donors...

 

For our film, we would need to raise about $2,000.

Food is often the most expensive thing to secure. Feeding a crew of 11 people for 3 nights in a row can, and will, get pricey. Additionally, we have to get individually packaged single serving food because of COVID restrictions. That means no pizza :(

Securing a private cemetery for those nights is a cost itself, adding to that the complementary equipment we will have to rent (generator, portable restroom...), and that cost goes even higher up.

The time period appropriate costumes need to be sourced very carefully, and they can get expensive.

Finally, the cost of festivals (just the entry fee) isn't too big, but adds up to a lot when there are many festivals to consider.

The future of the film is in festivals and we want to make sure we give ourselves the means to do it right (that's where you jump in), otherwise this project won't have a very bright future.

Follow us on Instagram to how we use the funds!

https://www.instagram.com/deadendfilm2021/?hl

 

THANK YOU and PLEASE DONATE

story:
SUMMARY

HI! I'm Benjamin N. Redic II, aka The Violence Conductor.  I'm a filmmaker, stunt man and fight choreographer.  I'm an absolute nerd and I have been since I was a kid.   I grew up reading greek mythology,  Dragonlance, Icewind Dale and Tales of The Malazan 5th.  I watched anime.  Record of Lodoss War, Princess Mononoke, and  I played action games, rpgs and jrpgs.  Everquest. Morrowind and Nexus of the Winds.

Here are some of our Talented Cast and Crew!!!

Lindsay Walker

Leila Annastasia

Lexter Rivera-Santana

 

 

UPDATE: We have hot our goal! Thank you so much! As we said, we didn't plan on doing any more crowd funds for this series of projects. So the additional funds we raise go towards the next shorts in the series. Those will also be used to raise funds from investors/distributors for the $100,000 feature.  Thank you all for the continued support! Thank you for getting involved!! We cannot believe how successful this is becoming!!

What I loved the most about all the different things I read, watched and played was the adventure.  The big quest.  To slay the dragon.  To free the land from unholy grip of....well you know the rest.  This campaign, The Chronicles of A Broken Path is our first real chance to step into that realm.  To make the kinds of fantasy/action/adventure films that we don't see enough of.  Independently.  You could say that this is the first step of our Quest. 

Imagine the world of Lord of The Rings,  with the combat of The Witcher, magic like Naruto with the conflict and depth of character of Game of Thrones.  We want to make an action heavy fantasy world, full of magic and combat.  Monks that can crack a warrior's armor with a single punch.  Warlocks that wield blades imbued with enough mana to destroy a group of enemies.   A world full of diverse characters and races involved in multilayered conflict that will only be resolved by treachery, martial arts, diplomacy and sorcery.  And we need you to join with us on that quest.  To be part of our "Fellowship of the Film" if you will.  The next couple of projects we make in this world will be self funded but this first one is the most ambitious of them. projects and that's why we need your help.   Will you join with us on this dangerous journey?

 

What this Quest Needs from you....

We need to raise $5,000.00 to do this right.  But if you noticed, the campaign is only for $2,500....we'll get to why that is a little later..... Almost all of that money is going to locations, cast and crew.   We have already spent thousands of dollars on all the cameras, costumes, insurance, stunt gear and safety equipment necessary to complete this project and begin making this world we created a reality.  

We have a really cool opportunity.  You see we pitched a few people on the idea and they loved it.  They agreed to fund half of the project via a Dollar for Dollar match so we really need your help!   We even spoke with some distributors about the project and they needed to see a sample of the work before we could move forward with them.   

There isn't an easy way to do something of this caliber and employing this many people.  If we could condense the project and lower the cost we would.  We just don't believe that the scale we are trying to convey and the world we are trying to build will be served by doing that.  We're going all in on this one, pulling out all the stops and we really hope that you come along with us on that ride.  This won't be the only project we create for you all.  There are others coming soon but they don't require this kind of budget.  The more we raise the more projects we get to create.  If we raised $100,000 we'd just shoot the feature! But that's a big goal so we're focused on the shorts right now and they will serve to further flesh out the world and prove to investors that people want to see this kind of project.  There will be other people outside our team involved in creating the history and lore of this thing as well.  The world will be immersive and expansive as it will connect with another "universe" from another sci fi creator based out of California!  We intend to continue having fans help us create the history of this world in partnership with us by making their OWN projects that we can canonize!

Here there be Dragons.....

There  are a lot of ways for a short film to go off the rails, and trust me we learned that the hard way.  But you can trip upstairs and if you plan it right you can fail forward.  We have some of the most talented individuals we know involved in all aspects of the project  to make sure that skip the pitfalls.  This is a community project and everyone is excited to get this going! Our condensed crew has been making projects together for a few years now and we've gotten pretty good at it.  Most of the people involved are filmmaker hybrid (preditors) just like us. 

 
 

Ballistic Blade Entertainment and Wild Canvas Media have collaborated on a number of festival award winning and nominated projects.

Matt Poitras of MP FilmCraft creates period accurate custom leather work from Han Solo belts to Viking and Scythian armor from scratch.  His work is amazing and we're delighted to have him onboard! 

Beaux Loy is an award winning vfx artist with crazy skills.  We are happy to have him aboard helping with the effects on screen!

There is a lot of fighting in this project so we will be doing a ton of training with the cast.   Jungle Movement Academy in Round Rock, TX and Cougar Tae Kwon Do in Jarrell, TX have graciously sponsored this project and offered us training space!  

Finally we have the team over at Austin Action Fest & Market assisting with promotion and functioning as a sales agent for the project!  Through Austin Action Fest we have already been speaking with international distributors about where this goes next. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

If you can't skip a cup of coffee or a cold one to donate a few bucks that's ok.  Please like and share this Quest with people who might be able to!  Everything helps.  Everything counts. Get the word out and support us that way!  Follow us on Facebook HERE
story_txt:
SUMMARY
HI! I'm Benjamin N. Redic II, aka The Violence Conductor.  I'm a filmmaker, stunt man and fight choreographer.  I'm an absolute nerd and I have been since I was a kid.   I grew up reading greek mythology,  Dragonlance, Icewind Dale and Tales of The Malazan 5th.  I watched anime.  Record of Lodoss War, Princess Mononoke, and  I played action games, rpgs and jrpgs.  Everquest. Morrowind and Nexus of the Winds.
Here are some of our Talented Cast and Crew!!!
Lindsay Walker

Leila Annastasia


Lexter Rivera-Santana

 

 
UPDATE: We have hot our goal! Thank you so much! As we said, we didn't plan on doing any more crowd funds for this series of projects. So the additional funds we raise go towards the next shorts in the series. Those will also be used to raise funds from investors/distributors for the $100,000 feature.  Thank you all for the continued support! Thank you for getting involved!! We cannot believe how successful this is becoming!!

What I loved the most about all the different things I read, watched and played was the adventure.  The big quest.  To slay the dragon.  To free the land from unholy grip of....well you know the rest.  This campaign, The Chronicles of A Broken Path is our first real chance to step into that realm.  To make the kinds of fantasy/action/adventure films that we don't see enough of.  Independently.  You could say that this is the first step of our Quest. 
Imagine the world of Lord of The Rings,  with the combat of The Witcher, magic like Naruto with the conflict and depth of character of Game of Thrones.  We want to make an action heavy fantasy world, full of magic and combat.  Monks that can crack a warrior's armor with a single punch.  Warlocks that wield blades imbued with enough mana to destroy a group of enemies.   A world full of diverse characters and races involved in multilayered conflict that will only be resolved by treachery, martial arts, diplomacy and sorcery.  And we need you to join with us on that quest.  To be part of our "Fellowship of the Film" if you will.  The next couple of projects we make in this world will be self funded but this first one is the most ambitious of them. projects and that's why we need your help.   Will you join with us on this dangerous journey?
 


What this Quest Needs from you....
We need to raise $5,000.00 to do this right.  But if you noticed, the campaign is only for $2,500....we'll get to why that is a little later..... Almost all of that money is going to locations, cast and crew.   We have already spent thousands of dollars on all the cameras, costumes, insurance, stunt gear and safety equipment necessary to complete this project and begin making this world we created a reality.  
We have a really cool opportunity.  You see we pitched a few people on the idea and they loved it.  They agreed to fund half of the project via a Dollar for Dollar match so we really need your help!   We even spoke with some distributors about the project and they needed to see a sample of the work before we could move forward with them.   
There isn't an easy way to do something of this caliber and employing this many people.  If we could condense the project and lower the cost we would.  We just don't believe that the scale we are trying to convey and the world we are trying to build will be served by doing that.  We're going all in on this one, pulling out all the stops and we really hope that you come along with us on that ride.  This won't be the only project we create for you all.  There are others coming soon but they don't require this kind of budget.  The more we raise the more projects we get to create.  If we raised $100,000 we'd just shoot the feature! But that's a big goal so we're focused on the shorts right now and they will serve to further flesh out the world and prove to investors that people want to see this kind of project.  There will be other people outside our team involved in creating the history and lore of this thing as well.  The world will be immersive and expansive as it will connect with another "universe" from another sci fi creator based out of California!  We intend to continue having fans help us create the history of this world in partnership with us by making their OWN projects that we can canonize!

Here there be Dragons.....
There  are a lot of ways for a short film to go off the rails, and trust me we learned that the hard way.  But you can trip upstairs and if you plan it right you can fail forward.  We have some of the most talented individuals we know involved in all aspects of the project  to make sure that skip the pitfalls.  This is a community project and everyone is excited to get this going! Our condensed crew has been making projects together for a few years now and we've gotten pretty good at it.  Most of the people involved are filmmaker hybrid (preditors) just like us.  
 
 
Ballistic Blade Entertainment and Wild Canvas Media have collaborated on a number of festival award winning and nominated projects. 

Matt Poitras of MP FilmCraft creates period accurate custom leather work from Han Solo belts to Viking and Scythian armor from scratch.  His work is amazing and we're delighted to have him onboard! 

Beaux Loy is an award winning vfx artist with crazy skills.  We are happy to have him aboard helping with the effects on screen!

There is a lot of fighting in this project so we will be doing a ton of training with the cast.   Jungle Movement Academy in Round Rock, TX and Cougar Tae Kwon Do in Jarrell, TX have graciously sponsored this project and offered us training space!  


Finally we have the team over at Austin Action Fest & Market assisting with promotion and functioning as a sales agent for the project!  Through Austin Action Fest we have already been speaking with international distributors about where this goes next. 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
If you can't skip a cup of coffee or a cold one to donate a few bucks that's ok.  Please like and share this Quest with people who might be able to!  Everything helps.  Everything counts. Get the word out and support us that way!  Follow us on Facebook HERE

story:
MAJOR UPDATE:

 Anyone who purchases a digital copy OR the Blu Ray will receive an email from us within 24 hours with a link and password to your digital copy. Blu Ray purchasers will get a digital copy to tide them over until they recieve the physical disc. Discs are usually mailed within one week. Thank you all so much for the love and support of BAD GIRLS! 

 

BAD GIRLS 

We are producing an eye-popping feature-length underground film and we guarantee it is unlike anything else. The film wrapped shooting just days before the pandemic lockdown and has been in post-production since. We are aiming for a release in both physical and digital formats in early 2021. We are inviting fans of alternative cinema (arthouse to grindhouse) to join our team to help us pay final post-production costs, get the movie over the finish line, and become part of motion picture history. 

BAD GIRLS is produced by Crystal Colligan and Christopher Bickel. It was directed by Mr. Bickel and stars Morgan Shaley Renew, Sanethia Dresch, and Shelby Lois Guinn. 

BAD GIRLS gleefully subverts genre tropes in spinning its lurid, hyperreal tale of desire, love, chaos and violence. After robbing a strip club, three desperate teenage girls lead a misogynistic Federal Agent on a lysergic cross-country chase -- scoring a duffle bag full of money, d**gs, and a crew of willing kidnapees along the way.

"These are characters people haven't seen before, interacting in a world that is almost-but-not-quite our own," says director Christopher Bickel of the "exaggerated reality" of the BAD GIRLS universe. "When you're making a movie for the cost of a used car, you're forced to get creative with the storytelling in ways that Hollywood focus-groups don't allow. You won't find BAD GIRLS in a Walmart because it doesn't belong in a Walmart." 

Due to platform constraints, this campaign presents a family-friendly cut of our trailer. To see the full-cut of the trailer, check out www.badgirlsmovie.com. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

BAD GIRLS was shot on a shoestring and every bit of money we had available to us went into the production. From paying the cast and crew to making sure everyone had food to securing our locations and rental of the plethora of classic cars used in the film. We now find a number of miscellaneous costs to complete the film and to get it released. True to our DIY punk rock roots, we are planning to do our own distribution -- so there are a number of costs involved in that.

We believe that the best way to raise these funds is to pre-sell the film and related mechandise. Furthermore, we are giving the promise that those who help us out now will be the first people to see and own a copy of the film. 

We have made a conscious effort to make all of the "perks" in this campaign appropriately priced and affordable. Our perks are "a la carte" and not cumulative -- select the items you'd like individually and save! We are offering physical format in the form of a Blu Ray loaded with extras as well as a digital release. Once again, contributors to this campaign will be the first to get a copy -- likely a month before the general public.

 

Background

BAD GIRLS will be a second film for underground producer/director Christopher Bickel. His first film, THE THETA GIRL, was widely critically acclaimed and has been distributed all over the world. Though made for roughly the same amount of money as THE THETA GIRL, BAD GIRLS is a much bigger and more complex production. Film Threat's Chris Gore described THE THETA GIRL as "a film that warped my mind," Here's what other critics had to say about Bickel's first film, THE THETA GIRL:
 

  • "One of the best exploitation films in a generation" - Nevermore Horror
  • "This film explodes onto the screen like the lovechild of Ted V. Mikels and Jodorowsky, skull-f**ks you like a tag team of Blue Sunshine and Blood Feast, and when it's done you will say, "Thank you, may I have another." - Psycho Drive-In
  • "Far, far better than it has any right to be... This is the kind of movie that microbudget indie producers should be studying to up their filmmaking game." - The Slaughtered Bird
  • "In its wildest moments, you can feel the same sort of creativity and mania of young Sam Raimi and Peter Jackson, cobbling together action and horror out of not-much-at-all." - Cinapse
  • "Perfectly capturing the look and feel of earlier films THE THETA GIRL carves out its own niche by upping the ante with even more sex and violence than we would have seen in the films it clearly loves so much. This is a kind of perfect distillation of the exploitation genre that would have been a cult classic back in the day...and is destined to be one in today... This is one of my favorite (and possibly one of the very best) films of 2018." - Unseenfilms.net
  • "THE THETA GIRL is a remarkably inventive, psychedelically captivating, micro-budget mind-banger presently mushrooming into the consciousness of indie fright fare fans, particularly those with a bent toward bravura brain blasting derring-do... THE THETA GIRL is a knockout accomplishment by any standards." -- Mike McPadden, Daily Grindhouse

BAD GIRLS was co-written by Bickel and star of THE THETA GIRL, Shane Silman. 

DOP Stephen Nemeth is known for his camerawork on the extreme horror film AMERICAN GUINEA PIG: BLOODSHOCK (2015)

This is a first feature for most of the cast members, though Mike Amason, Cleveland Langdale, Dove Dupree, and Shane Silman are returning from THE THETA GIRL. 

BAD GIRLS stars Morgan Shaley Renew, Sanethia Dresch, and Shelby Lois Guinn as the titular "Bad Girls." Cleveland Langdale and Micah Peroulis star as two cult rock stars kidnapped by the girl gang. Jonathan Benton stars as a geeky hotel clerk swept up in the madness. Mike Amason and Dove Dupree star as oddly-paired FBI agents following the wreckage of the girls' cross-country crime spree.

 

Inspirations

Citing influences as diverse as Jack Hill, Russ Meyer, Greg Araki, R Kern, David Lynch, Monte Hellman, Sam Peckinpah, John Waters, and Robert Downey (Sr.), we have crafted a vision more than just the sum parts of those influences. More than anything, it was probably the get-it-done-cheap lessons of Roger Corman that were the guiding light of this picture. This is a punk rock demo tape of a movie, made for people who love punk rock demo tapes and movies. 

 

Your Help

Your help sees to it that we get this defiantly Anti-Hollywood film released in a timely manner and you will be the first to see it. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign on the social media platform of your choice. If you see anyone else sharing it, be sure to like and comment on their post. Tell your friends. Word of mouth is the underground filmmaker's best friend. See a local film. Support underground filmmakers. Thank you!

story:
Synopsis

My name is François Bibonne and I spent 15 months in Vietnam exploring the country of my grandmother, Therese Nguyen Thi Koan. 

As a classical music fan with a history degree, and a graduate of history, I was fascinated by Vietnam’s historic roots in classical music.

From a music report about the Vietnam National Symphony Orchestra...

The conductor of the Vietnam National Symphony Orchestra, Honna Tetsuji, allowed me to begin filming rehearsals and concerts, and to establish a network with new music projects for young people in Hanoi and Saigon.

The content of the interviews with musicians was the history of Western classical music in Vietnam, and the relationship between France and Vietnam.

To a music trip in the mountains.

It was at this time that my research led me to cross paths with a traditional Vietnamese musician who inspired me to learn more about Vietnamese traditional music culture. We went to the North of Vietnam with a crew of musicians, and I could feel the presence of my grandmother in their music and in the landscape of the nature there.

I finally took part in a mission I had not imagined when leaving France...

Why should you become a producer?

The documentary was made with a team of hard-working and committed volunteers without a budget. We need your support to pay a French professional studio who will provide us with a wider platform to show our documentary to the world. Your funding will also contribute towards an international sustainable project which aims to grow bamboo trees in Vietnam. 

 

10% of the total amount (=1200€) will be used to raise money for the forest of Yen Bai in the North of Vietnam where we shot a part of the documentary. The forest will provide water to many, improve air quality for all, and ensure that the ground does not erode and cause further damage to this beautiful yet fragile ecosystem. 

Every 20 euros you plant a bamboo tree in Vietnam

 

With your generous contributions our team will send you regular updates, and exclusive behind the scenes content, as well as an accredited mention on our documentary. 

 

POSTPRODUCTION/7000€ (editing, color grading and sound design)

TRANSLATION/2000€ (French, English, Vietnamese)

MARKETING/1200€ (ads on social networks, website, inbound and outbound marketing)

COPYRIGHT/1000€ (secure the footage and the sound)

FESTIVALS/800€ (submit the movie to international competition)

 

Your support will promote Vietnam

Because the post-covid era needs to refresh cultural bridges between countries, Once Upon a Bridge in Vietnam aims to close that gap as it celebrates Vietnam through both classical music and Vietnamese music.

More than digital tourism, this documentary is an exploration of cross-cultural languages through musical composition, an insight into the rich and wonderful history of Vietnam and its conflict and reconciliation with France. Both history and music lovers will thoroughly enjoy this in depth study into the colorful and vibrant world of Vietnamese music culture.  

Women leaders and young musicians

Most of the interviews were conducted with female musicians who represent a source of inspiration for Western countries.  We interviewed people from four different generations including one young musician based in Norway. These talented musicians are testament to the international influence of music culture, and are an inspiration for other young women who dream of becoming musicians themselves. 

From the Hanoi Opera House to ethnic music in the jungle

The beauty of the documentary lies in its transmutability; to travel from the Hanoi opera house to jungles and rice-fields in the countryside, from international music to ethnic music. These combinations bring unique contrasts that inspired many composers in Vietnam.

It shows that Vietnam is a very special country with a very diverse music scene and a united music community.

The soundtrack

The music used is performed by the Vietnam National Symphony Orchestra (music director Honna Tetsuji), the Green Sound project musicians (music director Phan Thuy) and the Hope Choir (music director Tôn Thât Triêm). 

In the trailer, you can hear Những kỷ niệm quê hương composed by Hoàng Dương and played by the Vietnam National Symphony Orchestra, and Echo Sound composed by Hồ Hoài Anh, Arr. Phan Thủy, played by The Green Sound.

The choice of the soundtrack highlights the connection between Vietnamese traditional music and western classical music with beautiful compositions.

A starting point for research

The documentary is also a tool to prompt music lovers and universities to focus on more about the richness of music history in Vietnam.

Press Review

Vietnamese

  • https://lecourrier.vn/la-musique-classique-le-pont-des-civilisations/879821.html
  • https://lecourrier.vn/musique-classique-le-vietnam-un-elan-prometteur/906741.html
  • https://www.lofficielvietnam.com/pop-music-film/kham-pha-khong-gian-am-nhac-co-dien-viet-nam-cung-francois-bibonne
  • https://vietnamnews.vn/life-style/expat-corner/976089/french-filmmaker-bridges-cultural-gap-through-music.html
  • https://vovworld.vn/fr-CH/tags/fran%C3%A7ois-bibonne.vov

French

  • https://www.resmusica.com/2021/05/05/camille-saint-saens-et-le-vietnam/
  • https://lalettredumusicien.fr/article/vietnam-l...

 

Thi Koan Association

To know more about my projects, you can got to the website of Thi Koan association at www.studiothikoan.com

story:
What is Cinema Ghoul?

How would you like a streaming network that gave you the tea on the content you were about to stream? With Cinema Ghoul you get just that! Every video title will have an introduction to it that gives you the backstage view when it comes to Hollywood. It's streaming, but personalized. 

Featuring the kinds of content you won't find on other networks, we will share movies and television shows that current audiences won't have seen. Old stuff, but make it interesting and later we will look forward to producing original content without the interference from big studios.

Not only will you have access to content that's been scattered across the globe in one place, but you will be able to keep a list of favorites under your very own "Ghoullection." 

Why We Are Here

We are currently trying to raise funds to turn CinemaGhoul.com into a streaming network. After looking over our options, we decided that fundraising keeps separate interests and big studio interference out.

Our vision is to partner with people who like to be in the know about Hollywood, whose passion is the film industry, or those who just love having a sense of community by offering fun, one -of-a-kind, memorabilia that will never again be released after we launch!

Becoming A Cinema Guardian

When you choose to back our project (at ANY level), you will go down on record as one of Cinema Ghoul's Cinema Guardians. 

This means that you will hold a spot within our company that no one outside of IndieGoGo can acquire.

In short, you will be included in the Cinema Ghoul community and benefits for life, simply for choosing to join in on the fun and help us get launched!

We invite you to partner with us on what we aim to be your most rewarding streaming experience. 

For a broader scope of Cinema Ghoul, why we are choosing fundraising to raise capital and other topics, please visit cinemaghoul.com
story_txt: What is Cinema Ghoul?How would you like a streaming network that gave you the tea on the content you were about to stream? With Cinema Ghoul you get just that! Every video title will have an introduction to it that gives you the backstage view when it comes to Hollywood. It's streaming, but personalized. Featuring the kinds of content you won't find on other networks, we will share movies and television shows that current audiences won't have seen. Old stuff, but make it interesting and later we will look forward to producing original content without the interference from big studios.Not only will you have access to content that's been scattered across the globe in one place, but you will be able to keep a list of favorites under your very own "Ghoullection." Why We Are HereWe are currently trying to raise funds to turn CinemaGhoul.com into a streaming network. After looking over our options, we decided that fundraising keeps separate interests and big studio interference out.Our vision is to partner with people who like to be in the know about Hollywood, whose passion is the film industry, or those who just love having a sense of community by offering fun, one -of-a-kind, memorabilia that will never again be released after we launch!Becoming A Cinema GuardianWhen you choose to back our project (at ANY level), you will go down on record as one of Cinema Ghoul's Cinema Guardians. This means that you will hold a spot within our company that no one outside of IndieGoGo can acquire.In short, you will be included in the Cinema Ghoul community and benefits for life, simply for choosing to join in on the fun and help us get launched!We invite you to partner with us on what we aim to be your most rewarding streaming experience. For a broader scope of Cinema Ghoul, why we are choosing fundraising to raise capital and other topics, please visit cinemaghoul.com

story:
Short Summary

The Hell With Nike follows Darien, a middle aged man who wanders city streets, occupying his day with the company of his best friend Nik, who happens to be a shoe. When Nik convinces Darien to engage in a life of crime, Darien faces a complicated decision: Is his relationship with Nik putting his own life in jeopardy?

About the Project

My name is Dakota Linder. I am the writer/director of The Hell to Nike. Born in Hastings, MN my family and I moved to Scobey, MT when I was about five. I finished High School in Scobey then decided to attend film school in Bozeman, MT. This will be my third year at MSU and it's safe to say I’m doing what I love.

This idea came to me when I thought back to middle school. These people I called my friends didn't make me happy but I stayed with them because I was afraid to be alone. However the more I matured the more I realized that sometimes to be happy you need to accept that you need to be alone.

What We Need 

The funding of this film is essential to its development and as students at Montana State University, we cannot provide sufficient funding to develop this project with a finished product of professional quality. Thanks to the School of Film and Photography at MSU, we have the ability to rent equipment without any expenses. Therefore, the funding for this film will go to different areas such as set design, costumes, and food for our cast and crew. A detailed list of estimated expenses are shown below:

  • $150 - Wardrobe
  • $800 - Food for Cast and Crew
  • $350 - Set Design
  • $50 - Covid Supplies
  • $150 - Misc. Supplies
  • $50 - Post Production
  • $100 - Film Festivals
  • $450 - Money for Unforeseen Circumstances: Having extra funds for the random, inevitable problems or complications that can arise on set is essential so that production can continue to run smoothly. Any excess funds not used for the production of The Hell With Nike will be donated to COVID relief organizations. 

The Impact

Your donations will help provide young student filmmakers to gain experience working on a film set. The experience gained from this project will help these filmmakers to achieve their goals as they ready to enter the film industry.

Risks & Challenge

Due to the unfortunate circumstances and health risks posed by COVID-19, our set will follow a list of COVID regulations that will ensure the health and safety of all cast and crew be preserved. That list is as follows:

  • Temperatures of all cast and crew will be checked once before entering the set, and once after the set has been wrapped for the day. 
  • Cast and crew will be required to sign a wellness check upon entering set, and are asked that should they display any symptoms to please alert the production crew as soon as possible. 
  • Masks will be worn at all times. Actors may remove their masks only while filming a scene, afterwards masks must be put back on until they are to go on camera again. 
  • Hand sanitizer and sanitizing equipment will be provided on set to ensure a clean environment. 
  • CDC guidelines and those that the professional film industry follows today will be instated on set.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many other ways you can contribute to the making of this film: Following us on social media and spreading the word are great ways you can help out and are just as important to us as donations!

Follow us on instagram @helltonikefilm

And please share the link to this page with your family and friends! 

Thank you!

story:
JUICE: The Legacy

From the Case Files of Donnie Vexman, Esquire

The Basics

M.G. Productions has been producing short form video projects on the web for over 7 years, and is looking to transition into full length projects. Juice: The Legacy, is a Phase One 30 minute short designed to be integrated into a full length anthology feature. Completion of Juice: The Legacy will set the foundation for Phase Two and Three Projects.

More Than This

Meeting our goal is not just about being able to make this Phase One short film. It is about proving that high quality, theatrical content can be successfully made for niche communities. Success with Juice: The Legacy paves the way for a consistent stream of high end content.

Donations and Perks

We are looking to raise $6000 to complete production, including: $1750 for fabrication and/or rental of multiple body props, $4250 for full service film crew, location, equipment rental, as well as editing and special VFX in post production. There is also allocation for crowdfunding fees and holds the site requires to administrate the funding.

PERKS:

$1 – Our utmost appreciation for contributing. Every dollar helps.

$5 – Behind the Scenes Photo Set

$9 – Behind the Scenes Video Package. Plus previous perks.

$20 – The fully edited Phase One Short Film, “Juice: The Legacy” (*estimated 30 minute run time) Plus previous perks.

$100 - Video Shout Out from the Cast, Plus previous perks

$250 Producer Credit PLUS access to un-edited raw footage from production. Plus previous perks.

$500 Executive Producer Credit PLUS access to un-edited raw footage from production PLUS limited On-set privileges OR Zoom access PLUS Invitation to Cast and Crew Party. Plus previous perks.

Other Ways to Help

If you would like to help see this project succeed, but don’t want to make a financial commitment, then please spread the word. Your efforts on Social Media are extremely valuable in helping make this film a reality. Every person you can reach is a potential donor.

Endgame

Shortfall: Should all funds not be raised, the project will still be completed. The only difference will be that corners will, by necessity, need to be cut. Which means less VF/X or possibly none. The run time might be effected. Prop fabrication and/or rentals might be down-sized.

Windfall: Should funds raised EXCEED our goal, then that money will be used toward production of another Phase Two Short Film that would also be part of the proposed 3 part anthology feature film. Every extra step ahead now, paves the way forward for more ambitious projects in the future.

story:
Alright, what the Hell is this?

Glad you asked.  Up North is a film we've been working on since late 2018. In brief, it's a film about an estranged small-town family reunited by the death of a man who was either wise, crazy, or a little of both.

In the not-so-brief... well, I'll get to that.

You're asking for a decent chunk of change. What do you need it for?

Nearly every cent raised from this campaign will go toward the housing, feeding, and ethical payment of cast and crew. Everything else, from camera equipment to wardrobe to locations, is already accounted for. We're raising money because we refuse to exploit people in pursuit of our vision .

Fair enough. But why should I care?

Alright, here's the "not-so-brief" I was talking about earlier. 

This movie is about a lot of things. It's about faith, though maybe not what people often mean when they say that. It's about family, but I wouldn't call it a "family film". And it's a film about queer identity, but it goes a little bit beyond a lesson about how you should be nice to that gay kid in your class (not to downplay the very important work being done in those spaces, but this isn't that). This is a film that will attempt - using everything we've learned to this point, both as filmmakers and as human beings - to say something incredibly, facilely obvious in a brand-new way.

Our tagline gives it away. This is a film about kindness.

Alright, Socrates. You've told me the philosophy. But how is this gonna look?

Stylistically, I'd describe what we're going for as the exact midpoint between 3 Billboards and Call Me By Your Name. Essentially, a lowkey, rural style with a lot of jokes and snappy dialogue, which, by their contrast, give extra weight to interspersed scenes of profound personal realization, the kind that transcends all the talking everyone is doing.

Basically, imagine a cross between a comedy, a Western, and a Renaissance altarpiece, and you'll have an idea of what we want our film to look like.

Sounds heavy. You really think you can pull it off?

Won't be easy, that's for sure. But with your help, we can make it happen.  

If the goal is reached, I can say with confidence that we can hit the ground running in November. If not, all signs point to a rollout happening in March.

Did... did you put "Gnosticism" in the tags?

Don't worry about it.

Anyway, if you're unable to donate yourself, and you sympathize with what we're trying to do, please share this campaign around. I know it's a cliché, but every bit really does help.

Wait just one minute. I'm still not entirely convinced. Describe to me one scene from your movie that you think might sway me.

Okay, here goes nothing.

A man is walking. Where, we don't know, but we know that it's a city, and it's huge. The throngs of people on the street keep bumping into the man, who looks as though he can barely stand. Sure enough, he falls, and a passing taxi splashes water into his face, blinding him. The man sits there, alone and overwhelmed, and it seems, for a moment, that despair will overtake him. But just then, a hand reaches down from out of the crowd and pulls him to his feet. By the time the man has opened his eyes, whoever helped him up is gone. But he will remember this moment, and do his best to carry it forward.

We know this, because we are introduced to this scene when he describes it to another character, a local who, out of curiosity, has visited him in his rickety shack. He acts out the scene for her, and the shack he's in couldn't be more different from a busy city street. But as he does, the sounds of that day are heard, as if the spirit of that moment is intruding on the present.

One simple act of kindness, which resonates throughout an entire lifetime. 

 

 

Thank you for your attention.

story:
We Put the World to Sleep: Official Site | IMDb | Facebook | Twitter | Investment Page

Die Bully Die: IMDb

Short Summary

My name is Adrian Țofei, I'm an independent filmmaker and actor, my first movie, Be My Cat: A Film for Anne, received international acclaim, and now I need your support to make my next feature films We Put the World to Sleep and Die Bully Die.

We Put the World to Sleep is a found footage apocalyptic antihero feature film about three young idealists disappointed with the world who join forces and embark on a mission to bring everything to an end. Directed, produced & written by me, starring Erisse Peterson, Duru Yücel Țofei & myself, with Jay Sorensen and Danha Yunes attached as Executive Producers.

Shooting is scheduled for June 2018. I plan to do it based on controlled improvisation, just like I did Be My Cat: A Film for Anne, then premiere it in one of the world’s top film festivals (Cannes, Sundance, TIFF, Venice, Berlin, Telluride, SXSW, Tribeca), secure a top distributor, travel the festival circuit and get a limited theatrical release, or at least all the major VOD platforms. 

Right after I send We Put the World to Sleep to the first round of festivals, I want to start the production for Die Bully Die using the same equipment to cut on costs. Die Bully Die will be a revenge horror movie about a guy in his thirties who plans revenge on everyone who bullied him in kindergarten, school and high-school. 

What We Need & What You Get

Both movies are only partially funded. We need at least $3,000 more. Because of the improvisational method I am using, I cannot find a production company to finance the projects. The companies need a script and I do not work this way, I spend a lot of time living in character and years preparing the circumstances that would lead during shootings to authentic results identical to genuine life events. I create an alternative reality that speaks for itself. And I need your support to do that. You are our last hope of bringing these two projects to life the way they should be brought. You can learn more about the huge potential of the found footage concept combined with controlled improvisation in my Found Footage Manifesto. 

What you get are all kinds of goodies like VIP streaming (the team's private screener to watch the movies before release), links to download the movies, thanks credits at the end of the movies and on IMDb, signed DVDs/Blu-rays, and even associate producer or executive producer credits! You can choose a different movie for each item in a perk. Let's say you get the perk that has both VIP streaming and download: you can select We Put the World to Sleep for the VIP streaming and Die Bully Die for download, or vice-versa, or both for streaming, or both for download! 

The Team

Adrian Țofei

Actor & Filmmaker | Official Site | IMDb | Facebook | Twitter

We Put the World to Sleep: Starring / Director / Producer / Writer

Die Bully Die: Starring / Director / Producer / Writer

Adrian Țofei is an award-winning and critically-acclaimed Romanian actor and filmmaker. He directed, produced, wrote and starred in Romania’s first found footage horror feature film, Be My Cat: A Film for Anne, for which he won numerous awards and critical acclaim, including Best Film at the 2015 A Night of Horror International Film Festival in Sydney and Best Actor at the 2016 Nashville Film Festival.

Be My Cat: A Film for Anne was called “terrifying” and “a modern Peeping Tom” by Austin Chronicle, “potentially revolutionary and dangerous” by Dread Central, a “disturbing found footage masterpiece” by 28DLA and “the most revolutionary found footage film since The Blair Witch Project” by ANOH. It was also included in Dread Central’s Top 5 Best Horror Movies of 2016, Blumhouse’s Top 5 New Intelligent Found Footage Films You Need to See and Audiences Everywhere’s Top 50 Best Horror Movies of the 2000s.

Adrian’s acting performance in Be My Cat has been described by critics as “incredible“, “exceptionally strong“, “authentic“, “excellent throughout“, “complex”, “powerfully convincing“ and “frighteningly natural“. Artsploitation said that he did “the most believable movie psychopath since Norman Bates“.

Erisse Peterson

Actress & Musician | IMDb | Facebook | Twitter

We Put the World to Sleep: Starring (improvised audition below)

Erisse Peterson is an American actress and musician. She got her start in acting at an early age, after her family relocated to Los Angeles, California in 1996. As a child actor, Erisse was represented by Bob Feldman (father of actor Corey Feldman) and studied ballet, tap and jazz dance.

Later, Erisse Peterson attended Mississippi School of the Arts, the state’s only residential arts high school. She intensively studied theatre arts under her instructors, Dr. Robert Brooks and Tammy Stanford, and performed in numerous stage plays. She also developed a passion for all aspects of film, including directing and film scoring. During 2011-2013, Erisse attended Mississippi State University, where she studied Philosophy & Religion.

Erisse Peterson joined We Put the World to Sleep in 2015, when the project was called I Put the World to Sleep, after winning the international casting call (check out her improvised audition above). She recently ventured into music as well, releasing her first EP, Somethingmissing, under the stage name Planes, and a new single called Galactic Daisy. 

Duru Yücel Țofei

Actress & Screenwriter | Official Site | IMDb | Facebook | Twitter

We Put the World to Sleep: Starring

Duru Yücel Țofei is a Turkish actress and screenwriter. She studied English-Turkish Interpretation and Translation in college and then enrolled at The Studio Players in Istanbul to follow her true passion, where she received three years of Acting and Art Education under Şahika Tekand and Esat Tekand. During 2012-2017, Duru played in The Studio Players' Becoming A Rhinoceros 2.014, various TV series, commercials, and a short movie screened in Cannes. She is currently preparing for her role in We Put the World to Sleep and also co-writing the script for the female antihero thriller drama Good Girl.

As very expressive child, Duru always had a playful existence which later proved itself when she sang in front of the whole class in primary school and staged impressions of all her teachers during secondary school. She studied theatre for a year when she was 10, which led to her playing two different characters in the play that was staged at the end of the year. From that moment on, she came to know very clearly the fact that she wanted to be an actress.

Duru likes singing, especially jazz, and has a demo she handed out just to her family and friends. Swimming, yoga, spending time in nature, learning about the ways of the world and what’s happening in it, learning about the causes she might have the privilege to support, the topics of spirituality, health, science, history and architecture are among her interests.

Jay Sorensen

Producer & Foreign Service Officer | IMDb | Facebook

We Put the World to Sleep: Executive Producer

Jay Sorensen has been a horror movie fan since childhood. A U.S. Foreign Service Officer, she is especially interested in international contributions to the genre. She is an avid supporter of indie films and first became a producer in 2011. She once appeared in a Crazy Frog / Jamba commercial and was an extra in Francis Ford Coppola's Youth Without Youth.

Danha Yunes

Actress & Producer | IMDb | Facebook

We Put the World to Sleep: Executive Producer

Danha Yunes studied acting for film and TV at the Stella Adler Studio of Acting and the New York Film Academy.

UPDATE: Brandon Hart just joined We Put the World to Sleep as Executive Producer and Sarp Onat Yucel as Associate Producer.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to contribute more than the maximum amount for the executive producer perk, then check out the investment info! Becoming an investor will guarantee you a share of the revenues. 

If you cannot contribute financially, but still wanna help, please share the campaign on your social media or via email (use the sharing tools provided by Indiegogo), talk to your friends and family, write on your blog/website, talk about it on your YouTube/TV show, or do anything else comes to your mind that would help us make these movies! Thank you so much!

What you get are all kinds of goodies like VIP streaming (the team's private screener to watch the movies before release), links to download the movies, thanks credits at the end of the movies and on IMDb, signed DVDs/Blu-rays, and even associate producer or executive producer credits! You can choose a different movie for each item in a perk. Let's say you get the perk that has both VIP streaming and download: you can select We Put the World to Sleep for the VIP streaming and Die Bully Die for download, or vice-versa, or both for streaming, or both for download! 
The Team

Adrian Țofei
Actor & Filmmaker | Official Site | IMDb | Facebook | Twitter
We Put the World to Sleep: Starring / Director / Producer / Writer
Die Bully Die: Starring / Director / Producer / Writer



Adrian Țofei is an award-winning and critically-acclaimed Romanian actor and filmmaker. He directed, produced, wrote and starred in Romania’s first found footage horror feature film, Be My Cat: A Film for Anne, for which he won numerous awards and critical acclaim, including Best Film at the 2015 A Night of Horror International Film Festival in Sydney and Best Actor at the 2016 Nashville Film Festival.
Be My Cat: A Film for Anne was called “terrifying” and “a modern Peeping Tom” by Austin Chronicle, “potentially revolutionary and dangerous” by Dread Central, a “disturbing found footage masterpiece” by 28DLA and “the most revolutionary found footage film since The Blair Witch Project” by ANOH. It was also included in Dread Central’s Top 5 Best Horror Movies of 2016, Blumhouse’s Top 5 New Intelligent Found Footage Films You Need to See and Audiences Everywhere’s Top 50 Best Horror Movies of the 2000s.
Adrian’s acting performance in Be My Cat has been described by critics as “incredible“, “exceptionally strong“, “authentic“, “excellent throughout“, “complex”, “powerfully convincing“ and “frighteningly natural“. Artsploitation said that he did “the most believable movie psychopath since Norman Bates“.

Erisse Peterson
Actress & Musician | IMDb | Facebook | Twitter
We Put the World to Sleep: Starring (improvised audition below)

Erisse Peterson is an American actress and musician. She got her start in acting at an early age, after her family relocated to Los Angeles, California in 1996. As a child actor, Erisse was represented by Bob Feldman (father of actor Corey Feldman) and studied ballet, tap and jazz dance.
Later, Erisse Peterson attended Mississippi School of the Arts, the state’s only residential arts high school. She intensively studied theatre arts under her instructors, Dr. Robert Brooks and Tammy Stanford, and performed in numerous stage plays. She also developed a passion for all aspects of film, including directing and film scoring. During 2011-2013, Erisse attended Mississippi State University, where she studied Philosophy & Religion.

Erisse Peterson joined We Put the World to Sleep in 2015, when the project was called I Put the World to Sleep, after winning the international casting call (check out her improvised audition above). She recently ventured into music as well, releasing her first EP, Somethingmissing, under the stage name Planes, and a new single called Galactic Daisy. 
Duru Yücel Țofei
Actress & Screenwriter | Official Site | IMDb | Facebook | Twitter
We Put the World to Sleep: Starring

Duru Yücel Țofei is a Turkish actress and screenwriter. She studied English-Turkish Interpretation and Translation in college and then enrolled at The Studio Players in Istanbul to follow her true passion, where she received three years of Acting and Art Education under Şahika Tekand and Esat Tekand. During 2012-2017, Duru played in The Studio Players' Becoming A Rhinoceros 2.014, various TV series, commercials, and a short movie screened in Cannes. She is currently preparing for her role in We Put the World to Sleep and also co-writing the script for the female antihero thriller drama Good Girl.
As very expressive child, Duru always had a playful existence which later proved itself when she sang in front of the whole class in primary school and staged impressions of all her teachers during secondary school. She studied theatre for a year when she was 10, which led to her playing two different characters in the play that was staged at the end of the year. From that moment on, she came to know very clearly the fact that she wanted to be an actress.
Duru likes singing, especially jazz, and has a demo she handed out just to her family and friends. Swimming, yoga, spending time in nature, learning about the ways of the world and what’s happening in it, learning about the causes she might have the privilege to support, the topics of spirituality, health, science, history and architecture are among her interests.
Jay Sorensen
Producer & Foreign Service Officer | IMDb | Facebook
We Put the World to Sleep: Executive Producer
Jay Sorensen has been a horror movie fan since childhood. A U.S. Foreign Service Officer, she is especially interested in international contributions to the genre. She is an avid supporter of indie films and first became a producer in 2011. She once appeared in a Crazy Frog / Jamba commercial and was an extra in Francis Ford Coppola's Youth Without Youth.
Danha Yunes
Actress & Producer | IMDb | Facebook
We Put the World to Sleep: Executive Producer
Danha Yunes studied acting for film and TV at the Stella Adler Studio of Acting and the New York Film Academy.
UPDATE: Brandon Hart just joined We Put the World to Sleep as Executive Producer and Sarp Onat Yucel as Associate Producer.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to contribute more than the maximum amount for the executive producer perk, then check out the investment info! Becoming an investor will guarantee you a share of the revenues. 
If you cannot contribute financially, but still wanna help, please share the campaign on your social media or via email (use the sharing tools provided by Indiegogo), talk to your friends and family, write on your blog/website, talk about it on your YouTube/TV show, or do anything else comes to your mind that would help us make these movies! Thank you so much!

story:
Watch The Teaser Trailer Here -> Milford Teaser Trailer

ATTENTION! READ FIRST! If we hit $30k I will be able to complete the film!. I can make $30k work. But.... $50k would make it much better and easier but I want to reassure people that I can still film the movie with $30k. So let's start there! Thank you!

The Situation

This will be a 20 minute short film. In order for this to truly stand out and be as beautiful as we know it can be, we need to pay everyone involved. My last short "Neutral" cost $50k but not many of the crew got paid. This time around I would like to pay people for their time and work.

Where The Money Goes

  • Equipment rentals
  • Location rentals
  • Gas and vehicle rental to drive to OR
  • Crew pay
  • Actor pay
  • Cost for 16mm film, film camera, film processing (if we hit $50k & shoot on film)
  • Film permits
  • Food for crew
  • Housing for crew
  • Post color correction
  • Post audio mixing
  • Original soundtrack and score

Other Ways You Can Help

Live in or near Portland OR?

  • We need locations! Apts, houses, restaurants. If you have a location and would allow us to use it send us a message! Or anything that you think may help. Let us know!

Benefits For Donating

  • We will film extensive behind the scenes content and give early access to donators.
  • Donators will be the first to see the film once it's finished.
  • Donators can be an extra in the movie if you live near Oregon.

Thank You!

Because of everyone who helped me make Neutral I was able to complete a film that I am beyond proud of. Neutral is by far my biggest achievement. I would love to do it all over again!

Thank you for reading!

Nathan

story:
Short Summary

I love making movies. I recently was blown away by the film "1917" for it's one-take look and impeccable pre-production and cinematography. It inspired me to make a film that would also be shot as one continuous take so I chose a location and wrote a script to the land.  

I usually shoot films on a zero dollar budget and make it happen the best I can. This time, I want to go the extra mile to make a truly unique and captivating film that is different than what everyone else is doing.

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $3,000. This will cover a number of different items that require funding I am simply unable to provide myself to include: The entrance fee to shoot on location at Ruby, rented professional camera stabilizers, other more advanced cinema support equipment for maximum picture results, A hired Cinematographer, food and water for the cast and crew, the cast's wardrobe, multiple support vehicle rentals and more.

Ways of saying thank you!

* $5.00 or more: Get a thank you with your name in the credits

* $10.00 or more: Receive a signed copy of the screenplay by the cast and myself

* $20.00 or more: Attend the virtual premier and be one of the first to see the film 

* $50.00 or more: Receive a signed movie poster by the cast and crew

* $100.00 or more: You will be listed as an executive producer prominently in the credits and movie poster and will acquire IMDb credit.

* $500.00 or more: You will name the lead protagonist!

All amounts given are helpful and appreciated!

The Impact

This film is more than just a film. This is an opportunity to participate in something truly unique 

  • This film will be shot to look as if it occurs in one long continuous take which is very different than may other short films.
  • This film will draw attention to Ruby Arizona as an attraction to encourage people come and visit this historical town and drive funding for the conservation mission that Ruby is dedicated to.

Risks & Challenges

To produce a movie that looks like a long continuous take requires MASSIVE PLANNING! There is also more margin for error and you don't have the luxury of editing like you normally do. So ensuring we have the right equipment and crew to get job done is critical.

I excel at pre-production and plan for challenging shoots well and I am confident that I have accounted for potential issue that may come up.  Now I just need the funds to acquire the tools necessary to make this film a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand not everyone is able to give money, but there are other ways you can help! 

- Lending or donating equipment that otherwise will be rented

- Share this campaign to attract more attention

Thank you for considering and reading through this!

story:
Short Summary

Still Small Theatre Troupe was started in late 2012, and has performed a number of original works since that time. Our first play, The Prophet Project, was recognized with the 2013 Making a Difference in Christian Service Award from Gordon Conwell Theological Seminary. We're based in Beverly, MA, but tour to pretty much anywhere people want us!

Our shows are not specifically for Christian audiences; they're for anyone who wants to enjoy thought-provoking art. All of our performances are followed by a talkback in which the audience can discuss the show with the cast and crew (and sometimes the author!).

We are currently producing a film adaptation of our original musical Diary of Perpetua. Over 340 million Christians face abuses ranging from job and housing discrimination to rape, imprisonment, and execution solely because of their faith. Many people are unaware of their plight, and many of those suffering are unaware that anyone hears their story. Those who do hear about it are often overwhelmed by the brutality of what goes on.

We aim to inspire the free world to help and learn from these people, and to let those suffering know they are not alone, by producing a film that presents their story in a way that engages rather than overwhelms. We are a grassroots company that is run entirely by volunteers and independent contractors. We don't have deep pockets, but we have deep hearts and a lot of determination to see this project through.  We are campaigning for aid in funding our upcoming film, The Diary of Perpetua.

 

What We Need & Where It’s Going

            Our goal is to raise $12,000 dollars for the film with your help!  Your donation would be going towards physically producing the film, securing venues, creating costumes and props, marketing, compensating our cast and crew, and providing you with exciting perks.  Some of perks for donating include VIP passes, special edition DVDs, T-Shirts signed by the cast, your very own handmade props, and more!  We have perks for all donation amounts because every contribution matters, and we are grateful for any amount you are able to donate.  The funds generated will be going towards these purposes even if we do not reach our entire goal.

 

The Impact

When we first performed The Diary of Perpetua as a staged reading with minimal costumes, staging, and a handful of actors, we invited a representative from a large persecution relief organization to share at our post-show discussion.  After seeing the show, she told us in tears, “I’ve met persecuted Christians; I’ve heard their stories; I tell their stories… and I’ve never connected with them this deeply before.”  Plays, film, and music have a way of reaching our hearts and remaining in our imaginations in ways that news items cannot.  Audience and actors alike consistently come away from this show deeply affected, and we can’t wait for God to use this to touch many more lives!

 

Risks & Challenges

As this is our first major film, we are learning a lot and appreciate your prayers for the logistics of our production process.  We ask that you pray for protection against any unforeseen challenges that may arise and for wisdom to move through them!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to make a financial donation, we still appreciate your support of the project.  As you come across this, please spread the word within your communities and invite your friends to donate or see the film!  You can also use Idiegogo’s share tools to get the word out.  And ... we're still casting for extras! Give us a yell at stillsmalltheatre@gmail.com! We thank you for your support of our work.

story:
Hollow Lake will be the fourth feature film from independent film company Fright Meter Films and Writer/Producer/Director Troy Escamilla.

Hollow Lake is a home invasion style slasher film that tells the story of two couples who decide to spend a quiet, relaxing weekend at an isolated lake house.    Unexpected consequences arise after one of the couples experiences an illicit encounter, leading to a nightmarish night filled with brutality and bloodshed.

To say the Hollow Lake will push boundaries is an understatement.   On top of delivering the scares and disturbing death scenes that horror fans expect, the film will also touch on many issues not explored in modern slashers.   The film will truly be unlike anything genre fans have seen.    

You can check out the trailers of our last two feature films, Teacher Shortage and Mrs. Claus, below to get an idea of what we were able to do with very similar budgets as the goal for Hollow Lake.

 

TEACHER SHORTAGE TRAILER

 
MRS. CLAUS TRAILER

 

Anything helps, even giving the campaign page a share on social media.     We elected a fixed campaign, so if we do not reach our goal, the film will not happen.  So, again, anything you can to support the campaign will be very appreciated!

 

 

Because of the subject matter of this film and the fact that it's going to be a very small cast, casting this film is going to be a careful and timely process.   However, we are in the final stages of casting a few important roles.  Once we hit 50% of our goal, we will begin making casting announcements!
