story:
GUNS OF EDEN wrapped filming on Saturday, August 7th, after 16 days of principal photography thanks to a crowdfunding campaign which raised $86,000.  We finished on schedule, with an outstanding cast and crew. Judging by the first week's dailies, this will be my best and most ambitious film. Thank you all for your support! I'm certain we will receive distribution, but we still need to raise finishing funds to complete the movie. In the meantime, we will begin shipping those reward perks which are now available.

 

THE PITCH

GUNS OF EDEN is a feature length action movie written and directed by Gregory Lamberson, starring Alexandra Faye Sadeghian, Lynn Lowry and Debbie Rochon. Our goal is nothing less than to make a movie that will be seen as a classic in the future.  We've raised enough in contributions and donations to cover pre-production and principal photography, but need more to cover post-production (picture editing, sound editing, music scoring, color grading, sound mixing) and film festival expenses. We're offering some of the best reward perks out there. Join the team today!

THE STORY

GUNS OF EDEN is a feature length action movie written, directed and produced by award-winning author and filmmaker Gregory Lamberson, who describes it as “a cross between DELIVERANCE and FIRST BLOOD, with a female hero and a dash of THE WARRIORS."

Megan Forest is a cop in Buffalo, New York suffering from PTSD after accidentally killing a fellow police officer. Megan’s partner Jeremy persuades her to go camping with himself and two married friends, Blake and Gabriella. While hiking in the woods, Megan and Jeremy witness the execution of an unarmed drug dealer by Sheriff John Preacher and his deputies - and they are seen by the killers. The four campers run for their lives, but the deputies seal off the woods and Preacher summons different factions of an armed militia to hunt them down, triggering an all out war. 

WRITER-DIRECTOR-PRODUCER GREGORY LAMBERSON

Gregory Lamberson is an award-winning author and filmmaker who has worked on independent films since 1984, when he served as the production manager on the horror-comedy I WAS A TEENAGE ZOMBIE at the age of 19. Two years later, he wrote and directed his first feature, SLIME CITY, which became an international cult classic. He has directed eight feature films, most recently WIDOW’S POINT starring Craig Sheffer, and has worked on many others, including Frank Henenlotter’s BRAIN DAMAGE,  Debbie Rochon’s MODEL HUNGER, and Christopher Ray’s ASSAULT ON VA-33.

Lamberson has authored 15 books and is the co-founder of Buffalo Dreams Fantastic Film Festival. His films have won numerous awards on the film festival circuit, and in 2019 the Shawna Shea Film Festival presented him with its prestigious William C. Gerrity Award, named after the renowned Hollywood legend who worked as an assistant director, production manager, and producer. Lamberson lives in Buffalo, New York with his wife Tamar, who co-produces his films, and their daughter Kaelin, who has acted in some of them.

STRAIGHT TALK FROM THE DIRECTOR

Hello, Film Supporters:

Although I’m most closely associated with the horror genre, I love films of all kinds, especially police thrillers and crime dramas.  I’ve been developing GoE for 25 years, and can’t wait to get started. We will make this movie, it will be released, and you will receive your perks. Your contributions will not be wasted, and every contributor will see his name in the credits.

The Screenplay

I wrote the first draft of the screenplay for GUNS OF EDEN (then called GOD’S COUNTRY, and later MEGAN’S WAR) back in 1996. I’ve worked on it obsessively over the last year, and the story is more relevant today than when I started it. A good screenplay is the foundation of every good movie, and I believe this is the best I’ve written.

Creative Goals

I aim to create a film in the spirit of DELIVERANCE, FIRST BLOOD, and SOUTHERN COMFORT. Other influences include BILLY JACK, CAPRICORN ONE, ASSAULT ON PRECINCT 13 and RACE WITH THE DEVIL. I 've blogged extensively about these films and others in our Updates section. Despite its 70s and 80s inspirations, GUNS OF EDEN will be a modern thriller with wall-to-wall action. I would love to see this become the first in a series of films centered around the lead character, Megan Forest.

A Winning Team

Just like Lee Marvin in THE DIRTY DOZEN and Richard Burton in THE WILD GEESE, I’m assembling a crackerjack team to help me realize my vision. Tamar Lamberson is producing with me,  as she did on JOHNNY GRUESOME and WIDOW'S POINT, and Chris Cosgrave, an expert on action cinema techniques, is Co-Producing. Chris will shoot the film, choreograph some of the action, and create visual effects (some utilizing miniatures).  Keith Lukowski, who is providing much of our gear, is also on board as Co-Producer.

Phil Gallo, who scored the cult horror films MOTHER’S DAY and THE REDEEMER, and directed WEST NEW YORK and MATTY FRESNO AND THE HOLOFLUX UNIVERSE, has been my trusted editor since 1995, and will once again pull my bacon out of the fire when necessary.

 

Armand John Petri and Joe Rozler, who co-composed the outstanding scores for my films KILLER RACK, JOHNNY GRUESOME, and WIDOW’S POINT, will return. Between them they have done excellent work for Manowar, the Goo Goo Dolls, 10,000 Maniacs, and many other rock bands. In this video, Armand previews the score for GUNS OF EDEN.

.

MEET OUR PRINCIPAL CAST 

We’ve cast up and coming NYC actress Alexandra Faye Sadeghian in the starring role of Megan Forest, and I look forward to collaborating with her to create a truly memorable screen hero. 

 

Other cast members so far include Bill Kennedy as Sheriff John Preacher, our primary villain;

 

“Trazz” Johnson will play Jeremy Scott, Megan’s police partner;

 
We are proud to announce that the great Lynn Lowry has accepted the key role of Frances, a recluse who helps Megan Forest when she most needs it!
 
We are pleased to announce the addition of the great Debbie Rochon to our cast in the role of Annie, leader of the "girl group" the Betsys!
 
We are pleased to announce the casting of the great Brooke Lewis Bellas in the role of Darcy, a foul mouthed member of the militia!
 
Nicole Alshahen  has been cast as Gabriella Peterson, a social worker;
 
Dominic Luongo was the first person cast, as Blake Peterson, an everyman high school teacher;
 
Kim Piazza will play Representative Olivia Dahlly:
 
 
 
Brian C. Schilling will play Griffin, a security expert:
 

Keith Lukowski will play Garett, a sociopathic deputy;

 
Tim O'Hearn has been cast as Caleb, a "heavy metal hillbilly!"
 
Xander Goldman will play Walter, Sheriff Preacher's right hand man:
 
We have an enormous cast!

Passion Project

I’ve worked on features with budgets as low as $6,000 and as high as $900,000. I know how to stretch a dollar, and how to use my time effectively on set. I also know the right people to help me achieve my goal of making a memorable action movie. GUNS OF EDEN is a true labor of love, and that passion will shine through in the finished work. This is what independent filmmaking is all about.

Crowdfunding

Contribute to a project you believe in and wish to support – become part of the team – and receive one or more cool reward perks in addition to screen credit on the film. This is not shopping: your perk cannot have an equal monetary value to your perk, or we won’t have any money left to make our movie.

Many crowdfunding campaigns for movies avoid perks involving physical goods because packing and shipping perks for 200 or more people entails an inordinate amount of work. I’m not afraid of that work, and believe I've come up with unique perks with legitimate value in exchange for your generous support.

Some of the coolest perks are Limited Editions, including the hardcover and trade paperback editions of the GUNS OF EDEN novel I'm writing exclusively for supporters. These will be the only print editions of the book, making them true collector’s items, Supporters who select the Deluxe trade paperback edition and either the Special or Deluxe edition of the hardcover will be listed in the Special Thanks section of the books and receive Supporting Producer screen credit in the film. Likewise, our Limited Edition poster will feature the names of supporters in the credits block. 

 

Exceeding Our Goal

We have exceeded our goal, we have cast special guest stars, and we are making this movie!  But we still need to raise more money to cover post-production and film festival fees.

Thank You

Thank you in advance for your support. I’ve waited a long time to direct this particular movie and look forward to making it a reality. We’ll keep everyone who contributes informed throughout the process, with regular updates. And we'll be adding content throughout this campaign.

Let’s make a great movie!

Gregory Lamberson

PRODUCERS

The Producers of this film are Gregory Lamberson, Tamar Lamberson, Chris Cosgrave and Keith Lukowski. Our first Executive Producers are Erin Elizabeth Heald, Kim Piazza and Armand John Petri.  Our Co-Producers so far are Faith Nichols Peterson, Brooke Lewis Bellas and Brian C. Schilling, We are looking for additional Executive Producers, Co-Producers, and Associate Producers! 

CAMPAIGN TEAM

 

We are fortunate and excited to have a full team of talented people from across the U.S., across the Canadian border, and across the pond helping us with this campaign as Associate Producers, many of them filmmakers whose whose you should see if you haven't already: Richard Rowntree (Director - DOGGED and NEFARIOUS); Brett Cameron Glassberg (Director - DERELICTS); Joseph Fusco (Director - FINISH LINE: THE RISE AND DEMISE OF OFF TRACK BETTING); Christopher Darton (Director - ESSENCE OF GOODNESS: THE HAROLD EXTELL STORY and HARD WORKING MAN: THE MUSIC AND MIRACLES OF DANNY BROOKS); Skip Shea (Director - TRINITY and SEEDS) Bill Kennedy (Actor/Producer - ATTACK OF THE KILLER SHREWS): Kristen Skeet (Director -MURDER CREEK); Steve Boliek, Jr. (Director - ZOMBONER); Ty Cheman (Director - NOT NOT ANOTHER MONSTER MOVIE): actress Sheri Fairchild (THE SPECIAL); screenwriter Corby Kennard; genre journalist Jeff Fountain (HORROR GEEK LIFE); and bodybuilder/gym owner Eugene Bofill (REPS Fitness)! 

ART TEAM

Poster - Philip R. Rogers
Black and white illustrations - Bob Freeman
Color illustrations - Gayle Petri
Graphics - Chris Cosgrave

EXPENSES

Covid-19 has impacted all our lives, and has taken a toll on film and television production: the major studios keep postponing their tentpole films, or relegating them to Video-on-Demand or other streaming services, and many television shows have been postponed or cancelled. The mandated costs required to protect cast and crew on a major production are astronomical; those costs are less extreme on a small indie film on which 6 - 10 people do the work of dozens. We still need to do time consuming testing, meet insurance requirements, provide our people with PPE and individually wrapped meals, make mobile handwashing stations available, and have a Covid Compliance Officer on set – on top of the common production requirements, like costumes, picture vehicles, special effects, set construction, and props. It adds up quickly!

STATUS

The screenplay has been completed, a “breakdown” and tentative shooting schedule have been made, concept art and videos created, casting and location scouting initiated, and we've begun acquiring prop weapons. Our goal is to begin shooting around Buffalo, New York in mid-July. As we update this campaign page, we are 120% funded thanks to the contributions of over 350 backers!

RISK FACTORS

We live in uncertain times, for sure. But we're experienced and  committed filmmakers who intend to make this movie, and kick ass doing it. Weather and health issues could cause delays, but as nothing is going to stop us. 

SOCIAL MEDIA

Please follow the Guns of Eden on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/GunsOfEden

Twitter: @Digi_Guerrilla

Instagram: officialgregorylamberson and gunsofedenfilm

TRAILERS FOR PREVIOUS FILMS BY GREGORY LAMBERSON

 
 

 

 

Please share our campaign on social media even if you can't contribute, and remember to check back for cool updates!

Short Summary

  • My name is Kimberly Terasaki and I am a student film maker working on this passion project.
  • I am a relative newcomer to the fandom but was inspired by the drive and creativity of other fans, as well as a number of other horror properties including but not limited to: The Blair Witch Project, Halloween 2018, Never Hike Alone, and YouTube culture in general.
  • With no new "Friday the 13th" movies on the horizon, it falls to fans to keep the franchise alive in whatever ways we can. This is my contribution to that work.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need money to rent / buy props and camera / sound equipment to present the most realistic and high quality film we can.
  • In exchange for your contributions, we offer: $1 = postcard, $3 = download of the movie and all supplementary materials, $5 = poster (signed or pristine, you choose), $15 = Camp Crystal Lake Counselor Shirt, $55 = executive producer credit and early access to the script and first screening, $75 = producer credit and access to the script and first screening.
  • We also offer the opportunity to purchase props / costumes used in the shoot: $15 = a shirt of a character used in the shoot, $40 = camp crystal lake sign, Poseable Body / Victim of Jason Voorhees $85.

  • The money will still go to the project as the project will get made no matter how much money we earn.

The Impact

  • Friday the 13th fans are some of the most dedicated I have ever seen, as shown by their massive support for Friday the 13th The Game and other independent projects. Even if we do not raise enough money,  I want to assure people that.
  • This is my first big project, but I have done many smaller short films, which I would be happy to provide.
  • Have any questions as to how your contribution is being used? Email me anytime and I will answer in the message / set up a google meet so we can build the trust of creator and benefactor.

Risks & Challenges

  • I know that making a fan film is risky, especially with so many moving parts. Casting alone took weeks longer than I was expecting.
  • I am both good at planning and at improvising, both of which are highly necessary when working on a small project.
  • The project will be made no matter what, even if I have to film it on my iPhone. However, if you are dissatisfied with the quality of our work, message me and we will provide a refund.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate, please feel free to share!
  • Remember to tune in on May 13th, 2022

UPDATE (posted May 18th): 

We have finished the first half of filming (the main part that was on-location at Camp Beechwood of Sodus, NY) and raised far more than the minimum $500 I set for us. Many contributors have already received access to exclusive pics and footage from the shoot.

However, the shoot has become a lot more expensive than I have predicted and I have spent $9,305.48 of my own money on this project. I am able and willing to do this; however, in order for the movie to be completed, I estimate that I will need at least an additional $3000 to finish filming. I am very sorry to do this, especially since I initially wanted to have all of the filming done at this point. Such is life and the creation of art, unfortunately.

I will still maintain the perks that I have an likely include new ones in the coming weeks. But I truly do need the help of anyone / everyone who is willing to contribute or even share so that we may reach out and let people know about the project. I am always happy to share pics / footage from the first half of the shoot, so you can attest to the quality of the production we are making.

I cannot thank all of my current donors enough for their support in this.

story:
HELP END RACISM THROUGH FILM!

We Three Kings is a collective of three inspirational Afro-Caribbean men who have joined forces to produce a feature film entitled ON THE OTHER FOOT. Please read on to find out all about our exciting project and how you can get involved. We already have  £150k but would like to raise a further £100.000 to give this film the attention and visual look it deserves so that is stands up against some of the even bigger budget films.

THE SYNOPSIS

Billy Pitcher is an over protective,  overpowering  father who feels he is always right!  Always pushing his point and his right-wing agenda!  When his daughter starts to date a man who does not agree with any of his views it tips him over the edge.

As a young  millennial woman she is not fazed by her father's antics and eventually convinces him to attend an African church in order for him to at least understand and embrace her new partner's culture. Unfortunately for him he attends on the day of 'UMBADEHDEH', a spiritual day where dreams and worst nightmares can come true and he is miraculously transferred into an Afro-Caribbean body. What follows is a comedic and hilarious journey of gut wrenching laughs as he finds out first hand what it's like to be Afro- Caribbean in todays society.

We will be adding exciting cast to the project and you can follow our journey on instagram at

https://www.instagram.com/ontheotherfootmovie/?hl=en

 

MEET THE WRITER AND PRODUCER

My name is Fredi Nwaka and I am an award winning writer, director, producer from the United Kingdom. Fostered from the age of 3 months until I was nine years old in a small town called Deal, where I was the ONLY black person until coming back to London. I actually thought I was the only black person in the world but thats a whole other story.

My companies are Are We Dead Yet Ltd and Nwaka Productionz  and I have written, directed and produced independent films for  a number of years including one which is currently being distributed globally called The Living Dead  http://devilworks.eu/projects/are-we-dead-yet/ and a romantic comedy called In Spite Of Everything  which will also soon be released.

Originally a recording artist signed to Wu Tang International I discovered  my passion in filmmaking late in life, in fact several years ago but have been going 100mph ever since, winning numerous awards. It hasn't been easy nor financially stable YET but when you're a creative and you love what you do, plus you're inspiring others along the way, you make it work somehow.

 

INSPIRATION

This campaign is important to me on so many levels. After watching the news in the U.S and seeing, hearing and watching the graphic events which led to George Floyd tragically losing his life I decided that enough is enough. I have experienced racism myself on so many levels from a young age but it's not about me. I wanted to do something! Something that would at the very least create awareness, educate people, highlight cultural differences some of which have never been heard before but in a tasteful, interesting and non offensive way.  Many people are marching to show their support and solidarity but I have decided to make a feature film which hopefully can still be enjoyed long after the marching, fog horns, posters and banners have died down.

Your contribution will mean that generations to come will be able to see life from a different perspective as well help bring about awareness globally, especially if the film gains distribution like the other films I have made.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Making a feature film is by no means a simple task however I have done it twice now with very small budgets. We already have  £150k but would like to raise a further £100.000 to give this film the attention and visual look it deserves and to give it every chance of being distributed globally and viewed in cinemas as well as on VOD (View On Demand) platforms. Obviously the more money we can raise the better the film but we are passionate about  the message and want to create as much awareness as we can. We want to reach the widest and most diverse audience possible.

Your contributions will go towards paying for the following

  1. Cast
  2. Crew
  3. Film Equipment
  4. Locations
  5. Licences
  6. Post Production (Editing,Colour grade and VFX)
  7. Marketing and promotion.

The aim is to start pre-production in September and commence principle photography in October/November or when social distancing regulations permit.  We aim to have the film complete by the end of the year or early 2021.

We have many exciting perks from exclusive tickets to the UK  premiere, short cameos in the film, producer credits to even meeting the cast and crew. 

We are aiming to make a feature film as I said but if we do not reach our target we will make a short version and submit this into festivals to gander interest to make a feature film so its not a matter of IF.... just a matter of HOW and WHEN?

 

EPG MEDIA are the main communication company supporting the movie ON THE OTHER FOOT and will be responsible for all press and communications.

 

 

The Impact!

Your contribution will give so many people around the World a voice, some who have never been heard while highlighting so many issues in a comical, interesting tasteful way.  I have produced several films and never start a project I cannot finish. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Its always good to be transparent, open and to provide insight into the risks and obstacles we may face on the way to achieving  our goal however I am confident with your support we will make it happen. The only obstacle I forsee is time...

There are many risks in film but when the heart and drive is stronger and outweighs these risks nothing is an issue.  Check out the trailer to my last feature film to give you an indication of what can be achieved on a very little budget and in a short space of time. (15 days)

https://youtu.be/LMuXRCW2mKQ

The cause is such a great one that we have so much support from the acting, media and celebrity community and this will go ahead and make a difference.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some people are just not in a financial position to contribute and thats absolutely fine but that doesn't mean you can't help.

You can spread the word and our campaign on social media and become an ONTHEOTHERFOOTSOLDIER which is just as valued as those who pledge to support our campaign. There are also many exciting Indiegogo share tools to make your jobs easier.

story:
THE FILM

Craig & Sara are finally going to be parents and are having their #MiracleBaby – a fact they’ve attracted a lot of attention for from friends and people following their struggle online. However, the stress doesn’t stop for them when at the baby shower for their coming bundle of joy neither Craig or Sara can outrun the judgement, questions and advice of everyone around them. There’s not a person at the party who isn’t curious to know the one thing the parents-to-be haven’t shared: how their struggle to get pregnant finally came to an end.

 

The happy couple insists it was a miracle, but was it?

 

#MiracleBaby is a short film that blends drama, comedy, and genre together to create an unforgettable film about how far we’re willing to go to live a life that looks perfect, and the pressure put on women to have a baby.

 

 

WHY NOW

(aka a message from the director, Meg Welch)

 

In 2016 I got tired of remaining complacent with how women were treated, and like so many others I decided to stand up. I marched in the Woman’s March. That seed began a current of change and growth in my personal story. But I wasn’t alone. With #MeToo and #TimesUp gaining prominence, the cry for women filmmakers to have a voice in the film industry, and in our society, it’s finally started to feel like the voices of women are being listened to when they speak up, and that people want to hear from them.

 

When I first read #MiracleBaby it felt like it hit the part of my soul that felt so liberated in our current climate: the part that got angry every time I got a stomach bug and a male coworker would ask if I was pregnant, or that was scoffed at when I admitted I didn’t know if I wanted children – even the part of me that found delight in explaining to two elderly women at the Women’s March what “Feminist AF” meant.

 

#MiracleBaby lives in what I truly believe: that a person’s value is not defined by their ability or desire to have a baby, and why they make the choice to start a family or not is their business and no one else’s.

 

What I absolutely love about #MiracleBaby, is that I can tell a story with all of this embedded inside it, but wrapped in a fun coat of quirkiness and genre that will go places a standard drama won’t. And I can’t wait for you to see it.

 

 

WHY WE NEED YOU

Xander and I are a team of micro-budget filmmakers. We both work day jobs to provide for ourselves and our creative endeavors, and there’s only so much we can contribute to the making of our films and still be able to pay our bills. We are putting countless hours into the making of #MiracleBaby, while we work full time jobs, assemble cast and crew, and do all the prep needed for the shoot. We’ve both committed to financially contributing to the film, but what we can scrape together just isn’t enough.

 

We need additional funds so that we can get more equipment (to make a visually and aurally better film), provide food for our team during production, business needs (like insurance), props and decorations (this is set at a baby shower after all) and even transportation and storage of said equipment.

 

There are a lot of moving pieces to making a film, and though our shoots are always humble, we strive to provide the best onset experience we can for our cast and crew, because we value the time and effort they give us and think that providing them with a good meal, comfortable rest areas and nicely maintained, quality equipment is the least we can do as responsible micro-budget filmmakers.

 

In short, the more money we’re able to raise the better #MiracleBaby will look and sound, and it will help our cast and crew remain happy, safe and healthy.

 

 

MEET THE FILMMAKERS

Meg Welch

(Director)

Meg has made two no budget features and multiple short films as a writer and director. Working with limited resources has made her a scrappy, adaptable filmmaker who is willing to plunge ahead in order to tell her story. Her joy in filmmaking comes from exploring relationships, genre and the attempt to uncover what truly make us human.

 

Currently, Meg hails from Orange County, California where she lives with her cat Marty (named for Scorsese and McFly) and holds down a day job at a craft company. In addition to filmmaking, Meg is a painter who has had her art in several showcases in LA and Orange County, done multiple art walks, and is an active member of a zoom Shakespeare group that she and her friends began during the pandemic.

 

You can reach Meg on Twitter & Instagram @mrbosslady.

 

Xander Montes

(Producer)

Originally from Long Beach, California, Xander Montes is an up-and-coming film producer living in Orange County. 

 

Xander is developing the feature film Old Dog, dramedy about a tightly wound man navigating his relationship with his dad and navigating what it could mean to be a father.  

 

He has produced a variety of short films, including Til Death that premiered at the Los Angeles 48 Hour Film Festival (2019).  Xander also holds credits as the 2nd AD position on the 5th season of A Haunting (2012) and a set decorator on a short called A Truth In Silence (2013). 

 

You can find Xander on Instagram at @xfmontes.

 

Helene Kay

(Writer)

Helene Kay is a comedienne but her IMDB gives off horror movie vibes. She considers herself a triple low threat because of her time doing standup, sketch, and improv. She’s performed all over California mainly in Orange County and Los Angeles, unofficially in awkward social situations. She’s studied writing at Vanguard University, the Groundlings, and UCB. She enjoys working with Megan and Xander and uses writing as a gimmick just to hang out with them.

You can find Helene on Instagram at @helenekay.

 

As filmmakers, Meg & Xander value having a team that is diverse and gender inclusive. To meet more of our team please follow our journey on Instagram at @miraclebaby.movie. We will be announcing more of our collaborators there.

 

REWARDS

We think our rewards are pretty rad, and we want to use them to really give you a feeling of being with us on the journey of making #MiracleBaby. Making a film of any length is a process that is incredibly detailed, and something that not everyone knows the nuts and bolts of – so in this digital age we want to be able to share our knowledge and the nature of our craft with you.

 

Our rewards are cumulative, so if you pledge at the $250 level (hint, hint) you would  be able to be an extra on set, zoom with the director, get a signed copy of the script, a download of the film, etc. It’s a really good deal. Like really. I mean, we know we’re movie geeks who love to see how things get made and we really hope you do too.

 

$1 – just good karma: From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for helping bring this short film into the world.

$10 – shout out: We’ll shout our thanks from the digital rooftop by thanking you on the #MiracleBaby Instagram. We’ll even follow you (just don’t forget to give us your username). 

$15 – Shower Invite: Digital wallpaper to grace your laptop or your next zoom meet, and if you give us your instagram username we’ll add you to our close friends & family list so you can see exclusive BTS and other posts as we go through the life of making #MiracleBaby and as we put it out into the world. 

$25 – The Sonogram: We’re so stoked you want to contribute to the birth of this film that you’ll get to see it before any of the other backers - via a password protected link*. It’ll be doubly fun for you because your name will show up in our credits, thanking you for backing us!

*Will be after editing is completed, and may be delayed depending on film festival rules and requirements. 

$50 – Guest Gifts: Advanced access to the movie not enough? That’s cool, we’ll send you a link to DOWNLOAD* a copy of this bouncing baby so that it can live in your digital library forever.

*Will be after editing is completed, and may be delayed depending on film festival rules and requirements. 

$75 – Shower Treat: Get a signed copy of the script (signed by as many of the creatives as we can wrangle) for your reading, displaying or collecting pleasure. These people are gonna be great, so do you want to say you have one of their earliest autographs?

Shipping within the continental US only.

$100 – Diaper Raffle: We think Meg is pretty cool, and we think you’d think so too. For the mere price of $100 you can get a private 30 minute zoom chat with her to hear about #MiracleBaby, her zombie movie without zombies, creativity, how to hold down a day job while making movies - or even her favorite coffee places. Whatever. (Just make it appropriate please.)

$250 – Shower Games: Wanna be in the movie? Back us for $250 and you can come be a guest at the baby shower when we shoot*. Not your jam or you're simply too far? That’s cool. We’ll schedule a zoom with 2-3 members of our creative zoom where we’ll discuss whatever you like and answer your questions.

*We cannot provide transport or a place to stay. If you wish to be an extra you must be local or be willing to provide your own.

$350 –  Photo Wall: You send us a photo* and we’ll frame it and and use it as set dressing, making you a de facto friend of family member of the happy couple. And then when you watch the film later you can have fun looking for your own personal easter egg.

*Photos must be appropriate and of the backer, we can’t do any kind of copyright infringement, use someone's image without their permission or other naughtiness here. 

$500 – Birth Announcement: We’re going to plan the biggest best zoom we can, with as many of our behind the scenes and in front of the camera creatives as we can, and for 30 minutes we’ll be able to answer your questions, tell you funny stories about working on the set, and in the business and whatever else you desire.

$1000 – Godparent: We love that you love us this much, and that means you’re now an EXECUTIVE PRODUCER of the film. You’ll even get an IMDB page credit out of it*. How cool is that?

*As long as IMDB lets us, and it better let us.

 

 

WHAT COULD POSSIBLY GO WRONG?

Whoo. This is a doozy. There’s always a list of things that can go wrong when you have so many moving pieces – shoots can get cancelled at the last minute, people can drop out, and sadly, we may make a movie that you don’t like (though we’ll try everything in our power to avoid that). Basically, imagine everything that could go wrong if you were planning a party, and then multiply that by 10 because there are more moving parts: things like cameras that need to function, and marks for actors to hit.

 

The point is, we don’t know what could go wrong, but there can always be something. But this isn’t Xander & Meg’s first rodeo. We’re both experienced filmmakers, who have worked on multiple films, together and separately, and we will strive to bring you all the best film possible, in the most timely manner we can, but we will be doing it safely and with the physical and mental health of our cast and crew in mind.

 

However, the biggest monkey wrench that could gum the works right now has to be acknowledged: Covid-19 and the global pandemic.

 

In addition to being a producer, Xander is a Covid Compliance Officer and is keeping abreast of the rules and safety measures we need to follow in order to make the #MiracleBaby production as healthy and safe as possible. We are hoping that state of the pandemic will not change any local ordinances that would cause us to delay or cancel our shoot, but as we’ve all learned since 2020 we cannot predict how the pandemic is going to roll out.

 

Please cross your fingers and say a little prayer that the shoot will be able to go forward as planned.

 

 

SCORE SOME GOOD KARMA

If you’ve gotten this far on the page kudos for sticking to it, and thank you for reading. But we’re going to ask you one more thing.

 

If you can’t contribute to #MiracleBaby we understand. Times are hard for a lot of people right now, and we get it if a financial contribution simply won’t fit in your budget. Please, take care of yourself and your loved ones' needs first.

 

However, would you consider sharing our campaign?

 

Posting about our humble little movie on any social media platform helps to extend our reach, get more eyeballs on the message and hopefully a few more dollars in the coffer. It’s crazy simple to do, and it really can help us.

 

If you’re on instagram you can tag @miraclebaby.movie when you post, and if you’re not you can link to this campaign in a tweet, Facebook post, or whatever way we’re social media-ing now.

 

CLOSING WORDS

Being an artist is rough, mentally and physically. And having to maintain a day job, effectively making your true passion the side hustle (though necessary) can feel heavy. Your support, sharing or contributing to this campaign, really does mean the world to us. It makes us feel validated and supported as artists, like our effort is not in vain.

 

We’re all walking this yellow brick road together, and your support makes us realize that it just might lead home.

 

Thank you so much, and we can’t wait to bring #MiracleBaby to you.

<3 Meg & Xander
story_txt: THE FILMCraig & Sara are finally going to be parents and are having their #MiracleBaby – a fact they’ve attracted a lot of attention for from friends and people following their struggle online. However, the stress doesn’t stop for them when at the baby shower for their coming bundle of joy neither Craig or Sara can outrun the judgement, questions and advice of everyone around them. There’s not a person at the party who isn’t curious to know the one thing the parents-to-be haven’t shared: how their struggle to get pregnant finally came to an end. The happy couple insists it was a miracle, but was it? #MiracleBaby is a short film that blends drama, comedy, and genre together to create an unforgettable film about how far we’re willing to go to live a life that looks perfect, and the pressure put on women to have a baby.  WHY NOW(aka a message from the director, Meg Welch) In 2016 I got tired of remaining complacent with how women were treated, and like so many others I decided to stand up. I marched in the Woman’s March. That seed began a current of change and growth in my personal story. But I wasn’t alone. With #MeToo and #TimesUp gaining prominence, the cry for women filmmakers to have a voice in the film industry, and in our society, it’s finally started to feel like the voices of women are being listened to when they speak up, and that people want to hear from them. When I first read #MiracleBaby it felt like it hit the part of my soul that felt so liberated in our current climate: the part that got angry every time I got a stomach bug and a male coworker would ask if I was pregnant, or that was scoffed at when I admitted I didn’t know if I wanted children – even the part of me that found delight in explaining to two elderly women at the Women’s March what “Feminist AF” meant. #MiracleBaby lives in what I truly believe: that a person’s value is not defined by their ability or desire to have a baby, and why they make the choice to start a family or not is their business and no one else’s. What I absolutely love about #MiracleBaby, is that I can tell a story with all of this embedded inside it, but wrapped in a fun coat of quirkiness and genre that will go places a standard drama won’t. And I can’t wait for you to see it.  WHY WE NEED YOUXander and I are a team of micro-budget filmmakers. We both work day jobs to provide for ourselves and our creative endeavors, and there’s only so much we can contribute to the making of our films and still be able to pay our bills. We are putting countless hours into the making of #MiracleBaby, while we work full time jobs, assemble cast and crew, and do all the prep needed for the shoot. We’ve both committed to financially contributing to the film, but what we can scrape together just isn’t enough. We need additional funds so that we can get more equipment (to make a visually and aurally better film), provide food for our team during production, business needs (like insurance), props and decorations (this is set at a baby shower after all) and even transportation and storage of said equipment. There are a lot of moving pieces to making a film, and though our shoots are always humble, we strive to provide the best onset experience we can for our cast and crew, because we value the time and effort they give us and think that providing them with a good meal, comfortable rest areas and nicely maintained, quality equipment is the least we can do as responsible micro-budget filmmakers. In short, the more money we’re able to raise the better #MiracleBaby will look and sound, and it will help our cast and crew remain happy, safe and healthy.  MEET THE FILMMAKERSMeg Welch(Director)Meg has made two no budget features and multiple short films as a writer and director. Working with limited resources has made her a scrappy, adaptable filmmaker who is willing to plunge ahead in order to tell her story. Her joy in filmmaking comes from exploring relationships, genre and the attempt to uncover what truly make us human. Currently, Meg hails from Orange County, California where she lives with her cat Marty (named for Scorsese and McFly) and holds down a day job at a craft company. In addition to filmmaking, Meg is a painter who has had her art in several showcases in LA and Orange County, done multiple art walks, and is an active member of a zoom Shakespeare group that she and her friends began during the pandemic. You can reach Meg on Twitter & Instagram @mrbosslady. Xander Montes(Producer)Originally from Long Beach, California, Xander Montes is an up-and-coming film producer living in Orange County.  Xander is developing the feature film Old Dog, dramedy about a tightly wound man navigating his relationship with his dad and navigating what it could mean to be a father.   He has produced a variety of short films, including Til Death that premiered at the Los Angeles 48 Hour Film Festival (2019).  Xander also holds credits as the 2nd AD position on the 5th season of A Haunting (2012) and a set decorator on a short called A Truth In Silence (2013).  You can find Xander on Instagram at @xfmontes. Helene Kay(Writer)Helene Kay is a comedienne but her IMDB gives off horror movie vibes. She considers herself a triple low threat because of her time doing standup, sketch, and improv. She’s performed all over California mainly in Orange County and Los Angeles, unofficially in awkward social situations. She’s studied writing at Vanguard University, the Groundlings, and UCB. She enjoys working with Megan and Xander and uses writing as a gimmick just to hang out with them.You can find Helene on Instagram at @helenekay. As filmmakers, Meg & Xander value having a team that is diverse and gender inclusive. To meet more of our team please follow our journey on Instagram at @miraclebaby.movie. We will be announcing more of our collaborators there. REWARDSWe think our rewards are pretty rad, and we want to use them to really give you a feeling of being with us on the journey of making #MiracleBaby. Making a film of any length is a process that is incredibly detailed, and something that not everyone knows the nuts and bolts of – so in this digital age we want to be able to share our knowledge and the nature of our craft with you. Our rewards are cumulative, so if you pledge at the $250 level (hint, hint) you would  be able to be an extra on set, zoom with the director, get a signed copy of the script, a download of the film, etc. It’s a really good deal. Like really. I mean, we know we’re movie geeks who love to see how things get made and we really hope you do too. $1 – just good karma: From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for helping bring this short film into the world.$10 – shout out: We’ll shout our thanks from the digital rooftop by thanking you on the #MiracleBaby Instagram. We’ll even follow you (just don’t forget to give us your username). $15 – Shower Invite: Digital wallpaper to grace your laptop or your next zoom meet, and if you give us your instagram username we’ll add you to our close friends & family list so you can see exclusive BTS and other posts as we go through the life of making #MiracleBaby and as we put it out into the world. $25 – The Sonogram: We’re so stoked you want to contribute to the birth of this film that you’ll get to see it before any of the other backers - via a password protected link*. It’ll be doubly fun for you because your name will show up in our credits, thanking you for backing us!*Will be after editing is completed, and may be delayed depending on film festival rules and requirements. $50 – Guest Gifts: Advanced access to the movie not enough? That’s cool, we’ll send you a link to DOWNLOAD* a copy of this bouncing baby so that it can live in your digital library forever.*Will be after editing is completed, and may be delayed depending on film festival rules and requirements. $75 – Shower Treat: Get a signed copy of the script (signed by as many of the creatives as we can wrangle) for your reading, displaying or collecting pleasure. story:
Thank you very much for checking out this campaign. Unfortunately we didn't make enough funds from our last campaign to greenlight the production of this film.   After further analysis and recruiting resources who are willing to donate set locations, we realize this film can be made with a lower budget. Everyone that contributed to the previous campaign will still receive their donation next year. 

Years after the events of Friday the 13th 1958, Sean returns to Camp Crystal Lake with a dark history. Despite warning, he attempts to save his family name by reopening it as Camp Trinity Pointe. He gathers a group of friends to help rebuild the camp and prevent another tragedy from happening, but there is an evil that haunts the camp and is seeking revenge.

Ari Lehman, a prominent singer and songwriter, is most famously known in the horror community for being the first-ever Jason Voorhees! Following his acting debut in Manny's Orphans (1978), he premiered on the first Friday the 13th film, released in 1980. We are excited to have him as a member of our cast and for him to return to Camp Crystal Lake, one last time. 

James Grim: Director | Executive Producer | Writer | Screenplay

James was brought up watching prominent horror franchises such as from Halloween, and Friday The 13th, to name a few. He runs a noteworthy YouTube channel, where he couples his love for horror and films through discussions, reviews, and commentary, and refurbishes masks! In 2019 James released a fan film titled "Halloween: The Blackest Eyes" and in March of 2020, he released a direct sequel titled "Halloween: The Devil's Autumn" and is a producer on the upcoming fan film "The Haddonfield Nightmare". 

Zack Francis: Director | Director Of Photography| Writer | Executive Producer | Editor

Zack is the owner of TallStory Studios, a company he started in his small town of Bristol, Rhode Island. With a growing client list from California, Connecticut, and everywhere in between, he has been brought onto this team for his unique cinematography style, one that he has been developing for quite some time; his ability to utilize visuals has captured audiences, allowing them to immerse themselves in the story. These visuals will help bring a never-before-seen Jason to life! Zack has worked on countless music videos, personal and commissioned short films, and the upcoming Chucky fan film "Charles".

 

Mike Chibante: Composer | Audio Engineer | Graphic Designer

Mike, a self-taught composer, has already worked on countless projects, building a reputable resume, composing and engineering music, and audio for films such as "Charles" and "Halloween Inferno," to name a few.  Thanks to him, "My Special Boy" will have original music! Mike's effortless talent is conveyed flawlessly, creating suspense and atmosphere, inciting fear and emotion in viewers.  

Michael Lawrence: SFX Artist | Executive Producer

Michael is a jack-of-all-trades, singlehandedly crafting the props, sets, and animatronics for the film, "Charles". He is most known for his outstanding special visual FX work and for his commissioned pieces he sells to fans all over the world. His latest project  was being the mastermind that brought you the look of Chucky for the fan film "Charles".

BAT Productions: Producer | Screenplay

BAT Productions was founded in 2018 by Braden Timmons. Since its founding, the company has produced three short films: The Man Outside,  A Halloween Christmas and their newest film, The Haddonfield Nightmare which is in production. BAT Productions is no stranger to Grimnox Productions. Having partnered with them on their most recent film, Halloween: The Devil’s Autumn, they now have the opportunity to bring Jason back to the screen in My Special Boy.  BAT Productions creator, Braden Timmons, is thrilled to be a cast member and a member of the writing and co-producing staff of My Special Boy. 

 

Help us bring Pamela, and her special boy, back to your screen!

It all began with an idea. As a group passionate about horror and filmmaking, we have been preparing for months, putting in countless hours writing, editing, and planning. We are excited to say that we are finally prepared to give you one of the best Friday the 13th Fan Films and make My Special Boy the best it can be.

However, to do that, we need your help. Contributing to this campaign will help finance the best equipment, authentic props, permits to shoot at various locations, and the means to provide our viewers with the highest quality film, in the most efficient and timely manner possible.

We are looking to raise $20,000. It is important to note that while we aim at raising this amount and potentially more, Indiegogo takes a significant percentage of all profits. We cannot thank you enough for your support and for becoming an integral member of the My Special Boy family.

If you don't see a suitable perk for you, another way to help is to spread the word- follow, like, comment, and share our social media with your friends and family! You can find us on Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube.

My Special Boy is in no way afﬁliated to nor represented by Paramount Pictures, New Line Cinema, Platinum Dunes, or any other organization(s) associated with the Friday The 13th franchise.

Due to the unavoidable expenses of independent film production, coupled with a desire to do justice to such a prominent franchise, we are compelled to partner with fans to aid in this film's funding.

This is a non-profit fan film fostered by inspiration, love, and passion for a franchise that is arguably one of the most successful horror franchises to date. Our goal is to recreate the iconic look of Friday The 13th Part II (1981) while giving it our own fresh take.

Thank you so much for taking the time to visit this campaign. Should you have any remaining questions, comments, or concerns about this project, please contact us at myspecialboy2021@gmail.com

story:
Welcome

Welcome to the IndieGoGo campaign for our film 'BLUE'. Thank you so much for taking the time to have a look. Like many projects on this platform, this film has been a labour of love from the beginning, and we are incredibly excited to begin this journey.

In order to bring our story to life, we are looking to crowdfund the majority of our budget and it would be amazing if you would join us on this journey.

BLUE is the story of two fishermen, John Winter, and his son, Charlie, who are struggling to make a living on their small commercial fishing boat. Their relationship is tested and they must both overcome challenges in different ways.

 

Writer's Statement - 'David Smith'

The screenplay has taken me over a year to complete with many, many coffee shops and a lot of sitting by the sea but I can't explain how happy I am with the current draft - and as a writer this is a rare feeling. Writing this screenplay has been by far the most challenging for me to date, not because of structure or length, but mostly because of the characters journey; it needed to be right, to feel right, and it took a while to get there. Character is one of the most important factors to me in a story, and trying to figure out each individual inside your own head, who they are as a person, what's their struggle, passion, personality, arc is all as important as each other, but having that bouncing around in your thoughts and trying to put that down on to paper can be very draining. Anyone who has ever attempted to write a screenplay, book, story or article knows that writing is a discipline, and I myself have a love/hate relationship with writing, and I know some of you will relate to that.

Over a year of writing and we have a finished draft that I am so proud of, and I honestly cannot wait to begin filming and bring to life the most passionate project I've ever worked on.

First and foremost, the most important aspect of any film should be the story, to connect the audience to the characters, to capture an audience and take them on a journey. One powerful way of achieving this is through the visuals.

Through the moodboard below we are portraying the visual style for this film. The entire film will be shot in the Southwest of England and we really want to capture the beauty of this part of the UK. 

As shown in our campaign video, we have produced a range of shots for concept purposes. This should give you not only a general feel for what the film will look like aesthetically, but also giving you an insight into the overall tone and atmosphere of the story.

All of the stills in our moodboard will have a huge impact on the final look of the film. One factor we think is important to the visual identity of this film is the aspect ratio in which the film will be captured. If you look at the above images, they all have one thing in common: They are all shot in an aspect ratio of 1.85:1 or similar. This is important as it will allow to us show more within a single frame and capture more information on screen, compared to a more common aspect ratio of 2.35:1.

Pre-Visualation and Story Boards

For some select scenes we have begun the process of putting together some pre-visualisation sequences. This will help us plan and develop our shot list, blocking of scenes, initial editing decisions and allow us to be as prepared as we can for when we come to principle photography, because, as we know, filming doesn't necessarily always go as smoothly as we hope.  

A look at some of our pre-vis can be seen below:

Below we have designed a location moodboard using real locations we would like to use for the film. These are all locations situated in the South West of England, including locations in Dorset, Devon, Somerset and Cornwall. Some of these locations have been confirmed, others are still pending due to dates, permissions, finances etc.

Setting

The main backdrop for our film will be the beautiful coastal fishing town of 'Cadgwith Cove', located in the Southwest of England. This small, quaint, character-filled town is really the perfect setting to tell our story.

 

Below there are some images and videos to introduce you to this beautiful place:

Our crew have a range of industry experience and each one brings value to the production. From the director, to the concept artist, every individual involved has the passion and drive for this story and cannot wait for it to be transferred to the big screen.

In 2019 we produced our very first feature film which was made for only £7,000, this film was a massive achievement for all of us and is called 'Bear', which can be found on Amazon Prime and has over one million minutes streamed to date.

We premiered the film in late 2019 at a multiplex cinema to a packed out auditorium:

 

Roles and Responsibilities

Casting

We are in the midst of compiling our cast together, in total there are 12 principle characters within this film, main and supporting roles. The story follows our two main protagonists John, and his son, Charlie.

John Winter - Paul Breen

Paul is a wonderfully talented actor, classically trained at drama school and early on in his career was lucky enough to work around the country touring multiple theatre productions. He also has experience within Film and TV. This is where I met Paul and we then went onto make a feature film together, with Paul in the main role. So pleased and engrossed in his performance I actually wrote ‘Blue’ with Paul in mind to play the main protagonist, John. After we shot some test footage it was even clearer to me that Paul was the perfect man for the job. I’m thrilled and excited to be working with him again and cannot wait for you to see what he will bring to this new, challenging role. If this wasn’t challenging enough Paul is also taking on the role as one of our producers, so not only is he giving his all on screen, but off screen also.

In total we are asking for £5,000. This will be the minimum we would need to produce this film.

This money will help cover the costs of:

- Location Rentals - Some locations will be sourced locally and will be given to us for free (Friends/Family etc), but there are multiple locations which require a fee e.g. Protagonists House, Town Hall, Local Pub, Market Stall etc.

- Equipment Rental - Lenses, Rigs, Lights and Sound Equipment.

- Travel and Accommodation - Majority of shoots will be local but there are two locations that will require travel and accommodation, one of these we will be staying at our location.

- Food and Services - Everyone knows that a hungry crew is an unhappy crew, so we do intend to provide craft services on the majority of our shoots.

- Costumes - There are some specialist costumes for this film that will need to be bought/hired.

- Rental of Boat - We will be hiring a small fishing boat for the necessary scenes. We have already found a boat which we think is perfect and we have permission from the owner, and we are now just waiting for dates and finance until we can commit (this boat can be seen in our test footage).

As a thank you for your donation/pledge, there are a variety of different rewards available to you. This could be a copy of the screenplay, a T-Shirt, a Screen Credit and more! Have a look below for a summary of all the rewards:

Thank You!

Once again, thank you so much for taking the time to look at our IndieGoGo campaign. We are super excited to begin filming this story and bringing it to life. We hope that you will join us!

Here we go!

 

Risks and challenges

As with any project that is being made on a lower budget there will be added/more risks. £5,000 is a very modest budget for what we are trying to achieve, but in the hope of putting some reservations at ease our last film was a feature film and was made for £7,000, we were very proud of the film we had created and is available on Amazon Prime and we have had over one million minutes streamed to date. As well as the funds we raise from crowdfunding we will be putting as much as we can of our own finances to help towards the costs of production. Another huge risk during these times is the ongoing Covid 19 pandemic, yes we are moving in the right direction but as we plan to begin filming January/February there is always going to be an uncertainty regarding regulations and restrictions. To hopefully help us in the event of any restrictions being placed we have some contingency locations that are available to us, these locations being a closer distance to us.
story_txt:
Welcome
Welcome to the IndieGoGo campaign for our film 'BLUE'. Thank you so much for taking the time to have a look. Like many projects on this platform, this film has been a labour of love from the beginning, and we are incredibly excited to begin this journey.
In order to bring our story to life, we are looking to crowdfund the majority of our budget and it would be amazing if you would join us on this journey.

BLUE is the story of two fishermen, John Winter, and his son, Charlie, who are struggling to make a living on their small commercial fishing boat. Their relationship is tested and they must both overcome challenges in different ways.

 
Writer's Statement - 'David Smith'
The screenplay has taken me over a year to complete with many, many coffee shops and a lot of sitting by the sea but I can't explain how happy I am with the current draft - and as a writer this is a rare feeling. Writing this screenplay has been by far the most challenging for me to date, not because of structure or length, but mostly because of the characters journey; it needed to be right, to feel right, and it took a while to get there. Character is one of the most important factors to me in a story, and trying to figure out each individual inside your own head, who they are as a person, what's their struggle, passion, personality, arc is all as important as each other, but having that bouncing around in your thoughts and trying to put that down on to paper can be very draining. Anyone who has ever attempted to write a screenplay, book, story or article knows that writing is a discipline, and I myself have a love/hate relationship with writing, and I know some of you will relate to that.
Over a year of writing and we have a finished draft that I am so proud of, and I honestly cannot wait to begin filming and bring to life the most passionate project I've ever worked on.


First and foremost, the most important aspect of any film should be the story, to connect the audience to the characters, to capture an audience and take them on a journey. One powerful way of achieving this is through the visuals.
Through the moodboard below we are portraying the visual style for this film. The entire film will be shot in the Southwest of England and we really want to capture the beauty of this part of the UK. 

As shown in our campaign video, we have produced a range of shots for concept purposes. This should give you not only a general feel for what the film will look like aesthetically, but also giving you an insight into the overall tone and atmosphere of the story.



All of the stills in our moodboard will have a huge impact on the final look of the film. One factor we think is important to the visual identity of this film is the aspect ratio in which the film will be captured. If you look at the above images, they all have one thing in common: They are all shot in an aspect ratio of 1.85:1 or similar. This is important as it will allow to us show more within a single frame and capture more information on screen, compared to a more common aspect ratio of 2.35:1.

Pre-Visualation and Story Boards
For some select scenes we have begun the process of putting together some pre-visualisation sequences. This will help us plan and develop our shot list, blocking of scenes, initial editing decisions and allow us to be as prepared as we can for when we come to principle photography, because, as we know, filming doesn't necessarily always go as smoothly as we hope.  
A look at some of our pre-vis can be seen below:




Below we have designed a location moodboard using real locations we would like to use for the film. These are all locations situated in the South West of England, including locations in Dorset, Devon, Somerset and Cornwall. Some of these locations have been confirmed, others are still pending due to dates, permissions, finances etc.

story:
VAMP NITE TRAILER

 
 

OUR VAMPIRE STORY

Action - Comedy - Horror - Short film

Our Vampire Amila was imprisoned over a century ago by a secret sect of vampire hunting priests.  Only to be rediscovered and shipped to New York. Her wait is finally over, and she is ready to feed again. Mayhem ensues as warehouse workers unwittingly resurrect our beautiful vampire, back from the dead. Becoming her prey, giving her a lifeline of fresh blood. Their only hope is to trap her in the warehouse. The only one who can do it is the last vampire-hunting priest,  with his sidekick Nun and the not so helpful manager of the warehouse. But is it too late? If Amalia escapes the warehouse, all of New York City will become her feeding ground. This action-packed new film directed by 4 time SAG Award Nominee stuntman Roberto Lopez proves nothing more vicious than the wrath of a woman scorned.  Especially when she's a beautiful black & century-old hungry vampire with a new world to discover.
 
 

OUR GOAL

Our goal of $20,000 will make our hard work and dreams come true. Your support will allow us to complete post-production on our film and allow us to release it on October 31, 2021, as intended. 

We are so excited about this film and can't wait for you to see the finished product. 

OUR STRETCH GOAL

Any amount over our initial target goal will be used to enhance our in-person and online Premiere to the utmost so that the experience is an unforgettable one. The Director would love to continue the Vamp Nite storyline, and additional funds will be used to create the next installment if possible. 

 

BUDGET

Your contribution will go towards color correction, sound design, computer-generated special effects, music score, and opening & end credit design.

We are almost certain you will be incredibly impressed with the quality of our work. 

 

RISKS

The great news is that there really is no risk to you because our film is 2/3 done. For those of you who may not be familiar with the actual process of making a film, here's the thick of it: film production is basically broken down into three parts; Pre-Production, where we make all the necessary preparations before the start of filming; Production, where we actually film all the scenes in the script; and Post-Production, where we take everything filmed and edit it, color it, design the sound, add SFX if any, add the music score, and finally add the opening & ending credits. 

Since we've successfully completed the Pre-Production, Production, and editing portion of Post-Production, we are practically steps away from completing Post-Production and having a finished product. 

In many instances with crowd-funding, you get films that are in the early stages of Pre-Production and there is a very high risk that the film will ever be made, let alone premiered. This is totally not the case with us. Our film is almost completed and Will Premiere on October 31st, 2021. What remains to be seen is if we will crawl across the finish line or run across? With your help, we will run across the finish line and enjoy a great Premiere alongside you.

 

OUR CAST

Our team in front of the camera,  behind the camera, and in post-production is made up of seasoned veterans of the film industry.  

Roberto Lopez:  Writer/director/actor is a seasoned stunt coordinator and is well known for his work on OLD, GLASS, and SPLIT the movies.  He is also very proud to have been the stunt coordinator for 3 seasons on the sketch comedy show CHAPPELLE'S SHOW, starring Dave Chappelle.  As a performer, you might have seen him on shows like GOTHAM, BLUE BLOODS, DAREDEVIL, HAPPY, and most recently on Netflix MONSTER. 

 

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0520189
 
 
 

Damali Ross:  Born in Guyana, South America. Her family moved her to NYC when she was young and there she became a competitive USAG gymnast, placing 3rd at the 2005 State Championships. She graduated from Oswego University with a BA in Fine Arts but her passion was to become a professional stunt performer. She was cast in Adam Sandler and Allen Covert while working on the production named  THE WEEK OF. Later that year she working on ‘BlacKkKlansman’. Make sure to check her out starring in the next episode of ‘Power Rangers Unworthy’ now streaming.

   
       
 

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9405151

 

 

Rev. Dr. Marcos Antonio Miranda: Marcos Antonio Miranda is a 30 year veteran of the Screen Actors Guild and starred in the award-winning film 'DESTINATION UNKNOWN' opposite Lisa Vidal and Yancey Arias, where he played a gypsy car driver trying to survive on the tough streets of Queens, New York. He also starred in Larry Fessenden's award-winning film 'HABIT' and in the Spanish language, Caribbean blockbuster 'IN SERCH OF A DREAM' opposite Luna Lauren Velez, Kamar de Los Reyes, and Elvis Nolasco. As a director, his credits include Big Pun: Still Not a Player, Big Pun Live, Inside Hip-Hop, BLAZIN', and a host of music videos.

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1257937

 

Kimmy Suzuki: Kimmy Suzuki was born in Japan. She's a veteran actress and stunt performer. She is known for her work as Luci Lui stunt-double on ELEMENTARY TV show,  HAPPY, HARLEM, FBI, BLUE BLOODS,  BLACKLIST, PRODIGAL SON, CATFIGHT, and TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES.

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0840617

 

Luciano Acuna Jr.: is a parkour/stuntman/actor from Brooklyn, New York. He is known for his work on films The GREATEST SHOWMAN, TRACERS,  as well as TV show  HAPPY, THE GOOD COP, HUNTERS, FBI, DECEPTION, GOTHAM, BLUE BLOODS, and AMERICAN NINJA WARRIOR.

     

 https://www.imdb.com/name/nm5729373

 

Kareem Walkes: International Saxophonist also known as "Lil' Maceo" is quickly becoming one of contemporary jazz’s most thrilling and emotive performers and continues to stand out and push boundaries as a composer and performer. He’s becoming the go-to sax-man for artists like JT Taylor (Kool & The Gang) Cyril Neville (The Meters), Li'nard's Many Moods (Patti Labelle), and Blues Hall Of Famer Slam Allen (James Cotton). Kareem's playing, though inspired by Maceo Parker and Candy Dulfer, among others, displays his own fresh ideas and distinctive tone. Born and raised in Queens New York, home to many Jazz legends like Louis Armstrong, Count Basie to name a few, Kareem has been breathing powerful, soulful, raw energy into his saxophone since the age of 18.

https://www.instagram.com/lilmaceofunk

 

Anthony Mecca: Raised in West Chester, PA. Based in NYC. He is known for his stunt work on countless TV shows and movies WEST SIDE STORY, CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG, HOLLOWEEN KILLS, VAMPIRES VS THE BRONX, AND THE IRISHMAN.  He can also be seen on numerous tv shows, THE MARVELOUS MRS. MAISEL, LAW & ORDER SVU, GODFATHER OF HARLEM, HAPPY, and THE EQUALIZER, just to name a few. 

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2180726

 

Donna Benitez: Making her acting debut on Vamp Nite as the sassy executive secretary. She runs a successful plumbing business while raising three kids and now has four wonderful grandchildren.

https://www.instagram.com/lalafabulous16

 

IMPACT

With your help, we can complete VAMP NITE without having to cut corners. This means we will Premiere a high-quality project. This also means that every one of you can take a 'short' break from all the stressors of a year and a half of dealing with the pandemic, sit back, grab the popcorn and a drink and enjoy our vampire film full of comedy, special effects and the coolest action around.

Some of you who choose to may even enjoy the additional perks we offer and even get a chance to hang out with the cast & crew at the New York City Premiere. 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't contribute, you can still help by getting the word out to your friends and via your social networks. Like the videos, comment and share.  Please remember and remind others to use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Grimnox Productions is thrilled to launch its first campaign!

We are excited to make a Friday The 13th film, and bringing "Sack Head Jason" is something we've wanted to do for quite some time!  But that's not all. Fans will have "Hockey Mask Jason" as well. 

My Special Boy takes place after the events of the first film. This will be a full-length feature film that will pay homage to some of the best elements of the franchise that we all know and love, while simultaneously maintaining its originality and establishing its own identity. 

Ari Lehman, a prominent singer and songwriter, is most famously known in the horror community for being the first-ever Jason Voorhees! Following his acting debut in Manny's Orphans (1978), he premiered on the first Friday the 13th film, released in 1980. We are excited to have him as a member of our cast and for him to return to Camp Crystal Lake, one last time. 

James Grim: Director | Executive Producer | Writer | Screenwriter

James was brought up watching prominent horror franchises such as from Halloween, and Friday The 13th, to name a few. He runs a noteworthy YouTube channel, where he couples his love for horror and films through discussions, reviews, and commentary, and refurbishes masks! In 2019 James released a fan film titled Halloween: The Blackest Eyes and in March of 2020, he released a direct sequel titled Halloween: The Devil's Autumn

Zack Francis: Director | Director Of Photography| Writer | Executive Producer | Editor

Zack is the owner of TallStory Studios, a company he started in his small town of Bristol, Rhode Island. With a growing client list from California, Connecticut, and everywhere in between, he has been brought onto this team for his unique cinematography style, one that he has been developing for quite some time; his ability to utilize visuals has captured audiences, allowing them to immerse themselves in the story. These visuals will help bring a never-before-seen Jason to life! Zack has worked on countless music videos, personal and commissioned short films, and the upcoming Chucky fan film "Charles."

Morgan Silva: PR and Marketing Manager | Administrative Assistant

Morgan has been freelance writing for well over five years, creating a myriad of pieces ranging from opinion editorials she has published in New York Times, her academic analytic papers she co-writes with her mentor from St. Andrews College in England, to her commissioned pieces published in pop culture publications. She is now modifying her career, gearing towards entertainment and film marketing and personal relations; this year alone, she has run three film campaigns, with many projects in the works. 

 

Chad Sumner: Writer | Associate Producer | Actor

Chad recounts growing up loving all things horror- from B movies to mainstream. Slashers are his favorites types of horror, along with classics such as Friday The 13th, Halloween, A Nightmare On Elm Street, and Scream. As the actor portraying Jason in My Special Boy, he hopes to do the role justice, particularly channeling his favorite Jasons such as Kane Hodder, Ted White, Richard Brooker, and Derek Mears.  

Mike Chibante: Composer | Audio Engineer 

Mike, a self-taught composer, has already worked on countless projects, building a reputable resume, composing and engineering music, and audio for films such as "Charles" and "Halloween Inferno," to name a few.  Thanks to him, "My Special Boy" will have original music! Mike's effortless talent is conveyed flawlessly, creating suspense and atmosphere, inciting fear and emotion in viewers.  

Michael Lawrence: SFX Artist | Executive Producer

Michael is a jack-of-all-trades, singlehandedly crafting the props, sets, and animatronics for the film, "Charles". He is most known for his outstanding special visual FX work and for his commissioned pieces he sells to fans all over the world. His latest project  was being the mastermind that brought you the look of Chucky for the fan film "Charles."

BAT Productions: Producer | Screenplay

BAT Productions was founded in 2018 by Braden Timmons. Since its founding, the company has produced three short films: The Man Outside,  A Halloween Christmas and their newest film, Halloween: Haddonfield Nightmare.  Their first feature film, Haddonfield Nightmare is set to begin filming this fall, projecting a Fall 2021 release. BAT Productions is no stranger to Grimnox Productions. Having partnered with them on their most recent film, Halloween: The Devil’s Autumn, they now have the opportunity to bring Jason back to the screen in My Special Boy.  BAT Productions creator, Braden Timmons, is thrilled to be a cast member and a member of the writing and co-producing staff of My Special Boy. 

Help us bring Pamela, and her special boy, back to your screen!

It all began with an idea. As a group passionate about horror and filmmaking, we have been preparing for months, putting in countless hours writing, editing, and planning. We are excited to say that we are finally prepared to give you one of the best Friday the 13th Fan Films and make My Special Boy the best it can be.

However, to do that, we need your help. Contributing to this campaign will help finance the best equipment, authentic props, permits to shoot at various locations, and the means to provide our viewers with the highest quality film, in the most efficient and timely manner possible.

We are looking to raise $50,000. It is important to note that while we aim at raising this amount and potentially more, Indiegogo takes a significant percentage of all profits. We cannot thank you enough for your support and for becoming an integral member of the My Special Boy family.

If you don't see a suitable perk for you, we encourage you to visit our Patreon. Patreon allows any amount to be donated. While donations are extremely appreciated and encouraged, they aren't required! Another way to help is to spread the word- follow, like, comment, and share our social media with your friends and family! You can find us on Facebook, Instagram, and Youtube.

My Special Boy is in no way afﬁliated to nor represented by Paramount Pictures, New Line Cinema, Platinum Dunes, or any other organization(s) associated with the Friday The 13th franchise.

Due to the unavoidable expenses of independent film production, coupled with a desire to do justice to such a prominent franchise, we are compelled to partner with fans to aid in this film's funding.

This is a non-profit fan film fostered by inspiration, love, and passion for a franchise that is arguably one of the most successful horror franchises to date. Our goal is to recreate the iconic look of Friday The 13th Part II (1981) while giving it our original spin.

Thank you so much for taking the time to visit this campaign. Should you have any remaining questions, comments, or concerns about this project, please contact us at myspecialboy2021@gmail.com
story_txt: Grimnox Productions is thrilled to launch its first campaign!We are excited to make a Friday The 13th film, and bringing "Sack Head Jason" is something we've wanted to do for quite some time!  But that's not all. Fans will have "Hockey Mask Jason" as well. My Special Boy takes place after the events of the first film. This will be a full-length feature film that will pay homage to some of the best elements of the franchise that we all know and love, while simultaneously maintaining its originality and establishing its own identity. Ari Lehman, a prominent singer and songwriter, is most famously known in the horror community for being the first-ever Jason Voorhees! Following his acting debut in Manny's Orphans (1978), he premiered on the first Friday the 13th film, released in 1980. We are excited to have him as a member of our cast and for him to return to Camp Crystal Lake, one last time. James Grim: Director | Executive Producer | Writer | ScreenwriterJames was brought up watching prominent horror franchises such as from Halloween, and Friday The 13th, to name a few. He runs a noteworthy YouTube channel, where he couples his love for horror and films through discussions, reviews, and commentary, and refurbishes masks! In 2019 James released a fan film titled Halloween: The Blackest Eyes and in March of 2020, he released a direct sequel titled Halloween: The Devil's AutumnZack Francis: Director | Director Of Photography| Writer | Executive Producer | EditorZack is the owner of TallStory Studios, a company he started in his small town of Bristol, Rhode Island. With a growing client list from California, Connecticut, and everywhere in between, he has been brought onto this team for his unique cinematography style, one that he has been developing for quite some time; his ability to utilize visuals has captured audiences, allowing them to immerse themselves in the story. These visuals will help bring a never-before-seen Jason to life! Zack has worked on countless music videos, personal and commissioned short films, and the upcoming Chucky fan film "Charles."Morgan Silva: PR and Marketing Manager | Administrative AssistantMorgan has been freelance writing for well over five years, creating a myriad of pieces ranging from opinion editorials she has published in New York Times, her academic analytic papers she co-writes with her mentor from St. Andrews College in England, to her commissioned pieces published in pop culture publications. She is now modifying her career, gearing towards entertainment and film marketing and personal relations; this year alone, she has run three film campaigns, with many projects in the works.  Chad Sumner: Writer | Associate Producer | ActorChad recounts growing up loving all things horror- from B movies to mainstream. Slashers are his favorites types of horror, along with classics such as Friday The 13th, Halloween, A Nightmare On Elm Street, and Scream.
