story:
Short Summary

Renee's a quick witted Law Student, with a taste for power, and nobody can stand in the way of her goals. Her desire for absolute power and desperation, leads her to create a devious plan, she may not be witty enough to pull off. Renee always must have the one up, but at what cost....

We are MusaMajicTV; a digital creative agency. Over the past half decade we've worked to convey black realities. From our short films to music videos to our signature HIGH TASTE events. Each body of work is an experience UNMATCHED. We strive to create innovative content, that leaves our audience not only fulfilled but provides them with a look into what we believe is the future. 

 Our time to elevate is now and YOU are a vital part of that journey.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is a modest $10,000. This total will cover:

  • Props (Whips, Law school books,  and nipple clamps) ,
  • Equipment rentals (lenses, lights. etc)
  • Location Rentals
  • Vehicle rental
  • Crew Salaries: Strong Crews help make excellent art! 
  • Lunch: We want to feed our PEOPLE. (Somewhere in between Lobster and Pizza)

YOU GET A PERK! YOU GET A PERK! YOU GET A PERK!

  • Executive Producer Credit
  • Signed Movie Poster
  • Sugar Daddy Stickers
  • Early Access to BTS video 
  • Exclusive on set access during filming 

The Impact

Our team of creators has spent the last couple of years creating innovative visual content and we want to take our crafts to the NEXT level. Your participation will help be an important part of not only empowering creators but inspiring them to create more. 

Reaching our goal will also provide further hands on experience for the young professionals who we work tirelessly to create opportunities for. 

Check our TRACK RECORD; THIS IS WHAT WE DO and we will only get BIGGER AND BETTER. Wouldn't you love to be apart of this!?

Risks & Challenges

When filmmaking anything can and will happen. So we have to be prepared for every bump in the road. As we know COVID is a present threat to the health and safety to communities around the world.

Our team is dedicated to making sure health and safety is our #1 priority in anything we do. 

  • We are requiring all cast and crew be tested prior to the first day of filming.
  • We are masked required production. 
  • Our crew has been working with limited resources for so long, that being resourceful is second nature. So we are always ready to adjust in real time as we deal with the bumps and hiccups.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share our campaign FAR AND WIDE. Tell your Mommas, Daddys, Sugar Daddys. 
  • Check out or social media pages and follow them for more information.

story:
Little Spark Films started as a team to make music videos. Over the past five years, we've evolved into a small production company with focus on music videos, yes, but our heart in the horror community, particularly focusing on Hellraiser and branching into the Clive Barker Universe. We met Pyramid Gallery, a purveyor of configuration boxes about two years ago and offered to make a video for his Lament Configuration. Since then, we've made videos for the Lament and Lost Configurations as well as the Servants Configuration, a box designed by ConfigurationBoxes.com for Paul Kane's crossover novel, Sherlock Holmes and the Servants of Hell.

Paul Kane enjoyed the "book trailer" as deemed by CliveBarkerPodcast, and contacted us to check out a script he had based on one of his short stories, "The Torturer." He is credited as "...the resident Hellraiser expert" by Clive Barker, and is an internationally published author with short stories and novels spanning horror and fantasy.

We optioned the script, signed on fabulous actors, filmed over five days in Dallas, and now we're to post production.

Donations will go to paying for the audio mixing/mastering, music, editing, visual effects, promotional art, and marketing material.

 Donating to this campaign opens up Paul Kane's writing to a wider audience as well as showcasing independent art, music, and film. 

The Torturer brings a new spin to guilt, grieving, and suffering and we're ready to share this compelling story with you.

PERKS! The Good Stuff

$1 Social Media Shout out

$5 - Free Digital copy of film (after festival run)

$10 - Autographed promo card (Includes $5 perk)

$25- Torturer Movie patch (Includes $5)

$50- A thank you in the credits of the film for making it possible. (Includes $5)

$75- A signed and numbered mini movie poster from our director! Only 100 made!! (Includes $5)

$100- A random but fun piece of used movie background/prop used in the film. Own a piece of the movie you helped make. As well as a BIG thank you in the films credits. Only 25 available! (Includes $5)

$200- Worn clothing/costume from the film signed by the actor and director. Only 5 available!(Includes $5)

$500- Early sneak peek at the film private viewing party in DFW at undisclosed location. Only 5 available. (Includes $5)

$1000- Producer credit, signed script, limited edition poster, private viewing party, prop from movie. Only 3 available!! (Includes $5, $100, $500)

Closing Statement

We pride ourselves on finishing projects and making a comfortable environment for our cast and crew. From our 48 film race submissions (one of which is on TromaNow!) to our music video sets, we organize, organize, organize, communicate, and make sure everyone is fed and happy. We want to make a terrifying, brutal short film with a story that punches you in the gut and your donations will help finish it.

Share, share, share! Let's make this movie!

story:
Help us make an 80's teen sci-fi movie!

////FINAL STRETCH GOAL $55K////

We think it's totally rad that you're considering being a part of our Final Stretch Campaign!  We're so close to reaching our production budget and have 70% raised already! With your help, we can raise the remaining 30% to begin this tubular production of our 80's movie in the Fall! 

LOGLINE: A nerdy 14-year-old boy suddenly gets the popularity he’s always wanted when a deceitful Artificial Intelligence makes him a social media sensation.

SYNOPSIS: In an alternate 1980’s world, a 14-year-old computer nerd named Beckett O’Connell, is on a quest for popularity by becoming the next MeTubular™ sensation. With many failed attempts to create an audience with his video channel, Beckett becomes more and more desperate for the fame he seeks. 

One weekend, when Beckett’s parents go out of town and leave him and his older sister Maddie alone for the first time, Beckett and his best friend Jay, tirelessly search the web for answers. Just when they’re about to give up hope, Beckett accidentally stumbles across a site called Viral University and an Artificial Intelligence by the name of Mr. Viral who promises all the likes and views Beckett could ever want. 

Upon arriving to school the next day, Beckett finds out that his latest video has more than one million views. Beckett is finally becoming the Internet star he’s always wanted to be and rapidly gaining popularity among his peers. But he soon finds out that fame comes at a great cost and Mr. Viral is playing him like a puppet to win his soul. 

Just as Beckett is about to lose the friendships of those he cares for the most, he discovers Mr. Viral’s plan and realizes he is the one behind all the most famous MeTubular™ kid phenom influencers. With his wit, and with extreme caution, Beckett tries to figure out how to stop and destroy Mr. Viral and seeks out help from an underground (once famous) gamer by the name of “Samurai.” With the strategy of Samurai and his own tech intelligence, Beckett and his friends end up in an epic battle with Mr. Viral and his other Internet puppets to save his friends and ultimately win his soul back.

////CHECK OUT OUR TEASER////

 

////THE PERKS////

CHECK OUT SOME OF OUR FAVORITE 80'S MOVIES FOR THE PERK PACKAGES!

DID YOU KNOW that the movie TRON was inspired by the Atari game PONG? Also to inspire the actors, arcade games were placed on the production sets and could be played during downtime.

DID YOU KNOW that other actors like Judd Nelson and Emilio Estevez were in contention for the role of Billy Peltzer? But apparently Zach Galligan and Phoebe Cates had such great chemistry it landed Galligan the role with Spielberg. 

DID YOU KNOW that the idea for The Last Starfighter came when writer Jonathan R. Betuel saw a boy playing a video game at an arcade one day around the same time he'd been reading "The Once and Future King" by T.H. White? Yeah, the idea was about a video game being like the sword in the stone and a boy had the highest score ever in the video game would send out a ripple effect across the universe.

DID YOU KNOW that the high school used for exterior shots for Weird Science was the same one used for Sixteen Candles? Yeah, they both used the same fictional town name "Shermer, Illinois" as well. 

DID YOU KNOW that License to Drive was the second film in the 80's to feature the two Corey's? Actually neither Corey Haim or Corey Feldman had their license yet. 

*2 VIP Passes to Premiere does not include travel or lodging. 

DID YOU KNOW to keep the production of E.T. hush hush while shooting, they called the production, "A Boy's Life?"

DID YOU KNOW that Alan Ruck and Matthew Broderick previously acted together in the Broadway production of Biloxi Blues? Cameron's Mr. Peterson voice was an in-joke imitation of their former director Gene Saks. 

DID YOU KNOW that the original time machine for Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure was going to be a 1969 Chevy Van? But the filmmakers didn't want people to think they were ripping off Back to the Future. 

DID YOU KNOW that the one studio executive wanted to rename Back to the Future, "Space Man from Pluto?" Apparently Spielberg sent a letter to the exec saying, "Thanks for the hilarious memo, we all got a big laugh out of it!" And that was the end of that. 

DID YOU KNOW  that apparently One-Eyed Willy's skull was an actual human skull? Rumor has it the cast list for the film listed the skeleton of One-Eyed Willy was a man called Raul Woo, who died from lead poisoning.

 

////GOING VIRAL PROMO POSTER////

////OFFICIAL LOGO HAT & T-SHIRT ////

 

Thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign. Please consider helping us make this movie a reality by contributing and sharing with family and friends. We need your support! Also, check out our rad posts on Instagram and Facebook @goingviralmovie 

Please feel free to reach out and DM us here or on Instagram/Facebook @goingviralmovie with any questions or concerns. As well as you can sign up to our email list at goingviralmovie.com

////THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT AND KEEPING THE 80'S ALIVE!////

© 2021 Going Viral Movie, LLC

story:
The Story

Roger is the worst husband. Ever. Best friends Beverly and Suzette decide the most logical solution is that, well, Roger must die.

Hello and thank you for dropping by our indiegogo campaign!  Roger Must Die tells the story of a scorned wife who goes to desperate measures to regain control of her life. We believe in the strength of women. Our protagonist, Beverly, must find her inner strength to raise herself out of her circumstance. While we don't condone murder, we do believe in raising women up, which is why we are attempting to make this film with an entirely female crew. 

The Creators

Filmmakers

Allison Shrum - Writer, Director

Fallon Gyurko - Producer, Costume Design

Kelsey Christian - Producer, Music Supervision, 1st AD

Lindsey Akers - Producer, Talent

Sara de la Haya - Producer, Talent

Emileigh Potter - Director of Photography

Natalie Slone - Sound Mixer

Audrey Willis - Key Hair and Makeup, SFX Makeup

Ashley Hammelman - Assistant Hair and Makeup

Cast

Beverly - Lindsey Akers

Suzette - Sara de la Haya

Roger - Taylor Novak

Keith - Barron Boedecker

Your Impact

As with any film, there are challenges and expenses that must be met. We believe in compensating artists for their work, and a large portion of our budget will be allocated to paying our fabulous female crew including cinematographer, sound mixer, editor and more. We also need funds to feed our cast and crew while on set. 

The story is set in a 70's inspired world and we need the proper locations, cars, and clothing in order to create this authentic environment. No great horror movie is complete without blood and we require excellent special effects make up to properly pull off the genre.

Lastly, we want people to see our film and reserve a portion of the budget for festival submissions. We need at least $3,000 to make this incredible story and sincerely appreciate any amount that you can give. 

The Perks

We are SO grateful for your contribution and can't wait to reward you with several perk levels!

$1 - Fan: We'll take your dollar! Every one counts!

$5 - Best Friend: Thanks for being such a good friend! Donors at this level will get a shoutout from the official Roger Must Die instagram account! 

$25 - Party Animal: 100 of you will receive a ticket to a private premier with the cast and crew! Time and location tbd. Event will take place in Nashville and you are responsible for your own transportation. You rock! 

$50 - Fashionista: Our incredible costume designer, Fallon Gyurko, has designed a gorgeous custom scarf to commemorate Roger Must Die. Only 30 of these beauties exist and you need it. 

$100 - Executive Producer: Thank you for this incredible donation! 5 generous donors at this level will receive Executive Producer credit in the film credits and IMDB page. 

Give Any Amount: If none of these levels fit your budget but you still want to give, we are honored to take any amount. 

If you can't donate at this time, please consider sharing our campaign with your friends and family to help spread the word! Thank you so much for your support of women in film and specifically of Roger Must Die.

story:
UPDATE JULY 18 2020:

The film is completed and had its World Premiere screening at the Cinequest Film Festival in March 2020 (just days before covid-19 shut everything down)! On July 17th, it was announced via Entertainment Weekly that Shifter has been acquire for distribution by The Horror Collective for release on August 6th!!! 

 

Who Are We?

Shifter is the latest feature film from Planet Thunder Productions, which is made up of collaborators Jacob Leighton Burns, Vinnie Hogan, and Zachary Burns.

Our previous feature film, Electric Nostalgia premiered in 2016 and screened in cities all across the US. Following the success of Electric Nostalgia, which is now available on DVD/BluRay/Amazon Prime, we are using that momentum to jumpstart our next creative endeavor that we feel will be even bigger and better than the last one. 

The Cast

Shifter: Meet the Cast from Planet Thunder Productions on Vimeo.

Nicole Fancher in the lead role as Theresa Chaney

Josh Bonzie as Blake Douglass

and Paul T. Taylor as Ed Campbell

 

What We Need

WE CAN’T DO THIS ALONE! The film won't get made without the aid of a talented cast and crew. Most of what we raise will pay for their wages and keep them fed! Their talent is incredibly valuable, and we want to make sure that they are taken care of and that the shoot is worth their time, energy, and talent. 

(pictured, the cast and crew of MONO: Danger Boy, produced by Planet Thunder Productions)

The rest of the funds will be spread across a variety of departments: Production Design, Locations, Hair & Make Up, Wardrobe, Camera, Sound, Grip/Electric, Visual Effects, Production, Production Insurance and more. Being a horror film, all of these departments are crucial to the success of the project. The world we create has to be visually intriguing, while also feeling real, believable and lived in. With your help, we can create an environment that makes what exists on screen, feel like it could exist in reality.

What's In It For You?

Those that contribute will gain access to a wide variety of awesome perks*! Everything from shout outs, credits in the film, t-shirts, featured extra opportunities, a seat at the VIP screening, and many more!

Shifter doesn't get made without the generous contributions from people like you, and we want to return the favor by offering a wide variety of perks for your help!

Perk Highlights 

  • Official Shifter Mug
  • Official Shifter Film Crew T-Shirt
  • Shifter Logo Enamel Pin
  • Shifter Concept Art Print autographed by Jerry Bennett
  • Autographed Shifter Script
  • Featured Extra Role in Shifter

Disclaimer: Planet Thunder Productions strives to produce thoughtful, imaginative, and memorable films of any length or genre in an environment that encourages and respects creativity. This includes making sure our cast, crew, supporters, and contributors feel safe. Planet Thunder will not tolerate harassment in any form. If someone engages in any form of harassment, Planet Thunder has a zero tolerance policy and may take any action they deem appropriate, including warning the offender or revoking perk privileges without refund. 

*A shipping charge will be added during checkout

The Impact

As collaborators, we have worked on dozens of short films and multiple feature films that have screened in a variety of film festivals across the country to great success. Our previous feature film, Electric Nostalgia, premiered to sold out audiences and won Best Oklahoma Feature Film at the deadCenter Film Festival. It went on to fill theaters at the Austin Film Festival, the Boston Sci-Fi Film Festival, Idyllwild Festival of Cinema, Orlando Film Festival and more, picking up more nominations and awards along the way, including Best Director at the Twisted Horror Film Festival. 

(pictured: Electric Nostalgia cast and crew at the 2016 Austin Film Festival)

Thanks to Electric Nostalgia, we have built up a generous amount of resources and contacts over the years. We expanded our base and it continues to grow every day. Now that we know what is possible, we have a strategy and plan to help carry our next film even farther, while staying true to our mission and core values as filmmakers and storytellers. 

Why Shifter?

We are committed to creating original, memorable stories, that are not only exciting and thrilling, but also thought provoking. 

When I think about Time Travel films, three standard approaches come to mind:

  1. The Fish-Out-Of-Water approach: A character is sent backwards or forwards in time and they have to learn how to fit in that time period (ex: Time After Time, The Time Machine)
  2. Paradox/Puzzle box/Mindtrip: A film that's usually trippy and weird and focuses it's attention on the plot mechanics and paradoxes created through time travel. The film is a puzzle that needs to be solved. (ex: Primer, Donnie Darko, Timecrimes )
  3. Set the Timeline Straight/Prevent a Tragedy: A character goes backwards or forwards in time to fix something wrong with the timeline, or to prevent a tragedy from occurring. (ex: Back to the Future, Looper)

As a huge fan of the genre, all three approaches are great and and I love all of those films. But I began to wonder if there was a new approach that hadn't yet been explored. Time Travel films are often adventure/action and oftentimes, comedies. So I asked myself, what horror can be found in time travel? 

Horror is a genre I've been attracted to for a long time for it's capacity and versatility to tell a wide range of stories, and make us rethink ideas or explore themes we hadn't thought about before. But I also feel that it has been underutilized, and many films fall short of the potential that the genre provides. Horror films can be scary and have something to say. Shifter will be a tense horror thriller with scares and gruesome gory effects but will also serve as a character drama that will explore themes of isolation, loneliness, and the dangers of an unchecked hubris. 

SHIFTER Proof of Concept Trailer from Planet Thunder Productions on Vimeo.

Other Ways You Can Help

The number one way to help Shifter become a reality is to make a contribution, but there are many other ways to help! The film won't get made unless people know about it, so PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD! 

Share our IndieGoGo page, email your friends and family, post about us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc! 

We truly feel that this project will not only be awesome, but it will be something that you are proud to have been a part of! Please join us on this exciting adventure!

And don’t forget our hashtags #shifterfilm #shifthappens

story:
On a sunny day in April of ‘98, Victoria (Rachel Browne) takes pictures of Ciaran (Francis Mezza). They drive down to the train station, part ways… and then the Troubles end. But the two know there is so much more between them than either expected.

Another Day in ’98 is a short drama exploring how difficult it is to talk about how we feel; how the beginning of the end to decades of division affects two very different people on a personal level. This honest, intimate portrayal of youth and conflict between past and the future comes with a vision of hope for our divided times of 2021.

With Your help, we hope to not only bring ‘90s Belfast to the screen, but to life - through investing in VFX, music, sound design and colour grading. Most importantly - we are excited to bring the film everywhere through festivals and other contests. If You’d like to see what we have achieved since the start of the campaign, scroll down to our timeline!

 

 

 

Having completed the thrilling stage of principal photography, we are now raising funds to polish up our film. Our primary goal is to prepare the production for entering the film festivals and delivering it to our backers along with their rewards.

What do we mean by ‘polishing up’? This includes all the previously mentioned elements of post-production: VFX, music, sound design, and colour grading. Some scenes and sequences of the film need additional audio or video, thus the funds will go towards facilitating safe, COVID-compliant recording sessions. We are looking forward to finalise all of the work as we progress with the campaign - and we invite You to follow us and be part of that progress!

Furthermore, we want to be able to continue our commitment and remain fair toward everybody who contributed to the making of this film, but had to incur unexpected COVID-19 related expenses.

A portion of the funds will be used to facilitate the Indiegogo fee as well as submission fees to different festivals. You can read about the latter one further down below!

 

We had an opportunity to work with two incredible, rising stars of the Irish acting scene. It's thanks to them we see the potential of the story; they help to complete the mood of the whole piece. And if You are worried we made them do all the work during such difficult times for free - that's not the case! Get to know them and see how they looked like on our set:

 

Rachel Browne (as Victoria) was raised in Dublin and Essex. Her career started with an invitation to Morley College Theatre company, then Reboot Theatre company for performing in The Southwark Bunker Theatre. She trained in Identity School of Acting and signed to their agency. Featured in the New York Times for her work in The Heptameron (2020) in Italy, Rachel is building a strong presence on the screen in other short films like Flicker (2020) and Manhunt (2020).

 

Francis Mezza (as Ciaran) is a Belfast-born actor who trained at The Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama. His acclaimed theatre performances across United Kingdom and Ireland includes The Absence of Women (Lyric Theatre, Belfast), Macbeth (Rough Magic Theatre), The Doppler Effect (The Belfast Ensemble), The Ferryman (Sonia Friedman Productions/Royal Court) and Cityscapes (Pintsized). His on screen presence includes Derry Girls (Hat Trick Productions/Channel 4).

 

We are proud of everybody who worked on this film and put so much effort to make it happen in a safe environment. You can read about the backbone of the crew below! This international and multiculutral bunch can tell You about their experience on this film and other project they worked on. Also, check how they hid behind the masks on our set:

 

Writer and Director - Timotej Bača

“I originally pitched the film back in November 2019 and if you had told me then what was going to happen in the following months and years… We had originally planned on shooting in February 2020 until what happened, happened. When restrictions eased up I called everyone up, rewrote the script and turned my entire house inside out to timewarp it into 1990s Belfast, to have full control over the safety. Over the months of the production of this film, one could feel the pressure of history happening to us as we lived our ordinary lives, I hope this film reflects that.”

Alongside my short film work as an independent filmmaker I also lecture at Central Saint Martins College of Art (CSM) and work as a freelance director in advertising.

 

Producer and 1st AD - Jan Jakub Osiński

“This project posed a challenge when it came to undertaking decisions. It was a real test to how I’m planning and producing films on every stage. Despite the hardships, we were able to achieve wonders on such a small budget; we have meticulously recreated the look and the atmosphere of the ‘90s Belfast and can enhance it even more. With our eyes on the upcoming festivals, I’m excited to engage the audience and give them a valuable film for the hard times we currently go through.”

As a graduate of UAL, currently studying journalism at UWr, I’ve undertaken production specialism and work as a producer and assistant director. I’ve taken part in a number of independent productions ranging from short drama and documentary forms, television series and music videos; I’m a laureate of the Xuria competition 2019.

 

Producer and Sound Recordist - Ashling Sugrue

“Despite having worked extensively with this crew before, bringing ‘Another Day in 98’ to life was still a real challenge for all of us, and I’m very glad to have been along for the ride. I’m excited to see the project completed and out in the world.”

I’m an Irish-Kyrgyz filmmaker with my toes dipped in many production pies! I have experience in producing international shorts, have self-shot a documentary in Kyrgyzstan, won screenwriting awards at ScreenCraft and the Atlanta Film Festival, and I am now working as a content producer for luxury fashion brands. I’m looking forward to seeing where ‘Another Day in ‘98’ will go from here!

 

Zachary Chia - Director of Photography

“The production of 'Another Day in ‘98' saw quite a number of changes and obstacles to work around from the early stages of drafting up until the edit due to many unforeseen circumstances. Despite having to work within many limitations (especially the tight headspace of the attic, which was one of the locations), it was an awesome experience making this film with a team that pushed on and gave their best from start to finish.”

I’m a graduate of UAL. I currently work as a camera and lighting crew. Some of my recent projects include “To Have Ham Over Your Eyes”, which was an award nominee at the London Short Film Fest 2020, and “The Nose” which was also directed by Timotej!

 

Krystian Graczyk - Editor

“'Another Day in ‘98' is a challenging project given the current pandemic situation. We have managed to pull it together and film in both London and Belfast while suffering from cancellations and lengthy postpones. Likewise to the rest of the film industry, I had to implement new ways of workflow based on remote editing. Nevertheless, thanks to close support from the producer, director, and the edit team, we are crafting something special.”

I graduated UAL having specialised in post production. I’ve worked on many different projects such as Starbucks + Sign2Sing, RCP charity as well as films entering multiple festivals and film events with showings at the Nightpiece Film Festival 2019 (Edinburgh Festival Fringe) and Kinofilm, Manchester International Short Film & Animation Festival 2020. Currently I’m Media Manager at London based Connected Pictures.

 

We want our work to be seen! We want our film to be reviewed, hear everybody’s voice, be able to present our talents to the wider audience. If You choose to, we would be proud to show Your name in the credits as well. And is there a better way to do it all if not the festivals?

The story being set in Belfast with the historical background of the Good Friday Agreement means we want to concentrate on the audiences that can relate to this groundbreaking time in 1998. We are therefore preparing to apply for the Irish and UK based film festivals, as we believe we have a strong film that will grab attention! It doesn't mean we will stop there - we want to venture out internationally as well!

 

We offer a range of rewards, a way to say “Thank You!” for Your support! Please, find a full description of the rewards we provide, below:

●     Digital limited film access - Be able to stream the final film for the whole December of 2021. You will be given a special password that would remain active for the duration of the period  allowing You for unlimited rewatches!

●     Social media shoutout - Your name will be out there on our Instagram, forever! Write Yourself down in the digital history and show Your friends and family You care about independent culture!

●     Film credit - Your name will be engraved on the end credits of the film. Get Yourself shown to audiences at home and festivals and become part of the final film until the end of time!

●     Postcard from Belfast - We want to send You a personalised letter from Belfast. We have prepared the original design of our postcard and would love to get it to You! The postcard was designed by Szymon Osiński.

●     Director’s commentary/BTS - Be able to stream and download a special video from our director talking about the creative process, drama and bloopers that we all witnessed on the set. See how the project evolved, what was cut, who doesn’t know how to drive a car and where did the blue blazer go!

●     Official signed poster - Get an official design of the poster (A3) signed by the director and others sent to You . It’s a unique piece carefully constructed by Marco Antonio Grubben.

●     Signed script with notes - Receive the full script of the original film with handwritten notes added by the director detailing what happened with particular scenes, how they evolved and how they were shot. Get to know the almost 30 page long story of Victoria and Ciaran in full extent!

●     Assistant Producer title - You will be credited as an Assistant Producer, at the top of the end credits, along the rest of the crew. It’s an honour for us to have You on board!

●     Executive Producer title - You will be credited as an Assistant Producer at the very top of the end credits. You are a true V.I.P in our crew and Your name should be on the highest spot!

 

The original design of the postcard by Szymon Osiński!

 

We are glad to state that supporting our project does not bear any risks of the production failing. We want to polish up our film and make it better than if we had tried continuing on our own.

Depending on Your support, we might have to challenge ourselves in limiting the spectrum of film festivals which we can attend. We aim for the film to be finished by the end of April 2021, which would allow us to submit to festivals closing their applications around this time. Our experience of the past months shows that remote editing and work related to the transfer of large amounts of data is excruciatingly slow. In such cases, we will keep in touch with You via email and Instagram, and inform You officially about any significant delays or changes.

 

Thank you for Your support!

If You want to help us by sharing our campaign, feel free to do so! We know these are hard times for everybody and sometimes every penny counts.

Check our Instagram for more!

 

 

All the stills attached to this page do not have to reflect the final look of the film.

You can read about the backbone of the crew below! This international and multiculutral bunch can tell You about their experience on this film and other project they worked on. Also, check how they hid behind the masks on our set: Writer and Director - Timotej Bača“I originally pitched the film back in November 2019 and if you had told me then what was going to happen in the following months and years… We had originally planned on shooting in February 2020 until what happened, happened. When restrictions eased up I called everyone up, rewrote the script and turned my entire house inside out to timewarp it into 1990s Belfast, to have full control over the safety. Over the months of the production of this film, one could feel the pressure of history happening to us as we lived our ordinary lives, I hope this film reflects that.”Alongside my short film work as an independent filmmaker I also lecture at Central Saint Martins College of Art (CSM) and work as a freelance director in advertising. Producer and 1st AD - Jan Jakub Osiński“This project posed a challenge when it came to undertaking decisions. It was a real test to how I’m planning and producing films on every stage. Despite the hardships, we were able to achieve wonders on such a small budget; we have meticulously recreated the look and the atmosphere of the ‘90s Belfast and can enhance it even more. With our eyes on the upcoming festivals, I’m excited to engage the audience and give them a valuable film for the hard times we currently go through.”As a graduate of UAL, currently studying journalism at UWr, I’ve undertaken production specialism and work as a producer and assistant director. I’ve taken part in a number of independent productions ranging from short drama and documentary forms, television series and music videos; I’m a laureate of the Xuria competition 2019. Producer and Sound Recordist - Ashling Sugrue“Despite having worked extensively with this crew before, bringing ‘Another Day in 98’ to life was still a real challenge for all of us, and I’m very glad to have been along for the ride. I’m excited to see the project completed and out in the world.”I’m an Irish-Kyrgyz filmmaker with my toes dipped in many production pies! I have experience in producing international shorts, have self-shot a documentary in Kyrgyzstan, won screenwriting awards at ScreenCraft and the Atlanta Film Festival, and I am now working as a content producer for luxury fashion brands. I’m looking forward to seeing where ‘Another Day in ‘98’ will go from here! Zachary Chia - Director of Photography“The production of 'Another Day in ‘98' saw quite a number of changes and obstacles to work around from the early stages of drafting up until the edit due to many unforeseen circumstances. Despite having to work within many limitations (especially the tight headspace of the attic, which was one of the locations), it was an awesome experience making this film with a team that pushed on and gave their best from start to finish.”I’m a graduate of UAL. I currently work as a camera and lighting crew. Some of my recent projects include “To Have Ham Over Your Eyes”, which was an award nominee at the London Short Film Fest 2020, and “The Nose” which was also directed by Timotej! Krystian Graczyk - Editor“'Another Day in ‘98' is a challenging project given the current pandemic situation. We have managed to pull it together and film in both London and Belfast while suffering from cancellations and lengthy postpones. Likewise to the rest of the film industry, I had to implement new ways of workflow based on remote editing. Nevertheless, thanks to close support from the producer, director, and the edit team, we are crafting something special.”I graduated UAL having specialised in post production. I’ve worked on many different projects such as Starbucks + Sign2Sing, RCP charity as well as films entering multiple festivals and film events with showings at the Nightpiece Film Festival 2019 (Edinburgh Festival Fringe) and Kinofilm, Manchester International Short Film & Animation Festival 2020. Currently I’m Media Manager at London based Connected Pictures. We want our work to be seen! We want our film to be reviewed, hear everybody’s voice, be able to present our talents to the wider audience. If You choose to, we would be proud to show Your name in the credits as well. And is there a better way to do it all if not the festivals?The story being set in Belfast with the historical background of the Good Friday Agreement means we want to concentrate on the audiences that can relate to this groundbreaking time in 1998. We are therefore preparing to apply for the Irish and UK based film festivals, as we believe we have a strong film that will grab attention! It doesn't mean we will stop there - we want to venture out internationally as well! We offer a range of rewards, a way to say “Thank You!” for Your support! Please, find a full description of the rewards we provide, below:●     Digital limited film access - Be able to stream the final film for the whole December of 2021. You will be given a special password that would remain active for the duration of the period  allowing You for unlimited rewatches!●     Social media shoutout - Your name will be out there on our Instagram, forever! Write Yourself down in the digital history and show Your friends and family You care about independent culture!●     Film credit - Your name will be engraved on the end credits of the film. Get Yourself shown to audiences at home and festivals and become part of the final film until the end of time!●     Postcard from Belfast - We want to send You a personalised letter from Belfast. We have prepared the original design of our postcard and would love to get it to You! The postcard was designed by Szymon Osiński.●     Director’s commentary/BTS - Be able to stream and download a special video from our director talking about the creative process, drama and bloopers that we all witnessed on the set. See how the project evolved, what was cut, who doesn’t know how to drive a car and where did the blue blazer go!●     Official signed poster - Get an official design of the poster (A3) signed by the director and others sent to You . It’s a unique piece carefully constructed by Marco Antonio Grubben.●     Signed script with notes - Receive the full script of the original film with handwritten notes added by the director detailing what happened with particular scenes, how they evolved and how they were shot. Get to know the almost 30 page long story of Victoria and Ciaran in full extent!●     Assistant Producer title - You will be credited as an Assistant Producer, at the top of the end credits, along the rest of the crew. It’s an honour for us to have You on board!●     Executive Producer title - You will be credited as an Assistant Producer at the very top of the end credits. You are a true V.I.P in our crew and Your name should be on the highest spot! The original design of the postcard by Szymon Osiński! We are glad to state that supporting our project does not bear any risks of the production failing. We want to polish up our film and make it better than if we had tried continuing on our own.Depending on Your support, we might have to challenge ourselves in limiting the spectrum of film festivals which we can attend. We aim for the film to be finished by the end of April 2021, which would allow us to submit to festivals closing their applications around this time. Our experience of the past months shows that remote editing and work related to the transfer of large amounts of data is excruciatingly slow. In such cases, we will keep in touch with You via email and Instagram, and inform You officially about any significant delays or changes. Thank you for Your support!If You want to help us by sharing our campaign, feel free to do so! We know these are hard times for everybody and sometimes every penny counts.Check our Instagram for more!  All the stills attached to this page do not have to reflect the final look of the film.

story:
From the Director of El Color Negro , Andy Hodgson, comes our newest film, El Mulatto.

 

During the height of the Black Lives Matter protests last year, Andy Hodgson felt compelled to start writing and directing stories that explored and shared the black experience.

 

El Mulatto is an exploration of what it means to be born half black, half white. Being a multi-racial individual, like Andy, comes with its own set of challenges and inner conflict.

 

Historically, a mulatto has been defined as: the first general offspring of a black and white parent; or, an individual with both white and black ancestors. Generally, mulattoes are light-skinned, though dark enough to be excluded from the white race.

 

Starring Donald Sales, this film was inspired by the poem Mulatto by Langston Hughes is the story of a mixed race son approaching his white father and being rejected by him. The poem relies on the sexual exploitation of southern black women by southern white men. While mixing words inspired by Hughes poetic words, with cinematic images exploring the entanglement of black and white, a young mixed race man 'unearths' his freedom in the face of racism.


We currently have a grant for production and need additional production and post production funds to finish this film.

 

Anything you can give will be so appreciated.

 

This story matters. Thank you for helping us bring it to life. 

 

Much love,

 

Andy, Jessie, Phil and Pauline

El Mulatto Producing team

story:
Wigwolf's The Wet Ones is three interconnected stories.

1. The Wet Ones- Muff-Muff and The Puppy-Boy conspire to destroy Bunnula the vampire bunny and take away everything he loves. 

2. Kate Middleton's Adventure- Kate Middleton and her talking car help save a town from corrupt bobcats while Kate has flashbacks to her past life with Bunnula the vampire bunny.

3. Titanic Sinclair Kills Everything-
Katy Perry goes off the rails and becomes an alcoholic after Titanic Sinclair murders everyone she knows. She retreats into her alter ego Miami drug lord Trey Sanchez and exacts his/her revenge. 

The movie will feature fake news clips, and scenes from my old Bunnula TV YouTube series whenever a flashback happens.

The movie will be filmed on a variety of obsolete formats such as Video 8 tape, VHS tape, and Mini DV tape.  I feel that using these formats will give the film a unique look that can't be recreated by digital effects.  

For even the minimal contribution you will have your name in the credits of the most important and famous movie ever.  A film that will rival Citizen Kane and the best work of directors such as Douglas Sirk and Wim Wenders.  

As you move up the tiers you will receive even greater rewards, such as a DVD or t-shirt!

This movie is going to be unlike anything the world has ever seen.  You will totally regret not being a part of it!

IMDB Page: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt14501448/

CAST

LLOYD KAUFMAN as BRODY DEVEREAUX

BEATRICE FREIRE CAMPBELL as CRAWLINE

 

WIGWOLF as BUNNULA THE BUNNY

 

 

MARCONI PUMA as DISCO DANNY

KEVIN WALTER as FAMOUS DIRECTOR NICHOLAS RAY 

ERIK HANDY as SILVERFISH

MORRIS SLATER DIAMOND as ELVIS/VOICE OF ELVIS 

ANDY DICK as THE BUNNY KING

RACHEL ALIG as SPIDER BABY

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially please consider sharing our project with your friends and your followers on social media.  

  • Spread the word about The Wet Ones!
  • Share everywhere!

CONTACT WIGWOLF

AS SEEN ON...

story:
The Story

Generations collide! Lost in a time and place not her own, and thrown into the middle of a conflict that shouldn’t involve her, Lieutenant Sofia Karras just wants to go home. But is home still waiting?

Directed by Laura Barnes, Echoes will feature the following.

  • Amira Kremers as Sofia Karras
  • Shona Smith as Alison Fitzpatrick
  • Marley Hunter as Jer-Ahn
  • Steve Hammond as Magon
  • Mat Hodson as Terak
  • Nick Cook as Daniel Hunter
  • Hilary Roberts as Caitlyn Frances
  • Lucita Faria-Cook as Yanis Caed
  • David M. Reid as Lucas Jansen
  • Euan Smith as Jason Raines
  • Mel Graham as Joanna Clayton
  • Stephen Curtis as Okala Kalim 
  • Alan Johnston as Rendar
  • Bob Bruce as Kaine
  • Donna Mackintosh as Altera
  • Gavin Beckers as Nash

In addition, Samuel Cockings of Trekyards fame, has kindly agreed to provide visual effects, and you can expect to see his usual high standard of work throughout the film.

Why support us?

Honestly? You probably have far better things to be spending your money on, and let's face it, there are a ton of similar projects out there asking for money.

Putting that aside though, while this may be our first crowdfunder, it isn't our first film. We've been making fanfilms for well over a decade, we've even gotten moderately competent (disclaimer; that word might not mean what I think it means). We're not making big budget, glossy, professional films, but we are trying to tell fun, entertaining stories set in the Star Trek universe. And I think this new story is no exception.

So why do we need your help now? The simple fact is, these things are expensive. I think we've done a pretty good job of getting the most out of our shoestring budgets and the kindness of friends so far. But we'd like to do better.

Echoes will require a lot of challenging exterior shooting, some new costuming, and location hire. Food, transport, expendables, these are all things that add up quickly and drain what little budget we have. We're not looking for people to cover all our costs, but even a small donation would be of immense help in stretching our resources out, and ensuring we can produce as professional and polished a film as possible. 

So should you support us? Only you can answer that question. But if you do, you can be certain you'll receive our gratitude and a (hopefully) entertaining film.

So what exactly are we asking for?

In short:

  • Travel expenses. 
  • Room hire.
  • Food. Actors and crew can get a little grumpy if you don’t feed them. We don’t want that.
  • Props and costumes. Most of this is in place already, but we still have to provide wardrobe and props for our antagonists, the Venkari Solidarity. We don't anticipate these being expensive, but we will need to purchase materials for them.
  • Make up. We don't anticipate any complex make up, but the cost of supplies even for the most basic makeup quickly piles up.
  • Associated consumables (such as batteries).
  • Post-production expenses.

Risks & Challenges

At present, we're aiming to have the film completed by April of 2021, but it's always possible that various roadblocks could crop up to delay that. However, we are determined to produce and complete this film and I think our track record to date shows that we are likely to keep that promise. Since 2003 we have produced a dozen films ranging from 5 minutes to 47 in length (with two more coming this year). While these films are certainly amateur in presentation, they also demonstrate continual evidence of our growth as filmmakers and storytellers, and we're confident Echoes will continue that trend. You can find all our previous films on YouTube, should you care to review them.

https://www.youtube.com/user/StarShipIntrepid

Other Ways You Can Help

Now we realise not everyone is willing or able to contribute, and that's absolutely fine. But if you'd like to help out in other ways please feel free to share the campaign and get the word out.

Thank you so much!

story:
"The Moonlight Feels Right"

"The Moonlight Feels Right" is "Carrie" meets "Ginger Snaps", it is meant to be a horror that takes a modern spin on the tropes of the past. This short film is intended to be included in an anthology feature film that will bring a universe of short films together. I am excited to be heading this anthology with my short and to be creating something that is unique and original. Hope you can help and be a part of this adventure. Introduction to Horror Anthology coming 2022! 

Announcement!

We are excited to announce that RokitPig will be producing the anthology! That is right Fans!! #Rokitpig has greenlit the Feature Anthology "A Date with Death" (working title)

We have 4 days left and will add perks for 3 more shorts filming in the Fresno/LA area! There are acting, producing and product placement perks! Join our universe and let’s make an epic feature horror anthology! We will be updating the perks on the page today! Still some available for The Moonlight Feels Right! We will be adding perks for Spin to Win - Written and directed by Chris Neal , The Fridge - Written & Directed by Taze Raney , Scorned (working title)

Written & Directed by Raul Cantu, and an INTENSE wraparound story, "A Date with Death" (working title) Written & Directed by Raul Cantu for the Anthology.

We are honored to be working with Rokitpig on this, here are a few words from Rokitpig CEO Jerry G Angelo

"RokitPig is excited to announce we have been won over by some very talented and creative filmmakers and will be producing a marvelously entertaining anthology!

These Pigs are ready to Rokit!" Jerry G. Angelo

 


THE DIRECTOR ANTHONY PISENO

A little about me, I grew up in Fresno, California. My father introduced me to his favorite films at a young age. I grew up with Ray Harryhausen films like “The Seventh Voyage of Sinbad”, “Clash of the Titans”, and “Jason and the Argonauts”. He also introduced me to Godzilla and Star Wars. I fell in love with monsters and eventually horror. Fast forward to three years ago and the filmmaker in me was finally born with a short film titled “the box” since I have evolved into a better and more complete filmmaker. In my short career I won a Best Sci-Fi film from The Blood Horror Festival with my film “Prey by Night” and won 1st place in the 20th GERM festival with my film “It Calls”.

MEET THE CAST

Legendary Scream Queen!

BIO: After earning a Masters's Degree in oceanography, Brinke has been involved in the film business since 1981 with her debut in Roger Corman's "Slumber Party Massacre".  Since then, she has appeared in 220 movies, many of them fantasy and horror, earning her the title of Scream Queen.  She’s been featured in numerous documentaries such as "The Psycho Legacy” and “ Exploit This! The History of Cult Cinema".  Brinke was Executive Editor at “Weird Tales” magazine; wrote a sci-fi novel, "Dangerous Toys”; and published her own comic book series "Brinke of Destruction".  She has recorded dozens of audiobooks and radio plays, co-produced two horror documentaries ("Shock Cinema" and "Something to Scream About”), and also wrote and directed a psychological horror film, "Personal Demons” (2021). (IMDB Bio)

Star Trek Legend! Tracee Cocco! 

Tracee Lee Cocco is an actress, model and stuntwoman. She began working as a model and was featured by Alberto Mousse in several magazines. She also modeled for Revlon, Jimmy Z Ad, Pool & Spa Magazine, 7Up, the Auto Stereo Sound Magazine, and McDonald’s. Tracee began acting in 1989 on Baywatch, appearing as a lifeguard during the show’s early seasons. This led to her involvement on Star Trek: The Next Generation in which she was a regular stunt performer and most famously played Lieutenant Jae. The role has since developed a cult following. She later appeared in three of the feature films and was a stand-in for Alice Krige in Star Trek: First Contact. Tracee appeared as various characters on Star Trek Deep: Space Nine and Star Trek: Voyager, went on a national promotional tour for the shows, and appeared in video game tie-ins. Her film work includes Demolition Man, Virtuosity and Bulletproof.

Tracee’s recent film credits include Renegades, Night Mistress and its upcoming video game tie-in, The Assassin’s Apprentice 2 and several films currently in production. She is incredibly popular on the convention circuit and appears all over the world. Tracee lives in Los Angeles. (From Traceeleecocco.com)

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

You can also help us by simply sharing this page, we are so thankful for visiting and for your support. 

Help us reach our stretch goals to get the anthology started!  This will be included in a feature film! 1st stretch goal $25,000

Tracee appeared as various characters on Star Trek Deep: Space Nine and Star Trek: Voyager, went on a national promotional tour for the shows, and appeared in video game tie-ins. Her film work includes Demolition Man, Virtuosity and Bulletproof.
Tracee’s recent film credits include Renegades, Night Mistress and its upcoming video game tie-in, The Assassin’s Apprentice 2 and several films currently in production. She is incredibly popular on the convention circuit and appears all over the world. Tracee lives in Los Angeles. (From Traceeleecocco.com)
 
 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

You can also help us by simply sharing this page, we are so thankful for visiting and for your support. 
Help us reach our stretch goals to get the anthology started!  This will be included in a feature film! 1st stretch goal $25,000

story:
About the Film

To Meet the Faces You Meet is a feature-length independent science fiction film based on the 1972 underground comic Fever Dreams written by Jan Strnad (DC Comics, Disney, Heavy Metal) and illustrated by Richard Corben (Heavy Metal, Fantagor, Dark Horse Comics). The film is animated and directed by J. Allen Williams (Darkstar: The Interactive Movie, Everything), who co-wrote the screenplay with Strnad.

To Meet the Faces You Meet will star the talented Samuel Hunt (Chicago P.D., Empire, Unbroken: Path to Redemption) as its protagonist Friz and Patton Oswalt (The King of Queens, Young Adult, Ratatouille) as Friz's symbiotic robot MEAD, whose parts have already been recorded.  The antagonist chasing our heroes across the universe is none other than the incomparable Robert Picardo (Star Trek: Voyager, the Stargate franchise, The Orville) as the villainous Admiral Gillette. The film will also feature the iconic voice of Patrick Warburton (Seinfeld, The Tick, Family Guy) as Timmy the Wunderbot, a 300 foot tall toy unleashed on the bad guys.

Why We Need Your Help

After nearly four years of work, the entire 94-minute feature film is nearly complete, including animated plates, editing, music score, and sound effects. In fact, just one crucial final stage remains — filming the live-action sequences and adding the performances of our stellar cast.

In order to finish the film and make it the very best it can be, we could use your help. The purpose of this IndieGoGo campaign is to raise crucial funds for additional actors, their airfare, hotels and food (craft services) while they are in our care during the shoot, SAG fees, studio space, set construction, lighting, sound, and other ancillary production needs.

Thanks to a Kickstarter event earlier this year, we were able to raise enough funds to hire the actors Samuel Hunt, Patrick Warburton, and Robert Picardo, in addition to a few others (see our CAST video).  We were able to add more actors than anticipated by matching the KS funds with our own studio funds, but by doing so the costs for production went a lot higher than anticipated — travel, lodging, food, SAG fees, etc increased exponentially with each “name” actor we added to the cast.

We've set a minimum goal of $10,000 for this campaign to add to our funds already raised, but that's just it—the minimum. Every dollar beyond this goal will go to making the production look and sound even better by teaming up with potential backers like you! 

Synopsis

The military thought they had created the ultimate weapon－a soldier (Friz) linked symbiotically with an artificially intelligent spaceship (MEAD: Mobile Extrasensory Autonomous Deceptor) with the ability to project illusions so real that they cannot be distinguished from reality. Together, Friz and MEAD became the most deadly fighting force the world had seen.

There was one problem: An errant bit of programming instilled MEAD with a conscience and pacifist tendencies that made him and his human symbiote useless for military purposes. Scheduled for "decommission," Friz and MEAD go on the run, pursued by bounty hunters and the unscrupulous Admiral Gillette－who has a personal axe to grind. He won’t stop until MEAD is destroyed and Friz executed for desertion.  The truth is, it’s all about revenge.

Perks for Backers

No contribution will go unrewarded when backers help make our film look and sound as great as it possibly can. Our list of perks includes adding your name in the film's end credits scroll, a Blu-Ray copy of the film (sent to YOU before anyone else sees it), art prints and posters, a signed 32 Collector's Card set, props, and more. Check out our list of perks for more info… there's something for everyone!

Risks & Challenges

To Meet the Faces You Meet will be made regardless of the outcome of this fundraiser. The purpose of this campaign is to raise the additional funds needed to complete the film so that we can make the final product better than ever without driving the studio into more debt and slowing their ability to complete the film quickly.  Remember, 90% of the film is complete after nearly four years of production (check out our videos), we just need a bit of help over the finish line to make the film BETTER FASTER.  Parallax Studio has funded this first 90% including all of the CGI and animations, Patton Oswalt’s fee, studio fees in Hollywood — everything done to date. Covid-19 has really hurt the film industry, especially independent studios like ours.  We are ready and able to finish TMtFYM regardless, but your help will make a huge difference — a game changer.  We want to be poised to release our film through a major distribution network when Covid finally recedes and the film/theater industries are ready for content.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to back our campaign (understandable, given the current state of the world), please consider spreading the word about our film on social media and IRL. We're grateful for every Like, Share, Re-Tweet, and Mention! Anything you do to get MEAD onto screens everywhere will be appreciated and acknowledged. THANK YOU!

story:
The Film

Hello! I'm Charles Socarides, writer/director of Ray.

I'm sure you've read the news: opioid overdoses in the U.S. have skyrocketed during the Covid-19 pandemic. Addiction has always been a disease that feeds on isolation, hopelessness and shame, so it is no surprise that some people are hurting worse than ever. 

Ray is a 12-minute drama that tells the story of Quinn, a young man who has lost his twin brother to a heroin overdose. At his brother's funeral he meets Daphne, a woman tortured by her own substance use disorder, who has the power to destroy or save them both.

Sound interesting? I hope so... because, at this critical moment, we need stories that shed light on the shared humanity of this deadly disease.

Ray has been my personal passion project for three years, and the GOOD NEWS is that we were able to wrap production in the height of the pandemic and the film looks amazing (see above)!

Our stars gave killer performances, our camera team knocked it out of the park and the production design was more vivid than I could have imagined. But now for a dose of reality: 

We need your help to finish this thing. 

Team RAY is seeking one final push to close the gap on post-production costs.

These include such essential services as:

-Sound Mixing & Design 

-Color Correction & Grading

-Music Licensing

-Editing 

-Publicity

Each of these elements is vital for completing the film and getting it out into the world (please see our breakdown below).

We are SO THRILLED we've made it this far. Thank you for considering lending your support to help us finish the job!

And please meet our team.

 

The Team

Juan Castano plays "Quinn", a young man struggling to accept the overdose of his twin brother.

 

In addition to starring in the Netflix shows What/If  and Tales of the City, Juan recently received both the Drama Desk and the Lucille Lortel Award for his outstanding work in NY theatre.

 

Sarah Steele plays "Daphne", a mysterious woman struggling with substance use.

Sarah currently plays Marissa Gold on The Good Fight. She has starred in many films such as Speech and Debate, Please Give and Spanglish. For her work, she has received an Independent Spirit Award and a Drama Desk Award. 

 

Charles Socarides (writer/director)

 A working actor for 20 years, Ray is my directorial debut!

 

The mind-blowing department heads of Ray

 

Jordan T. Parrott, Director of Photography 

Cheyenne Ford, Production Designer

Jason Hoffmann, Editor

Guy Rosmarin, Sound Mixing/Design

Adam Bradley, Producer

 

Behind-the-scenes shots of all of us shooting a short (safely) in a pandemic:

Production Designer extraordinaire Cheyenne Ford adding the finishing touch to another amazing creation.

 

Director: "We're in this together!" Actors: "Please stop talking and let us act!"

 

Our star Juan Castano and our youngest actor (and Juan's mentor), Edwin Echavarria!

 

Masked up and nailing an exterior shot.

 

Stars Sarah Steele and Juan Castano goofing off between takes of VERY SERIOUS ACTING.

 

DP Jordan Parrott and ACs Megaera Stephens and Josh Reyes posing with our most important character, Ray.

 

What We Need & What You Get

It is true what they say about filmmaking: "When you're done filming, congratulations, you're 50% of the way there." (I think it's actually closer to 40%!).

Post-production is every bit as essential to building the world of the film as finding the right location or casting the perfect actor.

We are seeking $6,500 to help cover these costs. Here's the breakdown:

Editing: Pacing is everything in this claustrophobic, ultimately explosive story. We need a fantastic editing team to capture this rhythm and deliver the finished film. ~$1,750

Sound Design and Mix: Quinn's inner world will be crafted from memories that he can't get out of his head. Sound is our most important tool in establishing this mood. Also, without a quality mix, the dialogue of the film would be uneven or lost. ~ $2,000

Color Correction and Grading: Ray was shot on the fancy Mini LF. Large Format (LF) is able to capture an amazing amount of detail. To bring this out - and at the same time achieve the textured, filmic look we're after - we are working with top-of-the-line colorists. ~ $1,500

Song Licensing: We have found the perfect music for the film and couldn't be more thrilled. We'd love to compensate those composers and cover small copyright fees. ~$500

Film Festival Submissions: To get as many eyeballs as possible on the film, we will be submitting heavily to film festivals. These fees run from $50-$100 per submission. ~$500

For your generosity and belief in the project, we are so happy to offer the following exciting PERKS:

-a digital download of the film

-a digital copy of the Ray poster

-a signed copy of the Ray script 

-a personalized Thank You video from stars Juan Castano and Sarah Steele!

-an Associate Producer credit

-an Executive Producer credit

-and of course our eternal gratitude!!!

For more details, please check out the "Perks" on the campaign page!

 

The Impact 

During pre-production, we were honored to partner with and receive funding from Northern Illinois Recovery Center, a cutting-edge addiction treatment center right outside of Chicago. 

Their early involvement inspired us to set the goal of making the finished film widely available to the recovery community. We hope to do that with safe in-person screenings.

Whether the film is viewed at a fancy film festival, a treatment center halfway around the world or on a laptop somewhere, our goal of reaching people in need remains the same. As does the film's message: you are not alone. 

Your donation will help us realize our dream of sharing this story. Thank you so much!

New York Times - Drug overdose deaths spike

Washington Post - Opioid death at an historic high

story:
You can’t choose your family, but you can support what team to support. And oh boy, James made the wrong choice tonight…

Bragoro (Puberty) will be a Comedy, Drama short film about a teenager receiving an ad-lib education about his roots whilst trying to watch a football match between England and Ghana.

The story will follow James, a 14 year old second generation immigrant. Born in Hammersmith, West London, Bred in Kennington, South London, as he prepares to support his home country in the World Cup Semi Final whilst aided by his school friends who are also supporting England.

However, conflict arises as James' Mother and Father host a Tanzania/Ghana fusion night to watch the match and his whole family are supporting the other team in the Semi Final, Ghana. Why? Because his Mum and Aunty are from Ghana, born and raised and whilst his Dad and Uncle are from Tanzania, they want Ghana to win because an African country has never been to the World Cup Final. 

The story takes a turn though as friction bubbles to the surface, and James says something to his Aunty that you never say to your elders in Ghana. Thus kicks off the time ye olde tradition of Cultural Bragoro, which translates to Cultural Puberty. Where a young person goes through a maturing of sorts in their cultural understanding. Of their heritage and roots. 

Why This? Who is this for? Why Now?

I believe this is a story that was a long time coming for me personally as I was once James. Where I didn't really see the importance of my heritage or roots, why I should even care and that since I was born and bred in the UK, it didn't really matter because I wasn't "from" my motherland or fatherland (for me this was Tanzania and Ghana respectfully). But that wasn't true at all, of course it was important. It was my heritage, it's where I'm from. And honestly, I wish I'd seen a film like this when I was younger. 

This is the type of thing that every second generation immigrant in this country thinks about. Where one or both your parents were born overseas and migrated to the UK (in this instance), then you were subsequently born in the UK. So this story is for any second generation immigrant that feels confused about your identity, and where you think you're from. Also specifically, this is for anybody of the African diaspora. Diaspora meaning a scattered population whose origin lies in a separate geographic locale. Since I've seen a lot of films about second generation immigrants going on a journey to find themselves and their identity but not a lot of them were from the African perspective that was specific to say me. So it's just something that caught my eye and what I always wanted to show on-screen.

And they are a lot of reasons why now is the best time to tell this story. I've got to get the B word out of the way, so Brexit is a big reason why this story is so important now, more than ever. Also how timely it is from a football sense because not only are we getting into World Cup season next year but we’re hot off “It’s coming home season” from the Euros. It's also important identity is tackled in this film given the racial abuse Marcus Rashford, Jadon Sancho and Bukayo Saka received in the final that was prominently from this country. Finally, this short is something I wanted to write and direct in memory of my late Babu and Grandma. They've given me every bit of strength I have in life and I want to thank them by not only showing my appreciation but also give a spotlight to the countries they were born and raised, Tanzania and Ghana. 

Crew

Jacob Mosha - Writer / Director 

Jacob Mosha is a London based writer-director who normally loves writing and directing Horrors and Dramas but wanted to do something much lighter this time round. This short is very personal for Jacob as he personally his half Tanzanian, Quarter Ghanaian, and a Quarter British. This short is also be submitted as his graduation film for his Masters in Directing at MetFilm School.  

 

Myles Wilkinson-Gayle - Director of Photography

 

Myles Wilkinson-Gayle is a London based cinematographer who's a passionate crew member with 6 years of experience both on-and-off set. He's a diverse, dedicated and highly creative cinematographer with more than 3 years behind the lens and a keen eye for lighting. experienced in handling high volume of simultaneous tasks with ease and accuracy. 

 

Budget Breakdown

 

The money will be put into the following areas of production:

£1,335 - Actors

£1309.32 – Props / Costumes / Footage

£980 – Locations

£238.46 – Kit Transport, General Transport, Contingency 

£137.22 – Film Festival Fees

Total: £4000

Total: £4000

story:
*You can choose to give without a perk. Click the "Back Now" button near the top of the page and enter any amount. 

After escaping from a severely abusive relationship at 19-years-old and publicly sharing her experiences in 2016, a South Asian woman reflects on her 5 year journey of isolation from her faith-based community, lingering trauma from her ex-partner, navigating the aftermath of using her voice and self-healing to build a new life.

Produced and created by two South Asian women, 'This Is My Proof' is a documentary centring the experience and journey of navigating community isolation after coming forward about assault and domestic abuse.

This film will be used as a tool and resource for domestic violence education. It will contribute to the Violence Against Women movement, and provide representation on what it means to experience intimate-partner violence as a marginalized individual. Our goal is to submit the documentary to film festivals and distribute it  through platforms that can reach a wider audience and community spaces.

Together, we can continue the fight towards ending violence against women.

Approximately every six days, a woman in Canada is killed by her intimate partner.

In 2016, Serena shared her experiences for the very first time online in the form of a blog post. In under two weeks, 34,000 people had viewed and read it. Her inbox was flooded with hundreds of messages from women who were, and may still be, experiencing violence.

She later went on to speak on national TV and panels about her experiences, in hopes of dismantling stereotypes of domestic abuse, assault and gender-based violence. 

The idea for this documentary came naturally when Serena was reflecting on how she could make an impact by sharing a deeper layer of her experiences with domestic violence, particularly about the aftermath of coming forward with her truth.

Now, she recognizes the opportunity to reflect on what the past 5 years of healing, coping and rebuilding have been like, specifically as a Muslim woman. She's ready to open up the doors to details she's never shared before and begin a whole new conversation.

With YOUR support we can:

  • Continue and shift the conversation around intimate-partner violence
  • Teach and inspire teens to recognize red flags and calls for help
  • Foster a safe-space community that BELIEVES and supports all women

'This Is My Proof' will be a high-quality film that requires cinematographers, licensing, distribution, a post-production team and more. This film began production in March 2021, however, in order to resume, we need your help. Until now, we have been working with a limited self-funded budget because we believe in the power of this film, but with your support, we can complete production and begin the post-production and distribution process.

Our conservative goal is: $10,000 | Our stretch goal is: $15,000 | Our dream goal is: $20,000. 

Here is a breakdown of how we plan to utilize the funds:

If we exceed the funding necessary to complete the film, all excess proceeds will be donated to the Canadian Women's Foundation.

Financial support will help us complete this film, but there are many other ways you can contribute to 'This Is My Proof' and the wider movement, such as:

  • Share this page with your family and friends
  • Engage in meaningful conversations around the topic of this film

This film is being created and produced by two South-Asian women, Jenny Jay and Serena Lalani.

Jenny Jay (Director & Co-Producer)

Jenny Jay is an award-winning cinematographer, photographer, writer, and activist. She is also the founder and owner of The Double Jay Collective, a photography and videography studio based out of Toronto, where she helps brands create engaging, heartfelt, and sales-driven content. Whether she's behind the camera, documenting her travels or amplifying the stories that need to be told, Jenny is an embodiment of what it means to be a true multimedia creator.

Serena Lalani (Producer)

Serena is a domestic abuse survivor and advocate that has pushed the boundaries on what it means to find your voice after experiencing violence. She's helped countless women discover their inner resilience after suffering from abuse. As a writer, storyteller and solopreneur, Serena also builds sustainable communities online for BIPOC entrepreneurs by bringing their tone, values and vision to life.

Supported by The Double Jay Collective

Since its inception in 2015, The Double Jay Collective has served over 150+ entrepreneurs to tell their stories, establish their brands, launch their courses, or sell out their e-commerce products through the tools of photography, videography, and content marketing & storytelling.

story:
:::STRETCH GOAL $35,000:::

THE CREW

Joe Moe is a writer, director, producer, FX artist and designer of dark rides for international theme parks. Joe is steeped in old school and contemporary horror, having been best friend and caretaker to the late 92-year-old genre legend and editor of Famous Monsters of Filmland magazine, Forrest J Ackerman (1916-2008). Joe lived with “Uncle Forry” and curated 800,000 props, artworks and books at The Ackermansion of Sci-Fi, Fantasy & Horror. Joe was editor of Famous Monsters retro issues and Mad Monster magazine. As a filmmaker, Joe produced, co-wrote and co-designed the $2.5 million deconstructed slasher movie Red Velvet, starring Henry Thomas and Kelli Garner. Joe was creative director for Ulalume Film and 3Mac Films studios. Joe has worked on Tim Burton’s Ed Wood, contributed design for David Lynch’s Coffee commercial and is an author of optioned and produced screenplays, stage plays and published short stories. Joe edits a series of annual Days of the Dead/Black Bed Sheet Books “Fanthologies,” discovering and publishing new horror writers. As a performer, Joe has been a studio singer for Disney, done voice acting for performance artist Heather Woodbury and playwright Doug DeVita as well as appearing with Malcolm McDowell and Nivek Ogre in the Fangoria radio play “House of Blood.” Joe’s day job is as horror memorabilia specialist and cataloguer in the Entertainment & Music Department of Heritage Auctions. Funky Facts: Joe sculpted a monster mask (“Schizoid”) for legendary Don Post Studios, once operated the front half of beloved Muppet, Snuffleupagus, and swam with a 7-foot Tiger Shark (not on purpose)! Thank you for contributing to this dream project. We’ll make you proud!
