story:
*For the French version of the campaign video, please click here*
https://vimeo.com/146695791

Oscar-nominated director Michael Mann helped redefine the possibilities of commercial film and his enduring influence can be seen in the array of filmmakers whose work, in very different ways, owes him a debt - from Christopher Nolan (The Dark Knight) and Nicolas Winding Refn (Drive) to Louis Letterier (The Incredible Hulk) Ben Affleck (The Town) and Ben Wheatley (High-Rise).

 

Michael Mann’s THE KEEP, released in 1983 and based on fantasy author F.Paul Wilson’s best-selling novel was a film that was never fully realised.

 

Drawing from Bruno Bettelheim’s text The Uses of Enchantment and set in North East Romania at the height of the Nazi’s power, THE KEEP was conceived by Mann to be an epic adult fairytale for our times.
 

Starring Oscar-Nominated Sir Ian Mckellen, Gabriel Byrne, Scott Glenn & Jurgen Prochnow, Mann’s notion of crafting something completely unique was way ahead of its time.



The material struck a cord with Mann who approached it with the same exhaustive research that he had applied to his crime epics.

Inspired by the silent German & Danish film works of F. W Murnau, Paul Wegener & Carl Theodor Dreyer, Mann created a phantasmagoria of white-washed exteriors separated by a bridge into the deep blacks and greys of THE KEEP interior. Two polar opposites that created the perfect duality to set up the story.
 

 

 

The demon Molasar as played by Mike Carter (Bib Fortuna in RETURN OF THE JEDI)
 

 

 

Mann’s ambition was such that he not only had three-time Academy Award-winning production designer John Box (Lawrence of Arabia/Dr Zhivago) on board to perfectly realise the sets, but enigmatic FX artist Wally Veevers (2001:A Space Odyssey) to create the complex practical effects, along with an often chaotic revolving door of many established and upcoming artists across all creative fields, including experimental musician & composer Laurie Anderson, comic book auteur Enki Bilal, electronic pioneers Tangerine Dream and visionary portrait photographer Art Kane in a creative milieu of unique proportions. The resulting film created a very influential fabric of vision and sound for filmmakers around the world.

 

The Romanian village set created at the bottom of Llanberis quarry North Wales - 1982.

Mann (left) on set in North Wales with actors Jurgen Prochnow (centre) and Scott Glenn (right)

Above - The large interior space built on the sound stages of Shepperton studios influenced by Albert Speer & fascist architecture. This sequence remains one of the memorable scenes in the Theatrical version of the film.

 

The soundtrack by Tangerine Dream became equally memorable, taking composer Howard Blake's world-renowned theme 'Walking in the Air ' from the much loved children's animation short, the Oscar-nominated The Snowman (1982); and turned it into an all-encompassing  mix of music composition and sound design that wrapped itself around THE KEEP's mysterious, supernatural core.

 

(Photo Credit - Monique Froese - 1982)
Pictured - Michael Mann (left) with from (far L & R) Ex-Tangerine Dream members Chris Franke & Johannes Schmoelling with (centre) the late founder of TD Edgar Froese, discussing the score to THE KEEP


Professor Ian Christie describes Tangerine Dream's unique musical contribution to THE KEEP (1983)

 




“Movies aren’t finished. They’re abandoned.”—David Fincher (Director - The Social Network, Seven, Alien 3)

Despite Wally Veevers' untimely death in Feb of 1983, marking a major blow to an already difficult production, filming continued, costs escalated and schedules ballooned to a point where much of the footage remained left out of the theatrical version of THE KEEP upon its Xmas release in the U.S. This lost footage equates to over one hour’s worth of story, dialogue, key plot points and some instances where whole scenes and effects had been severly cut against Mann's wishes.

A tough learning experience for Michael & the crew, what we’ve been left with is a visionary filmmaker pushing the boundaries of cinema that made a huge impact on audiences around the world who were lucky enough to see it either on its initial release, home video in the 80's, or most recently, digital streaming.
 

 


Shot over five years in six countries across two continents, A World War II Fairytale is a completely unique opportunity for you to learn more about one of Michael Mann's most wildly inventive, ambitious and unknown periods in his career. The production combines historian Stephane Piter's twenty-plus year archive on THE KEEP with that of hundreds of new interviews with cast, crew, critics & filmmakers. The documentary also unearths a wealth of material which allows a much deeper look into the filmmaking process and Michael Mann's working methods.

''I had a look at your website. You have done a lot of solid work here and your collection of THE KEEP materials is impressive. I'm glad that this early work of mine has inspired you so much and I appreciate your continued passion'' ~ MICHAEL MANN on producer Stephane Piter's initial drive behind the project.
 




Michael Mann will be remembered as one of the most important and influential voices in American Cinema inspiring a whole new generation of filmmakers. Along with his peers Ridley Scott, Martin Scorsese & Francis Ford Coppola, Mann has pushed the art of storytelling and his body of work will remain a vital piece of modern film history in many years to come.

THE KEEP is the perfect portal with which to tell that story. The 1980's were a formatively fertile time for Michael Mann in one of the most experimental and exciting decades of his career working in the studio system.

 

Confronting the harsh realities of the filmmaking process A World War II Fairytale will present to you, for the first time, director Michael Mann's enthusiasm for the material, what he wanted to say with THE KEEP and why it remains one of the most personal projects of his career.

 

Ben Wheatley talks about his interest in Michael Mann's THE KEEP, exclusively for A World War II Fairytale

 

 

"Good Luck with the rest of the journey, I can't wait to see your masterpiece" -  Louis Leterrier - Director - The Incredible Hulk, Clash of the Titans.

 

 

Director/Producer Stewart Buck

As a result of an intensive study in film over the past ten years, Buck has built up relationships with some of the most respected directors, writers and artists of the last 30 years through his knowledge of film and film history, including the multi-award winning British artist Philip Ridley (The Reflecting Skin) and Oscar-winning political filmmaker Michael Wadleigh (Woodstock).

With Buck's feature length directorial debut A World War II Fairytale, the director aims to break away from the more traditional retrospective into territory explored in George Hickenlooper's Hearts of Darkness: A Filmmaker's Apocalypse & Frank Pavichs' recent documentary on Alejandro Jodorowsky's unrealised adaptation of Frank Herbert's Dune.

You can find out more about Buck's other upcoming projects here;

http://www.imdb.me/stewartbuck

 

Stephane Piter - Producer/Special Effects Make-up Artist & Historian on THE KEEP.

Stéphane Piter is a passionate special effects make-up artist and plastic art specialist in France. You can peruse his work on the Lune Rouge website linked below and in “Cinema Special Effects/ Art section/ Press Section” pages on www.the-keep.ath.cx. My other interests include filmmaking, professional studies and education, as well as visual creation.
http://www.lunerouge.org/spip/article.php3?id_article=260 

 

Alex Kuciw - Producer
After an 11-year tenure at international commercial production giant Hungry Man, editing, writing and directing commercial spots, short films and web series, Kuciw began his own boutique production company in 2010. At the helm of Django Media, he produced a segment of the horror anthology V/H/S, several promos for ActionFest and the New York Asian Film Festival, and most recently the short film, Saint Frankenstein, which premiered at the Sitges Film Festival.

 

 

WHERE ARE MY FUNDS GOING?

In order for us to get close to a final master of A World War II Fairytale over 65% of our goal will go toward post-production costs in NYC. This part of filmmaking tends to be one of the most expensive and we want to produce the very best final product that we can. After Indiegogo's 5% deduction, the final 30% will contribute to on-going licensing of materials for the documentary, legal and your extra special rewards. However the more we raise beyond our target the more material we can include in the final program.
 

 

 

 

The Future of THE KEEP?

 

If we go way beyond our goal, we'll start to look further into the soundtrack rights with the Tangerine Dream estate, whilst focusing on a long term movement for the film itself, helping to present a serious case for the importance of THE KEEP and preserving its legacy. Michael Mann is aware of our endeavour and we want to present him with only the very best.

 

We have already undertaken a great deal of effort to document an unknown period in Michael Mann's career. Starting completely independently in February 2011, we have financed this project as far as we can go ourselves with the filming of over one hundred interviews across the globe, location footage for five days in North Wales with extras and servicemen who worked on the film, and along with Stephane Piter's comprehensive archive from the last 20 years, we have unearthed a treasure trove of extremely rare material and special content to be included only in this release.

With that, it is testament to our long-term commitment to the project and making sure we deliver something really special for you that Michael Mann would be proud to be associated with.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

 

 

 

First of all, please SHARE this page to as many film and documentary lovers as possible.

 

 

If you cannot contribute personally, that's fine. Whats important is we expand on our community by bringing THE KEEP and Mann's work to a wider audience. Our documentary and rewards help people to learn, be informed and inspired knowing that they will understand a lot more about the filmmaking process and the difficulties a director faces bringing their individual vision to the screen.

Thank you for your support!

 

The movie & soundtrack

Since we started this journey, it was to be expected that we'd receive numerous questions around any future release of THE KEEP movie and/or soundtrack. The first thing to note is that we are not affiliated with Paramount or Michael Mann. They are continually kept informed of what we're doing, but our main focus is to complete the project to the very best standard with the intention of presenting this to Michael next year. Both the film and soundtrack elements will need great time and devotion afforded to it as a separate project and plans to look at what can be done to preserve them. As we've explained above this is really the beginning of the future of THE KEEP and we will do our utmost to support that activity and encouragement.
 

If the project doesn't reach it's funding goal, do I get my money back?

We're doing a Flexible funding Campaign, so even if we fall short of our goal, we will nonetheless put whatever we raise towards A World War II Fairytale's post-production and you will get your perks. 

When will the perks be delivered?

It will take some time to deliver such a huge project in a relatively short space of time given the fact further negotiation and licensing of materials will be required during the post-production phase. As well as creating and making your rewards and additional extras to the very best standard and quality possible, we have spent the last two years introducing the project to various production companies and distributors. With all of that in mind there may be delays affecting the final delivery dates we've anticipated, but we will keep you informed and updated if we start to foresee any of these delays.

Each perk has it's rough delivery month listed and we'll do our utmost to get them to you as soon as possible. 

I put the wrong e-mail address on Indiegogo and I'm afraid I won't receive my perk. How do I fix that?

Please send an email to dinu121passproductions@gmail.com and we will update your new e-mail address manually to our database.

How do I update my shipping address?

Send your new address to dinu121passproductions@gmail.com and we will update our files accordingly.

How will the funders be kept informed during and after the campaign?

We will be frequently updating our Indiegogo page, as well as our Facebook and Twitter accounts and official website.  Also look out for updates on this page & in your inbox from Indiegogo. They'll be updates directly from the producers during post-production and location reports from Romania next year!

However the more we raise beyond our target the more material we can include in the final program.   

 
The Future of THE KEEP? If we go way beyond our goal, we'll start to look further into the soundtrack rights with the Tangerine Dream estate, whilst focusing on a long term movement for the film itself, helping to present a serious case for the importance of THE KEEP and preserving its legacy. Michael Mann is aware of our endeavour and we want to present him with only the very best. 
We have already undertaken a great deal of effort to document an unknown period in Michael Mann's career. Starting completely independently in February 2011, we have financed this project as far as we can go ourselves with the filming of over one hundred interviews across the globe, location footage for five days in North Wales with extras and servicemen who worked on the film, and along with Stephane Piter's comprehensive archive from the last 20 years, we have unearthed a treasure trove of extremely rare material and special content to be included only in this release.
With that, it is testament to our long-term commitment to the project and making sure we deliver something really special for you that Michael Mann would be proud to be associated with.
Other Ways You Can Help 
 
 
 
 First of all, please SHARE this page to as many film and documentary lovers as possible. 
 If you cannot contribute personally, that's fine. Whats important is we expand on our community by bringing THE KEEP and Mann's work to a wider audience. Our documentary and rewards help people to learn, be informed and inspired knowing that they will understand a lot more about the filmmaking process and the difficulties a director faces bringing their individual vision to the screen.Thank you for your support! 
 The movie & soundtrackSince we started this journey, it was to be expected that we'd receive numerous questions around any future release of THE KEEP movie and/or soundtrack. The first thing to note is that we are not affiliated with Paramount or Michael Mann. They are continually kept informed of what we're doing, but our main focus is to complete the project to the very best standard with the intention of presenting this to Michael next year. Both the film and soundtrack elements will need great time and devotion afforded to it as a separate project and plans to look at what can be done to preserve them. As we've explained above this is really the beginning of the future of THE KEEP and we will do our utmost to support that activity and encouragement. If the project doesn't reach it's funding goal, do I get my money back?
We're doing a Flexible funding Campaign, so even if we fall short of our goal, we will nonetheless put whatever we raise towards A World War II Fairytale's post-production and you will get your perks. 
When will the perks be delivered?
It will take some time to deliver such a huge project in a relatively short space of time given the fact further negotiation and licensing of materials will be required during the post-production phase. As well as creating and making your rewards and additional extras to the very best standard and quality possible, we have spent the last two years introducing the project to various production companies and distributors. With all of that in mind there may be delays affecting the final delivery dates we've anticipated, but we will keep you informed and updated if we start to foresee any of these delays. 
Each perk has it's rough delivery month listed and we'll do our utmost to get them to you as soon as possible. 
I put the wrong e-mail address on Indiegogo and I'm afraid I won't receive my perk. How do I fix that?
Please send an email to dinu121passproductions@gmail.com and we will update your new e-mail address manually to our database.
How do I update my shipping address?
Send your new address to dinu121passproductions@gmail.com and we will update our files accordingly.
How will the funders be kept informed during and after the campaign? We will be frequently updating our Indiegogo page, as well as our Facebook and Twitter accounts and official website.  Also look out for updates on this page & in your inbox from Indiegogo. They'll be updates directly from the producers during post-production and location reports from Romania next year!

story:
Synopsis:

Set in California, psychotherapist Dr. Ruby McIntyre has a private practice specializing in uncoupling. While focusing on her patients progress, she begins to question her own abilities and motives.

What's In It For You?
Those that contribute will gain access to a wide variety of awesome incentives*!  Everything from shout outs, credits in the film, signed scripts, memorabilia and much more!

Please know we understand the state of our country right now and genuinely appreciate generous contributions from people like you. We would like to return the favor by offering a wide variety of incentives for your support!

Incentive Highlights

  • Special Thanks (via Film Credits)
  • Autographed Poster by MC Lyte
  • Autographed Script by MC Lyte
  • Digital Copy of the Film
  • Associate Producer Credit
  • Personalized Thank You Video from MC Lyte
  • Executive Producer Credit

Where does your money go?

  • Cast & Crew payment:  Artists deserve to be paid for their work.
  • Location: A beautifully, textured Downtown Los Angeles loft.
  • Equipment:  Film grade equipment will help us create a cinematic quality film.
  • COVID-Related Fees: WE WANT EVERYONE SAFE! Filmmaking during this time is not impossible, but it comes with an extra cost for safety.
  • Additional Production Cost: Insurance, parking, craft services/catering, wardrobe, hair/makeup, etc. 

Other Ways You Can Help

The number one way to help "Break Up In Love" become a reality is to make a contribution, but there are many other ways to help! The film won't get made unless people know about it, so PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD!

We truly feel our film aims to educate and inspire and will be something that you are proud to be a part of!

Share our IndieGoGo page, email your friends and family, post about us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc!

And don’t forget our hashtags #breakupinlove2020 #BUIL #consciouslyuncoupling

story:
What's this film about?

The films follows Jackie (Ken May), a morgue worker in a small town. Jackie's personal life, is one of chaos and violence! With more than half of the bodies coming through the morgue, is by his helping hand. This killer may think he's going about his murders under the radar, but a small town disgraced Detective (Shane Ryan) is hot on his trail.

  • Shot in somewhat experimental way, this SPLATTER flick is shown uncut, uncensored and entirely too graphic to be given to a distribution and wait for a return... so we are doing it our OWN way, and funding the next project ourselves!
  • Entering the indie horror world, we are met with the same slasher and remake. We hope this hits more of an original take on the slasher flick genre!
  • Not to mention, this film is done... so don't picture what this film can be like... the stills, trailer and final advertisement is all from a finished film ready to be shipped out once the discs arrive!

Starring: Ken May (Robowoman, Tales for the Campfire 3) as the killer and morgue worker, Jackie! Shane Ryan (Samurai Cop 2, Choke) as the Detective, close to being fired and at the end of his mental rope! Doug Waugh (Grosshouse, Death Park: The End) as the comedic lift and co-worker to Jackie! Rebecca Vanguard (Flesh Eater X) playing the grieving daughter being lured into the killers web! Also, starring Wolvie Ironbear & Andy Moon! Directed by SamHel (I Cut Your Flesh, LoveDump, Flesh Eater X) with FX by James Bell of VeryFineCrapVideos

IF YOU HAVEN'T NOTICED...

This slasher flick is finished, and we are finally unveiling it to the world. If you have NOT noticed, the film is also... COMPLETE!! So the only waiting around is for the indiegogo to give us your money... and then us taking that money and making the discs to then send to you! So, what DON'T you have to worry about?

  • The start, filming & editing of an entire film... we already did that!
  • Waiting to see what this film will be like or who will it feature!
  • Will I get my package ever?! (let me reassure you below!)

I have directed over 10+ short films, 2 feature films and EVERYONE has finished, made it onto DVD & Blu-ray and OUT to the buyers and supporters of that film... Sure, they're delays but with your support on indiegogo, it makes it EASIER... to inform supporters of any issues or problems that may delay projects, but THE FILM IS DONE... the only waiting is for the discs to arrive and us shipping that disc to you!

What are we giving you? What are we doing next?

We are simply trying to make the NEXT film so, we decided to give an opportunity to get your hands on this film and let it be a launching pad to our next big film... IF we reach our goal. 

  • We are aiming for $15,000 for our next project... and IF all DVD & Blu-rays sell out, we'll more than double our asking goal! 
  • You, want a SIGNED release? we got it, if you order from this Indiegogo! You want a prop from the film? we saved them for you! Trying to get your name on the NEXT project... maybe, we'll see!
  • The funds will be going (obviously) to manufacture the DVDs, Blurays, Posters & then to our new project!!

    Are there risks?

    Are there risks? not entirely outside; we wanna jump into the next film and aim to shock people with this film! And keep them in awe with the second, and YOU can help out! Regardless, films take a while to make, and we didn't wanna wait too long to make it, so help us out by pre-ordering this horror film, buy props, share indiegogo around and help us reach the goal... Nay, help us go past our goal, and the more money coming in, the bigger we can make the next! $15K, is the MINIMUM goal to make it... imagine if we have $50K...Let's make it happen!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    SHARE IT! A lot of support that comes into indiegogos, and people reaching there goal is based on support and usually they have a name that brings that! A lot of our films are underground and reaching a niche audience with the brutality and graphic content... Now, we are trying to reach a wider audience and we NEED all the help we can get!

A lot of our films are underground and reaching a niche audience with the brutality and graphic content... Now, we are trying to reach a wider audience and we NEED all the help we can get!

story:
Who am I?

Hi! My name is Nace DeSanders. I am an independent writer, director, and producer. Steadily advancing my skills and knowledge as a filmmaker for the past few years, I have independently developed a number of short films, all of which received/ are receiving praise at film festivals! 

It is crucial that I strike while the iron is hot and take the next step which is directing a feature film! Hello Sickness is an extremely personal story that I know needs to be told and, quite frankly, needs to be told by someone who looks like me! Someone with the life experiences I have! 

What Is It?

A totally new, weird experimental feature film, written and directed by Nace DeSanders, Hello Sickness is about a young woman who moves to rural South Africa to care for her sick grandmother but instead gets wrapped up making and avoiding friends. The film heavily plays on the reliable narrator technique to create a surreal atmosphere in a truly unique story.

What We Need

So at the moment, the budget for Hello Sickness is about $100,000 USD. We have secured some funding (about $25,000) but are looking to supplement that through this campaign. Your money will go towards things like...

  • Purchasing the funky vintage props
  • Purchasing the plane tickets for the few foreign cast members
  • Renting out the beautiful locations
  • Feeding the hardworking (and limited) cast and crew!

Why Is It Important?

Hello Sickness will allow me and many of those involved to gain valuable learning experiences. This will allow us to shoot more and better films in the future!

By supporting this film, you are not just helping a single film get made, you are kickstarting the careers of multiple young, female filmmakers!

After making the first feature film, it becomes MUCH easier to reach out to production companies and studios. The first feature film is proof that we are serious as young filmmakers.

You want more women in film? This is your chance to support that!

Check out the FAQ section for more information!

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully understand that after the global pandemic (that is still very much happening), many people are not in a space, financially, to donate to projects like this one anymore.

 Please do not feel any pressure to donate if you're not able to right now! But there are still other ways you can help! Share this campaign with friends and family, let them know that any and all help is greatly appreciated. Call up the rich aunt! Send a link to your comfortably retired friend's grandpa! Whoever you know!

Tell anyone who donates to mention that you referred them, and we'll make sure to send you something special as a thank you!

I appreciate and love you!

How can we see your previous work?

The information for all of my shorts are below:

Infatuation is a 4-minute experimental short film developed in February of 2020. Making bold statements about race, beauty, fetishization, and art, Infatuation was my debut short film that managed to be a smash hit! It screened at about ten film festivals, winning awards such as best cinematography, best experimental short, best short, and best female director. 

Video Link: https://vimeo.com/554600879/

Password: mannequins 

IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13432934/

Webpage: https://nacedesanders.com/infatuation/

The Wounded and The Watcher is a 6-minute experimental short film developed in November of 2020. My second short film explores social media’s role in pacifying its users in the face of world events, specifically tragedy. It is already set to be screened at a number of film festivals and is guaranteed to receive accolades.

Video Link: https://vimeo.com/572562065

Password: twtw

IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt14915914/?ref_=nm_flmg_dr_3/

Webpage: https://nacedesanders.com/the-wounded-and-the-watcher/

Charlie’s Theater is a 15-minute experimental short film developed in March of 2021. My third short film is about a young woman who deals with her fear of aging through maladaptive daydreaming. The film received corporate sponsors such as VitaCoco and Little Bird Kitchen and had the Bushwick Film Festival’s CEO, Kweighbaye Kotee, as a producer. We plan to complete the post-production process in October of 2021. Afterwhich, it will be screened at film festivals as well.

Video Link: n/a

Password: n/a

IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt14901876/?ref_=nm_knf_t2

Webpage: https://nacedesanders.com/charlies-theater

story:
Synopsis

A 8-12 minute experimental short film. TOUCH follows a queer love story of two post-grads. The relationship is told through their physical interactions with one another rather than depending on dialogue. Alex learns mindfulness with Talia, signaling a magical glow that protrudes out of them in moments of deep content. Unfortunately, both of them are in a transitional period in life. Talia is avoiding the impending reality of adulthood when she gets accepted to a job in a new city. Meanwhile, Alex must comes to terms with the fact that their relationship will be cut short and must learn to appreciate the time they share.

Directors Statement

Hi! My name is Hanna Rose Biebel, a senior cinema student at Elon University. My reasoning for wanting to tell this story is based on its central themes -- mindfulness, and intimacy. Practicing mindfulness offers me peace within my body, mind, and physical surroundings. Being able to interpret mindfulness in this short film will send the message to my audience, and reinforce it in my own head, that these moments are extremely gratifying and a beautiful part of the human experience. The same goes for intimacy. What it means to be intimate with someone. How wonderful it feels to be in the moment with someone, and how foreign it can feel when that moment is gone. Both mindfulness and intimacy can feel ethereal at times which is what I want to capture in this short.

The Impact

Your contribution to this project will help make a positive impact to the LGBT+ film genre. Many LGBT+ films are centered around the same storylines, such as coming out and accepting themselves for who they are. This is where TOUCH comes in, it's moved on from that. This is a story of young love through the eyes of body language and physical affection. It's a universal language and something every person craves.

The Team

This is a true collaboration of Elon's cinema department! This project represents a chance for all involved to learn and grow as artists. Additional students from other departments at our school will be joining in the near future. 

Writer/Director: Hanna Rose Biebel, senior 

Producer: Alex Chadwick, sophomore 

Director of photography + Camera operator: Rebecca Potters, junior

1st and 2nd AC: MK Douglas, senior 

Gaffer: Hector Lopez, junior

Sound mixer: Ben O'Connor, junior

Budget 

This budget allows us to make this short possible! We want to ensure the crew is well taken care of and nourished on set. An original score will be created in paid partnership with students from Elon University’s music department. A nominal acting fee will also be set aside for our actresses from the theatre school. Other costs include props, locations, transportation, and practical effects.

Other Ways to Help

Not everyone is in the position to donate money, but that's totally okay! You can still help support our vision. Spread the word to your friends and family, and share our campaign on social media too! <3

story:
INTRODUCTION

Avatar: Flames of Ren is a short action film based on the universe of the animated series Avatar: The Last Airbender by Michael Dante DiMartino and Bryan Konietzko.

Avatar: Flames of Ren is about a young firebender who embarks on a dangerous quest to find and kill the avatar.

Ethan De Guzman as 'Ren'  (look-test, 2021)

Personal Note:

I began this personal project out of passion for filmmaking, martial arts and the ATLA series. Watching the series as a kid, the profound spiritual journey of Aang and the emotional self-discovery of Zuko made a powerful impact on me growing up and has, in many ways shaped my personal values.

Avatar: Flames of Ren is a spiritual journey of self discovery and acceptance.  This project is my quest, as a filmmaker, to express something similar as creative and as entertaining as possible within a short film.

I originally started this project way back in 2016. However, the project had been shelved.  This year however, because of a growing interest from my short clip (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C5KI01ENSNU) I decided to revive the project and try again here at Indiegogo.

 

STORY

Our story takes place a few generations following Avatar Wan. Imagine a war-torn world before the four nations were even established. It is a time when the Avatar’s existence was still just a rumour not known to many and only understood by a few.

Ren, a young firebender, lost everything. He is a victim of war, haunted by nightmares of a horrible past - visions of fire, blood and echoing screams. Amidst all this destruction, were those unforgettable, terrifying, glowing eyes staring back at him - the Avatar.

We follow Ren as he searches for the Avatar for whom no one has seen in decades. Through his journey, his hateful flames grow furious as he becomes stronger. Ren endures many obstacles including fierce battles against other elemental benders.

With only a scroll depicting a spiritual tree to lead his way Ren eventually finds the Avatar who has been seemingly waiting for him. They fight a fierce battle but Ren is quickly overwhelmed. The Avatar is about to kill him when a strange but familiar power awakens within and he is able to deflect the final blow. Ren’s eyes glow and the Avatar in front of him fades away smiling.

Ren’s anger had severely blinded him from the truth - that he is the next Avatar and has always been. His fierce hate towards the Avatar had blocked his spiritual connection. His journey has allowed him to breakthrough. Thus he is able to discover himself.

Well, would you look at that, Flames of Ren is exactly what Zuko was blabbing about: "you must look in yourself, to save yourself from your other self. Only then will your true self, reveal itself."

 

 

FIGHT SCENES

We want to give fans the fight scenes that they have been craving for.  As fans would know, bending in Avatar is based on specific styles of Chinese martial arts.

Firebending - Northern Shaolin

Earthbending - Southern Kung fu

Airbending - Baguazhang

Waterbending - Tai Chi

As a passionate wushu* practitioner myself, I am very particular and strict about fight sequences.  I believe that it is important to be authentic and to clearly showcase the martial arts roots of each elemental bending style. It will be exciting to work with my coach and teammates from NZ Wushu who are all too familiar with these.

*Wushu us a compound of all Chinese traditional Martial arts.

Coach Wei Zhao demonstrating Tai Chi and 'Soft Fist' (Waterbending)

 

WEAPONS

In the real world, Northern Shaolin, southern kung fu, Baguazhang and Tai Chi also actually use a variety of weapons within their styles.

In the original ATLA series, we saw elemental bending with weapons: we saw a lot of Aang with his staff, briefly with Kyoshi and her fans, even an earthbender with hammers and Zuko with dual broadswords. However we did not see much of it.

As such, I also want to explore elemental bending with weapons. I believe that it would be exciting and refreshing to see. 

Waterbender weilding a Jian (straightsword) - also used in Tai Chi

 

Funding

Avatar: Flames of Ren is an action short film. Action is already hard enough to film morever action with elemental simulations! Most of the funding will go towards VFX which is the hardest part of this project.

As you can imagine, a project like this requires a lot of time and resources. A lack of funding is the only thing holding us back. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

We offer some exciting rewards for those who sponsor us including an exclusive White Lotus challenge coin and tailor-made cinematic costumes which will be made by our talented costume designer Jay Conanan.

Costumes / Wardrobe look-test (old cast of 2016, new cast is being determined)

 

We are also offering a Filmmaker's Pack for filmmakers that might be interested in how this whole process was brought about. How the story was written, approach in cinematography, grading, choreography - everything from pre-production, production and post-production including setting up this crowdfunding campaign. In collaboration with Zack McCarthy from CG Visuals, we are also giving away Trapcode Elements for those who avail of the Filmmaker's Pack.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_NvXgqMPbFE

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are open to all the help we can get.  If you're a VFX artist, 3D modeler, dynamics simulator, matte painter, compositor or storyboard artist, you are all welcome.  Also, if you think you can help in other ways please email joey.de.guzman90@gmail.com

If you'd like to support us in other ways, please do share this page around!

Please visit our social media accounts!

http://www.facebook.com/AvatarFlamesofRen/

https://www.instagram.com/flamesofren

https://www.tiktok.com/@flamesofren?lang=en

 

Stretch Goals

$20,000 - With this, we will be able to spend more on great VFX for awesome looking elemental simulations - which are understandably time consuming and expensive.

$40,000 - With more than double the budget, we will be able to extend action scenes and spend even more on VFX. While telling a good story is important, let's be honest, most people are looking to being entertained with awesome fight sequences - and those are expensive!

$70,000 - With this accomplishment, we can have a bigger crew, better cameras, more cinematic lenses! This makes for a greater quality short action film!

$100,000 - Woah! That's a lot! Is that even possible? We can only dream! But with this achievement, we can go all out and make something truly epic - more intense fight scenes, extended sets for gorgeous landscapes, longer story and just an overall better cinematic experience.

 

CONCLUSION

I love Avatar, martial arts and filmmaking. Avatar: Ren’s Flames is all three in one and would be a dream come true for me personally. It is a passion project promising exciting bending fight scenes and a meaningful experience. If this campaign is successful, we will be releasing the short film online for all to enjoy.

I am really excited to bring this project to life and can only happen with your help. If you are even a little bit excited about this as I am and you’d like to help out, please sponsor us today!
story_txt:
INTRODUCTION
Avatar: Flames of Ren is a short action film based on the universe of the animated series Avatar: The Last Airbender by Michael Dante DiMartino and Bryan Konietzko.
Avatar: Flames of Ren is about a young firebender who embarks on a dangerous quest to find and kill the avatar.

Ethan De Guzman as 'Ren'  (look-test, 2021)
Personal Note:
I began this personal project out of passion for filmmaking, martial arts and the ATLA series. Watching the series as a kid, the profound spiritual journey of Aang and the emotional self-discovery of Zuko made a powerful impact on me growing up and has, in many ways shaped my personal values.
Avatar: Flames of Ren is a spiritual journey of self discovery and acceptance.  This project is my quest, as a filmmaker, to express something similar as creative and as entertaining as possible within a short film.
I originally started this project way back in 2016. However, the project had been shelved.  This year however, because of a growing interest from my short clip (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C5KI01ENSNU) I decided to revive the project and try again here at Indiegogo.

We are also offering a Filmmaker's Pack for filmmakers that might be interested in how this whole process was brought about. story:
Greetings film fans thank you for a few minutes of your time. We are Little Spark Films an indie production team operating out of DFW Tx and WAGES OF SIN is our teams newest project.

A micro budget feature,  blending of Drama, Horror and Comedy. It's the story of strung out lawyer Sinclair Niedenthal in the late 90's, whose world is falling apart. Procuring a sleazy motel room in secret there are only two things he wants; a stress free night with no hassles and a big bag of dope. Unfortunately he will only be getting the latter as things soon take a turn for the weird, when after a physical altercation with Darby, a pizza delivery man, Sinclair determines the only option is to take him captive. Escalating the rest of the night into a drug-fueled battle of wills for survival.

What We Need & What You Get

Even on a small production like hours cost Mount up pretty quickly. On this project we've essentially cut all of the fat but that still leaves a lot of things to be covered. From location rentals, set dressing, original wardrobe Construction, props construction and Rentals, maintaining our equipment, makeup and practical effects, feeding cast and crew, boarding and transportation, post-production special effects and sound as well as the extra money we will be putting towards ensuring that we will have a COVID-19 SAFE SET! Not to mention, this is always important but especially in the times we're in now, we need to be able to pay our crew a living wage. Too many small Productions ask their Crew to give their all and get very little back but right now with working on a movie set being more dangerous than ever and making a living so much harder we find this to be unacceptable.

As you can see there is so much that needs to go in to every aspect to make this film work but luckily we're the guys who know how to make it work. However that only can happen with your help and just like with our crew we are not asking you to give us something for nothing. We have 25 reward tiers for contributors ranging from digital copies of the film and soundtrack to t-shirts, set worn wardrobe and W.O.S. sock puppet friends. Then the upper tiers offer an awesome custom pizza box goody crate full of various stickers, patches, pins and other movie memorabilia as well as producer credit tiers. Lots of fun goodies for every price range so make sure to check out the full list.

The Impact

In the wake of Covid-19 financing any movie is a tough sale but as you can tell from the above description (& our video) this film is not what you would consider the norm and as such it makes it exceedingly difficult to secure independent financing. Which is why the support of you, the viewing public matters so much in this endeavor.  
Cinema is at an interesting yet tumultuous Nexus point right now. Due to a Confluence of outside forces such as the rise in streaming media and the recent pandemic now all movies are forced to contend with movies that would have been the theatrical releases from major studios and as such movies like WAGES OF SIN are getting fewer and fewer. However the upside to that is that when one does come along and is crafted exceptionally well it becomes more visible. We want to make something that is against the grain, something Fearless, something that shows that all film can be art if handled properly; That embodies the core ideals of what Indie film making it supposed to be. We have the experience, the team and the vision but again we can't do it without you. 
We at Little Spark Films in the last year alone have completed 8 commercials, 3 music videos, 2 short films and a feature film. All of which have been completed on time, on budget and have exceeded expectation. A record we fully intend to maintain with WAGES OF SIN.

 

OUR TEAM FOR WAGES OF SIN

For Wages of Sin we have Ty Addams stepping into the directors chair right off of production of his 1st feature: THE MAN WHO LEFT NOTHING.


In order to visually capture the twisted tone of the film we have the Uber Jorg himself Jörg Viktor Steins-lauß as cinematographer bringing his considerable talents to the table.


On Practical make up effects we have the macabre makeup madness of the exceptional Tori Yeager.


For our two leads we have Nathan Gershon known for Robowoman and the upcoming Aamzon series Panic; as lude lawyer Sinclair Niedenthal. And Nerdscum Cory W Ahre of Bloodsucker's Handbook and Sacrament the Film in the role of pizza delivery guy Darby Burroughs.


Overseeing the production we have Catalina Querida and Joe Manco co-founding members of LSF and talented directors in their own right having completed dozens of commercials, music videos and films. Check out the website at www.LittleSparkFilms.net

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for your time reading this far into this and if you still are reading then clearly want to help but we also know that not everybody in these times are able to contribute financially and that is okay. You might not be able to help us out in that way but potentially you could introduce this campaign to someone who could by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and other social media platforms using the Indiegogo share tools.

We are grateful for any assistance we receive and once again thank you very much for your time and interest from all of us at Little Spark Films.

Thank you for your time reading this far into this and if you still are reading then clearly want to help but we also know that not everybody in these times are able to contribute financially and that is okay. You might not be able to help us out in that way but potentially you could introduce this campaign to someone who could by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and other social media platforms using the Indiegogo share tools.
We are grateful for any assistance we receive and once again thank you very much for your time and interest from all of us at Little Spark Films.

story:
An old man wandering the mountains alone… a young couple seeking to get their relationship back on track… a storm on the horizon— what happens when these worlds collide? 

THUNDERCLAP is a story about the lingering pain of war.

In a cabin in South Carolina a veteran of Iraq meets an older veteran, and their mutual issues of P.T.S.D. forge an unexpected bond of healing. 

We’re dedicating this short film to those that suffer with P.T.S.D. and for all those who care for them. We think it is an important film that needs to be made, we need your help to make it! 

As a relative of a Vietnam veteran told me: He fought his war every day of his life, even when he was asleep.

In case you’re not familiar, shorts films are often stepping stones to feature films, and are categories unto themselves at the Academy Awards. (This year’s Live Action winner, The Neighbor’s Window, is available on sites such as Vimeo and YouTube.)  

              

So, who are we? Well, the production team first met at the Beaufort International Film Festival… 

Wally Marzano-Lesnevich, is a screenwriter, producer, director and actor. His feature film  Almost Paris premiered at the Tribeca Film Festival, and was distributed by Freestyle Digital Media. During the film’s festival run it received the Audience Choice Award at the Beaufort International Film Festival and Best Screenplay at the Golden Door Film Festival. He has three features in development, and has made numerous shorts (you may see a few on his website at (http://www.wallyml.com.) 

           

Raymond Smith is an experienced educator who recently moved into documentary film making. His film Voices from Vietnam: Reflecting at the Wall explores the experiences of Vietnam war veterans, and the stories that inspires that documentary inform our short film. Voices from Vietnam aired on ETV and PBS stations across the country. Ray is also the founder of the Doko Film Fest, a not-for-profit national film festival showcasing high school filmmaking. Wally has presented master classes at Doko Film Fest, and Andrew has been an integral part of their production team. 

         

Andrew Smith is a young film maker responsible for the filming and editing of Voices from Vietnam: Reflecting at the Wall. Andrew is also an experienced videographer in the corporate world.

Pete Goldberg has a musical career spanning 40+ years across  a wide range of musical idioms, included are; Jazz, Rock, Classical, Bluegrass and Musical Theater. Pete studied music at New York University and the Berklee College of Music. He has performed as a band leader and as an accompanist in area clubs, concerts and corporate settings. He will bring this eclectic set of influences and experiences to the music of Thunderclap.

How can you help make this short film a reality? 

We need your financial support to make this happen! 

We love this story, so we are providing our interest and production time free; however, we need your financial support to rent our location, pay for our crew and actors, and rent some extra equipment. Any contribution you can make is deeply valued and you will be aiding others to understand this issue which is suffered by so many.

story:
The Team

Writer/Director

Aimee Graham is an award-winning filmmaker. After working as an actor for over 20 years she returned to school in pursuit of her love for storytelling and recently graduated from USC’s School of Cinematic Arts with a Bachelor of Arts in Cinematic Arts, Film and Television Production. While at USC, Aimee’s first short film, Mayfly premiered as part of Visionfest’s celebration of the best of Los Angeles independent film. Her second short, Command Z premiered at So Cal Creative and Innovative Film Festival, a festival honoring the creativity and innovation inspired by the limitations of working with low budgets. Her most recent short film, Customer Service, starring Richmond Arquette and Justine Bateman premiered at LA Shorts Film Festival, won the audience award at the Williamsburg International Film Festival and has screened at numerous festivals. Other films Aimee served as producer, cinematographer, production designer and editor have toured the festival circuit and won prestigious awards.

Executive Producer

Ron Krauss received his first break working for Roger Corman in the art department, where he learned all aspects of filmmaking. He moved on to produce and direct music videos and commercials while starting his own production company, Aron Productions. His first short film, Puppies For Sale (1998), starring Jack Lemmon garnered critical acclaim winning "Best Short Film" in more than twenty film festivals worldwide. Krauss went on to produce Chicken Soup For The Soul (1999-2001), writing and directing several episodes. Krauss also served as producer for Beyond The Glory, a documentary series profiling some of the most legendary athletes in history. An episode on Carl Lewis he wrote, produced, and directed led to an Emmy nomination for the show. Krauss made his feature debut with Rave and followed Rave with his second feature Alienhunter, a science fiction picture starring James Spader.

In 2008 Krauss started his new company Day 28 Films, combining his experience in documentary film and humanitarian efforts to create a media company that focuses on inspirational and socially relevant entertainment dealing with the human condition. Krauss then wrote, produced and directed, Amexica, a story set in the underworld of human trafficking. He worked closely with several anti-human trafficking organizations to create an accurate portrayal and raise awareness in the fight against this global issue. It was screened in the United Nations. In January 2014, Krauss’ third feature, Gimme Shelter starring Vanessa Hudgens, Rosario Dawson, Brendan Fraiser and James Earl Jones released in theaters. The film was inspired by a true story of a pregnant teenager and her experiences with Kathy DiFiore’s Several Sources Shelters.

Producer

Ken Morris believes in strong, character-driven content with an emphasis on diversity of stories and crew because the more we listen to each other, the more we learn from each other. A 2016 graduate of the American Film Institute (where he produced the award-winning short film The Fare and earned his MFA), Ken Morris is a writer-producer with over a dozen short films, two features, and countless other projects under his belt. Obseldia, his second feature, premiered at the Sundance Film Festival in 2010 and won the Alfred P. Sloan Prize and Excellence in Cinematography and is currently available online through Cinedigm. The Fare, Ken’s AFI thesis project has received the Hispanic Heritage Foundation’s Short Film Award, Honorable Mention at the Cleveland International Film Festival, and has appeared at festivals across the world. He resides in Los Angeles with his writing partner and wife, Amber Morris. 

Scientific Advisors

Daniel P. Stark, PhD., Caltech 2008; Assistant Professor, University of Arizona

Bhwana Motwani: Graduate Student in Astrophysics, Caltech 2021

The Actors

Terence

Owen Beckman has over a dozen prime time television credits and leading roles in thriller, The New Republic and Dream Boy, starring Rooney Mara, which played at Berlin, Athens, Chicago and New York International Film Festivals, Owen Beckman is an actor on the rise. His ability to get to the depth of a character, creating nuanced and fleshed out performances without resorting to stereotypes is compelling to watch.

Belle

Gretchen Lodge earned rave reviews from the New York Times for her performance in Lovely Molly, shown at Toronto International Film Festival, South by Southwest and Edinburgh Film Festival, to name a few. Her recent film Camera Obscura premiered at the Florida International Film Festival this April and continues to tour the festival circuit. A fearless actress with tons of range and complexity, Gretchen Lodge is a captivating force to be reckoned with.

What We Need & What You Get

We aim to raise 50,000 or more in August to fund production in September 2017. 

Funds will ONLY be used for the production of The Allnighter: cast, crew, equipment, locations, insurance, permits and food. What is raised will be used to make this film happen. Which means... if we raise twenty dollars... we will make the film for twenty dollars. But damn, that would be hard. 

We are excited about your involvement! Many perks are listed... If there is anything you would like - but do not see -- please reach out. If possible, we will make a perk especially for -- You!

The Impact

For many filmmakers making your first feature is challenging which is why these platforms are vital, they allow fresh, diverse voices to be heard. If you are interested in new faces, independent cinema, supporting more women in the media, please consider coming along for the ride...

Other Ways You Can Help

Sincere appreciation for taking the time to read, review and consider our project. If you are not able to contribute... no worries. Your support will be deeply felt if perhaps you can utilize the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about The Allnighter  -- Facebook, Twitter, Instagram -- whatever social media floats your boat! Heck, if you give us a "like" it means the world!

Thanks again! Happy travels! And hope you join us for this journey!
story_txt:
The Team
Writer/Director

Aimee Graham is an award-winning filmmaker. After working as an actor for over 20 years she returned to school in pursuit of her love for storytelling and recently graduated from USC’s School of Cinematic Arts with a Bachelor of Arts in Cinematic Arts, Film and Television Production. While at USC, Aimee’s first short film, Mayfly premiered as part of Visionfest’s celebration of the best of Los Angeles independent film. Her second short, Command Z premiered at So Cal Creative and Innovative Film Festival, a festival honoring the creativity and innovation inspired by the limitations of working with low budgets. Her most recent short film, Customer Service, starring Richmond Arquette and Justine Bateman premiered at LA Shorts Film Festival, won the audience award at the Williamsburg International Film Festival and has screened at numerous festivals. Other films Aimee served as producer, cinematographer, production designer and editor have toured the festival circuit and won prestigious awards.
Executive Producer

Ron Krauss received his first break working for Roger Corman in the art department, where he learned all aspects of filmmaking. He moved on to produce and direct music videos and commercials while starting his own production company, Aron Productions. His first short film, Puppies For Sale (1998), starring Jack Lemmon garnered critical acclaim winning "Best Short Film" in more than twenty film festivals worldwide. Krauss went on to produce Chicken Soup For The Soul (1999-2001), writing and directing several episodes. Krauss also served as producer for Beyond The Glory, a documentary series profiling some of the most legendary athletes in history. An episode on Carl Lewis he wrote, produced, and directed led to an Emmy nomination for the show. Krauss made his feature debut with Rave and followed Rave with his second feature Alienhunter, a science fiction picture starring James Spader.
In 2008 Krauss started his new company Day 28 Films, combining his experience in documentary film and humanitarian efforts to create a media company that focuses on inspirational and socially relevant entertainment dealing with the human condition. Krauss then wrote, produced and directed, Amexica, a story set in the underworld of human trafficking. He worked closely with several anti-human trafficking organizations to create an accurate portrayal and raise awareness in the fight against this global issue. It was screened in the United Nations. In January 2014, Krauss’ third feature, Gimme Shelter starring Vanessa Hudgens, Rosario Dawson, Brendan Fraiser and James Earl Jones released in theaters. The film was inspired by a true story of a pregnant teenager and her experiences with Kathy DiFiore’s Several Sources Shelters.
Producer

Ken Morris believes in strong, character-driven content with an emphasis on diversity of stories and crew because the more we listen to each other, the more we learn from each other. A 2016 graduate of the American Film Institute (where he produced the award-winning short film The Fare and earned his MFA), Ken Morris is a writer-producer with over a dozen short films, two features, and countless other projects under his belt. Obseldia, his second feature, premiered at the Sundance Film Festival in 2010 and won the Alfred P. Sloan Prize and Excellence in Cinematography and is currently available online through Cinedigm. The Fare, Ken’s AFI thesis project has received the Hispanic Heritage Foundation’s Short Film Award, Honorable Mention at the Cleveland International Film Festival, and has appeared at festivals across the world. He resides in Los Angeles with his writing partner and wife, Amber Morris.

Daniel P. Stark, PhD., Caltech 2008; Assistant Professor, University of Arizona

Bhwana Motwani: Graduate Student in Astrophysics, Caltech 2021

Terence

Owen Beckman has over a dozen prime time television credits and leading roles in thriller, The New Republic and Dream Boy, starring Rooney Mara, which played at Berlin, Athens, Chicago and New York International Film Festivals, Owen Beckman is an actor on the rise. His ability to get to the depth of a character, creating nuanced and fleshed out performances without resorting to stereotypes is compelling to watch.
Belle

Gretchen Lodge earned rave reviews from the New York Times for her performance in Lovely Molly, shown at Toronto International Film Festival, South by Southwest and Edinburgh Film Festival, to name a few. Her recent film Camera Obscura premiered at the Florida International Film Festival this April and continues to tour the festival circuit. A fearless actress with tons of range and complexity, Gretchen Lodge is a captivating force to be reckoned with.

Your support will be deeply felt if perhaps you can utilize the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about The Allnighter  -- Facebook, Twitter, Instagram -- whatever social media floats your boat! Heck, if you give us a "like" it means the world!Thanks again! Happy travels! And hope you join us for this journey!

story:
INSPIRATION BEHIND THIS PROJECT

All throughout growing up, I was overweight. I was very aware of my size at a very young age. Don't get me wrong, my parents put me in every sport you could imagine and I danced throughout my entire childhood. As a child in both musical theatre and dance communities, being overweight made fitting in, let alone succeeding, very difficult.

I remember weighing 123lbs in 6th grade, and by my freshmen year of high school, I was 180lbs. In middle school, I’d wear two sports bras for fear I’d be made fun of because I was too saggy, and in high school I’d wear an abdominal compression guard (AKA Spanx) under my clothes. I hate the world that made me feel like I needed to wear these constricting undergarments in order to achieve what it said I needed to be — thin, small, perfect. I had a difficult time being cast in musicals as a high schooler, making me think the reason behind this was indeed my weight.

In college, I rapidly lost an astronomical amount of weight -- I was the smallest I'd ever been to this day. But this wasn't because I was more healthy or more active. It's because I've always thought that in order to be a "successful" actor, singer, dancer, I'd have to be thinner, smaller, skinnier. I started getting cast, gained praise for losing weight, and had an overall successful college musical theatre career... on paper. What nobody knew was that I was counting every single calorie I ate, I was obsessed with tracking my food intake, I was running 2 miles a day ON TOP OF spending hours in dance classes, rehearsals, and at the gym.

The summer after I graduated college with my BFA in musical theatre, I was cast in Music Theatre Wichita's production of 42nd Street. At this point in my health journey, I was the smallest I had ever been in my life. I was on a paleo diet, eating less than 1,000 calories a day. I was spending 8 hours in rehearsals and not allowing myself to eat a single thing off the "goodie" table. To top it all off, I was definitely not eating three full meals a day.

There was one specific cast party during the run of this show that I will never forget -- I didn't even want to go, out of fear that there'd be food I wouldn't allow myself to eat, and people would judge me for not eating it. 

I didn't know it at the time, but in hindsight, this was my lowest point. Though I never experienced exactly what Gemma goes through in this film, it's very clear to me that so many people do. This breaks my heart, and it should break yours too.

Stemming from a true series of events, I felt compelled to tell this story for myself, for female musical theatre majors, and for females in the entertainment industry everywhere. The toxic ideologies and stigmas presented in the film are *still* very much present in the entertainment industry today, and have been for years and years and years.

My question to myself is: "Megan, how are you going to fight for change within these systems?" 

My answer to this question is and always has been through my art.

I am determined to get this project seen by those who need to see it. I hope to start conversations, and get people talking.

Awareness of the problem is step one.

Awareness of the solution is step two.

 

WHERE DOES MY MONEY GO?

Into the film — to pay the actors, the crew, the DP, the assistant director, for sound, and for post production. I am raising $12k for a two-day shoot in LA. All funds raised will go to produce this short film. The overall quality of our film is dependent upon if we are able to reach our goal!

BTW, It's very feasible to shoot and fund post production with this budget.

Donations will cover payment for: 

1. Paying creatives

+ Actors

+ First AD

+ Director of Photography

+ Lighting and Sound

+ Hair/Makeup

+ Production Assistants

 

2. Production costs

+ Equipment Rentals

+ Location

+ Food

+ Props

+Wardrobe

+ Fundraising Costs

 

3. Post-production costs —

+ Editor

+ Sound Mixer

+ Colorist

+ Post Crew

 

4. Safety

 + COVID-19 safety costs

+ Insurance

 

WHAT ARE THE PERKS??

+ Digital film poster

+ Megan's 32-bar audition song cut

+ Special Social Media Shoutout

+ Special thank-you in the credits of the film

+ First access to the final cut

+ Behind the scenes sneak peek

+ Downloadable theme song

+ Associate Producer credit

 

THE SOCIAL IMPACT

Body image, body dysmorphia, eating disorders are all very present in our society today. I have witnessed firsthand how the toxicity that exists in the journey of an aspiring musical theatre professional can directly affect their mental health, physical health, psychological health, and emotional health. I firmly believe we, as humans, should never compromise those things in our lives. No industry is worth the cost of your well-being.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

BE ABB'S HYPE PERSON!

+ Repost about us on Instagram -- @abroadwaybody

+ Increase awareness using the Indiegogo share tools

+ Spread the word to your friends, family, peers, co-workers

+ If you know of someone who writes for a newspaper, blog, or has an impactful social media presence, please tell them so they can spread the word as well

+ We also will need food, meals, beverages, for our on set crew + cast

Please email Megan at abroadwaybody@gmail.com to contribute!

TOGETHER, we can get the word out!

 

THE PRODUCTION TEAM

The developmental team for this film is fully female. It's also important to me to strive to hire an entirely female production team as well. Though some men will be involved, I want to provide opportunities for women to fill these roles.

 

DEVELOPMENTAL TEAM ~

Katelyn Stoss, Jennie Hughes, Kristen Bock, Caitlin Flieger

 

CREATIVE TEAM ~

Produced by: Beloved Root

Created by: Megan Gill

Directed by: Emilia Ray

Wardrobe Stylist: Scarlett Dyer

 

Keep an eye out for updates as we cast + hire!

 

WHY ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT BODY IMAGE IN THE ENTERTAINMENT INDUSTRY?

As an actor in the performance industry, the fear of not getting cast due to my weight is still very much present in me, and in many other femxle actors I know. I've experienced my friends being treated in similar ways that Gemma is treated in the film. It's horrifying, to put it bluntly. This toxic conditioning at such a young age forces us actors to hyper-focus on our body image instead of hyper-focusing on our art.

I am inspired to tell this story for women everywhere who can't or couldn't speak up or contradict those upholding these "ideals."

If I can do anything in this world, I hope it’s to impact future generations, and what other way to do so than to target the institutions I have been a part of and the industry I currently work in.

 

DO YOU HAVE BIG PLANS FOR THIS FILM?

One hundred million percent. As an actor, I’ve never dreamed I’d be creating my own short film. However, I never put limitations on myself, and I only hope to continue evolving as an actor. As it turns out, creating your own film project is one of many ways to continue down the road of evolution in that arena.

On another hand, this story needs to be shared with the world.

This story needs to be heard.

I plan to take this baby around the festival circuit.

I strongly believe it should be seen by everyone in the entertainment industry.

I can only hope that this piece to be the example of what not  to do moving forward.

 

SOURCES FROM THE CAMPAIGN VIDEO:

https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/stor...

 

https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/05/theater/broa...

story:
FOLDED IN GREY

Candace Moccia, a once prodigious and now reclusive artist is thrust back into the limelight for what could her final masterpiece showcase only to become possessed by her dead and blood thirsty lover toying with her mind, spiraling her into madness.

 

JUST ANNOUNCED! NFL LEGEND DENARD WALKER JOINS THE CAST OF “FOLDED IN GREY”


 

SARAH NOELLE (BABYLON, WITCHBLOSSOM)

GUY MAYFIELD (BLOOD SOMBRERO, MIDNIGHT DEVILS)

VICTORIA KAIT (FALLEN, MUSIC)

Ethic Dejaun (Double Cross, Folded in Grey)

WE ARE EXCITED TO ANNOUNCE TALENTED ARTIST JEFF SULLIVAN HAS JOINED THE FILM AND WE WILL BE FEATURING HIS WORK!! BIO: Jeff Sullivan is an artist and musician from Connecticut. His work is Inspired by oneness, nature, shamanism, and spirituality. His visionary meditative artworks are a reflection of universal connection, love, and sacred reality generated into writhing sine wave mosaic frequencies. 

WE ARE EXCITED TO ANNOUNCE THAT THE KÜL HAS OFFICIALLY JOINED THE FILM AND BECOME A PART OF THE FILMS SOUNDTRACK ALONGSIDE CAMEO APPEARANCES FROM THE BAND. 
CHECK THEM OUT ON SPOTIFY: https://open.spotify.com/album/46Xnyvqt6KJBvbOG...

WE ARE EXCITED TO ANNOUNCE THAT OVERSCENE HAS OFFICIALLY JOINED THE FILM AND BECOME A PART OF THE FILMS SOUNDTRACK ALONGSIDE CAMEO APPEARANCES FROM THE BAND. 
CHECK THEM OUT ON SPOTIFY: 

https://open.spotify.com/artist/3nA8YmVHTNdIQsz...

 


We are proud to announce ISHI will be joining the soundtrack. Ishi was born as an experiment between friends in Dallas, TX.  In 2006, JT Mudd & Brad Dale set out to create a sound that would redefine their own voice in modern day music.  Their vision was to blend the classic, soulful story-telling and organic instrumentation of traditional folk music, with the infinite sonic possibilities offered through electronic production. Ishi’s ability to successfully walk the line between an ambitious studio act and a multi-sensory live experience allows them to engage their audiences in an uplifting celebration of life. Their subtle undertones of inner-exploration combine to create a concert experience that is unequivocally one-of-a-kind. Check them out: https://open.spotify.com/artist/0PuOTaQilwmrn6x...
