story:
It takes 1 minute to contribute to Queering Yoga! 

It'll help us introduce the practice of yoga to countless Trans & Queer people through this powerful documentary about stories of healing and transformation through yoga! 

Producer/Director Ewan Duarte on the left, Participant Richelle Donigan in the middle, and Director of Photography Avery Hudson on the right take a photo after Richelle's interview for Queering Yoga!!!

QUEERING YOGA!
Queering Yoga explores the intersection of Queer/Trans identities and the burgeoning tradition of yoga. Participants share their stories of transformation and healing through yoga. Queer/Trans filmmakers along with Queer and/or Trans yoga teachers are creating a film by and for our community! 

“Queering yoga” means queering the yoga practice (not the people or participants). “Queering"— as in making a binary, hetero-normative and Western culturally-appropriated spiritual fitness practice work for us as LGBTQIA spectrum people, as well as bringing cultural sensitivity, acknowledging access, oppression, the origins of yoga and how POC folks feel entering a space that is largely straight, white, upper/middle class, cisgender and female. We are stretching/queering yoga to include a lot of people, not simply queer identities. 


Some Questions That Are Explored in Queering Yoga

What is the intersection of Queer/Trans identities and yoga?

How can yoga benefit the lives of Queer/Trans people?

What does empowered and embodied visibility look like for the Queer and Trans communities? 

How It Began

The idea for Queering Yoga arose after I interviewed participant Sparkle Thornton, for an article about the intersection of her Trans identity and yoga practice in 2014 for Original Plumbing Magazine.

http://www.originalplumbing.com/index.php/the-basics/interviews/item/731-an-interview-with-a-trans-yogi

This interview received an overwhelmingly positive response, inspiring us to go further. A documentary is a powerful way to reach a larger audience and to tell empowering stories of Queer and Trans lives from the perspective of Queer/Trans yoga teachers. A film like this has never been made before!

As the Producer/Director of Queering Yoga, I’ve been actively working on the documentary with a wonderful team of Queer/Trans crew members and one ally since May 2015.

So far we’ve filmed five powerful interviews of amazing and dynamic participants who have riveting stories they have shared with us.

To go further and to continue this project we need to raise funds for production costs.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise at least $40,000 to complete production. We cannot get there without your support! We thank our community and allies for your contributions of any amount!

Queering Yoga, is fiscally sponsored by the Center For Independent Documentary. (CID). All contributions are tax deductible! http://documentaries.org


  • Hiring a professional film crew. 
  • Hiring a Graphic Designer, Web Designer, and Editors. 
  • Transportation and travel costs that are involved with the film. This includes traveling to where participants live to interview them or flying them out to the Bay Area. We will be interviewing Chani Nicholas in LA during February 2016. There are more participants to interview who live in other parts of the country besides the SF Bay Area who will be interviewed for the project. 
  • Food. Keeping the film crew and participants well feed during our long shoot days. 
  • Equipment rentals/packages. This includes two cameras, lights, and any other media equipment that we need to rent for the film shoots. 
  • IndieGoGo and fiscal sponsor fees. 

Please participate in helping me finish production on my new film! Just pick a level in the right hand column and click to contribute — it only takes a minute. 


We have fabulous incentives! 

If you want to see this documentary, then join us in supporting Queering Yoga! Let's make it happen! All contributions will help bring the vision of the project to fruition! 
  • We have yoga class offerings with amazing yoga teachers! Skeeter Barker, Sparkle Thornton, and Sterling Taylor in Oakland, CA. One class pass to YogaVibe in Rochester, New York. This is the studio where participant, Jacoby Ballard teaches Queer and Trans Yoga!
  • Yoga class cards to Third Root in Brooklyn, NY. Om Studios in Monterey, CA. Barefoot Movement in Downtown Oakland!
  • One 60 minute private yoga class with Sterling Taylor in Monterey at Om Studios or Left Coast Power Yoga in Oakland!
  • One set of Malas (prayer beads) made by participant, Sterling Taylor!
  • Sparkle Thornton, Queering Yoga Participant will sing a song and play the guitar for you! This incentive includes the digital download of the film!
  • One gift card to Good Vibrations!
  • A Digital Download of Queering Yoga!
  • Holistic Health and Herbal consultations with participant Jacoby Ballard!
  • Queering Yoga T-shirts! 
  • One spot in Jacoby Ballard's, Queer and Trans Yoga Retreat at the Watershed Center in New York! 
  • Lunch with Producer/Director, Ewan Duarte!
  • Two tickets to the SF Bay Area premiere of Queering Yoga!
  • Producer credits in the film! 
  • and more! 
The Impact

Director’s Statement­

There is still so much more education, awareness, and diversity that needs to be represented and seen through mainstream media about Queer and Trans lives. I’m passionate about continuing to create “conscious media”that focuses on authentic representations of Queer and Trans living from empowered and integrated perspectives. As a Queer/Trans filmmaker, I’m all too aware of who is telling our stories. It is so vital for Queer and Trans artists, writers, and filmmakers to be the one’s sharing our own lives and experiences from perspectives that aren’t sensationalized, objectified, or purely for profit.

As a Queer/Trans filmmaker who is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about Queer/Trans cinema and history, there currently isn’t a documentary in existence that represents Trans and/or Queer identified yoga teachers exploring the intersection of yoga and these identities. Queering Yoga is an intimate portrait about the Queer/Trans yoga movement.

It is important for empowered and integrated Queer and Trans lives to be represented in media. It’s time to take our stories into our own hands and hearts and make media about them. Queering Yoga will continue the conversation about Queer and Trans people from an empowered perspective. Queering Yoga explores the intersection of yoga and identity with groundbreaking representation of diverse perspectives from Queer/Trans yoga teachers, made by Queer/Trans filmmakers!

The ancient, Indian origins of yoga are honored and appreciated by the filmmakers and participants of Queering Yoga. Queering Yoga is the continuation of that ancient practice into the hearts and lives of Queer, Trans, Allies, and POC living in the Western world.

As a white (Eastern European Jew, a quarter Mexican, and a quarter German), Queer/Trans individual living in the U.S., I have questioned my purpose in the Queer yoga movement through my own meditations; I've confided in trusted healers, and I offer my intention for this project: To serve in the highest interest of all.

About Producer/Director, Ewan Duarte

Ewan Duarte is a professional writer, artist, educator, and award-winning independent filmmaker based in Oakland, CA. Ewan holds his MFA in Cinema from San Francisco State University. Ewan has had an avid yoga and meditation practice for over 10 years. His prior films, Spiral Transition (2010) and Change Over Time (2013) have won awards and screened in more than 140 film festivals worldwide such as Frameline, BFI London LGBT Film Festival, DC Shorts Film Festival, Rhode Island International Film Festival, Oslo LGBT Film Festival, Melbourne Queer Film Festival, Gender DocuFilm Festival in Roma, Hamburg International Queer Film Festival, Polari Film Festival in Austin, TX, and many more! His articles have been published in LILIPOH Magazine, Original Plumbing Magazine, IndieWIRE, Huffington Post, and the forthcoming anthology, Manifest: Transitional Wisdom on Male Privilege. You can check out his website here: www.ewanduarteproductions.com

Our enormously talented production team also includes:

Avery Hudson: Director of Photography

Asher Jelinsky: Associate Producer

Gwen Park: 1st AC. Web Designer. Videographer

Lanz Travers: Logo Designer. Graphic Designer. 

You can check out the entire list of our wonderful Queering Yoga team and participants on the website: http://www.queeringyoga.com 

Director Ewan Duarte above on the left, Participant Deontre Martin, and Director of Photography Avery Hudson on set after Deontre's interview! 

Queering Yoga Ambassadors: 

Natalie Coblentz

Christopher Curran

Philipe L. Harrington

Zander Keig

Beth Nelson

Maggie Weber-Striplin

Fresh White

We also have a Queering Yoga Community Advisory Board.

Risks and Challenges

We are determined to create an incredible film for you that will play in film festivals all over the world, screen in educational settings, a community screening near you, and in your home on Netflix, Hulu, etc. Queering Yoga is an independent film. Crowdfunding as well as applying for grants are the main avenues of financial support for independent filmmakers to bring their visions to fruition in film/media projects! 

Without crowdfunding, many independent films that you love wouldn't have been made!

We believe in the power and vision of this film! The challenge is to get the funding to make it happen! If you believe in the vision of the project, please contribute today!

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE SHARE THIS LINK! It'll take 1 minute! 

http://igg.me/at/queeringyoga/x/2255848

Share widely on your social media networks! It will take 1-2 minutes of your time to spread the word. The success of our campaign and thus the film being made depends on it. 

  • Write and post on your social media networks why you feel that this film is important and needs to be made! 
  • Email friends, loved ones, family, colleagues, and community members that you feel would be interested in supporting Queering Yoga  and ask them to  contribute and post on social media!
  • Use the IndieGoGo share tools to spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, etc. about the film! 
  • Join the email list and receive exciting updates about the film's progress! Send an email to: queeringyoga@gmail.com 

Thank you for reading and for supporting authentic Queer/Trans stories and lives told from empowering perspectives by Queer/Trans filmmakers! 

I appreciate you and your support! 

In excitement and gratitude,

Ewan Duarte and the entire Queering Yoga team

The talented Queering Yoga crew!!! Director of Photography Avery Hudson, 1st AC Gwen Park, 2nd AC Ericka Sokolower-Shain, Gaffer Gavin Murray, and PA Pablo Vivas on set during filming for Queering Yoga! 

UPDATE: Director's Statement
Some critiques have arisen regarding cultural appropriation for this new community film project that I would like to address. Below is an excerpt that I wrote in the Director's Statement about Queering Yoga. It's on the Queering Yoga film homepage. www.queeringyoga.com

"The ancient, Indian origins of yoga are honored and appreciated by the filmmakers and participants of Queering Yoga. Queering Yoga is the continuation of that ancient practice into the hearts and lives of Queer, Trans, Allies, and POC living in the Western world. 

As a white (Eastern European Jew, a quarter Mexican, and a quarter German), Queer/Trans individual living in the U.S., I have questioned my purpose in the Queer yoga movement through my own meditations; I've confided in trusted healers, and I offer my intention for this project: To serve in the highest interest of all."

I would also like to add that Yoga was brought to America by Indians (from India) for the purpose of elevating the consciousness of Americans and to teach them about yoga. The teachings were brought here so that people in the West could learn the tools and skills of this ancient Spiritual practice and utilize them for personal growth, healing, and transformation. Yoga did not only remain encapsulated in India. 

The Spirit of Yoga is alive in America, helping people to elevate and awaken to a true and kinder state of consciousness. 
The intentions of Queering Yoga are to continue this message and to spread the teachings of yoga through stories of healing and transformation through the practice of yoga from all of the participants in this film. This is expressed through a Queer/Trans perspective. Another intention of the film is to introduce the practice of yoga to countless Queer, Trans, POC, and Allies in the West! To create and nurture inclusive, safe spaces to practice yoga in community! 

Another aim of this project is to show participants who decolonize their yoga practices individually, as a community, and as yoga teachers who are mindful, aware, and honor the Ancient Indian origins of yoga with respect, reverence, and with historical consciousness. 

Half of the participants in Queering Yoga identify as QTPOC. There are QTPOC crew members as well as QTPOC individuals who are on the Community Advisory Board. Queering Yoga is still in the production and crowdfund phases. I'm still interviewing participants for the project and South Asian voices will be included in the film as well as on the Community Advisory Board. To make this happen, I need your support! To continue interviewing participants and filming them for the project, we need to raise more money through our crowdfund campaign to complete production. 

An inspiring documentary that I would like to recommend is AWAKE: The Life Of Yogananda. Yogananda had a spiritual calling to leave India and come to America to teach about yoga as well as other spiritual teachings. I highly recommend this documentary. 

http://www.awaketheyoganandamovie.com

Thank you,

Ewan Duarte

It takes 1 minute to contribute to Queering Yoga! 

It'll help us introduce the practice of yoga to countless Trans & Queer people through this powerful documentary about stories of healing and transformation through yoga! 


Producer/Director Ewan Duarte on the left, Participant Richelle Donigan in the middle, and Director of Photography Avery Hudson on the right take a photo after Richelle's interview for Queering Yoga!!!



QUEERING YOGA!


Queering Yoga explores the intersection of Queer/Trans identities and the burgeoning tradition of yoga. Participants share their stories of transformation and healing through yoga. Queer/Trans filmmakers along with Queer and/or Trans yoga teachers are creating a film by and for our community! 



“Queering yoga” means queering the yoga practice (not the people or participants). “Queering"— as in making
a binary, hetero-normative and Western culturally-appropriated spiritual fitness
practice work for us as LGBTQIA spectrum people, as well as
bringing cultural sensitivity, acknowledging access, oppression, the origins of
yoga and how POC folks feel entering a space that is largely straight, white,
upper/middle class, cisgender and female. We are stretching/queering yoga to
include a lot of people, not simply queer identities. 





Some Questions That Are Explored in Queering Yoga

What is the
intersection of Queer/Trans identities and yoga?
How can yoga
benefit the lives of Queer/Trans people?
What does empowered
and embodied visibility look like for the Queer and Trans communities? 
How It Began

The idea for Queering Yoga arose after I interviewed participant Sparkle Thornton, for an article about the intersection of her
Trans identity and yoga practice in 2014 for Original Plumbing Magazine.
http://www.originalplumbing.com/index.php/the-basics/interviews/item/731-an-interview-with-a-trans-yogi
This
interview received an overwhelmingly positive response, inspiring us to go
further. A documentary is a powerful way to reach a larger audience and to tell
empowering stories of Queer and Trans lives from the perspective of Queer/Trans
yoga teachers. A film like this has never been made before!
As the
Producer/Director of Queering
Yoga, I’ve been actively working on the documentary with a
wonderful team of Queer/Trans crew members and one ally since May 2015.
So far we’ve filmed five powerful interviews of amazing and
dynamic participants who have riveting stories they have shared with us.
To go further and to continue this project we need to raise funds for production costs.  

What We Need & What You Get



We need to raise at least $40,000 to complete production. We cannot get there without your support! We thank our community and allies for your contributions of any amount!
Queering Yoga, is fiscally sponsored by the Center For Independent Documentary. (CID). All contributions are tax deductible! http://documentaries.org




Hiring a professional film crew. 
Hiring a Graphic Designer, Web Designer, and Editors. 
Transportation and travel costs that are involved with the film. This includes traveling to where participants live to interview them or flying them out to the Bay Area. We will be interviewing Chani Nicholas in LA during February 2016. There are more participants to interview who live in other parts of the country besides the SF Bay Area who will be interviewed for the project. 
Food. Keeping the film crew and participants well feed during our long shoot days. 
Equipment rentals/packages. This includes two cameras, lights, and any other media equipment that we need to rent for the film shoots. 
IndieGoGo and fiscal sponsor fees.

and more!

movement. 
It is important for empowered and integrated Queer and Trans lives to be represented

people from an empowered perspective. Queering

The ancient,
Indian origins of yoga are honored and appreciated by the filmmakers and

As a white

story:
Welcome to our Campaign!

We are Equinox Production Group, LLC and we are campaigning for ADDITIONAL funds for our upcoming horror film MORTICIAN!

Mortician is a horror film that follows Edgar Crow and his assistant Cyrus as they begin a dark journey down a path of evil when their Funeral Home gets shut down due to illegal accusations. Meanwhile an FBI Agent begins a hunt for justice after a traumatic encounter with Edgar and Cyrus that will leave him searching for redemption. With a mix of high levels of stress, blood, and bodies this film is set to be a GREAT one!

The cast and crew involved are all passionate and thrilled to be a part of this project and we all are putting our 100% best into this film. That being said with YOUR SUPPORT we can make this film even better with a solid budget!

Here are Interviews from our Directors...

CORI COULTER - Director/Producer

DAVY LANTZ JR - Director/Producer/Actor-Michael

 
Filming did begin back on March 27th and we continue to film through the month of July/early August!
 
Let's meet our CAST!
Our cast is made of all LOCAL Talent in the Maryland, Pennsylvania area as every single one of them are STARS in their own RIGHT! A very PASSIONATE group we have here!
 
Here is the crew we have put together thus far!
This CREW is top notch! Not only do we have the 3 members of EPG leading the way but we also have a very TALENTED Special Effects Supervisor who has worked with many of the OG Special Effects talents in HOLLYWOOD including have the experience himself! Plus we have local celebrity Jesse L Green who not only is credited for EP but also will be playing a small role in the film as our FIRST victim! The MUSIC side of things is going to be AMAZING with the addition of ALFI ALVAREZ on board as our Music Composer for the Score of the film, as he is based out of the NEW JERSEY/NEW YORK AREA and has some good stuff already working towards for this film as you can hear in our 1 minute teaser promo up at the TOP! You can find his other work on his Youtube channel titled Alfi Alvarez where you can hear his album that he produced! Also we have added a local artist who goes by the name Bass Bandicoot aka Randy Nicklas who is based out of Frederick, MD and has hosted and played in many local shows including collaborating with Artists from DC and all over the east coast! Bass Bandicoot will be providing us with a few Original Songs with Lyrics for this film specifically! You can find him on facebook under Bass Bandicoot! We are very excited for these additions!
 
So as you can see we have a fantastic group helming this project! Any help you can give is GUARANTEE to push this film BEYOND it's already expectations!
 
Our Goal for this film when it is completed is to SUBMIT it into a FILM FESTIVAL that has REQUESTED this project! That festival is the SHOCKFEST FILM FESTIVAL! So we do have a plan and a deadline for that amazing opportunity!

What We Need & What You Get

What we are asking for is a goal of $3,000.00 of additional funding.

The funds will go towards these departments...

- Special Effects (Majority of funds) Bigger budget = better special effects!

- Location Permits (Minor of funds) Permits = Better Locations to film!

- Meals for Cast and Crew (Minor of funds) No one likes a HANGRY Crew!

- Music Score (about 5% to 7% of funds if possible) every horror film needs a GREAT SCORE!

What you get for your CONTRIBUTIONS is AWESOME MERCH PERKS!

DVDs

AUTOGRAPH POSTER by Cast and CREW

MOVIE T-SHIRT

PLUS COMBINATION PERKS! (for ex. DVD/T-SHIRT COMBO)

ALSO ROOM FOR MORE PERKS TO COME!

NOTE: ALL PERKS also come with a THANK YOU CREDIT on our IMDB page and in the ENDING CREDITS of the film!

The Impact

YOU are the IMPACT to a GREAT FILM! With your SUPPORT it will help us produce an even BETTER horror film with BETTER special effects and MORE!

Here is a little PROMO from our Executive Producer JESSE L GREEN who also is taking on the role of our FIRST VICTIM...

What a character! Ha
We have great and talented HOMEGROWN people involved that we hope our Impact on you will serve you all with great PRIDE in what YOU can be a part of! With your CONTRIBUTION we will be even more APPRECIATED in your TRUST in US that we will be making this film with FULL 100% of all MONEY RAISED even if we don't reach our goal! We will HONOR everyone's DONATION AND PERKS by the Shipping DATE given!

 

Risks & Challenges

With all RISKS and CHALLENGES there still is the COVID-19 Virus and we will be taking ALL safety precautions while filming this movie! This movie WILL get done by our planned time frame! Now, let's say there are DELAYS in production, we will keep all our CONTRIBUTORS up to date and WILL NOT FAIL at being HONEST and TRANSPARENT with all of YOU!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean YOU can't help:

  • You can SHARE our CAMPAIGN all over SOCIAL MEDIA.
  • YOU can even go to www.facebook.com/MorticianMovie to LIKE, FOLLOW, and SHARE to even keep the WORD OF MOUTH going!

And that's all there is to it!

What you get for your CONTRIBUTIONS is AWESOME MERCH PERKS!
DVDs
AUTOGRAPH POSTER by Cast and CREW
MOVIE T-SHIRT
PLUS COMBINATION PERKS! (for ex. DVD/T-SHIRT COMBO)
ALSO ROOM FOR MORE PERKS TO COME!
NOTE: ALL PERKS also come with a THANK YOU CREDIT on our IMDB page and in the ENDING CREDITS of the film!

The Impact
YOU are the IMPACT to a GREAT FILM! With your SUPPORT it will help us produce an even BETTER horror film with BETTER special effects and MORE!
Here is a little PROMO from our Executive Producer JESSE L GREEN who also is taking on the role of our FIRST VICTIM...

What a character! Ha
We have great and talented HOMEGROWN people involved that we hope our Impact on you will serve you all with great PRIDE in what YOU can be a part of! With your CONTRIBUTION we will be even more APPRECIATED in your TRUST in US that we will be making this film with FULL 100% of all MONEY RAISED even if we don't reach our goal! We will HONOR everyone's DONATION AND PERKS by the Shipping DATE given!
 

Risks & Challenges
With all RISKS and CHALLENGES there still is the COVID-19 Virus and we will be taking ALL safety precautions while filming this movie! This movie WILL get done by our planned time frame! Now, let's say there are DELAYS in production, we will keep all our CONTRIBUTORS up to date and WILL NOT FAIL at being HONEST and TRANSPARENT with all of YOU!
Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean YOU can't help:

You can SHARE our CAMPAIGN all over SOCIAL MEDIA.
YOU can even go to www.facebook.com/MorticianMovie to LIKE, FOLLOW, and SHARE to even keep the WORD OF MOUTH going!

And that's all there is to it!

story:
Short Summary

Brief description: ​ A young couple named Grayson Bailey and Nina Taylor move from Baltimore to Philadelphia to take the next step in their relationship. On a date at Penn’s Landing, Grayson and Nina eat lunch and start people watching. They fantasize about their future family together and joke about getting married. Grayson starts to have stomach pains and it worsens during the night after their date. Something is off. Frantic, Nina rushes Grayson to the hospital in hopes to confirm that he only has a stomach ache. Little did they know that Grayson would be diagnosed with something much worse.

Director's Statement:  I wanted to execute this film project for a couple of reasons. First, I have always enjoyed viewing and now making romance and young adult drama films. I also want to tell this story because I want to expose how anyone can come face to face with life’s finite disposition, regardless of age. Additionally, living in a time like the COVID- 19 pandemic has made me more aware of how relationship dynamics are tested by difficult and uncertain circumstances. Though I wasn’t the one going through cancer or having to immediately take care of someone who had cancer, my Granddad’s cancer scare made me realize just how quickly our lives can change. As I watched the dynamics between my grandparents shift completely when my granddad was diagnosed with Hodgkin’s Lymphoma, I started to wonder how it would feel for someone younger to endure all the new responsibilities that my grandmother had to take on.

Though there are many tragic love stories out there, especially ones that revolve around illness, I haven’t seen many films in this category that revolve around a young couple who is beyond the teenage and/or ”college” age group. The age group of 22-35 is an interesting group to play with because there are so many mature topics to explore. For instance in my film, the two main characters are in their early-mid 20s and in a post-grad mindset of getting established in their careers and taking the next step in their relationship. They are not engaged, but they are moving in that direction. And having a film that plays with the idea of crushing that momentum in their young lives, by implementing colon cancer as an obstacle for their relationship, is something that will differentiate it from the teen drama films that explore romances with an ill character or characters. And it also starts the conversation on how black people, especially black males, younger than the age of 50 can be affected by colon cancer.

- Reigna Wren, Writer and Director of In Sickness And...

What We Need & What You Get

Shooting a strong, portfolio-quality film during this unprecedented time of the COVID-19 pandemic places extraordinary pressures on student filmmakers and all filmmakers in a number of ways: expense-wise, resource-wise and execution-wise.  The process of making a short film or feature-length film is already exorbitant. Renting equipment and spaces to film in; catering; legal clearances; and being able to hire professional actors and non-student team members for the film all contribute to the typical expenses of making a quality narrative film. The COVID-19 pandemic certainly introduces new, additional expenses to the process in order to follow proper COVID-19 protocols for shooting on sets. Such protocols require purchasing  proper masks, face shields, sanitizers and gloves; securing testing for everyone involved in the the film; and, extending the shooting time in order to reduce the number of hours of daily exposure to accomplish social distancing. Though shooting during these times can put a lot of pressure on the team, it is a very timely opportunity for those who are students on the team as filmmakers to learn how to work in all types of environments and think on our feet. Please know that your assistance through donations to this film will provide a huge support toward bringing, “ In Sickness And...” to life as it is envisioned. At the same time, your support will help prepare and further develop student filmmakers with a skill set to make a strong, professional level product in all types of environments despite unforeseen circumstances. We greatly appreciate your consideration and support!

 

The perks for contributing to the funding of this film are as follows:

 

Those who donate $25 will receive an, “ In Sickness And ...” Thank You collage card of the cast and crew head shots. 

 

Those who donate $50 will receive a shout out post on our social media platforms for the "In Sickness And…” film. 

 

Those who donate $75 will receive an, “In Sickness And... “ Poster Print. 

 

Those who donate $100 will receive a custom designed cloth mask for the “In Sickness And... “ film. 

 

Those who donate $200 will receive a signed script of “In Sickness And...” (10 available)

 

Those who donate $300 will receive access to an exclusive digital screening and Q&A with the cast and crew of “In Sickness And...”. 

 

Those who donate $500+ will receive all perks mentioned above and an Executive Producer listing in the credits.

The Impact

This is director Reigna Wren's largest film project to date. And she is super excited about getting to film this ambitious project in the spring! The In Sickness And... team is a diverse group of Black, Feminine, and LGBTQ+ identifying filmmakers. By supporting this project, you are helping young, female, BIPOC, and LGBTQ+ voices be heard across the arts and cinema. And allowing us to create a film that is festival quality. Like many budding filmmakers, it is our dream to go to major festivals like the Tribeca Film Festival, the  Atlanta Film Festival, Sundance, and so much more. But, before we can submit to these festivals, we need the funding to first make a great film. By attending these festivals with this film, it will allow the filmmakers on this project to receive notoriety for their hard work and build a network as they go into the industry and establish their career as creatives! 

Risks & Challenges

Shooting during the COVID-19 pandemic is no small feat and is something that our team takes very serious. Normally, shooting a project this size wouldn't take more than three days with 14-hour filming sessions. But, with the new COVID-19 compliance rules for shooting on sets, our shoot is extended by two days due to having fewer crew members on set at a time. We'll have to take shifts to set up each scene in a socially distanced manner.  These time-consuming, precautionary steps must be taken each shooting day which cannot exceed 10-hours. More days to shoot means more days we have to pay for each set, greater equipment rental fees, and more pay for the actors and crew for the extended shooting time. Several months of educating ourselves on the SAG-AFTRA and other COVID-19 film union protocols have gone into preparation for filming during these times. To help execute this film as planned, we will take COVID-19 tests a week before the shoot; socially distance and quarantine leading up to and during times off of the set; wear proper PPE; and ensure that all team members are sanitizing and using the equipment and spaces safely. COVID-19 safety agreements and insurance coverage has been established to further ensure the safety of our cast and crew. Taking these steps put us one step further towards completing this project! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you in advance for contributing to this project. We hope that you feel inspired to share this project with your friends and family and help us reach our goal. Every little bit helps and is certainly appreciated. We can't thank you enough for taking the time to read about this project and support our team!

story:
The Project

Vibrant. Romantic. Dynamic.

'Make-Believers' will be a first-of-its-kind, Hollywood-influenced, musical rom-com drama set in Japan.  
We will be working with a group of talented young composers and filmmakers.  (Listen to our one of the five original songs for the film here):

ミュージカルには以前から興味がありました。ミュージカルの要素である、“振り付けや構成の美しさ”“感情に訴えかける音楽”で、言葉にならない感情を表現することができるからです。


Join us on our journey toward making a range of musical numbers from soaring to heartfelt, designing vibrant dance-sequence imagery and delivering emotional drama... 

そこで、こうした重要なテーマとミュージカルを掛け合わせ、非現実的な美しさを作り出したいと考えました。

私たちの目標は、インディペンデントで、オリジナルの日本のミュージカル映画を作ることです。

... while channeling the charm and breezy vibes of Woody Allen films like Everyone Says I Love You 

...Midnight in Paris ....

...with contemporary film musicals... 

Marking the feature film debut of Kenjo McCurtain, award-winning writer/director of the short films 'Automation': 

and 'The Widow (Yamome)'  

 

Our Story

Masa, late 30s, is an uptight singleton living in Tokyo as a manga writer who learns that his estranged father is on the verge of death after a stroke. In a moment of reflection, realizing that, as an only son, and unmarried that his father may have expected more of him, Masa hires a rental actress, Kanako, to fool his father into thinking that he has a fiancée.  

Kanako, lost and lonely in the big city, harbors dreams of stardom as a stage performer and uses her job as a springboard to improve her acting skills. Ultimately, she's disillusioned by the task of lying to strangers. 

As the months go by with Kanako's visits, Masa soon falls for her and starts to write anonymous love letters. While in reality their relationship is stilted and impersonal, with the lyrical and eloquently-written letters, Masa finds a way to Kanako's heart.  

主人公は内気で独身の漫画家。

疎遠だった父が危篤であることを知る。充実した姿を最後に見せようと、妻としてレンタルファミリーの女優を雇い、偽りの事実を作る。

しかし、思いがけず父の病状が良くなり、それと共に彼らの嘘が明らかになっていく。

And she soon begins to write back to her secret admirer.  It becomes apparent that only in their faceless communications can they have a meaningful relationship.  

And only through song can they truly express themselves… Is it too late for him to reveal himself before she makes a move to further her career?  

And how will they maintain their lies as the father's death delays and the family learns of Masa's new love? 

 

Our Team

KENJO MCCURTAIN - Writer / Director ・脚本・監督

 Kenjo McCurtain is an award-winning filmmaker who moved to Japan to pursue his craft after graduating with a BA in Film Studies in the UK, where his work was screened at the university's annual film festival.  Kenjo has written and directed four short films. Make-Believers , a five-year labor of love, will be his feature film debut as director.  Works: ‘Necropolis’ (2014): selected for the Fukuoka Independent Short Film Festival and ranked in Yahoo's top ten videos online thereafter;  ‘Automation’ (2017) winner of Best Director and Best Actor at the English Riviera Film Festival, Official Selection at Bali International Film Festival and Hollywood Verge Awards;  ‘Yamome’ (2018) winner of the Independent World Best Short Film Award at Mt. Fuji Atami Film Festival, Best Actress and Best Drama Short at Genre Celebration Film Festival, the 2019 Shorties Film Festival Best Editing and Best Film winner, and Official Selection for various film festivals worldwide;  ‘Transmission’ (2019) a psychological-horror short beginning its festival run in late-2019.  Kenjo is a Kyoto Filmmakers' Lab alumni and bilingual in English and Japanese. 
イギリスで生まれ、西イングランド大学（UWE）で映画を学び、卒業後は第二の母国日本に在住。自ら企画と脚本を書き、これまでに４つの短編を監督。現代社会における問題と孤独をテーマに描いている。2016年の京都フィルムメーカーズラボ卒業生。

上映・受賞歴： 
「ネクロポリス」２０１４年　福岡インディペンデント映画祭。　
人間社会に対するA.I.の限界について描かれた短編ドラマ「オートーメーション」は
2017年English Riviera Film Festival（イギリス）最優秀監督賞・最優秀俳優賞。日本だけではなく海外の映画祭でも多数ノミネート。
人間の孤独について描かれた短編ドラマ「やもめ」2018年　は熱海国際映画祭1000本以上の中から最優秀インディペンデントワールド短編賞 ・アジアンシネマトグラフィーアワード受賞・Shorties Film Festivalアジ ア短編最優秀、編集最優秀・Genre Celebration Film Festival女優最優秀賞、短篇ドラマ最優秀賞。
最新作は、監督初のホラー・サスペンス短編映画「トランズミッション」は今秋上映予定。

KEITA YUGOSHI - Cinematographer ・　撮影監督

A Fukuoka-native and graduate from Kyushu University, Keita has worked in TV & film production for over 11 years - starting with his employment at Tohoku Shinsha, one of Japan's leading media and production companies. In 2018, he made his film debut as cinematographer with "Until Rainbow Dawn", a feature film that screened at a number of international LGBT film festivals. He also recently worked as cinematographer on "Kakurenbo", an award-winner at Osaka Nakanoshima Film Festival. 
福岡出身　九州大学大学院芸術工学府 芸術工学専攻卒業　2008年 東北新社 入社　2018年 デビュー 2018年にカメラマンとしてデビューしました。まだ新人ですが、積極的に新しいカメラや機材を取り入れて 新しい映像表現を追求していきたいと思っています。お仕事お待ちしています。 自主製作映画「虹色の朝が来るまで」：ニューヨークLGBT映画祭・香港LGBT映画祭・レインボーリール東京にて上映 自主製作映画「かく恋慕」：大阪中ノ島映画祭優秀賞

HUMPHREY MORGAN - Producer・プロヂューサー

Since graduating with a BA in Film, Humphrey has worked in various capacities of film production and distribution. Chiefly, he has been in involved in film festival operations, such as that of the BFI London Film Festival as well as the Tokyo Film Festival. In 2011, he established the successful film blog, 'Film in Japan'. He has since partnered with Kenjo, helping to produce the short films 'Automation', 'Yamome' and 'Transmission'. As of 2019, Humphrey is managing operations at the Tokyo-based, independent film company, Shirokuma Films.
2011年から自身のブログ「フィルムインジャパン」を開設。
ケンジョウ監督の短編作品「オートーメーション、やもめ、トランスミッション」の制作活動を行う。2019年SHIROKUMA FILMSを設立。

LUNA INABA - Composer / Arranger・作曲家

Luna is an internationally-recognized concert pianist and composer, winning awards both in her native Japan as well as abroad. She first graduated from the Yuhigaoka High School music department. Later she graduated from the musical department of the prestigious Tokyo University of the Arts, studying composition under the tutelage of Tsuruta Mutsuo, and piano under the likes of Yoriko Inaba, Nobuko Minai, Kumiko Hattori, Ronald Cavaye, and Hitoshi Kobayashi. While still enrolled at university, 2002 saw the release of Luna's debut with "LUZ DE LA LUNA"; albums two "LOVE SONGS" (an iTunes featured release) and three "Blue Moon" (her first to fully feature original songs) where to follow later. In the following year, she made her first recital, performing at the famed Tokyo Bunka Kaikan. From then on she has continued to perform at concerts and events both at home and overseas. Aside from her piano work, Luna has also composed music for video games and television, and has begun a move into film. 
   Official Website: http://inabaluna.com/
大阪府立夕陽丘高校音楽科卒業。東京藝術大学音楽学部器楽科ピアノ専攻卒業。作曲を鶴田睦男、ピアノを稲葉依子、御薬袋宣子、服部久美子、Ronald Cavaye、小林仁の各氏に師事。国内外で多数受賞歴がある。
大学在学中の2002年にキングレコードよりデビューCD「ルス・デ・ラ・ルナ～月の光～」をリリース。 その翌年デビューリサイタルを東京文化会館にて実施。以来、国内外でのコンサート、イベント等での演奏活動を行っている。また、音楽番組をはじめドラマにも複数出演。2ndアルバムの「LOVE SONGS」はiTunesにて配信中。3rdアルバムは自身初となる全曲オリジナルの「Blue Moon」を制作。現在はピアニストとしての活動の他に、ゲームソフトや番組の音楽制作、映画への楽曲提供など作曲家としてのフィールドも広げている。
オフィシャルサイト http://inabaluna.com/

SAYURI HIRAYAMA - Choreographer・振付師

 A ballet dancer from a young age, SaUrI began her professional dancing career while at university. Currently she specializes in a wide range of musical genres that include ballet, contemporary jazz, house dance, as well as many more. SaUrI has performed in and choreographed various commercials, stage works and events in Japan, working with an array of famous artists in the process. While involved in choreography, teaching and casting in the entertainment industry, she also continues to receive inquiries for various corporate events. SaUrI has been offered special study abroad programs in New York, Italy, and the Philippines – holding dance workshops, and performing in shows. More recently, SaUrI continues to perform and choreograph, while moving into the realms of acting and modeling.
ダンサー・振付家。
幼少期からバレエ、ダンスを始め、大学在学中からプロダンサーとしてのキャリアをスタート。現在はバレエ、ジャズコンテンポラリー、ハウスを中心に幅広いジャンルの実力を持つオールラウンダー。
国内では様々なCM・舞台・イベント等の出演・振付を行い、有名アーティストとも多数共演。企業向けイベントの引き合いも多く、振付や指導、キャスティングにも関わる。ニューヨーク、イタリア、フィリピンなどでの特待生留学、ダンスWS開催、ショー経験も持つ。
慶應大学卒業後、リクルートに入社し、会社員とダンサーを両立。営業として通期MVPを受賞。新規事業に関わる経験も。最近では女優やモデル等、さらに活躍の場を広げている。

MASAMI KAKINUMA - Lyricist ・作詞家

An acclaimed lyricist, Masami has been writing songs for a host of popular national artists of the likes of Johnny's World, Johnny's Jr, JUJU, ASAKA, among many others. She has won the ShortShorts Film Festival's Bookshorts Excellence Award, the 'Earth' project sponsorship excellence award, as well as the Hoppy Happy Award. Aside from lyric compositions, Masami is also an author.
東京都出身。舞台ジャニーズワールド、ジャニーズJr、JUJU、アニソンシンガー亜咲花など作詞家として活動。ショートショートフィルムフェスティバルアジアのBookShortsにて各月優秀賞・アース製薬協賛企画優秀賞・HOPPY HAPPY AWARD佳作賞などショートショート小説も書いている。

CAST

TAKASHI KAWAGUCHI - Masa・マサ役

Takashi is a graduate of the New National Theater of Tokyo, debuting on stage in a Japanese production of Salome. He has performed in a variety of plays and films thereafter, with main roles in 'The Winslow Boy' and 'Twenty-four Eyes'.  In 2018, he starred in the award-winning Japanese feature film 'Bad Poetry Tokyo' for which his performance was highly acclaimed. 
新国立劇場演劇研修所第5期生として学び、舞台「サロメ」(新国立劇場)でデビュー。その後、様々な舞台や映像作品に出演。主な出演作に「ウィンズロウ・ボーイ」(新国立劇場 鈴木裕美演出)、「あわれ彼女は娼婦」(新国立劇場 栗山民也演出)、ドラマ「二十四の瞳」など。2018年に出演した映画「Bad Poetry Tokyo」(Anshul Chauhan監督)は国内外の映画祭で多数受賞。

YUKI MORIKAWA - Kanako ・カナコ役

An accomplished dancer and performer, Yuki became fascinated with the performing arts from an early age, and began learning modern dance from the age of five. After graduating from the New National Theater of Tokyo, she made her stage debut in 2013. Her notable performances include "Kokugo Gannen', 'Winslow Boy', and 'Reba'. 'Make-Believers' will be her feature film debut. 
５歳よりモダンダンスを習い始め、舞台に魅了される。
新国立劇場演劇研修所第６期生として学び、2013年にデビュー。
以降、國語元年(制作:こまつ座 演出:栗山民也) 、ウィンズロウ・ボーイ(制作:新国立劇場 演出:鈴木裕実)、レバア(制作:西瓜糖 演出:寺十吾)など、舞台を中心に活動中。

SHOUTA HATORI  - Tomoki ・トモキ役

Spurned on by a love of historical dramas and period films as a child, Shouta decided to go the route of an actor.  Stage works: Shimbashi Ensemble Performance “Yamato San Musashi” “Hakkenden”, Musical “Billy Eliot” “South Pacific”, Miyamoto Amon-Directed “Tai Goten” ・ The movie “High & LOW THE RED RAIN”. Shouta continues to expand his work in a variety of mediums from small theater plays to moving images. 

幼少期に見た時代劇に魅了され俳優の道へ。 ・舞台：新橋演舞場公演『大和三銃士』『八犬伝』、ミュージカル『ビリー・エリオット』『南太平洋』、宮本亜門演出『狸御殿』 ・映画『High&LOW THE RED RAIN』 など小劇場からミュージカル、映像と幅広く活動している。

Risks & Challenges

We are at an early stage of our production. We plan to shoot this film over 14 days in December.

But a musical demands a lot of preparation and our project is still a work in progress... a lot of elements need to come together to work.

Because of the nature of our film, with a long period of rehearsals, composing, and choreography to get through, we are vulnerable to potential delays that could see the production dates pushed back to early 2020.

Things are going well however, and if we manage to avoid any major setbacks, we will be able to meet that shoot date!

We're currently developing and recording the 5 original songs, hiring our dancers and extras and getting ready to choreograph the dance sequences.

For September/October we're planning casting sessions, rehearsals and location scouting.

As for the funding - it will be a big boost to allow us to commence all these processes. It will go to studio rental, the costs of recording and engineering the songs, the rehearsals, and the costs of locations, as well as cast and crew payment.

Any small amount will be a huge boost and we are deeply passionate about making this film happen. Thank you!

リターンについて

お礼のはがきや一部のグッズに関しては、本作品終了後1ヶ月以内で発送予定です。

・エンドロールへのお名前掲載
・映画DVDのご提供
・映画出演権（エキストラ）
・プロダクトプレイスメント（商品や店舗を映画内に）
・プロデューサークレジット


現在、制作の初期段階にあります。撮影は12月から2週間かけて、インディーズスタイルで行う予定です。撮影を12月から始める理由としては、ミュージカルの要素である音楽の製作や、ダンスレッスンに多くの時間が必要となるからです。すでに録音してある1曲以外にも、他に4曲を製作・録音し、ダンサーやエキストラを選抜し稽古をしなければ、リハーサルやロケハンを進めることもできません。また、こうした制作準備を進める上で、資金調達が大変重要になってきます。スタジオのレンタルや録音、曲のエンジニアリングには莫大な費用がかかります。

わずかな金額でも、私たちが情熱を捧げるこの作品にとって大きな助けとなります。ぜひご協力いただければ幸いです。

本プロジェクトはAll-in方式で実施します。目標金額に満たない場合も、計画を実行し、リターンをお届けします。

日本中で話題になる美しいミュージカル映画を作りたいと思っています。

皆様ぜひ力を貸してください！

よろしくお願いします！！
story_txt:
The Project
Vibrant. Romantic. Dynamic.
'Make-Believers' will be a first-of-its-kind, Hollywood-influenced, musical rom-com drama set in Japan.  We will be working with a group of talented young composers and filmmakers.  (Listen to our one of the five original songs for the film here):
ミュージカルには以前から興味がありました。ミュージカルの要素である、“振り付けや構成の美しさ”“感情に訴えかける音楽”で、言葉にならない感情を表現することができるからです。

Join us on our journey toward making a range of musical numbers from soaring to heartfelt, designing vibrant dance-sequence imagery and delivering emotional drama... 
そこで、こうした重要なテーマとミュージカルを掛け合わせ、非現実的な美しさを作り出したいと考えました。
私たちの目標は、インディペンデントで、オリジナルの日本のミュージカル映画を作ることです。
... while channeling the charm and breezy vibes of Woody Allen films like Everyone Says I Love You 

...Midnight in Paris ....

...with contemporary film musicals... 

Marking the feature film debut of Kenjo McCurtain, award-winning writer/director of the short films 'Automation': 

and 'The Widow (Yamome)'  


 
Our Story
Masa, late 30s, is an uptight singleton living in Tokyo as a manga writer who learns that his estranged father is on the verge of death after a stroke. In a moment of reflection, realizing that, as an only son, and unmarried that his father may have expected more of him, Masa hires a rental actress, Kanako, to fool his father into thinking that he has a fiancée.  
Kanako, lost and lonely in the big city, harbors dreams of stardom as a stage performer and uses her job as a springboard to improve her acting skills. Ultimately, she's disillusioned by the task of lying to strangers. 
As the months go by with Kanako's visits, Masa soon falls for her and starts to write anonymous love letters. While in reality their relationship is stilted and impersonal, with the lyrical and eloquently-written letters, Masa finds a way to Kanako's heart.  
主人公は内気で独身の漫画家。
疎遠だった父が危篤であることを知る。充実した姿を最後に見せようと、妻としてレンタルファミリーの女優を雇い、偽りの事実を作る。
しかし、思いがけず父の病状が良くなり、それと共に彼らの嘘が明らかになっていく。
And she soon begins to write back to her secret admirer.  It becomes apparent that only in their faceless communications can they have a meaningful relationship.  
And only through song can they truly express themselves… Is it too late for him to reveal himself before she makes a move to further her career?  
And how will they maintain their lies as the father's death delays and the family learns of Masa's new love? 


 
Our Team
KENJO MCCURTAIN - Writer / Director ・脚本・監督
 Kenjo McCurtain is an award-winning filmmaker who moved to Japan to pursue his craft after graduating with a BA in Film Studies in the UK, where his work was screened at the university's annual film festival.  Kenjo has written and directed four short films. Make-Believers , a five-year labor of love, will be his feature film debut as director.  Works: ‘Necropolis’ (2014): selected for the Fukuoka Independent Short Film Festival and ranked in Yahoo's top ten videos online thereafter;  ‘Automation’ (2017) winner of Best Director and Best Actor at the English Riviera Film Festival, Official Selection at Bali International Film Festival and Hollywood Verge Awards;  ‘Yamome’ (2018) winner of the Independent World Best Short Film Award at Mt. Fuji Atami Film Festival, Best Actress and Best Drama Short at Genre Celebration Film Festival, the 2019 Shorties Film Festival Best Editing and Best Film winner, and Official Selection for various film festivals worldwide;  ‘Transmission’ (2019) a psychological-horror short beginning its festival run in late-2019.  Kenjo is a Kyoto Filmmakers' Lab alumni and bilingual in English and Japanese. イギリスで生まれ、西イングランド大学（UWE）で映画を学び、卒業後は第二の母国日本に在住。自ら企画と脚本を書き、これまでに４つの短編を監督。現代社会における問題と孤独をテーマに描いている。2016年の京都フィルムメーカーズラボ卒業生。
上映・受賞歴： 「ネクロポリス」２０１４年　福岡インディペンデント映画祭。　人間社会に対するA.I.の限界について描かれた短編ドラマ「オートーメーション」は2017年English Riviera Film Festival（イギリス）最優秀監督賞・最優秀俳優賞。日本だけではなく海外の映画祭でも多数ノミネート。人間の孤独について描かれた短編ドラマ「やもめ」2018年　は熱海国際映画祭1000本以上の中から最優秀インディペンデントワールド短編賞 ・アジアンシネマトグラフィーアワード受賞・Shorties Film Festivalアジ ア短編最優秀、編集最優秀・Genre Celebration Film Festival女優最優秀賞、短篇ドラマ最優秀賞。最新作は、監督初のホラー・サスペンス短編映画「トランズミッション」は今秋上映予定。
KEITA YUGOSHI - Cinematographer ・　撮影監督

A Fukuoka-native and graduate from Kyushu University, Keita has worked in TV & film production for over 11 years - starting with his employment at Tohoku Shinsha, one of Japan's leading media and production companies. In 2018, he made his film debut as cinematographer with "Until Rainbow Dawn", a feature film that screened at a number of international LGBT film festivals. He also recently worked as cinematographer on "Kakurenbo", an award-winner at Osaka Nakanoshima Film Festival. 福岡出身　九州大学大学院芸術工学府 芸術工学専攻卒業　2008年 東北新社 入社　2018年 デビュー 2018年にカメラマンとしてデビューしました。まだ新人ですが、積極的に新しいカメラや機材を取り入れて 新しい映像表現を追求していきたいと思っています。お仕事お待ちしています。 自主製作映画「虹色の朝が来るまで」：ニューヨークLGBT映画祭・香港LGBT映画祭・レインボーリール東京にて上映 自主製作映画「かく恋慕」：大阪中ノ島映画祭優秀賞
HUMPHREY MORGAN - Producer・プロヂューサー

Since graduating with a BA in Film, Humphrey has worked in various capacities of film production and distribution. Chiefly, he has been in involved in film festival operations, such as that of the BFI London Film Festival as well as the Tokyo Film Festival. In 2011, he established the successful film blog, 'Film in Japan'. He has since partnered with Kenjo, helping to produce the short films 'Automation', 'Yamome' and 'Transmission'. As of 2019, Humphrey is managing operations at the Tokyo-based, independent film company, Shirokuma Films.2011年から自身のブログ「フィルムインジャパン」を開設。ケンジョウ監督の短編作品「オートーメーション、やもめ、トランスミッション」の制作活動を行う。2019年SHIROKUMA FILMSを設立。
LUNA INABA - Composer / Arranger・作曲家

Luna is an internationally-recognized concert pianist and composer, winning awards both in her native Japan as well as abroad. She first graduated from the Yuhigaoka High School music department. Later she graduated from the musical department of the prestigious Tokyo University of the Arts, studying composition under the tutelage of Tsuruta Mutsuo, and piano under the likes of Yoriko Inaba, Nobuko Minai, Kumiko Hattori, Ronald Cavaye, and Hitoshi Kobayashi. While still enrolled at university, 2002 saw the release of Luna's debut with "LUZ DE LA LUNA"; albums two "LOVE SONGS" (an iTunes featured release) and three "Blue Moon" (her first to fully feature original songs) where to follow later. In the following year, she made her first recital, performing at the famed Tokyo Bunka Kaikan. From then on she has continued to perform at concerts and events both at home and overseas. Aside from her piano work, Luna has also composed music for video games and television, and has begun a move into film.    Official Website: http://inabaluna.com/大阪府立夕陽丘高校音楽科卒業。東京藝術大学音楽学部器楽科ピアノ専攻卒業。作曲を鶴田睦男、ピアノを稲葉依子、御薬袋宣子、服部久美子、Ronald Cavaye、小林仁の各氏に師事。国内外で多数受賞歴がある。大学在学中の2002年にキングレコードよりデビューCD「ルス・デ・ラ・ルナ～月の光～」をリリース。 その翌年デビューリサイタルを東京文化会館にて実施。以来、国内外でのコンサート、イベント等での演奏活動を行っている。また、音楽番組をはじめドラマにも複数出演。2ndアルバムの「LOVE SONGS」はiTunesにて配信中。3rdアルバムは自身初となる全曲オリジナルの「Blue Moon」を制作。現在はピアニストとしての活動の他に、ゲームソフトや番組の音楽制作、映画への楽曲提供など作曲家としてのフィールドも広げている。オフィシャルサイト http://inabaluna.com/
SAYURI HIRAYAMA - Choreographer・振付師

 A ballet dancer from a young age, SaUrI began her professional dancing career while at university. Currently she specializes in a wide range of musical genres that include ballet, contemporary jazz, house dance, as well as many more. SaUrI has performed in and choreographed various commercials, stage works and events in Japan, working with an array of famous artists in the process. While involved in choreography, teaching and casting in the entertainment industry, she also continues to receive inquiries for various corporate events. SaUrI has been offered special study abroad programs in New York, Italy, and the Philippines – holding dance workshops, and performing in shows. More recently, SaUrI continues to perform and choreograph, while moving into the realms of acting and modeling.ダンサー・振付家。幼少期からバレエ、ダンスを始め、大学在学中からプロダンサーとしてのキャリアをスタート。現在はバレエ、ジャズコンテンポラリー、ハウスを中心に幅広いジャンルの実力を持つオールラウンダー。国内では様々なCM・舞台・イベント等の出演・振付を行い、有名アーティストとも多数共演。企業向けイベントの引き合いも多く、振付や指導、キャスティングにも関わる。ニューヨーク、イタリア、フィリピンなどでの特待生留学、ダンスWS開催、ショー経験も持つ。慶應大学卒業後、リクルートに入社し、会社員とダンサーを両立。営業として通期MVPを受賞。新規事業に関わる経験も。最近では女優やモデル等、さらに活躍の場を広げている。
MASAMI KAKINUMA - Lyricist ・作詞家

An acclaimed lyricist, Masami has been writing songs for a host of popular national artists of the likes of Johnny's World, Johnny's Jr, JUJU, ASAKA, among many others. She has won the ShortShorts Film Festival's Bookshorts Excellence Award, the 'Earth' project sponsorship excellence award, as well as the Hoppy Happy Award. Aside from lyric compositions, Masami is also an author.東京都出身。舞台ジャニーズワールド、ジャニーズJr、JUJU、アニソンシンガー亜咲花など作詞家として活動。ショートショートフィルムフェスティバルアジアのBookShortsにて各月優秀賞・アース製薬協賛企画優秀賞・HOPPY HAPPY AWARD佳作賞などショートショート小説も書いている。
CAST
TAKASHI KAWAGUCHI - Masa・マサ役

Takashi is a graduate of the New National Theater of Tokyo, debuting on stage in a Japanese production of Salome. He has performed in a variety of plays and films thereafter, with main roles in 'The Winslow Boy' and 'Twenty-four Eyes'.  In 2018, he starred in the award-winning Japanese feature film 'Bad Poetry Tokyo' for which his performance was highly acclaimed. 新国立劇場演劇研修所第5期生として学び、舞台「サロメ」(新国立劇場)でデビュー。その後、様々な舞台や映像作品に出演。主な出演作に「ウィンズロウ・ボーイ」(新国立劇場 鈴木裕美演出)、「あわれ彼女は娼婦」(新国立劇場 栗山民也演出)、ドラマ「二十四の瞳」など。2018年に出演した映画「Bad Poetry Tokyo」(Anshul Chauhan監督)は国内外の映画祭で多数受賞。
YUKI MORIKAWA - Kanako ・カナコ役

An accomplished dancer and performer, Yuki became fascinated with the performing arts from an early age, and began learning modern dance from the age of five. After graduating from the New National Theater of Tokyo, she made her stage debut in 2013. Her notable performances include "Kokugo Gannen', 'Winslow Boy', and 'Reba'. 'Make-Believers' will be her feature film debut. ５歳よりモダンダンスを習い始め、舞台に魅了される。新国立劇場演劇研修所第６期生として学び、2013年にデビュー。以降、國語元年(制作:こまつ座 演出:栗山民也) 、ウィンズロウ・ボーイ(制作:新国立劇場 演出:鈴木裕実)、レバア(制作:西瓜糖 演出:寺十吾)など、舞台を中心に活動中。
SHOUTA HATORI  - Tomoki ・トモキ役

Spurned on by a love of historical dramas and period films as a child, Shouta decided to go the route of an actor.  Stage works: Shimbashi Ensemble Performance “Yamato San Musashi” “Hakkenden”, Musical “Billy Eliot” “South Pacific”, Miyamoto Amon-Directed “Tai Goten” ・ The movie “High & LOW THE RED RAIN”. Shouta continues to expand his work in a variety of mediums from small theater plays to moving images. 
幼少期に見た時代劇に魅了され俳優の道へ。 ・舞台：新橋演舞場公演『大和三銃士』『八犬伝』、ミュージカル『ビリー・エリオット』『南太平洋』、宮本亜門演出『狸御殿』 ・映画『High&LOW THE RED RAIN』 など小劇場からミュージカル、映像と幅広く活動している。

But a musical demands a lot of preparation and our project is still a work in progress... a lot of elements need to come together to work.
Because of the nature of our film, with a long period of rehearsals, composing, and choreography to get through, we are vulnerable to potential delays that could see the production dates pushed back to early 2020.
Things are going well however, and if we manage to avoid any major setbacks, we will be able to meet that shoot date!
We're currently developing and recording the 5 original songs, hiring our dancers and extras and getting ready to choreograph the dance sequences.
For September/October we're planning casting sessions, rehearsals and location scouting.
As for the funding - it will be a big boost to allow us to commence all these processes. It will go to studio rental, the costs of recording and engineering the songs, the rehearsals, and the costs of locations, as well as cast and crew payment.
Any small amount will be a huge boost and we are deeply passionate about making this film happen. Thank you!

story:
His is Name Was Jason is a short film based off of Jason Voorhees from the Friday the 13th Franchise. It takes place between parts 1 and 2 of the movie franchise. Jason is now in his late 20's early 30's but has been presumed dead due to the drowning incident, or is he? Camp Crystal Lake has been shut down and abandoned for years on the account of the horror that unfolded on the night of Friday the 13th, 1979. The town folk of Crystal Lake are finally putting it past them and cautiously moving on but never forgetting. Only whispers and stories are told to the children at times when they misbehave and are instructed to never go in to the woods of “Camp Blood, or Jason is gonna get ya!”. "Camp Blood" is the nick name given by the locals.

This film will show you the story of 3 lifelong high school friends: Bo Thompson, Charles (Chuck) Roberts and Mickey (Mick) Bowetz. All 3 friends are avid deer hunters that made an ill-fated decision to venture into the foreboding area of Camp Crystal. Their belief of tracking and hunting a prized Buck that has eluded most hunters of the community for many years, will bring the town's name back on the map. This Buck seems to have found refuge and solitude in the foreboding area of the lake on the account that man hasn't tread there for so long. Once these lifelong friends enter the woods, they feel that time has almost come to a complete stop and direction seems to be off kilter. In the far-off distance, they get a glimpse of their prize and the thrill for the hunt begins! As quickly as it begins, they are also quick to realize the hunters have now become the hunted. The truth behind those scary ghost stories and of the legend that lurks at Camp Crystal Lake, is very much alive and has been living well without being disturbed by outsiders until that fateful November day.

I will also tell the story of Jason and his life of solitude, living in the wooded areas and abandoned camp ground of Camp Crystal Lake, as he forages and scavenges in order to survive. He is also constantly tormented by his mother’s voice and her words in his head to "guard and protect the camp ground", including the surrounding lake because this is now his domain. It’s all he’s ever known and is closest to a home he'll ever have.

We will bear witness to how Jason protects his home through this short film.

On the subject of the rights to Friday the 13th, we would again, like to formally acknowledge that we are in no way affiliated with Paramount Pictures, New Line Cinema, entity, person or individual associated with the Original Friday the 13th Franchise. If anyone from those entities takes issue with what we are trying to accomplish, we will happily comply with whatever is asked of us by those parties.

 

Little about me... I decided to take on this feat 2 years ago because my family and friends all gave me the encouragement  to pursue this seemingly impossible dream. I have been writing this back story for a few years now and I’m stoked at this becoming a reality With the Help of Jason John Cicalese as Director and Jason West as DIretor of Photography. 

 

This short film is really for the fans of the Friday the 13th Franchise and those who have been trying to piece together what happened to Jason between the first 2 movies. A bit about myself…….I grew up in the '80s, being a huge fan of ALL HORROR MOVIES!!! Needless to say, Friday the 13th was, is and continues to be my all-time favorite. There was always something about that boy jumping out of the lake that terrified me! And the Sack Mask Jason in Part 2. Growing up in South New Jersey, where Friday the 13th was filmed, made it feel like it was in my own backyard and that is where my love for the films came from!! AND…….most of the filming for my short film will be located in close proximity to the original film location of Part 1 .  

Now at 50 having a career in the creative field for 20 plus years, dabbling with prop making and creating screen accurate costumes for fun, I want to bring it all to life in this small fan film. I can’t afford to do this alone and will need all the support and funding I can get. I know I can bring this story to reality but only with your help. I know there are a lot of Friday the 13th fans out there and we can do this TOGETHER!! This film will be mine as much as it will be yours. After all, it is you, the fans, who will ultimately decide whether this project will become a reality. To those of you who do decide to back this project, I will forever be grateful and humbled by your generosity for this opportunity. I promise you this will be a film that will be as close to the originals as they come. Thank You in advance for your support and to those who have been following my Facebook Fan Page since July 2018!

Thanks Again for your support!

Dave Brown.

PS ~ Remember……Jason is not dead. We just have to wake him up!

 

Risks and challenges

Indiegogo- This portion of the budget will go towards Indiegogo fees and the purchase of rewards for backers.

Volunteers: This project would not be where it is today without a dedicated team of volunteers who have donated their time at no cost to the project. Made up of friends, family, and colleagues, this group also includes the core.

Actors: Gotta throw them something! Food and Travel.

Risks and challenges 
As you know it takes more than the $20K we are asking to make a film of this quality. Costumes, wardrobe, props, flights, hotels, craft services/ food and equipment rentals are very costly. This campaign will help to fund the film. We may run a second campaign in the future based on needs if any amount over our goal does not cover production and or post production expenses.
story_txt: His is Name Was Jason is a short film based off of Jason Voorhees from the Friday the 13th Franchise. It takes place between parts 1 and 2 of the movie franchise. Jason is now in his late 20's early 30's but has been presumed dead due to the drowning incident, or is he? Camp Crystal Lake has been shut down and abandoned for years on the account of the horror that unfolded on the night of Friday the 13th, 1979. The town folk of Crystal Lake are finally putting it past them and cautiously moving on but never forgetting. Only whispers and stories are told to the children at times when they misbehave and are instructed to never go in to the woods of “Camp Blood, or Jason is gonna get ya!”. "Camp Blood" is the nick name given by the locals.This film will show you the story of 3 lifelong high school friends: Bo Thompson, Charles (Chuck) Roberts and Mickey (Mick) Bowetz. All 3 friends are avid deer hunters that made an ill-fated decision to venture into the foreboding area of Camp Crystal. Their belief of tracking and hunting a prized Buck that has eluded most hunters of the community for many years, will bring the town's name back on the map. This Buck seems to have found refuge and solitude in the foreboding area of the lake on the account that man hasn't tread there for so long. Once these lifelong friends enter the woods, they feel that time has almost come to a complete stop and direction seems to be off kilter. In the far-off distance, they get a glimpse of their prize and the thrill for the hunt begins! As quickly as it begins, they are also quick to realize the hunters have now become the hunted. The truth behind those scary ghost stories and of the legend that lurks at Camp Crystal Lake, is very much alive and has been living well without being disturbed by outsiders until that fateful November day.I will also tell the story of Jason and his life of solitude, living in the wooded areas and abandoned camp ground of Camp Crystal Lake, as he forages and scavenges in order to survive. He is also constantly tormented by his mother’s voice and her words in his head to "guard and protect the camp ground", including the surrounding lake because this is now his domain. It’s all he’s ever known and is closest to a home he'll ever have.We will bear witness to how Jason protects his home through this short film.On the subject of the rights to Friday the 13th, we would again, like to formally acknowledge that we are in no way affiliated with Paramount Pictures, New Line Cinema, entity, person or individual associated with the Original Friday the 13th Franchise. If anyone from those entities takes issue with what we are trying to accomplish, we will happily comply with whatever is asked of us by those parties. Little about me... I decided to take on this feat 2 years ago because my family and friends all gave me the encouragement  to pursue this seemingly impossible dream. I have been writing this back story for a few years now and I’m stoked at this becoming a reality With the Help of Jason John Cicalese as Director and Jason West as DIretor of Photography.  This short film is really for the fans of the Friday the 13th Franchise and those who have been trying to piece together what happened to Jason between the first 2 movies. A bit about myself…….I grew up in the '80s, being a huge fan of ALL HORROR MOVIES!!! Needless to say, Friday the 13th was, is and continues to be my all-time favorite. There was always something about that boy jumping out of the lake that terrified me! And the Sack Mask Jason in Part 2. Growing up in South New Jersey, where Friday the 13th was filmed, made it feel like it was in my own backyard and that is where my love for the films came from!! AND…….most of the filming for my short film will be located in close proximity to the original film location of Part 1 .  Now at 50 having a career in the creative field for 20 plus years, dabbling with prop making and creating screen accurate costumes for fun, I want to bring it all to life in this small fan film. I can’t afford to do this alone and will need all the support and funding I can get. I know I can bring this story to reality but only with your help. I know there are a lot of Friday the 13th fans out there and we can do this TOGETHER!! This film will be mine as much as it will be yours. After all, it is you, the fans, who will ultimately decide whether this project will become a reality. To those of you who do decide to back this project, I will forever be grateful and humbled by your generosity for this opportunity. I promise you this will be a film that will be as close to the originals as they come. Thank You in advance for your support and to those who have been following my Facebook Fan Page since July 2018!Thanks Again for your support!Dave Brown.PS ~ Remember……Jason is not dead. We just have to wake him up! Risks and challengesIndiegogo- This portion of the budget will go towards Indiegogo fees and the purchase of rewards for backers.Volunteers: This project would not be where it is today without a dedicated team of volunteers who have donated their time at no cost to the project. Made up of friends, family, and colleagues, this group also includes the core.Actors: Gotta throw them something! Food and Travel.Risks and challenges As you know it takes more than the $20K we are asking to make a film of this quality. Costumes, wardrobe, props, flights, hotels, craft services/ food and equipment rentals are very costly. This campaign will help to fund the film. We may run a second campaign in the future based on needs if any amount over our goal does not cover production and or post production expenses.

story:
**Post-Production Stretch Goal: $25,000**

We're so grateful for the support from everyone who helped us reach our $15,000 stretch goal. Since then, we've shot the film in Arnold, CA, and are excited to announce our new fundraising goal of $25,000, which will cover our post-production expenses, including visual effects, marketing, and film festivals fees. 

To donate, select a perk on the right side that corresponds to the amount that you wish to contribute.

 

**New Stretch Goal: $15,000**

We’re so excited to announce that in a little over two weeks we have raised $7,000 for The Phoenix! We are blown away by the generosity of this community and can’t thank you all enough for your support to get us to this milestone so soon into our campaign!

With 46 days left, we want to continue to build on this momentum by announcing our new fundraising goal of $15,000! This new stretch goal will help us take our film to the next level by contributing to the following:

  • Animation: Creating an entirely original superhero cartoon is going to take a talented animation team to bring to life. Your continued support will allow us to hire a team of professionals who will  give “the Blue Phoenix” cartoon the polish and potency it needs to really pack a punch when it’s showcased in our film
  • Production Design: To make Charlie’s family home fit the time period where the film takes place (late 90s to early 2000s), we will need to acquire furniture, props, and home decorations from this era. With additional funding, our team will be able to invest more into creating an authentic period setting, along with supplies and materials needed to age the house interior for the 2nd half of the film when Charlie is older
  • Film Festivals: Your continued support means we will have the opportunity to submit the film to additional festivals across the country, which will not only broaden its exposure, but ensure that its empowering message can impact as many people as possible
  • Increased Location Time: Time on location is a hurdle in the making of any film, and ours is no different. Meeting our new goal of $15,000 would allow us to increase our time spent on location to film, helping our cast and crew to bring you closer to the characters and world of the Phoenix

 

 

Hello everyone! My name is Regina Pigsley and I’m a 24 year old writer and director from Northern California. My mission is to empower underrepresented female voices through filmmaking.

I’m working with a talented team of filmmakers to create The Phoenix, a story about a young girl, Charlie, who unexpectedly attains superpowers, and attempts to use those superpowers to fix her parents’ marriage. In order to bring Charlie’s story and powers to life, we need all the support we can get. By donating, you can be a part of my journey to empower the powerless. Any donation, no matter how small, gets us one step closer to making this film a reality. 

 

 

 

 

Inside a working class home in 90’s America, eight year old Charlie wants nothing more than to be a superhero. Her overworked parents are drifting apart, and their arguments just keep getting worse. Charlie’s only escape is her dream of being super.

Eventually, the toxicity around the house boils over, and Charlie watches as her mother throws a frying pan at her father. BAM! Charlie freezes time, her arms outstretched in a gesture of protest. She has finally unlocked her super power! Instinctively, Charlie discovers that she can not only stop time, but turn it back. 

What unfolds is Charlie’s journey to realize that her powers are not the solution to solving the problems of her broken home. Rather, the strength to rise above this hardship, lies within herself.

 

 

We have the ideas and talent to make this film a reality, but we need your help to bring Charlie and her powers to life. We are in need of additional funding to create the animation of an original cartoon called “The Blue Phoenix” that plays an important role in Charlie’s character development, as well as special effects that can properly showcase Charlie’s time-stopping superpowers.

Your donations will also go towards equipment rentals, transportation, food, and lodging for the cast and crew, as well as PPE and other materials to ensure that our production is Covid-19 safe.


By supporting our project, you will have access to many exclusive perks, such as stickers, a signed movie poster, producer credits, and much more, in addition to knowing that your support is getting us one step closer to bringing this important story to life.

 

 

This story, not only sheds light on what broken households look like, it is also meant to empower children, especially young girls, to stay strong and know that their situation is not their fault. We want this film to be an inspiration to young women to find and embrace their own individual superpowers, and use them to fight their way to a better life.

 

 

Covid-19 has brought new risks and challenges to filmmaking, and new expenses. In addition to securing the necessary funding for all of the production expenses, we will be bringing on a Covid compliance officer to our crew to ensure that we are adhering to all of the necessary guidelines and restrictions in place in California at the time of filming. This also includes acquiring PPE and thermometers to secure and monitor the health of our cast and crew, as well as individually packaged food to mitigate any further spread of Covid-19 on set.

 

 

If you can't make a donation yourself, you can help us by spreading the word! Please take a moment to follow our journey on Instagram and Facebook, visit our website, and share this campaign with your family, friends, and network!

story:
Dickie K. 

Using the real life experiences of the Koffler family we hope to create an accurate depiction of not only addiction, but also the process of recovery. The film was shot and edited between 2018 and 2019 and had the remainder of post-production stalled in part due to the pandemic. 

All that's left is what's remaining of our visual effects as well as a 5.1 surround mix of the film. 

Those services will cost $3,550. I will be covering half meaning that this campaign is looking to generate $1,175. This will allow us to speed up post-production, finally get a final cut to the cast and crew, and allow us to begin submitting the film to festivals. 

Queens Ledger: 'Dickie K' chronicles growing up in Forest Hills

Dickie K. 2019 Teaser
