story:
Summary:

Stand To is a short film drama addressing the problem of PTSD. However, where most stories focus solely on the individual sufferer, typically a veteran, ‘Stand To’ flips the perspective to shed light on the wider issue - the impact PTSD has on the loved ones caught up in the mire. 

The story follows Adrienne, and her struggle to help her boyfriend, Dean, adjust to life after the military. The complex nature of PTSD means this is a struggle fraught with difficulties, and quite often dangers, as Dean’s insecurity, paranoia and aggression leave Adrienne in a constant state of fear, anxiety and tragically, guilt. I have made every endeavour to make Adrienne and Dean’s story authentic.

As well as frequent discussions with the lead actor to create authentic dialogue, the experiences Adrienne endures are primarily drawn from the accounts of genuine partners of veterans from the following sources: 

‘Supporting my man through PTSD’ – https://www.england.nhs.uk/blog/supporting-my-man/ 

‘Coping with a veteran’s mental health issues’ – https://www.england.nhs.uk/blog/coping-with-a-v... 

‘6 things I learned from dating someone with PTSD’ – https://www.healthline.com/health/mental-health... 

Stand To's Impact

It is these stories that highlight why ‘Stand To’ is so important. The reality of PTSD is often overlooked, that for every veteran suffering, there are friends and family in the firing line. 

The best way to make people realise and understand this broader issue is to address it as the serious problem that it is. Therefore the film’s tone is consistently dark and dramatic, driven by key issues including unpredictable emotions, borderline domestic abuse, and even suicide. It is deliberately unrelenting emotionally, intentionally unsettling and unapologetically shocking so as to convey the harsh reality that there are people who experience this as everyday life. This is what makes this film distinctive. All too often films addressing PTSD focus solely on the veteran, with their condition solely affecting them. This is not the case in ‘Stand To’, because it is not true. 

Writer-Director Callum McKay's aim is to address this oversight to help generate greater awareness for the condition and consequently help both veterans and their loved ones. This is a unique approach to this kind of story, offering a fresh insight from a new perspective on an underrepresented issue. 

 

Cast:

Amy McCallum (for Adrienne)

Amy’s current and prospective roles prove her positive trajectory as an actor portraying roles re-envisioning the modern British woman. Adrienne is an emotionally complex character, intelligent and headstrong, but ill-equipped to fight this unfamiliar, unsettling, almost dangerous situation she’s tasked herself with overcoming. Amy’s raw, gutsy performances in programmes such as Holby City, Endeavour and White House Farm show she’s perfectly suited to delivering an enthralling performance of this compelling young woman.

Lee Lomas (for Dean)

Lee has effectively executed a variety of roles across film and television where he has worked for over 10 years. This includes roles in Hollyoaks, Cold Feet, Coronation Street and Who is Alice. He has featured in a number of different musicals and plays, such as Killing Nana and Sunrise for the Blind in 2019. A reflection of Lee’s high calibre acting experience, he is represented by the IAG talent agency which represents the very best actors to come out of the Identity School of Acting. Alumni of this school include BAFTA Rising Star recipients John Boyega and Letitia Wright.

Hannah Hoad (for Steph)

Hannah's past performances demonstrate she will be able to draw upon her experience of playing strong-minded characters to portray this supportive, but bluntly honest best friend. Both Adrienne and Steph are strong-willed individuals. Hannah has shown this is not unfamiliar territory for her, in her portrayal of characters in a range of the films such as White Powder and Just For The Money. Her ability to convey emotion through her reactions and expression rather than relying solely on dialogue is also clear to see in her role in Robbie Williams’ music video Mixed Signals. 

Elliot Cable (for Tom)

Elliot's performance in Fair Trade is what makes him such a strong candidate for the role of Tom, as it highlights Elliot’s skill at embodying a character who is lively, jovial, and who thrives on being the life and soul of the room. Yet he marries these traits with the important quality of conveying a natural chemistry with his co-stars, a trait that is crucial to the character of Tom.

Crew:

Writer-Director CALLUM MCKAY

Callum McKay is an award-winning screenwriter specialising in dramas and period screenplays. Through the consistently high standard of his work, Callum has created stories that explore the human condition with regards to human fragility and emotional turmoil, as well as thought provoking drama. This is exactly why some of his most promising screenplays have won awards both in the UK and America, such as ‘Dark Forces’, a category winner in the 2018 Hollywood Screenplay Contest, and ‘Miss Verity’, a finalist in the same competition and winner of the 2019 Raindance Live Ammunition Pitching Competition. Most recently, Callum’s work has attracted the attention of UK television channels with his first pilot script, ‘The Doghouse Club’, which was pitched to ITV and Channel 4 and praised for its writing quality.  Callum is currently working on a pilot for a new drama series, as well as a selection of short film scripts.

Although this is his first foray into directing for film, this is by no means his first project as a writer/director. As Head Writer for the Falmouth and Exeter Cornwall Campus Light Entertainment Society (FECCLES), Callum was the co-writer and director of the troupe’s show at the 2015 Edinburgh Festival, ‘Decaying with Grace’. 

Stand To is the perfect project for him to take on a directing role. Not only is he dedicated to the project’s success as its writer-director, but his commitment to the message it conveys makes him ideally suited to realising his vision for the script on the screen. He is also mentored by a BAFTA-membered Film Director to ensure a successful directorial debut.

Producer RANW ASO-RASHID

Ranw is an award winning Producer who has produced multiple short films including the award-winning Jane (Special Mention Award at LA International Short Films Fest), and the BAFTA-screened Dear Stranger. Ranw utilises his background in teaching to facilitate work experience/mentoring programmes for young people from under-represented groups to help produce memorable stories. Ranw will work with Unit Production Manager Tolga Dundar (who coordinated production on 007 Skyfall) to ensure a smooth production.

Director of Photography ASH CONNAUGHTON

Ash Connaughton is highly experienced in a wide range of production scales, styles and genres. Ash has shot drama narratives, documentaries, music videos as well as branded content and commercials; working for clients such as BBC, Warner Bros. and M&C Saatchi. 

Ash was Cinematographer on award winning pieces such as the short neo noir Lo Selezinero, feature documentary Tax Shelter Terrors and Feature Film Hello Darlin.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • In line with our funding strategy, we're seeking a specific amount of £5,000 to be raised from crowdfunding which will cover equipment rental, insurances, location fees, cast/crew expenses, post-production costs, production design, composing the score, marketing and unit publicity fees. It would also help ensure our project staff can be fairly compensated for the work they do.

  • The idea behind the perks is that the more you invest in the film, the more involved you are with its production and the more rewarded you are as we have tried to make the perks reasonable and attractive.

 

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • This is a challenging film to make - both technically and creatively. However, the calibre of talent of our cast and crew will ensure a naturalistic and outstanding performance on screen.
  • We have some of the industry's most experienced Head of Departments (HODs) on this project. Their combined experience numbers several hundred projects ranging from shorts to feature films in the UK and overseas. Some of our HODs have led in their departments on BAFTA/Academy Award nominated/winning films. Some of our HODs have also led on BFI-funded films. 
  • Our HODs will be in constant communication with one another, liaising on all technical/creative processes as required.
  • Young members of our crew, who are up-and-coming, are being mentored by industry-leading film/TV professionals in their respective departments. This will ensure their professional development and mentorship. This will impacts on the smooth running of the production and help address industry under-representation.
  • We are a COVID-compliant production with a thorough risk assessment of all aspects of the production, ensuring that all staff remain safe. This includes effective safeguarding procedures in place for school-age children completing supervised work placements/mentorship programmes.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We understand that not everyone can contribute to the film's fund right now, however you can always get the word out by word of mouth or even sharing a message about this project on social media, if so, use the Indiegogo share tools provided. Use the hashtag #standtofilm to post about what you're excited about for the film.

Callum McKay is an award-winning screenwriter specialising in dramas and period screenplays. Through the consistently high standard of his work, Callum has created stories that explore the human condition with regards to human fragility and emotional turmoil, as well as thought provoking drama. This is exactly why some of his most promising screenplays have won awards both in the UK and America, such as ‘Dark Forces’, a category winner in the 2018 Hollywood Screenplay Contest, and ‘Miss Verity’, a finalist in the same competition and winner of the 2019 Raindance Live Ammunition Pitching Competition. Most recently, Callum’s work has attracted the attention of UK television channels with his first pilot script, ‘The Doghouse Club’, which was pitched to ITV and Channel 4 and praised for its writing quality.  Callum is currently working on a pilot for a new drama series, as well as a selection of short film scripts.
Although this is his first foray into directing for film, this is by no means his first project as a writer/director. As Head Writer for the Falmouth and Exeter Cornwall Campus Light Entertainment Society (FECCLES), Callum was the co-writer and director of the troupe’s show at the 2015 Edinburgh Festival, ‘Decaying with Grace’. 
Stand To is the perfect project for him to take on a directing role. Not only is he dedicated to the project’s success as its writer-director, but his commitment to the message it conveys makes him ideally suited to realising his vision for the script on the screen. He is also mentored by a BAFTA-membered Film Director to ensure a successful directorial debut.
Producer RANW ASO-RASHID
Ranw is an award winning Producer who has produced multiple short films including the award-winning Jane (Special Mention Award at LA International Short Films Fest), and the BAFTA-screened Dear Stranger. Ranw utilises his background in teaching to facilitate work experience/mentoring programmes for young people from under-represented groups to help produce memorable stories. Ranw will work with Unit Production Manager Tolga Dundar (who coordinated production on 007 Skyfall) to ensure a smooth production.
Director of Photography ASH CONNAUGHTON
Ash Connaughton is highly experienced in a wide range of production scales, styles and genres. Ash has shot drama narratives, documentaries, music videos as well as branded content and commercials; working for clients such as BBC, Warner Bros. and M&C Saatchi. 
Ash was Cinematographer on award winning pieces such as the short neo noir Lo Selezinero, feature documentary Tax Shelter Terrors and Feature Film Hello Darlin.
 
What We Need & What You Get


In line with our funding strategy, we're seeking a specific amount of £5,000 to be raised from crowdfunding which will cover equipment rental, insurances, location fees, cast/crew expenses, post-production costs, production design, composing the score, marketing and unit publicity fees. It would also help ensure our project staff can be fairly compensated for the work they do.
The idea behind the perks is that the more you invest in the film, the more involved you are with its production and the more rewarded you are as we have tried to make the perks reasonable and attractive.

 
Risks & Challenges
People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

This is a challenging film to make - both technically and creatively. However, the calibre of talent of our cast and crew will ensure a naturalistic and outstanding performance on screen.
We have some of the industry's most experienced Head of Departments (HODs) on this project. Their combined experience numbers several hundred projects ranging from shorts to feature films in the UK and overseas. Some of our HODs have led in their departments on BAFTA/Academy Award nominated/winning films. Some of our HODs have also led on BFI-funded films. 
Our HODs will be in constant communication with one another, liaising on all technical/creative processes as required.

Young members of our crew, who are up-and-coming, are being mentored by industry-leading film/TV professionals in their respective departments. This will ensure their professional development and mentorship. This will impacts on the smooth running of the production and help address industry under-representation.
We are a COVID-compliant production with a thorough risk assessment of all aspects of the production, ensuring that all staff remain safe. This includes effective safeguarding procedures in place for school-age children completing supervised work placements/mentorship programmes.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone can contribute to the film's fund right now, however you can always get the word out by word of mouth or even sharing a message about this project on social media, if so, use the Indiegogo share tools provided. Use the hashtag #standtofilm to post about what you're excited about for the film.

story:
THE CAMPAIGN IS CLOSED! STAY TUNED FOR VIDEO UPDATE. THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR WONDERFUL SUPPORT!

 

THE GOAL

DEAD HAND is a martial arts action-comedy that we shot over the past 6 months with an extremely minimal, out-of-pocket budget. Now, we need your help to raise the cost of post-production so we can finish this action packed feature length movie.

We need to raise $20,000. I know, it seems like a lot, but remember! This isn’t a short film, or a concept that we hope to shoot. Filming is done! So here’s what that $20,000 will go towards:

  • $5,000 Production Recoup - This is what I personally spent out of pocket to produce the film. How’d we shoot a feature for $5,000?? Check out the Stretch Goals section for details.
  • $200 Stock Footage and Photos - We may need some photos or aerial footage to tie the film together.
  • $2,500 Visual Effects - We have Todd Blankenship of AmIAFilmmaker? on board as our VFX artist!
  • $3,000 Color Correction/Grading 
  • $1,000 Original Score - Daniel Vincent Galvan of Werewolf Therewolf (and the actor who played Mr. Gray) will be composing the score!
  • $3,000 Sound Design and Audio Mix - A lot of action means a lot of foley and sound effects! 
  • $1,000 Behind The Scenes Featurette - We have interviews from the cast and crew, behind the scenes footage, and more to fit into a whole featurette!
  • $1,300 Perks Costs - This covers the cost to produce the perks and cover additional shipping materials.
  • $1,000 Film Festival Fees - Once the film is finished we’ll need to blast it out into the film festival circuit. The more we can afford to submit to the better chances of media coverage and possible distribution deals we’ll receive.
  • $2,000 Cast and Crew Premiere - This will be put towards renting a theater for the cast and crew premiere. If you would like to attend this premiere, be sure to choose the appropriate perk option!

The Perks

Check out this video for more detail on exactly what the perks are!

 

Cast & Crew

John Francis McCullagh
Writer, Director, Eoghan Flynn

John Francis McCullagh has nearly a decade of experience in the film industry. From being a professional actor represented by the Linda McAlister talent agency, working as a fulltime video editor and content producer for Rooster Teeth LLC., to working the sets of the Dallas commercial scene, John Francis has gained experience and insight into film and built key relationships along the way. His skills focus on action cinema, drawing from his martial arts, stuntman, and directing background. John Francis has also directed and starred in multiple award-winning action short films. He aims to shake up the action film genre with great characters and beautifully shot martial arts action.

Brandon Yates
Co-producer, co-choreographer, Johnny Mai

Brandon Yates is an actor and stunt performer who got his start in the film industry through school and his kung fu training. Represented by Linda McAlister Talent, Brandon uses his experience from My Jhong Law Horn Kung Fu to acting experience from teachers like Fred Curchack, starring in his most recent project titled "DEAD HAND."

Angel Rodriguez
Matthias Frost

Angel "ARod" Rodriguez was born February 21, 1980 in Bronx, NY. He is the eldest of 4 children and was raised by his grandmother, mother and aunt. He is an American actor, Air Force retiree, motivational speaker and content creator/streamer under the moniker "Trindominus". His active duty time was spent stationed both overseas and stateside, with a deployment to Ali Al Salem AB Kuwait, in support of Operation Enduring Freedom. He was also a competitive video game player achieving moderate success and a competitive martial artist winning several medals. His debut acting role is Matthias Frost in the action comedy "Dead Hand" where his militaristic demeanor and martial arts training brought the character to life. Prior to, he made numerous shorts with gaming content channel ScrewAttack and was the host/MC for the successful ScrewAttack Gaming Convention aka SGC.

Kristin Keith
Anya Sokolov

Having spent her youth training intensively with music teachers from the Juilliard School and Southern Methodist University and devoting the majority of her adult years to working as a professional violinist, Kristin Keith is deeply familiar with the extraordinarily high levels of commitment, self-discipline, and sacrifice necessary for dedicating one's life to the pursuit of an art form. Ever since she began acting in 2014, she has devoted these same intense levels of commitment toward her acting career. Within her first year of acting, she was cast in fourteen short films, two feature films, and two commercials. And despite the fact that music was her original calling, it is through acting that she feels she has found her true purpose: "Every scene and every story is a celebration of Humanity in its most beautiful shades, as well as its darkest hues. As an actress, I am blessed to have the privilege of offering a unique voice in that celebration. As a musician, my only voice was my violin. But now I can use the voice I was born with...the voice that is fully Me. It is through acting, I feel I have truly come Home."

Josh Weinstein
Co-choreographer, Nico

Joshua Weinstein is a performer, martial artist, choreographer, and actor.  He got his start in the film industry through a recommendation from actor and stunt performer Brandon Yates and plays a roll in the upcoming film "DEAD HAND". Being a skilled acrobat and martial artist, Joshua performed all of his own stunts and fight scenes in the film.

Timothy Steven
Co-producer

Timothy Stevens has worked for over a decade in the industry and began his work in television and film shortly after graduating from film school at the University of North Texas.  His first professional experience came from the cable network RIDE TV. Timothy has worked nearly every department, beginning first as an editor, then camera operator, and later as a writer and story producer. He now directs and produces scripted and reality television while producing award-winning independent horror and action films. He has also written more than a dozen short and feature screenplays. His goal- to write and direct thrilling and thoughtful horror films.

For the full cast and crew check out our IMDb page!

Stretch Goals!

$20,000 is just the beginning!

Stretch Goal 1: $50,000

In order to be able to shoot this film for only $5,000 our wonderful cast and crew graciously agreed to work for deferred pay. This means that they agreed to be paid IF the film makes a profit. IF is the contingent word.

Every cent of the additional $30,000 will go directly to paying the cast and crew their agreed rates. Not a cent of this stretch goal goes to me, all of it goes towards paying the cast and crew their deferred pay! 

The Impact

By contributing to this campaign you are not only helping realize the dream I’ve had since I was four years old of becoming a feature film director, but the collective dreams of our cast and crew. We have all worked so hard for so long to bring this film to where it is now, and with your financial contributions we can finish it. 

This is just my FIRST feature film. One of the greatest hurdles to overcome in the film industry for a hopeful director is making their first feature film. Short films, good scripts, and a well made business plan cannot compete with having a feature length narrative on your resume when speaking with potential investors. It shows that you understand the difficulties of feature film making and can follow it through to a finished product. Completing DEAD HAND will give me that and could potentially open the door to bigger projects with full fledged budgets. By contributing to this campaign you are not only helping me create one action film, but potentially an entire career’s worth of action films.

Other Ways You Can Help

I totally understand if you are currently incapable of financially contributing to this film. However, there are still ways that you can help without spending money. By sharing this campaign on social media, and including a statement with how excited you are for the project, you could inspire others to check this page out and donate! 

Share the campaign on social media with a comment directing your followers to the page.

You can share directly from IndieGoGo!

Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram and be sure to comment and share all of our DEAD HAND posts. 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Logline

A mother relives memories of her daughter on the one year anniversary of her daughter's death.

 

The Story

Swimming with Stones is a short film from director-cinematographer Amber Yang and producer Jacqueline Thom, based on the personal experiences with loss from Amber and writer Hannah Baynes.

The story will follow a mother’s journey of going through grief. She comes to a realization that unloading the weight doesn’t mean leaving the memories behind.

Swimming with Stones is a tribute to those who are no longer with us and the topic of dealing with grief. It will be shot in long takes on a women-led crew.  

We are also dedicated to achieving a Green Production Certification, meaning our shoot is environmentally responsible.

 

Meet The Team

Amber Yang, Director-Cinematographer


Amber is a filmmaker and graphic designer. She received her Media Arts BFA and Graphic Design minor from Northeastern University. Her primary focuses are cinematography and graphic design, using her art to connect to others.

 

Note from the Director

Swimming with Stones to me is not just a tribute to masterful long takes in cinematography, but also a mosaic of memories, colors, and visuals that represent what grief and its weight feel like to me. Everyone will lose someone at some point in life. The goal of my film is to reach anyone who has or is currently experiencing the process of grief. 

My hope is that perhaps Swimming with Stones could offer some insight or serve as a lighthouse in the seemingly never-ending storm of grief. It is not to say that there may be an end to grief, but that getting and feeling better and lighter at the end of a long tunnel is possible.

 

Kaitlyn Kilpatrick, Camera Operator

Kaitlyn is a filmmaker and photographer from Denton, Texas. She received her BA in Media Arts and Photography Minor from the University of North Texas. Kaitlyn's range of skills is most focused on cinematography, BTS photography, and production design. Her work is inspired by small moments, her family and friends, and personal experiences. Kaitlyn has a passion for assisting like-minded artists in developing and bringing their visions to life, emphasizing underrepresented and women-centered stories. 

 

Devynn Montoya, Assistant Camera

Devynn is a filmmaker based out of Austin. They graduated from the University of North Texas in 2017 BA in Radio, Television, and Film. Montoya grew up fascinated with film and developed a passion for camera and photography when they started taking photos at concerts in their teenage years. As an artist, they are drawn to intimate stories about human relationships.

 

Jacqueline Thom, Producer


Jacqueline is a Media Arts Production student at Emerson College with a minor in Marketing Communications. She loves producing, cinematography, and putting her full support behind diverse, passionate stories that leave audiences changed for the better.

 

Why We Need Your Help

We are asking for $6,500 to help us cover:

  • Our filming location: This is one of the biggest elements of the film. It doesn't just serve as the location for the long take, but also the physical place where the memories live in the story.
  • Healthy food on set: This is so important to us because we need nutrient-rich food to help give the crew energy. 
  • Transportation, and other compensation for our crew and actors.
  • Post production: supporting our editing team and hiring a composer and musicians for an original score that fits the story. 
  • Film festivals: We would love to submit to as many festivals as possible with your love and support so that we may share our story!

Should we not reach our goal, we will still use our funding to cover location, transportation, and food expenses as best we can without sacrificing anyone's health and safety on set.

 

Perks

We have many perks in store, simply because we are so excited to have your support on our film! These include, but are not limited to:

  • minimalist t-shirts based on Amber's Polaroid photography
  • fresh new Polaroids photos taken by Amber, just for you
  • collectibles from our production design on set
  • goodie bags of our physical and digital merch, plus sponsorship products
  • exclusive Q&As and behind-the-scenes chats with our cast and crew

 

Risks & Challenges

Our director and producer have worked hard to tackle issues before they arise, but some risks can still happen last minute that are out of our control. We will always convey these challenges to you when they occur, so there is transparency about how we spend our resources and utilize your support.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, please share our Instagram and Facebook pages! We are always posting updates!

collectibles from our production design on set
goodie bags of our physical and digital merch, plus sponsorship products
exclusive Q&As and behind-the-scenes chats with our cast and crew

story:
The Story

LOGLINE: After an experienced killer with his own trademark fails to finish the job, he is forced to hunt down his victim and protect his profession.

BACKGROUND: The Ferryman is a 15-minute action packed short film following the hitman, who is called the Ferryman. Receiving his targets by the leader of his organisation, Hades, the Ferryman never fails. Until one day his secretary disrupts a kill and suddenly it is a race against time to secure the victim before he disappears. 

The short film will be full of Greek mythology elements, making this story just a little different to your classical hitman films.  

What we hope to achieve from the campaign

This short film will also be the first bigger production of the newly founded production company Stonefuchs Productions and we are hoping to make this special film the flagship of our productions. 

For that we want high quality in all aspects and allow people to focus on a well constructed story in the heart of Glasgow. This means high quality sets, lighting and costumes. Those are our main cost factors, as well as paying the hard-working cast and crew. We are very specific about the greek mythology details that are implemented in the story for our audience to discover and enjoy. 

We have some fantastic perks available and if you are a fan of Greek Mythology, you will truly enjoy not only the perks but also our finished film. 

Additionally, with every extra Pound we get we can start developing this story into a feature film, as the story and its characters have so much more to tell and so many questions will remain unanswered.

The core team

JULES WALLACE - The Ferryman

"A dark thriller set in the modern corporate world with an intriguing mythological twist.  The anti-hero character is a gift of a role, I can't wait to bring The Ferryman to life!"

GORDON J MILLAR - Mr. Aporia

“I’ve had the joy of working with Kate before, so I’m very honoured and excited to join such a strong cast and crew on her debut short film!”

REBECCA WYMAN - Piper

"I cannot wait to get started on The Ferryman! From the beginning, the concept of this short film has enthralled me and since having read the script, I am even more excited - I love how it is laced into the storyline as the plot unfolds. With the talent and skill of the entire cast and crew, this is definitely going to be one you don't want to miss."

CARRIE DODDS - Lethe

"I was attracted to this story as it was different from anything I had done before, with its basis rooted in Greek mythology but set in modern day Glasgow.  The character Lethe which I play is the loyal PA to the Ferryman, aka 'Mr Acheron', who is oblivious to the double life he leads.  I am excited to be part of this great team."

ANDREW DOUGALL - director

"I’m really looking forward to directing The Ferryman. I think Kate has written a really great story and as soon as I started reading it I started seeing scenes in my head. I’m particularly looking forward to working on the first scene as I’ve been playing it over and over for weeks now!"

KATE STONE - writer and producer

"I am really looking forward to see the story come to life! To follow the Ferryman and his tale into the middle of a modern Glasgow. The mythology elements do elevate the production and I truly think people will enjoy this little extra in our story."

SIMON WILLIAMSON - Director of Photography

"I’m really excited to get working on this project. An excellent team has been assembled with a positive mindset to make something special. It’s a film with a unique story and we have the team to really bring that to life. "

and many more  highly talented members of our crew! Some of which we also want to keep a secret until you see them on screen...

Other ways you can support us

We appreciate every little help, that gets us closer to our goal of shooting this film! If you are convinced of our idea, go and share it with your family and friends. ευχαριστώ
story_txt: The StoryLOGLINE: After an experienced killer with his own trademark fails to finish the job, he is forced to hunt down his victim and protect his profession.BACKGROUND: The Ferryman is a 15-minute action packed short film following the hitman, who is called the Ferryman. Receiving his targets by the leader of his organisation, Hades, the Ferryman never fails. Until one day his secretary disrupts a kill and suddenly it is a race against time to secure the victim before he disappears. The short film will be full of Greek mythology elements, making this story just a little different to your classical hitman films.  What we hope to achieve from the campaignThis short film will also be the first bigger production of the newly founded production company Stonefuchs Productions and we are hoping to make this special film the flagship of our productions. For that we want high quality in all aspects and allow people to focus on a well constructed story in the heart of Glasgow. This means high quality sets, lighting and costumes. Those are our main cost factors, as well as paying the hard-working cast and crew. We are very specific about the greek mythology details that are implemented in the story for our audience to discover and enjoy. We have some fantastic perks available and if you are a fan of Greek Mythology, you will truly enjoy not only the perks but also our finished film. Additionally, with every extra Pound we get we can start developing this story into a feature film, as the story and its characters have so much more to tell and so many questions will remain unanswered.The core teamJULES WALLACE - The Ferryman"A dark thriller set in the modern corporate world with an intriguing mythological twist.  The anti-hero character is a gift of a role, I can't wait to bring The Ferryman to life!"GORDON J MILLAR - Mr. Aporia“I’ve had the joy of working with Kate before, so I’m very honoured and excited to join such a strong cast and crew on her debut short film!”REBECCA WYMAN - Piper"I cannot wait to get started on The Ferryman! From the beginning, the concept of this short film has enthralled me and since having read the script, I am even more excited - I love how it is laced into the storyline as the plot unfolds. With the talent and skill of the entire cast and crew, this is definitely going to be one you don't want to miss."CARRIE DODDS - Lethe"I was attracted to this story as it was different from anything I had done before, with its basis rooted in Greek mythology but set in modern day Glasgow.  The character Lethe which I play is the loyal PA to the Ferryman, aka 'Mr Acheron', who is oblivious to the double life he leads.  I am excited to be part of this great team."ANDREW DOUGALL - director"I’m really looking forward to directing The Ferryman. I think Kate has written a really great story and as soon as I started reading it I started seeing scenes in my head. I’m particularly looking forward to working on the first scene as I’ve been playing it over and over for weeks now!"KATE STONE - writer and producer"I am really looking forward to see the story come to life! To follow the Ferryman and his tale into the middle of a modern Glasgow. The mythology elements do elevate the production and I truly think people will enjoy this little extra in our story."SIMON WILLIAMSON - Director of Photography"I’m really excited to get working on this project. An excellent team has been assembled with a positive mindset to make something special. It’s a film with a unique story and we have the team to really bring that to life. "and many more  highly talented members of our crew! Some of which we also want to keep a secret until you see them on screen...Other ways you can support usWe appreciate every little help, that gets us closer to our goal of shooting this film! If you are convinced of our idea, go and share it with your family and friends. ευχαριστώ

story:
The Spirit Boards Sessions is a new paranormal horror feature film about Ouija Boards by Haddon House Films!  Their first release was in January 2021 and called Psychotica. This film already has close to 50k views on Facebook. This short horror can be viewed on Haddon House Films Facebook page.

Billy Henrickle will serve as the Writer, Producer, and Director for The Spirit Board Sessions. Billy served in these same roles on Psychotica. He has also worked as a Producer on 7 feature films working with such talent as Eric Roberts, Tony Todd, Michael Berryman, Felissa Rose, Thomas G. Waites, Vernon Wells, Richard Tyson and many more.

Ronald Pete will serve as the Cinematographer, Editor, Composer, and VFX. Ronnie's work can be seen and heard throughout Psychotica. He has extensive experience with sound as an accomplished musican and seasoned editor.

Appearances By:

Felissa Rose

Shawn C. Phillips

Hailey Frey

Paris Brown

story:
The Story:

In the time of the American Civil War, a Captain in the Union Army wanders the hills of western North Carolina, hopelessly lost and fatigued having just narrowly escaped a bloody battle with his life. As he wanders through the deep, dark, mysterious woods, strange things start happening to him that leave him questioning his own sanity until he runs into Maggie, a pretty young hill-dwelling woman who takes pity on him and brings him to a nearby cabin where she lives with her father. The Captain thinks he is finally "out of the woods" little does he know his troubles are just beginning. 

This is a ghost story about witchcraft in the southern Appalachian mountains, more specifically western North Carolina. While not as well accounted as the stories of witchcraft in New England or elsewhere in America, these still very wild and deeply forested hills were the perfect breeding ground for superstition, the supernatural and unimaginable evil. 

Death comes in three's.."The Third Night" is in reference to the common theme of the number 3 in superstition or bad omens. For example if one were to see an owl peering into the window of a house that would be considered a bad omen. But if the owl returned three nights in a row, death would be sure to soon follow on the third night.

Our Cast:

Tori Eure- MAGGIE

Maggie is young hill dwelling woman who the Captain stumbles across deep in the forrest. She helps him and in a way saves his life, but also she may be a witch (maybe). Tori graduated from the University of North Carolina at Greensboro with a BFA in acting. After living and working in New York she relocated back to North Carolina where she still pursues acting and found a passion for working with hair and make up. She is extremely excited to embark on this journey and cannot wait to see the heights it will soar to!

 

Our Crew:

Channing Wilson- Writer/Director

Sam Graff- Producer

Matthew Marino- Director of Photography

Lily Guerin- Production Designer

Alyssa Franks- Art Director

Statement from the Director:

This project is one that has been in the works for a few years now, I have been chipping away at it here and there, writing or doing research. I really gained headway and got the project to a place where I felt I was actually able to shoot it over the lockdown last summer/fall and here we are, it's actually happening, the wheels are in motion the only thing left is the $$$! But this part should be easy, I know I have enough friends, family, and supporters out there that believe in me and the work that I do that are willing to throw a few bucks my way. This is a text book passion project, and I can honestly say I have never been more passionate about something, hence why I have invested so much of my time into it already. I can honestly say without any hesitation that this will be the best thing I have ever made, and the most personal, the most reflective of who I am as a person. So if you would like to find out what that looks like, I implore you to consider donating. Thank you so much! 

-Channing Wilson

Budget (where the money goes):

.

story:
If you were ordered to push the nuclear button that would end the world, could you go through with it? TRIGGER POINT will be a powerful and visually spectacular short film that asks questions about freedom and control as a Naval Officer is forced to contend with a bullying barrage of orders to initiate Armageddon. As she grapples with her conscience, you will partake in her intense and personal struggle and be forced to reckon with your own trigger point… 

WHAT’S YOUR TRIGGER POINT? 

About the Project:

TRIGGER POINT is the new short film from award-winning Director/Writer Dan Clifton (PATIENT 39, THE CALCULUS OF LOVE) and examines the mind of Naval Commander Judy Sheppard as she faces increasing pressure from her superiors in an intense military control room. In a thrilling and fast-paced scenario, the film places you in the driving seat and demands that you figure out your own trigger point… 

The script has already been nominated for the prestigious ‘Film The House’ award and we have assembled an award-winning cast and crew, including Producer Ludwig Meslet (BBC New Creatives), Bafta-nominated composer Sheridan Tongue, cinematographer Oliver Schofield and actor Tanya Loretta Dee as Judy Sheppard. Your help will bring their talent together and keep the arts alive! 

This is an opportunity to create an exciting and escapist film that takes you away from the reality of this year and urges you to grapple with your own conscience…

Where we are: 

We are in the pre-production stages of the film. Thanks to your donations we will be able to shoot the film in a way that does justice to this exciting and thought-provoking story and the hard work of our talented cast and crew. 

Why crowdfund now?

These are difficult times. Producing and shooting a film is now more challenging than ever. We want to film this in a safe and healthy environment but safety precaution protocols come with a price tag. We need your help to make sure we can do this. 

Despite COVID-19, we truly believe that now is more than ever the time to tell this story of freedom, autonomy and personal struggle. This film will make you think while also transporting you to an epic and exciting world that takes you far away from the pandemic.

It is through the arts that we all survived lockdown, and supporting this creative project will ensure that stories can continue to be told in the future.  

What do we need:

 To make this project happen we need to build a set that is credible, with the right kind of props and lighting to create a compelling and claustrophobic atmosphere. The set has been designed, the characters have been cast, and the creatives are raring to go…  but we can only make the film a reality with your help! 

Check out our trailer video for more information from the filmmakers and our social media channels through which we will release interviews with members of the cast and crew that will tell you more about the project!

How YOU can help:

Financial Contribution: The best way to help us is to donate! Whatever you can give would be greatly appreciated and will entitle you to some of our exclusive perks —  even £10 would go a long way to helping make this film a reality.

Follow us: On Indiegogo! The more followers a project has the more support the site gives us and the more packages that are available to help the project. Check out and follow our social media channels too and support us by liking the content we release! 

Share: Sharing our campaign with anyone you know would help getting more people to engage and donate! The more friends, family, even enemies(!) you can send our way, the more followers we could gain and the more donations too.

Our perks for you?

Help keep creativity alive and get involved in this project through donating!

In return for your support, we have a range of rewards that will keep you as involved in the project as you would like to be. These include visits to the set, a download link to the film, an exclusive masterclass with Dan himself and even producer credits for the film.

Before we take the film on a festival run and then widely release it, we intend to put on some pre-festival screenings of the film which are included in our perks. But before all that can happen we actually need to make the film… If you press one button today, make it be our donation box!

story:
Pareidolia is a sci-fi short film set in the not-so-distant future of NYC. We follow Damon, a criminal teleportation trafficker and smuggler, as he prepares for his latest gig: teleporting a criminal to safety with a new identity.

Damon knows how to disappear. It's not about creating a new identity, it's about fitting into an old one. His knack for blending in has given him a comfortable yet dangerous living; illegally teleporting people on the run wherever they won't be found. And his latest job of teleporting a criminal out of the city is no different. But something's not right. Something is following him. Something that he doesn't recognize, yet is eerily familiar. Maybe it's side effects from excessive use of the teleportation machine? Maybe he's not taking enough of his blue pills? Whatever it is, it's coming, and there's no place to run.

Pareidolia (noun) is the phenomenon in which we incorrectly perceive a stimulus as a object, pattern, or "secret message." When we see a dog in a cloud, a face in a knot of wood, or a "secret message" in a song played backwards, that's pareidolia. Why do we unconsciously experience this? What are we looking for? What are we hiding from?

John Bartley  -- Writer |  Director

John Bartley, a Las Vegas transplant now living in Brooklyn, is a Mexican-American filmmaker whose work focuses on identity, expectations, the examination and breakdown of communication. John has screened many of his shorts at the Las Vegas International Film Festival, Dam Short Film Festival, and UNLV's Spring Flicks Short Film Festival, and even winning "Best Nevada Filmmaker" and "Best Narrative Short Film" at the former two festival respectively for his film, Barriers. Currently, John works as a freelance Editor and is an Assistant Editor in the Motion Picture Editors Guild, IATSE Local 700.

 

Bradford Watson -- Producer

Bradford is a creative developer from Arkansas who has mastered the intersectionality of code, animation, interactivity and generative design. As the CEO and Founder of Spinach Records, he continues to carve a unique space between community building, artistic expression, and personal ownership.  Brad has executively produced three major productions in the last two months including a historic showing of LaQuan Smith’s Spring Summer 2022 collection at the Empire State Building as well as producing the official Met Gala After Party event 2021.

 

We have already raised some funding to produce this film, but we need additional support to make it a reality!

To take this production all the way through, we are asking for $7,500 to be used for:

  • Production Design and Props -- To really "teleport" the audience into the world of Pareidolia, we need to rent and build some props such as the teleportation machine! 
  • Visual Effects -- The shapeless figure that haunts Damon will be achieved using the DeepDream computer vision neural network, a computer process that enhances the patterns of images, creating an algorithmic pareidolia. This not only creates a psychedelic/disturbing effect, but one that's perfect for the figure stalking Damon's life.
  • Additional Crew -- We want more people to help out production! We are still building a team, but the more hands we can have on deck, the better we can steer this production in the right direction!
  • Post Production Sound and Score -- Sound is just as important as visuals. Not only do we want Pareidolia to look good, but we need it to sound good too! With your help, we can take the world of Pareidolia to the next level.

 

We want to make supporting us as rewarding to you as possible, so we have a great selection tier-based rewards you can choose from!

  • Thank you in the credits ($10)
  • Pareidolia sticker set ($20)
  • Pareidolia Tote Bag ($35)
  • 11"x17" Pareidolia Poster ($75)
  • Virtual screening + Q&A ($100)
  • Live Screening Event + Q&A ($250)
  • Associate Producer Credit ($1,000)
  • Executive Producer ($2,500)

 

There are always risks and challenges with shooting a film, especially in New York. But we believe in the process and are ready to take up any challenge that may and will come our way! We are a very malleable team that ready for the challenge.

 

If you aren't in the position to help support us financially, then no worries! Following our social media, sharing the campaign with friends and loved ones, and generally spreading the word are all fantastic ways you can help!

 

Instagram: @Pareidolia.film (https://www.instagram.com/pareidolia.film/)

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/PareidoliaShortFilm

 

Thank you for taking the time out of your day for Pareidolia! We appreciate your support and enthusiasm for this project!

story:
The Film

Our run-time target is roughly 20 minutes, with the average sketch being about 3 minutes in length.  We’ve already shot the entire mockumentary portion, consisting of interviews with ‘Blake’, and one of the five sketches.  We’re targeting an early November date to shoot our second sketch, with the bulk of any crowdfunding money raised going to the final three.

Without giving too much away, the final three sketches contain, broadly, a gruesome shootout, space travel, and some wacky time travel shit, so they’ll involve bigger casts, more complex costumes and sets, and, of course, special effects.  Practically every dollar we receive beyond our target will be poured into polishing those three things (hell, if we raise a million, we’ll just render a fully CG dog).

The Goal

We’re asking for $7,500 because that’s what we approximate it will take to finish the scrappiest version of the movie we can whittle down.  That means cutting some scenes, settling for cheaper effects, maybe just even having a guy in a dog suit. With approximately $10,000, we’re confident we can come much closer to our vision, and every dollar beyond that just makes it a safer bet.

The Rewards

In addition to digital and physical copies of the film, backers will have the opportunity to meet and hang with the creative team and even visit the set!  

Of special note: IF AND ONLY IF you've got a fully grown Saint Bernard (that looks like the Beethoven dog... like it isn't albino or whatever) and we coordinate you bringing it to set on the days we're shooting, your dog will be in the film and you get the full FULL ZOOMY for free.  Just reach out to us and let us know!

The Team

Kendrick Reinsch, the fellow in the video above, stars as Blake Cadwell, disgraced Hollywood entrepreneur.  At the New York University Tisch School of the Arts, Kendrick mastered the Strasberg method of acting, which, evidently, involves cramming lines ten minutes before a shoot while nursing a hangover (poorly).   

Alyssa Kurtzman, also a graduate of NYU’s esteemed Tisch school, is our director.  As her final film at Tisch, Alyssa wrote, directed, and produced The Matrix: The Musical, which, if you watch closely, features a younger, less broken, Kendrick.  Since college, Alyssa has been producing all kinds of (impeccably shot and edited) videos that you’ve probably seen pop up on your social media feeds as Head of Production for Branded Content at Group Nine--including this video also featuring our star.

Kris Rey-Talley, who’s known Kendrick and Alyssa since their Tisch days, brings the equipment and technical expertise and is why we’re able to shoot this thing in wholly inappropriate, entirely superfluous, kind of unflattering, and grossly inefficient 4K high definition.  Like Alyssa and Evan, but unlike Kendrick and Sal, Kris has spent his time since college churning out high quality content that you can check out here.

Evan Cutler Wattles, will be editing the film and, like Alyssa and Kris, is yet another filmmaker way too competent to be working on this project.  He actually edited our pitch video and even let us use his tiny dog. Here’s a link to his stuff.

A. Salao wrote this thing.  He has no other credits to his name and has, generally, never contributed anything of value to our cultural marketplace of ideas.  He also has no clue how he convinced all of these people he met in college to work on this weirdo project. If you like his dog movie, ask him about all of his way worse ideas that the rest of the team wisely rejected.

Please note that while most of us met in, and are alumni of, New York University, we’re not in any way sponsored or otherwise funded by the school… yet.

The Risks

Thankfully, most of the project (at least measured by runtime) is essentially done, and we’ve nailed down shooting locations for the remaining scenes.  So, the second biggest risk in not being able to finish this movie in a timely manner comes from the fact that all of the people actually shooting this thing (and some of the people being shot) know what they’re doing and are usually paid to do what they do.  We’re doing our best to coordinate, but since everyone’s working for free (and they still have rent to pay), timing the relatively few number of shoots we have left might be subject to delays as paying gigs hurl members of our team across the world.

The first biggest risk comes from finding an actual Saint Bernard.  But we’re working on it! Only the three scenes we’ve saved for last feature a dog, so we won’t need one for a bit of time--we’re actively searching and appreciate any leads!
story_txt:
The Film
Our run-time target is roughly 20 minutes, with the average sketch being about 3 minutes in length.  We’ve already shot the entire mockumentary portion, consisting of interviews with ‘Blake’, and one of the five sketches.  We’re targeting an early November date to shoot our second sketch, with the bulk of any crowdfunding money raised going to the final three.
Without giving too much away, the final three sketches contain, broadly, a gruesome shootout, space travel, and some wacky time travel shit, so they’ll involve bigger casts, more complex costumes and sets, and, of course, special effects.  Practically every dollar we receive beyond our target will be poured into polishing those three things (hell, if we raise a million, we’ll just render a fully CG dog).

The Goal
We’re asking for $7,500 because that’s what we approximate it will take to finish the scrappiest version of the movie we can whittle down.  That means cutting some scenes, settling for cheaper effects, maybe just even having a guy in a dog suit. With approximately $10,000, we’re confident we can come much closer to our vision, and every dollar beyond that just makes it a safer bet.
